reviews.review: Ronnie's . This mall was a wonderfull place to visit it's a vast shopping place plenty to do and lots of different types of shops must admit it takes a long time to get around and flat shoes which you can get there if your legs get to tired must see place

Large but more quiet mall. It was a really nice mall, everything you need is there. Quite impressive that they have a ski slope when it is 38C outside. More conservative mall with preference to be dressed with knees and shoulders covered and no PDA. Compared to the Mall of Dubai, this is a lot more quiet and nicer to shop.

Amazing. Keeps you up with your shopping, name the stuff and you will find that in the mall. The best part is that Mall has very awesome navigation and fully in compliance with Metro Signs Architecture.

So much to do . This mall in Dubai is awesome. So big, so much to see. Has an indoor ski slope, along with other snow activities. Lots of stores for shopping for anyone. It has so much to choose from. Lots of different places to choose from to eat. Something for everyone.
Beautiful . This was one of the malls in Dubai that I had to visit. Main attraction was the snow. World renown Ski slope in side a mall. Very impressive place to visit.

A visit to Godiva first floor . We did abit of shopping and then decided to go to Godiva for some strawberries dipped in Chocolate but decided to have the Fondue instead order for one as it's huge we had bananas marshmallows strawberries and cake plus the hot chocolate to dip all in this was fab but it's very filling enjoy when leaving instead of walking through the Mall again the taxi pickup is very close we left completely stuffed.
Good place . What a good place to visit with friends. We had a great time there. Thank you for the good service. We will definitely come back to visit and have a good time.

Shopping and Site Seeing . Very easy to get to via the Metro, plenty to do here. Snow Ski at the indoor Ski Slopes, Shop at the amazing shops or eat what ever your heart desires. There is something for all of the family, a must see!!

Designer. Great shopping all major brands and lots of sales even though it's not sale time , staff in a lot of shops are not that familiar with there own store as in if you want to know where something is they won't know so lots of walking , great restaurant on the 3rd floor of Harvey Nichols with a shisha bar attached , shoes shoes and shoe stores for days and you can bargain with them a little just not in your major designer stores all in all a must visit

the super excellent mall. if you don't visit it , you miss a lot one of the most popular mall in dubaiyou will never forget the nice time you spend with your family you cannot control your self to buy the nice things with reasonable prices to take with you to your home country

A shoppers dream. We recently visited this incredible shopping centre and were amazed by the variety of stores, places to eat, friendly staff and level of cleanliness!It was our second time there and we were just as impressed as we were 3 years ago!There is 'something for everyone' and many new stores and products we had never heard of before.We will definitely make it another 'stop over' destination again!
One of the best mall. Today I want their in Mall of emirates It's a fantastic mall in Dubai. Lots of choice for the shoping & Restaurant . Look is very modern & international.

Wonderfully exhausting . Huge doesn't start to describe this. Incredible building, marble floors and a beautiful roof. It houses everything, just everything. All the top brands and famous names. The intrepid shopper could spend a week in this mall and still not be finished.

Want to go skiing?. If you would like to ski this is the place. The shops are easy to find. A good mix in price ranges. A nice variety of resturants, but a lot of people especailly on fridays. This day you have to stand in line!

Extravagant Emirates Emporium. The most luxurious brands you can think of, you will find here at the Emirates Mall. It was so captivating my friend and I made an entire day out of it, and we still couldn't get to all the stores and places. Unfortunately we couldn't get to the Ski lounge we were too busy shopping. But next time I visit I will make sure to do so. Also they had some swanky restaurants and interesting outlets to grab some food.
Best of all. I loved this mall better than any other mall in dubai, it was huge and clean with any brand that one can wish for, great place in did

Shopping trip. Fairly new shopping mall with most famous high street and independent brands for all ages from clothes to toys to many other good quality products at reasonable prices the food court ain't bad neither highly recommended

MALL TO BEAT ALL MALLS. regular visitor even I live in Abu dhabi. Over the years they have expanded it and collected like shops such as high fashion in same area. Latest fashions , excellent selection of high fi , fast food and more up market food/coffee shops such as more and Paul
Best brands from all over the world. Presented in a very decent way. Nice for window shopping. Located at a metro station. Excellent guidance through information centers and maps

Try to see this in 1 day. Fashion from low to high end, lots of food options from fast to gourmet, enough technology to satisfy every nerdy type, home wares, all the branded jewelry/watch makers and did I mention ski slopes for the enthusiast and there is more, much much more. This place is big and impressive and if you are just visiting Dubai, you will need more than 1 day to do it justice. Well worth the visit.

Shopping Mall. This Mall is a little smaller than the Dubai Mall, but at the big brand stores are here. There is a large Food Court and this is the small whereSki Dubai is located. The Metro runs directly to the Mall, and it is easily accessible by Metro, Bus or Taxi.

Hands down the best in Dubai. I still remember going there when it just opened. It was great then and it's great now. They keep reinventing themselves always for the better. The size is just right it has just about all the stores you'd want and great selection of restaurants. I love this place can't come to Dubai now without going there at least once

Brilliant tax free shopping! . If you are near the Palm, this is not to be missed! The bus from Atlantis takes about 30 minutes, otherwise a taxi is 30D.Here you will find an excellent selection of high end stores and almost everything British but tax free. The diamond jewellery stores are an eye opener.In agreement with other reviews, it's a bit like Westfield only so much bigger and better. Shopping for all budgets - eg 30% off at Debenhams.Set your dear husband up with the kids at Ski Dubai, located in the centre, while you shop, shop and shop! Do pick up a map at the entrance - you will need it. Basically there are three floors: G, F and S where the Galleria and some are at the centre.Samsung at the centre of the Galleria is a good meeting point of you are lost, which is likely! There is an excellent range of cafes and restaurants and no filthy food court as is frequently the case in US (Ala Moana Waikiki).The Chanel is impressive with an increased range of goods and colours not normally seen in Australia. However it all comes with a warning: unless you dress the part you may not command attention and it does help if you are wearing a black robe.
Mall of Interest . Good things:-Apple Store-Go for sports -Gold Cafe-Dubai SkyArea of improvement:-Taxi long waiting time-Non-following roles for dressing by costumers-

My favorite mall in Dubai. Been living in Dubai for 6 years. Mall of the Emirates is by far my favorite mall. You can find pretty much anything you need, but it's not as massive as Dubai mall. Simple infrastructure, easy to find shops. Carrefour inside of the mall. Love it <3

Best Mall !! Second only to Dubai Mall. This is the best mall for me in Dubai in terms of convenience as well as what's on offer...You are close to Lulu's which to me as an Indian is a blessing and dress me of a week's chores... And ticks of almost everything in my to do list...You have the vox cinemas for your movie time before of after shopping for groceries at Lulu's !!It is beautiful and offers great dining options and is flowing with diversity if cuisines...It has debenhams... Yes ladies Debenhams :)A ski lounge ... And great home and furniture shopping options like crate and barrels, home Center and can cater to all your banking needs even late at night :)

Massive place. This place is really huge....loads of shops over 3 levels. Lots of choice and you will need comfy shoes on as we spent hours here. Def recommend a visit to the cheesecake factory as it's amazing. See separate review.

Spend an hour, an afternoon, or a day!. The Mall of the Emirates was my first stop when arriving in UAE after an over night flight from the US. There is so much to do and to see and so many dining choices! Access to the Burg is within the mall as well as to the waterfall gardens overlooking the lagoon. We came back again during our stay and found it to be the Mall of Malls. Don't miss it.

Biiiigggggggggggggg mall With a Snow park :). Great bigg mall.. Loads of brands to shop from. Many perfume brands are available which you do not get in India.There is the snow park in this mall which is called the Ski Dubai .. A must visit if visiting for Dubai for the 1st time.

Short trip!. We were going there for dinner after driving around Dubai! It's a nice mall with plenty of parking space, the restaurant were very busy with minimum of 45-60 mins wait. Better avoid the peak time next trip!

Where the locals go to shop.. This was the second mall that I have visited while in Dubai and I was very impressed and pleased with the centre. Firstly, while the centre was large it was not so large that you felt you needed a GPS unit just to find your way back to where you left your car!Another aspect of the centre that I liked was that there was a supermarket there. Now this may sounds nuts but we had a great time going through and looking at what foods and products fill the homes of "normal" Dubai families. One aspect of the centre that my Mum commented on was that there was no casual seating. At shopping centres at home (Australia) there are seats and couches dotted around the shopping centre for when you need a rest but don't want to sit down and have a meal or a drink. These were missing from the centre, nothing major, but we did notice their absence. If I had to choose one mall that I would go back to time and again, it would be the Mall of Emirates - hands down.
Not the best. Unless you want to Ski the the Dubai Mall is far greater. I found this to be just another mall - nothing exceptional.

Another Big Mall. This is not as big as Dubai Mall, but still big.It is easy to get around this mall and you can spend a lot of time here. The only draw back we found was that there did not appear to be any seating around the mall outside the eating areas.You can catch the Metro directly there and walk in air conditioned comfort to the mall.
AMAZING. This is so much more than a shopping mall. Wonderful places to eat and great experiences to be had...

Variety of Brands. Cousin of Dubai Mall. This is a nice mall, not as hige as Dubai mall, but has a great variety of Brands. We were told the items are cheaper her, but we did not find it to be. It has good food courts. Easily accesible through public transport.
Travel for 2. We have a good time at the Mall .. A lot of stores and we loved the inside ski .. That is a great attraction

Would be just another mall but Ski Dubai makes it special. We visited this mall during our recent visit to Dubai and though it is now nowhere near as exciting as Dubai Mall, the indoor ski area really seperates this from the norm. It is truly bizarre to be in the desert and see snow. We are not really snow people but it was still really interesting thing to see.

Typical "To Buy" mall. Another very large place in which to spend very large amounts of money. Typical of Dubai, this is another beautiful and very clean environment in which to immerse yourself into a buyers frenzy. Or just spend some time window shopping or people watching. I liked it!

My favourite mall in Dubai. Smaller than Dubai Mall but in my opinion easier to navigate and get things done. All the big brands are present and the food court is busy but offering a variety of options.
Wow. Great so great which is think better than the crowding of dubai mall , the style is unique and it's far from the airport but it's great
Good. This mall is good and big.many brands has branches in this mall.if you like ski you should go there because this mall has places that you can ski or play with snow.i like it
Gem. One more gem in mall world at Dubai. Its too huge and my second favorite mall after Dubai mall. Shopping paradise. Filled with all brands for shopping with food and entertainment.
Too big to handle. This is one huge mall, you could spend a day and not finish every store in it. if you have lots of money to spend then this is the place to spend it.

My favorite mall. It's a very easily accessible mall. It's my favorite in dubai. Metro station is attached to the mall and one doesn't need to step out in sun to reach it. It has mostly all the good brands and it's not too huge which cannot be covered in oneday. Additional attraction is the Ski Dubai. Has two foodcourts with good selection of eating options.

A day out is needed to explore all of it . Amazing place, a great variety of shops from budget to wow Food Court has a good variety of choices and with Starbucks and Costa right there you can have a coffee with your mealOnly one grocery store but this has everything you could ever want (No Pork products though) spices fruit veg and your every day shopping at your finger tips.Pots Pans to outdoor settings

Strictly average, not worth it. Frankly, I don't see the charm of this place. What is there to see except all the stores you find any where else? I thought my time spent here was wasted. The only place to go here is the ice rink which is over priced. No place to sit for the elderly if they get tired.
Excellence comes as standard. The mall is pristine and contains all kinds of shops which cater to all needs. One particular attraction is Ski Dubai.
Fantastic place. Such a spectacular place to visit, I went for a wonder round and have some food, plenty to do and see even if you are not shopping.

Fun to go to, but thats it. Mall of the emirates is one of the gigantic malls in Dubai, However, compared to Dubai Mall, this is manageable - it is not too big, and you can oversee all the stores. All the "important" stores are there; Louis Vuitton, Chanel, Hermes etc... However, do not believe that (despite there being no sales tax in Dubai) prices are low. As we were told - and experienced our selves, double EU prices with 1.2-1.5 and you have Dubai prices.If you are in the market for gold etc, be sure to bargain, and keep going. They will keep lowering the prices.Go to see the mall, but leave the money at home - it is not worth it.

Amazing Mall, less daunting than Dubai Mall but really needs more Arabic shops!. We visited The Mall of Emirates a few times on our trip and in a way I preferred it to Dubai Mall because it wasn't as daunting!It wasn't absolutely massive like Dubai Mall and it was quite enjoyable walking through! I just wish that it had more traditonal arabic shops, I mean I know its a mall but coming from the UK I really wanted to see more Arabic stores. There was 3 in the whole of the mall (for clothes anyway) which I though was quite weird for coming to Dubai, but apart from that, we really enjoyed exploring this mall.The whole catching a taxi thing was easy here as you just qued up and then as the taxis lined up you just get assigned one, very easy and efficient especially if your new to the country.

Mall of Emirates Cousin of Dubai Mall. It is also one of the beautiful mall and nice to hang on with friends and family. It also has a snow park called Ski Dubai with different activities and also a food court. Although it was a great experience Will be happy to visit again :-) ♥♥♥

Dubai trip. We came to dubai yestarday morning and stayed in sheraton which is connected to the mall the mall is big and contains all famous marks it contan big cinamas vox we ejiied to walk in tha mall and shopping
I advice peaple visiting dubai to paas and shopping from the mall
It contains alot of resturants

My favourite mall in Dubai. Though not Dubai's largest mall (that honour goes to Dubai Mall), Mall of the Emirates is my personal favourite. It has some 600 outlets and also boasts of Ski Dubai (a skiing facility that also has a ski lift, ice sculptures and live penguins), the glass domed Galleria, and a set of fine dining restaurants around a beautiful horse fountain.

Grand mall . Huge mall which has all brands under one roof. There is a huge Carrefour within the mall. Ski Dubai which is located inside the mall is a must visit for all those who have not had a chance to visit a ski resort.
One of the best malls in Dubai . I loved this mall it has everything you need the high end brand and low end brands . The imax cinema was amazing .

The mall and Dubai has made me feel quite lucky!. I live quite close to the MOE and hence, it is like a family mall. I have visited almost all the malls in Dubai and i feel that there is a special connection with MOE and today, I must say I experienced it. I did some shopping for my little one and had two shopping bags. While waiting for the shuttle bus to the Double tree by Hilton, i kept my shopping bags on one of the benches. When the shuttle arrived, i just grabbed my handbag and forgot to carry the shopping bags. I realized this only after reaching my hotel 5 mins later.Immediately called MOE Lost and found and informed them about the bags. They noted the entrance gate number and details about the contents. Within 10 mins, I got a call back from the security room stating that they have found my bags. I can't express how lucky i felt. I was already back in the mall and went straight to the security room near Carrefour. They confirmed my identity and details about the shopping bags and handed them over. I would like to thank the MOE security team, especially Mr. Asim for helping me. I have never felt this lucky in a long time and I am sure this was possible only because of this excellent country and the excellent team working to make life better for everyone who lives in Dubai.I love Dubai. Thanks for reading.Chai
Amazing . This shopping mall is huge. It contains hundreds of shops and restaurants. In addition to the activities such as skiing and fun area for kids Worth visiting

Not as Big as Dubai Mall. Access to Ski Dubai is inside the mall. They have game arcade and theaters on the top floor. More easier to navigate than Dubai Mall. Easy access from the Metro. One of the nicest mall in Dubai.
Shopping . Great mall with plenty to do - shopping, cinema, ski. Get here early cos parking can be a chore especially on weekends and public holiday. Best care cleaners ever here
just as good. just as good as Dubai mall and not as busy with the added bonus of Ski Dubai and penguin encounters.

Great mall, easy to navigate. One of the best malls in Dubai. Very easy to navigate. Wide range of stores and dining/cafe options available. 20 min drive from Dubai city centre. There is a nearby metro station as well. At weekends, parking becomes a bit challenging, but if you wait a few minutes, you will find a parking spot. It hosts Ski Dubai, where you can ski. There is a huge Carrefour on the ground floor.
Best Mall in Dubai. Better than Dubai Mall because smaller and easier to find your way, and where is your favourite Shop. All the major brandi are there!
I love this mall. Convenient for all family and shopping, I like to spend my time in this mall better than Dubai mall because my kids like ski of Dubai

One of Dubai's better malls. If you are into shopping malls then this one is my favourite in Dubai. It's usually easy to park in and isn't so big that you have to hike around the shops. Great Vox cinema on the top floor too. Only thing I'd say is that I avoid Carrefour shopping there as that is always busy and bedlam. I go to a quieter Carrefour elsewhere.

Only if you have extra time. If you went to Dubai mall then don't waste your time by coming to this mall , its little dated than Dubai mall and no special shops around there , if you have extra time and you don't know where to spend it then ok .the mall is easily accessible by metro and taxi , it is less crowded than Dubai mall of course, so basically what am trying to say is that it is ok mall but if you had to choose between the 2 most famous malls in Dubai then this will be the 2nd

Of all the Dubai malls,, this is my favorite. I am biased, since MOE is close to home.. But I must say, its size, well studied parking area and the fact that it has just enough vendors and variety makes MOE my favorite.I like to go there with the family for a Friday lunch, grocery shopping or simply to meet friends off working hours.It has most of the things you would need,, and the size (although it's a big mall) is not intimidating or tiring.Bottom line is,, I like it

Top end brands....with top end pricing to match !!. As is usual with Dubai, you will get all the brands that are available worldwide, but this Mall seemed to have more of the top end variety..........with the prices to match. If you're after 'normal' shopping, then you may be disappointed ! Decent sized Carrefour if after all that shopping you want to save some cash on food.... good food court with lots of variety. Easy to get to as they have a direct Metro line.

Worth a Visit if you want to Shop in Dubai. This Mall has good quality, reasonably priced clothing in abundance. It also has some good fast food courts, most of which you will recognize as USA brands.

nice place for visit. i went there when shops were closed , but lots of food strore were open after mid night , and also ski slope in the warm weather if any one can enjoy , in my opinion the ski slope is not attraction for people who has mountains in their countries

Huge mall !!!. When I always visit Dubai I make sure to visit this mall. It has all the brands from budget brands in ground floor and high end brands in upper floors. I like visiting high end watches stores and the customer service is beyond amazing!!!!!

High-end luxurious shopping mall. I guessed this might be the most luxurious mall in Dubai as I can spot a lot of famous & expensive sport cars at every corner of the mall. Quite a good place to shop around with world famous brands within one single mall.
luxury shopping. Includes everything inside, even a ski resort, which is amazing. Links to the metro. Not as big as the Dubai Mall, but still huge.

Simply the best. The obvious comparison is to look at Dubai Mall and take in all the pros and cons. Dubai Mall has only one thing going for it...it is massive and obviously that leads to more choice...but MOE is the winner in so many other ways...first it has the indoor ski slope and the penguins...ok so there is ice skating and a fish tank at DM but that doesn't beat a ski slope...then you don't get lost at MOE..everything you would want is there and you don't need to walk a mile to find it...MOE was also the first major mall of it's kind and it is continually being upgraded .the new cinemas are the best in Dubai. The food outlets are far better than DM and I even prefer the parking...I don't lose my car...you'll find me here most weekends...
Nice mall. Very good mall ... have much variety of shops, resturants and activities like cinema, ski dubai and magic planet ... also there was Carefour and alot of brands
One of the best two malls in Dubai. If you want it all (shopping, entertainment and food) either head to this mall or Dubai Mall, dont waste your time at other malls.

If there is a better Mall, let me see it.. Dubai has great malls, so does Texas and Florida, where I Lived previously. I adore the Trafford Centre in the UK but the Mall of the Emirates is my favorite.Here is a glorious Mall with designer shops, a Ski slope and terrific restaurants. The cinema is world class too.But the best thing, for me, is that you can get anything from here, cheap or expensive. It is a complete shopping experience. It takes a day to see it all and a lifetime to forget it.

Good place !!!. The Mall is excellent with various dining options. We barely visited this place for an hour or 2 in between our HOHO bus ride and really like it.The place is huge with loadsa options for shopping & dining. We chose a coffee shop on the ground floor. Would want to go back to the mall soon.

Nice mall with access and a good choice of restaurants . The right size with everything you desire in a mall in Dubai. Yes there is a lot of walking but it is easy to understand and still can be navigated on the busiest of days. Good choice of restaurants and stores as well as a large theatre. Ample parking available on the top floor.
Really good mall. Nice mall. Definitely worth a visit. Big car park, plenty of restaurants/food options. And the shops are really nice.

Fabulous time . Mall of emirates is the place to be in it has great food outlets some great shopping places and a all round fantastic location with plenty going on to entertain you and your family with which caters for all age and sizes ..
nice memories. i visited this large mall on august in include beatiful ice city shopping resturant supermarket and others

What a Mall!. I've never seen malls like this in the UK, truly amazing, so clean and tidy, an amazing range of shops and activities. Toilets so clean.
Went to this mall almost everyday and always found something new.

Not big not small. Not a big not a small ball which Is good and it has variety of brand and restaurants and cafes .Also it gas indoor ski resort which is unique place in the middle of desert and I hear it has the biggest Apple store too.

Sup. Great place. Unfortunately for free Wi-Fi you need an uae phone number. And that is a problem. For local people with UAE ID it cost 50 drh but for visitors with passport is 100 drh. That's not right.

Big mall for serious shoppers. This is a big shopping mall, full of some very very nice shops, ideal for those who are truly serious about their shopping. Well worth a visit if not wholly into your shopping to see ski dubai and the associated facilities around it. A very interesting change given the local climate.

A Class of its own. Nothing like it, if you are in Dubai, you have to visit Emirates mall. Very high class, you Are surrounded by luxury, beautiful architect not to mention all the stores and resturants. It's a ten star mall if there is such a thing.

Omg easily best shopping experience ever . ProSelection is vastSuper high quality, ultra clean, great service in all shops.Food outlets good choiceAir con and smells throughout are amazingConsPrices are very high - 1.5 X uk pricesNo michael kors shop ????Shop assistant tend to latch on and follow you offering alternative colours and sizes as soon As you pick anything up.
MALL OF THE EMIRATES. Aptly named it is a shopping mall well connected by mall and is next to hotel kempinski . It houses ski Dubai . Immense car parking. The exterior of the mall is eye catcher

Massive . The mall is very big alot of shop to see from the most expensive to the cheapest.It can not be seen in one day, alot of walking to do.Kids activities are available.Disable access is as good.Alot of space in the mallGood court are big more the one available.Alot of different culture food is available, from fast food to big restaurant.Atmosphere is greatVery busy on weekends.It is a family environment.
Amazing - worth a visit. Worth a visit even just to window shop. Beautiful architecture and some very high end shops if you can afford the price tags.

Exquisite !!. The mall is centrally located in Dubai and is full of international brands. It is connected to the metro network as well. It has a beautiful architecture. Ski Dubai is there inside the mall for adventure enthusiasts. Many star hotels are inside or just next to the mall.

Great place not too busy . This was quieter than the Dubai mall and I loved that, has every type of shop you can think of and great facilities
Toilets were cleans, restaurants catered for all ages and taste.
Have children's play area and cinema plus indoor ski. Very close to
Jumeriah beach area

Passing through. Great mall to go to if you want to shop and find everything you need, plus they have cinemas play area an indoor ski resort and also indoor smoking cafes if it is important for you. Plenty of parking and easy access to Dubai Metro. I personally like this the most of all big malls in Dubai; and not as crowded.

Good to escape the heat. The Mall of the Emirates is one of Dubai's most popular attractions, and for good reason too especially if you visit the city in the middle of a 43° summer. The indoor ski feature attracts many visitors, but it's not the only thing to bring people bere. Whether you want elite brands or something a little more down-to-earth, you'll find it here along with eating places to suit pretty much any palate. The mall is 3 stories high, but easily negotiated with strategically placed escalators.If you want to spend an enjoyable 2 or 3 hours wandering around, here's the place to go.

Shop till you drop. One of many buyers' heavens in Dubai. From Luxury brands to affordable items all to be found here. Fine dinning or fast food take your pick. don't forget to visit Ski Dubai before leaving, you won't regret.

Should be on your DUBAI itinerary!. If you are on your visit to dubai for a week or so, this place has to be on your itinerary.The indoor ski park is definitely something that you cannot miss. If you have visitors then plan a surprise for them, don't tell them what to expect and just show them right away from the second floor of the mall glass window!It has reasonable choices for clothes and accessories. While the options for food are lot better than other malls in the city. The connectivity is very convenient with the metro and taxis too. Also the parking lot is not as cracked up as few other malls in Dubai. The kids stores are an absolute must and have plenty of choices. Also, the mall is recently refurbished (yes, in Dubai 7-8 years old is OLD) and has superb finish and feel as you walk in the corridors. The cinema halls at the top floor are redone too and are worth a visit for the overall experience.The best part is that it is Big but not huge, so if you know what you want then you are good to go for not more than 2-3 hours and you are out of it.

Not to big and not to small :) . This is by far the best mall in my humble opinion. The mall has everything to offer it is not too big or is it too small weekends Parkins are free. It's not as crowded as some of the other malls but can get busy at times.

Little to see and do. Billed as the mall of the Emirates you can see why. It really is only for emiraties. Plenty to eat and drink which is a bonus and all is halal. The biggest bonus is the clean facilities and the dedicated mens/women's masjid with regular prayers and imam. The Mall it self is huge and a good walk around with mainly western shops from a-z so nothing that hasn't been seen before. Novelty of flash cars is nothing spectacular given most of these are probably shipped to London for most parts of the year. More a tick to say you've been.
Amaizing. Nice place to spent quality time with skii dubai and bawling. Good to go with friends and family. Direct access to metro.

Big mall. Nice shopping mall should not miss it if you coming to visit city of Dubai, there are more than 630 shops and over 100 restaurants & Cafes, 80 luxury stores and 250 flagship stores. It also hosts family leisure activities including Ski Dubai (the Middle East’s first indoor ski resort and snow park). It's to access to mall by red line metro or by bus and a lot of parking available for your car. There is cinema for 22 screens

Shopping paradise. This is undoubtedly an excellent mall, but is definitely number two after the Dubai Mall. That aside, you can find almost all the world big names inside from Louis Vuitton to Marks and Spencer. No matter what you are looking for, it's there, although you might have to look a little harder if you want a glass of wine!Do remember though that in the heat of summer, it is likely to be super packed on weekends, when everybody is off and has nothing to do. If you like crowds, this is the place to be.
2nd best mall in the world . This is the 2nd best mall after Dubai mall I love this place again really good choice of food places lovely dessert places and tea X

Shopping. This mall is not as big as the Dubai Mall but jut as good it has everything you'll need under one roof.Nicely laid out with easy to follow maps and fully air con'd.My kids absolutely loved watching ski Dubai here. With real snow imported for a full snow cold experience.

Biggest Mall Ever . I hate shopping with a passion but this mall has converted me. With over 1200 shops and 600 eateries I never ran out of things to do. I even found a laurdree by accident which was amazing!
Good but dubai mall is better . This is your typical mall. Nothing special but good with lots of shops.We visited the dubai mall a day before so maybe that's why we felt this is a par below it..

Best Mall in Dubai. This is the one place to offer mostly everything you can think of.Huge number of brands, shops and restaurants. Plus Ski Dubai and more for the kids and creative.We even stay at Kempinski Mall of Emirate, so transportation is not an issue at all.

A good place to shop.. Though not as large or expansive as the Dubai Mall, this had a lot of brands to offer and was quite a great place to shop from. The handy Mall Map was very helpful in locating the shops easily. Discounts are rare but the varieties are quite a lot.

Dubai Holidays. One of the best place to see in Dubai , there's a lot to do like eating , shopping and not forgetting the ski Dubai one of the best things to do , its for all age groups from 1 to any age limit cant wait to go back again.

Minus 2 on +50. As usual nice,clean,arranged place.They have fantastic ski center inside mall itself where you can enjoy winter games on +50.Mall is full of restaurants.Also they have big carrefour.Location is very good.Near Burj Al Arab.Relatively recently they open new big Vox cinemas.If you are fan of designers clothing this is perfect place for you.

The easiest mall in Dubai / it literally has everything . It is simply mind blowing having a ski slope / all different levels and snow park in the middle of a mall with live penguins . MOE as we living here locally call it, is the preferred choice for my teenagers and even my husband who ?.'wWho doesn't like shopping, he still enjoys the beautiful cinemas there and many restaurants .. As a shopper, one is spoilt by the choices from Harvey Nichols upmarket to reasonably priced shops such as American eagle / pull and bear / Bershka/ forever 21 . Also the mall has department stores such as Debenhams and Marks and Spencer . It has the best spots shops represented individually and in a department store specifically for sports . Easy to navigate mall . Spoilt by choices . A must go .

Lovely big mall. I love this mall as its not as big and daunting as Dubai mall, it's still bigger than UK centres though. The food court is nice and has many options to choose from. For me the highlights are the food court, centre point shopping department store and the huge Carrefour supermarket which you can buy practically anything from food to homeware all at a very reasonable price. This mall has a lovely feel to it and really is a must visit.
One of my favorite malls in Dubai . Very nice Lots of great restaurants And entertainment for kidsAnd shopping option Not extremely huge so you do t get exhausted Don't forget to visit ski Dubai
Very nice mall. This is a very nice mall, it ha most of the luxury designers that the dubai mall has and is less crowded, another huge plus is that it has free wifi!
Amazin. Visited this mall a few times during our stay in Dubai. It really is amazing and perfect for shoppers. Availability of food was excellent caters for all and reasonably priced.

Great Mall. What a great mall, all what you need in one place, cinemas, all kinds of cafe, restaurants, shops.I really enjoyed my time there and went 3 times already and still like it. You can go my metro, bus or taxis. Shop, watch a movie, lunch then dinner.
The 2nd best Mall in Dubai. I have written a previous review on this mall, which you can check.On this trip during July, the weather was hot so this was a perfect option to spend the day.

Very biiiiiiiiig Mall. This mall is one of the biggest malls in UAE with variety of options to all type of visitors.It is located at Sheikh Zayid road apart from Diera by 20 MinutesIt has its own parking area with multiple floorsIt has also many options for enjoyment such asSki Dubai Game areaShows Shopping Restaurants Cinema It has also the major brands of world but the problem is the prices of retails are very very very high comparing to other world

My home. I've been in Dubai and this mall is my home. I like it and no other place in Dubai attracts me as it does always. Very well designed, not giant bit not small! All you will find and all you will like. I love you MOE

Too Big to be nice. For me I do not like that at all, it is toooooo much big, to the extent that you need many days to finish it and if you have kids take care because they got lost, you will have a very hard time with that size of place
Very glam. This mall has some amazing designer shops if you have the money to spend. It also has some fast food restaurants and an indoor ski slope.

Must do. Definately a must see in Dubai. Very easy to lose oneself on the various levels with so many shops. Watching kids play on the ice at the ski ramp with an outside temperature of 45 deg is different!
Luxury and fun shopping. Walk throw this place and come out with lots of shopping bags ..don't stop shopping till you reach the door ..lol!

A great mall.. All luxury brands are present and you will not miss anything. However the prices are nothing special and on the level of other large cities in Europe or far east. The integrated Skiing resort is fantastic - I liked the penguins.

Must Visit Place in Dubai. One should surely visit the Mall of Emirates once when visiting Dubai,The best attraction is the Ski Dubai.Another plus point in this mall is that you can get pure Indian Vegetarian Food.You can also get Dhosa, Idli, Chaats and what not & the price is as similar to Price in any popular mall in Mumbai.It is very well connected with the Metro & there is an artificial lake near the mall where you can have picnic also.

Huge shopping mall. Probably the largest mall nearest to the beach hotels. Many hotels offer free shuttle bus. Many high street & designer names including Harvey Niks & Debenhams. Home of indoor Ski Dubai. Over 3 floors there is something for every shopper! Many restaurants & cafes too
The best mall in Dubai . Thus mall is a step above the Dubai mall. Anchored by two hotels plus the metro, the mall offers some of everything on a grand scale

Another superb mall. Dubai is full of amazing malls. We visited the dubai mall and this one. This also has the ski dubai in it. There are a variety of shops here too and you literally get tired roaming around the mall. Must visit of you have some time.

Disappointed . This was no different than shopping in the UK... Only difference it's more expensive.. Having visited the Dubai Mall which is AMAZING, we stayed for maybe an hour tops that's with having an expensive frozen yoghurt!
Popular. Its a popular mall and has lots of main brands as well, you can always check this one if ur going to Dubai. I love the restaurants as its all next to each other.

Lots to do, shopping, food - Tribe restaurant serves African cuisine if you happen to miss home, they play good music. . Lots to do, shopping, food - Tribe restaurant, serves African cuisine, good music and the ambience is on point particularly when you miss home. Then Ski - Dubai a most definitely must do
Great mall. Great mall, full of shops and restaurants , a ski slope and a brill imax cinema. Easy to get to from the metro as it had its own station attached to the mall.

Easily Accessible Mall. Mall of the Emirates seems overwhelming at first, but with a little bit of exploring you can enjoy it.The new section with the new Cinema, has some of the best restaurants in the entire mall. Borders has a quiet place in back for coffee, Starbucks. Some of the others are noisy and crowded.Carrefour the Walmart of the Middle East is also there.With a little searching you can find the useful stores, not just the high end fashion which seems to dominate most of the malls.Much easier to get around in than Dubai mall which is even larger.
Great shopping mall. No wonder to see such a mall in Dubai. The mall contains world brands and latest models. Huge mall can't get its end in one day.

Busy busy busy Mall. Like all malls in dubai, the Mall of the emirates is extremely busy. Try to go there early in the morning to avoid the masses of people. They have a selection of low to high end shops and the levels or service remain constant. Cinemas and restaurants on offer. Plenty of parking if you will drive there.Remember to cover your shoulders and wear something covering to the knees more of less. All malls in UAE have a dress code to dress decent. Some people ignore this rule and asked to leave. Please respect the culture. Beach clothing must stay on the beach.

Not biggest but the best . MOE is no the biggest mall in dubai but is the best, the way it designed give you easy access to parking, rest rooms are every where and you never get lost! Easy access to many taxi stations and Metro. 2 massive food court at the end of both legs of the mall. Don't miss sky dubai there.

Emirates mall. As I live in Dubai, a city of many malls, this one is my favourite. Easy to get around built on 3 levels. Good parking and metro access. Great shopping variety, restaurants and snow skiing. Visitors please dress respectfully, don't wear short shorts and tiny tops.

Fabulous mall. I've visited this mall on both of my trips to Dubai and it's just fabulous.Large selection of stores, I don't think I wanted for anymore than they had.Good coffee shops for stops and I don't mean Starbucks/ Costa! I mean some with non robotic staff and a nice environment with some individuality.Get a cab there from your hotel so you can shop til you are ready to drop.
Multi level Shopping Experience. Mall of emirates: worlds leading shopping mall, lots of activities are there, Ski Dubai is one of the best in that, dont miss this guys its worth.
Amazing. I went for the first time with my family. They had been before but I hadn't. It was amazing that they had a ski slip and snow activities in the mall! You'd never see that in England!

The Mal unique in Emirates. My self along with my family moves around this unique mall very often. This day too just like that along with my son and family had a move around the Mall. Refreshing one. Mind satisfying one.

Came for shopping spree & stayed for Ski Dubai. A better mall than Dubai mall in my opinion because you can find things easily here. This is definitely on anyone's to-do list if you're visiting Dubai for shopping. Ski Dubai is fantastic both inside & the outside. We really loved everything in Ski Dubai including bobsled, chairlift, kids activities & avalanche cafe. We visited this mall thrice while staying for ten days. We loved the food, ambiance & shops.

Nice mall . Mall of emirates is smaller in size than Dubai mall, but it is also a great mall with nice shopping experience and good brands from high prices to normal prices of shops, there is also the Dubai ski inside of the mall which i find nice for kids

Nice place to see snow in dubai. There are many malls in dubai.. but Mall of Emirates has unique attraction i.e. Ski Dubai.. visitors can have a fun and feel like in real snow.. I experience was wonderful

Normal high street shops! Hooray. Nice affordable shopping centre with places to eat that are reasonable - all your local London high street shops as well as your shops like Dior etc. Nice day out, no need to cover up to a major extent either everyone very friendly, attached to great great kempinski hotel, and ski area where you can see penguins- well worth a trip.

Dubai Mall is better than Mall of the Emirates!. Shopping centre is for visitors who are lovers winter sports. You can visit penguins including feeding (very expensive) or you can see people what they are skiing on the ski slope (it is too crazy, somewhat a strange and humorous). Nevertheless, beautiful and luxury architectonic design of Mall. I think that Dubai Mall is better and more magnificent than Mall of Emirates.

Very nice shopping mall. Mall of emirates is one of the mall in uae that has all the selections of everything we want from shopping and eating.there is also an indoor ski slope that we saw from the outside

Interesting to visit. Mall of the Emirates is a huge mall but with the added attraction of the indoor ski area, so a unique place to see. No where else in the world will you see an indoor ski area like this. Easy to stop by off the Metro.

Great Shopping Experience. We have been on holiday to Dubai many times and this is something that we do a couple of times when we are there.As you can imagine the mall is very large with numerous shops (including a lot of designer brands) on a couple of levels, Ski Dubai, cinema and Carrefour supermarket which is great to get your "supplies' for back at the hotelSpotless as you would expect and with a great food court if your feeling peckish which has a good range of expected outlets (McDonalds, KFC & Subway) plus a few Asian varieties and everything else in betweenEasy to pick up a taxi back to the hotel or the metro but it does get very busy especially at night and weekends so generally 2-3 hours is enough for meEnjoy

A huge Mall. Mall of Emirates is very convenient to reach through dubai metro. It has a huge collection of stores but no place to sit and relax for families specially with kids. Even the food courts are boring and overcrowded.

The best mall in Dubai and even on earth 😀. I like shopping here because it has huge selections of brands, goods, and qualities. All you need in one place. It's big enough to find whatever you need but not too big that you get tired just to reach the store you want.

Enjoy ski activities and biggest cinema in UAE. This mall got it all. Skiing is the unique thing they have. It is the only mall in the UAE or bay be middle east that has ski center. The mall is coprehensive and not very big which is comfortable for families. It has indoor playground, many shopping places, fantastic restaurants, biggesst cinema in UAE, beautifully designed, attached to it two hotels. The mall is located in barsha area which is in the middle in shaikh zayed road which make it perfect for all attractions between khalifa tower and JBR.

MOE. I love shopping and walking around MOE. I remember when it first opened 10 yrs ago and I still enjoy going there to drink coffee and whatch people. I love shopping there because of the variety of shops available. The new cimema area on the new 3rd floor is fantastic. My favorite place to watch the latest movies. Sli Dubai is still a nice attraction at the mall as well ad the play area for children of all ages. I recommend it to any visitor. A must see when you are in Dubai

The best mall of Dubai. It is definitely my most favourite mall for several reasons: location, variety of shops and size, which is not too big, like Dubai Mall and not small either. It also has two food courts in the far ends. Overall, leaves a very good impression and does not exhaust as much as other malls. Also, if you want to feel winter, just walk towards Ski Dubai and watch the snowy slopes :)
Nice. Its a nice shopping center. You find all you need and there is also a huge supermarket. Pleasent to visit and now.with a ski village inside... awesome

Lots to buy!. We went to the dubai mall but the Emirates mall was where we did all our shopping. Our hotel had a free shuttle which went to the mall, making it convenient to carry all our shopping. The is a store downstairs which sells everything from food to shoes. Bought a few plimsolls and loafers, they were very cheap. We went there over 3 days mostly to dine and shop.
Mall of the Emirates. Visited here a few times, there is so much to see, takes a while to get around it. Excellent facilities and shops.
Better than Dubai mall. Better than Dubai mall bc not big and almost all shops not expensive and with good quality, food, entertainments for kids, but parking is small

Good place for souvenirs . This mall is the 2nd good mall of Dubai in my opinion (after Dubai mall). It has lots of shops with lower prices than Dubai mall. It has less luxurious brands and brands in here have outlets and more discounts. In my opinion, it was a very good place for buying souvenirs if you want them to be all brand but not as expensive as new collection ones. Also know that it has big sales in summer time from 25-70% which makes it a good place for shopping but you should search between objects more. It is also a bit more far from downtown in comparison to Dubai mall.

Simply wonderful . It's an impressive place that was built with no budget limitations. The details are awesome. There're several shops and make you crazy. Clothes; sport gears; shoes and electronics. .. You find everything you can imagine at an affordable price.

Amazing Place. The mall is huge, easy access by Taxi & Metro, but from Metro you have to walk a big distance to arrive to the mall. Everything you can find inside, shops, restaurants, cinemas.............A must visit while you visit Duabi

Huge mall. I love this place its has less crowd than Dubai Mall. still has all the shops and restaurants.
the new cinema is huge and nice.

Best mall in UAE . It might not be a big mall, but it is very popular. I go here all the time! It's very convenient and easy to get to. There's free parking on the weekends which means there's a lot more people there than during the weekdays. Many different restaurants and retail outlets and also not forgetting Ski Dubai! Beautiful fountain inside. And the mall is connected to the metro station which makes it easier to travel.

Massive Mall. Walked through this mall to get to Ski Dubai. Was pretty good, has loads of shops over multiple floors and a pretty good sized food. Only had three days in Dubai, so did not spend much time here, but can see why people might make a day of it.

Another great mall. Dubai has quite a few impressive malls and Mall of Emirates is up there with the best. It's quite a big mall with the latest refurbishment adding more optionsIt's a movie goer's paradise with an impressive range of options. The mall is easily accessible through Dubai Metro and right at the edge of E11, a major arterial highway.
Good Dubai Mall. One of the older malls in Dubai - huge, lots of options, skating rink - got a bit overshadowed once the Dubai mall came up, however worth a visit definitely.

Very nice. As it is high end Mall so u dont find max here ,which i missed a lot.Carrefour is good and convenient. Now adays some area of parking is under construction . Good food courts.vox cinema is now closer to the entrance.

Nice mall. Nice mall, has everything shops..Carrefour, many restaurants from fast food to upscale restaurants, there's also a cinema. The only thing I didn't like was the parking. It was hard to find a place to park and the places are not all numbered. You have to remember where you parked without any letters or numbers. And unlike Dubai mall parking is not free.

Very nice . I prefer this than Dubai mall as it is so much easier to find the shops your looking for. Plus has the ski Dubai which is great fun. I preferred going to the mall of Emirates as it has all the shops you need and was much convenient in terms of finding shops.
Old charm. Well for quite many years it has been the best mall in Dubai and still continues to attract lot of people . Worth a visit

Shopping spree . The Mall of Emirates is the place to shop ( I think anyway) there is a Carrefour on the ground floor and Bath & Body Works shop on the 1st level which my girls absolutely love as we don't have one in the UK. There are two great big food court, extremely clean (however Dubai is clean anyway) and the Fauchon Paris cake shop that sells eclairs for 40 AED. If you are staying at the Atlantis hotel there is a free Mall of Emirates bus (every 30 mins) that takes you their right outside the hotel. The bus holds 20/25 people. The Mall of Emirates is big but not as big as the Dubai Mall.
Good time at the mall. The mall in very nice location and easy accesible by metro. The shops are nice. There are different selections of cafes, and shops. Parking is free

Great shopping opportunity. We spent 3-4 hours at this Mall. There are lot of designer shops and also english shops such as Next and H & M. There are three floors and there are also a number of restaurants, cafes and fast food outlets. There is also a ski slope complete with penguins! Worth a visit and also a connection point for the big bus

Exotic Mall in Dubai. Mall of Emirates is one of the fascinating bustling malss in Dubai, with wide range of shops ranging Higher end , exotic food court , fabulous hypermarket store. The food court is so huge with wide range of international foods. The mall is designed with natural lighting , and wee could feel some freshness inside the mall. I spent 2 hour in the mall walking around. It a one stop destination for shopping lovers to purchase wide range of goods. Lulu Hyper market is located few hundred yards away from Mall of Emirates .
Miss Vee. Mall of Emirates-I mean what can I say!! My kids loved Ski Dubai! Awesome experience! I mean who can manufacture snow but the Arabs! Awesome awesome.....
Excellent . Fantastic mall.nicely connected. Very spacious need lot of walking loved the food court.neat and clean always

Huge Shopping Mall. Allow plenty of time and bring your cash or cards. Lots of big name designer labels. Snow skiing indoors, fun to watch. Plenty of places to eat. Unfortunately I chose to have a quick coffee & tiny lemon tart at Fauchon cafe Paris and nearly choked when I realised it was $10 for the coffee & $20 for the tart, a bit more than I was expecting. But I had a great day in the Mall.

Plenty of attractions and a must see mall in Dubai. Still fairly new and well maintained. I always enjoy the odd visit to Ski Dubai, situated in this Mall. It's a funny feeling snowboarding down a snow covered slope in the middle of the desert. There is an arcade and plenty of shops well suited for kids. Like many of the other up-market malls in Dubai, you can expect to see all of the high street names. There is an area hidden around the back of the mall with a couple of bar/pubs overlooking Ski Dubai. I like visiting this side of the mall during the Christmas season. Not the biggest mall in Dubai but it seems they have plans to expand.
Place is huge. The Emirates mall is so big I didn't see all of it as I wanted to visit Ibn Batuta mall as well, you need a full day to appreciate this mall and a pocket/purse full of dirhams.

Lots of summer offers on. When we went to this mall in july there were lots of summer offers on. We had some great bargains from American Eagle, timberland, Gant and Hollister. There are lots of big designer shops in this mall as well as the regular clothes shops. There is also a Carefour supermarket for all your essentials. Great evening out and the mall was open until midnight. This mall also has a food court which is open until 1am.
Nice Mall. Good mall with major brands.A shopper or a window shopper, both will love this place. Many shops and brands to look around.

My Meeting Pount. I've been travelling/working in the UAE for over 9 years and i have been happy with the way this Mall has kept its quality of Shops-Clean Environment- easy to find. Despite having new malls opening in Dubai, the Mall of Emirates has kept its quality in Shops and Dinning. I really enjoy the new top floor with Restaurants such as the Greek Eat Greek all the all day food/Shillong MORE Cafe. I beleive that every tourist should visit it

Fun but mainly over priced luxury goods in this mall.. If you like paying well over the odds for so-called glamorous brands and names this is your place. Its full of people browsing and buying next to nothing. There is an amusing winter wonderland in the mall where kids can play, take a toboggan and there are even penguins knocking about - its huge! Its on the main metro route so easy to find. Standard Dubai really, playing to the materialistic crowd.

Great mall but not with a stroller. Been here with a stroller and I must say that it's really crazy that there is only one elevator in the mall. This makes my grade go done quite much.The mall it self is nice and there are plenty of shops to visit. Everything from exclusive brands to more normal störs with normal prices. The ski part looks really nice bit nothing that we hade the opertunity to try.
Beautiful mall. Beautiful mall ...loads of shops... need a week to explore all. On very accesdible route via bus or metro train
Nice shopping . The mall is big and has a lot of luxury labels shop. If you like to go for ski you can do this as well in the ski dubai which is a part of the mall.

Great upscale place to visit. We are visiting mall of Emirates since 2006, always find it excellent, congenial, upscale, pleasantly friendly place to be. This time more and more sale offers attracted us there. And there is always magic planet and food courts to cater the young ones.
Top places in Dubai. I like this mall, full of interior details, lavish environment, variance types of retail, rich in good quality products and coffee shops.Good for families as well as friends.

Mall of everything. Yes, bring your credit cards and loads of cash because this mall has every store on sale! If you don't have a car, you can take the metro station. And just a few minute walk will get you to the mall entrance (unlike in Dubai mall, you have to walk quite a distance).They have ski dubai and other attractions. I think the mall layout is better and well planned out unlike in Dubai mall where there are so many twists and turns. This isn't just a mall. It is a high end mall with great outlet prices!!

Very nice. This is a very nice mall (I think every building in Dubai is nice!), however for a tourist, I think the Dubai Mall is the way to go -- except for skiers who want to experience this indoor slope. And, there are activities for kids in the ski area. Lots of shops, but nothing extraordinary in my mind.

faster to shop here then Dubai Mall.. Its a lot easier to walk around this mall then the Dubai Mall but we still love the Dubai Mall. We come here for the NIKE store as its so much bigger and you get almost everything that you don't see in Nike dubai. Layout is good but they need to get a better system to find the shops as they system they have is time consuming and old. you do get more deals here sometimes so good to pop in and check.

Luxury designed shopping mall. I still feel that this attraction is more for locals than for tourists, since it has the Dubai Ski, many outlets etc. Prices are same as in other prices, so i do not think that has some price advantage. Restaurants yes, have quite a few. Anyway, many hotels offer shuttle buses to there, so can take one evening for it.
Good mall. The mall is good for families and groups. Many activities are there. Parking lots are free, sometime they charge for parking!
Nice. Full range of top end shops. Pleasant retreat from the blazing heat. Stores are kind of pricy, but if you are here in Dubai expect the cost. Very good setting for a variety of shoppers.

Shops for all budgets. Something for everyone in this Mall. Everyday brands to high end designer shops.
It's not everyday you can shop then watch people ski on indoor slopes or watch people interact with penguins. This is a tourist attraction not just a large shopping centre. Great selection of eateries to break up the walk around this huge mall.

Great mall. Mall is great. It has many merchants, stores, entertainment and cinemas. You can buy many things, pass time. But it has parking issue. Initial 4 hours are free then 20 aed will be charged per hour after 4 hours. At least it should be free for those who is spending 100 or more aed inside the mall.

Good mix of shops and food outlets. I always visit this mall whilst in Dubai. It has a great mix of shops from supermarkets to high end brands. There seems to be more American brands being added too. I was pleased to find an Abercrombie and Fitch has opened ( prices much the same as Uk) and Victoria's Secret are opening a Pink store soon too. Just about every type of cuisine under the sun . Not to mention the entertainment on offer too. You can see all the goings on of ski Dubai and you can see the Penguins at different intervals too. I'd say it's the best mall to go to if your only going to one. You can get great low cost souvenirs from up the back in Carrefour , ie fridge magnets , mugs, t shirts , small replicas of iconic buildings etc, a lot cheaper than the airport etc.

one of my favorite malls. it was the largest mall in the worldbefore dubai mall came in the picture so you can find most of the clothing shops there.it has:-four food courts (three restaurant and one fast food)-ski dubai-attached to two hotels for more restaurant variety-fashion area for high end clothing-carrefourand many moretip: go to higher floor for more chance to find parking

Great Fun & Ski Dubai is Unique! . A great Mall for all the luxury brands. It is spread out but not as much as Dubai mall and also a bit less busy.Has great restaurants and Cinemas but the crowning glory is Ski Dubai - the indoor snow park.Because it's not as busy as Dubai Mall I feel less rushed in the stores.And the Cheesecake Factory is awesome here with all the views of the snow park Ski Dubai with more seating. This means you get your table much quicker here. Easily connected to the Metro and it doesn't come with the 1 km walkway tunnel that Dubai Mall has from the metro station.It's fun with kids.

Shopping Day 1. A mall with an indoor ski slope. . What's not to love about the excesses of Dubai. It's 40+ degrees outside, 20ish degrees inside and this mall has a self contained ski slope that was even colder. We were not there to ski but did take several photos before covering the mall. This is one of several large malls in Dubai. It's big and clean and has a lot of variety. Look up the list of shops online. None of the cafes or food courts were open during Ramadan (June) but we could order food / drinks in the western hotel that adjoined the mall. We shopped one day and picked up the red bus on the second day. There is supposedly a bus service between malls but we could not find it. The next mall was Dubai Mall.

My favourite!. Out of the gazillion malls in Dubai, MOE is by far my favourite.The only Mac Store in the Middle East is there, a humungous GO Sport and so much more. They've got everything, the shops, great restaurants and Apres (if you need a cold brewski) for a pit stop in between shops.

Interesting Mall (especially Ski indoors). Amazing experience when you get to Ski inside a mall in a desert when outside temp is 44°C and you are enjoying snow is sub zero temparature in the mall. Kids and teenagers are going to love it. Beyond the ski there are good options of Food ranging from food court to fine dining. Ladies will love the shopping. Enjoy the Vox Cinema experience if you have the time.

Not your ordinary mall. After Dubai mall this was my favorite place,The mall actually looks better than Dubai mall,The stand out here is Ski dubai and although i never did it to have a ski slope in your mall is unreal.Well worth a look around this mall.

mall with full size ski slope. Dubai is full of malls but this and Dubai Mall appear most publicised. Both are huge and on same Metro line - fastest way between them. Attraction of this mall is it has full scale indoor ski slope!! As I had just come from Switzerland, impressed by the scale of imitation and never seen(or heard of) an imitation ski slope before- extra impressive as it is always 30-40C outside during the day.Mall has shops of every luxury brand you have ever heard of - and then some. Both have same shops/prices, so little point in doing comparative shopping between them. This one has 5 star luxury hotel inside it (Kempinski) and Novotel/Ibis over the road.
i love this mall!. Literally this mall has become my second home :) Cinema, Restaurants, Ski Dubai and Shopping :) all in one place! Love going back again and again and again! You will love it too!

Luxury shopping. It is a high end shopping mall which boasts world known designer brands. The mall is absolutely immaculate and I was there during Ramadan so it was quite, this revealed the true size of the place it is massive. It is also a great way to escape the heat. There is also a large supermarket Carrefour which is the equivalent to Tesco/Sainsburys.There is also lots of parking and good rail and bus links too.

Lively and Lovely. When I had few hours to kill before catching up with next meeting, I took an unplanned break at 'Mall of Emirates'. Completely swept by the variety of 'Brands' available. Was able to find few items, which I have been looking for a while in High Streets. Luckily I had the discount coupons which I obtained at the 'World Travel Market 2015' in London. Since then I made this to be my one stop shopping stop.

Basically just a high end shopping centre. I guess it does what it says on the box. Full of medium to high end retailers, with most of the shopping centre having a little bit of glitz but not much personality.We wanted to take the kids skiing, but there are very limited options for those who've never skied before. They have lessons, but separated into age groups, and my 4-year old would have had to have had a slot 3 hours away from my 11-year old. There wasn't three hours worth of stuff to do in the centre in the interim, so we didn't bother.Also, beware the games arcade up the top level. Of the three games the kids played, one took money off our card but didn't activate, and another had half the buttons malfunctioning so the game was lost within seconds. Trying to prove/explain this to the staff is fruitless, and we essentially spent $25 in about two minutes.

Just A Big Mall. Good way to cool off I suppose, clean, has all your brand names and has lots of people in costumes to keep kids excited. Also has the artificial ski slope.Besides the ski slope, pretty much a mall you could find any where else

Shopping in Dubai . Definately a great place to shop for anything. Temperature is perfect. You can buy toys, shop at Carre 4 which is massive and get any supplies for yourself while you are having a stopover. Money exchangers, even snow skiing to try. Shuttles to and from. Taxis are cheap. I shop here every time.

Wow. The shops the mall the aquarium you could pay just to see the aquarium but it is free and is an experience in itself you can pay and feed the fish etc but that is upto you.But for shopaholics welcome to paradise everything is available right upto the most expensive stuff which some of us mortals just see and move on !! But a great memory nonetheless!!

To compare...If Dubai Mall is the Trafford centre, Mall of the emirates is Manchester Arndale . We visited mall of emirates as we had been to Dubai Mall many times on this visit and the last visit to Dubai. The mall of emirates feels like local people the shops of course have the high end stores but it also has normal high street bargain stores and a huge food court with fast foods and a supermarket. The people shopping there obviously live and work in Dubai there's definitely less tourists. The mall itself is not as glamorous or in your face as Dubai Mall and because of this you feel less rushed and can walk around at a leisurely pace as it feels more relaxed. There are of course so many shops you need hours to visit them all.

Much improved with the new food courts and stores. Never was a huge fan of MOE and had visited recently to be pleasantly surprised with the addition of the food courts (more 'upmarket' than your average food court) and the new shops that have been added. It is of course home to the fabulous Ski Dubai and has a good selection of shops.
Great shopping. Great shopping centre! It's smaller than Dubai Mall, but it's enjoyment for you too. You find here all shops from cheapest to expensive and luxury brands.

Everything You Could Ever Want!. Amazing, a jaw-dropping at the same time! Every store possible was in this mall. As an American I could find all things British and European as well. This is the perfect mall if you have to pick just one.
fantastic. The mall is the nearest from opal. you can shop, eat and enjoy more than required. If possible, one can walk for exercise from the Hotel to the mall . modern equipmentd Reailly available
Has everything there. Very big mall with many shops and restaurants.Highly recommended. Big brand shops, good restaurants and cafes. Lots of entertainment too.

A mall worth visiting. The mall of the Emirates is easy to get to with the Metro line. There you can find any kind of food that you wish to taste from korean to greek food. Furthermore, if you you wish to see a movie the cinema is very comfortable and it has arabic and french subtitles. Finally, don't forget to visit Ski dubai it will transport you to a different world instantly.
Wow. Perfect place ro find everything you may need. Full od people going up and down, full bars and restourants with vey kind personnel.

Mall of the Emirates got bigger. I've been here several times and since my first time back in 2013, the mall has grown and become a lot more interesting to visit. All the shops you could ever be in need of (and now also an Apple Store!) plus a great variety of cafés and restaurants besides the food court where you can actually eat also during the holy month of Ramadan.

very good. much busier then the mall of Dubai but that may have been as we went late afternoon,. I wanted to go to ski Dubai and do the penguin thing but we hadn't booked and it was fully booked unfortunately,

Good range of shops. This mall is brilliant it's got good links to the sky train and also has a wide range of shops including a variety of American stores such as bath and body works and English stores like Next.
Overall a good range of shops.

Best mall in Dubai. Without fail this mall ticks all the boxes of a begrudging passive shopper: clean bathrooms, awesome cinema, quality food outlets, excellent cafes. Not to mention every shop you could need arranged in grid system. And an indoor ski slope with penguins, just in case you need to escape the desert.
Mall OF emirates . Enjoy shopping in Dubai. The MOE has 560+ outlets, choice of entertainments like Ski Dubai, 90+ dining options - making it one of the best shopping malls in Dubai.
Shops galore. Great for shopping or eating. Shops are huge and anything needed can be found. Sheraton & Ibis hotels within. Recommend Brunswick Sports Cafe for a yummy lunch.

Very beautiful mall. Its a huge mall but not the biggest in UAE. There are 3 food courts and many ancor stores.
The dubai ski facility is amazing
Massive ●●●. It's' really great & much more to do. Make sure u have enough time to see top to bottom ☆☆☆During the summer months more offers.

This is my favorite mall in Dubai!. Mall of Emirates (MoE) is a large shopping and entertainment center located in the Al Barsha district. It opened in November 2005. The total area is 604,000 m². The building was designed by the American company F + A Architects. In a single complex the visitor will find a shopping center, the Kempinski Hotel Mall of the Emirates and an indoor ski resort ‘Ski Dubai’. This is the first indoor ski resort in the Middle East.  MoE has a multiplex with 14 cinemas, a 500-seat capacity Dubai Community Theatre and Arts Centre and one of the largest indoor family entertainment centers in Dubai called ‘Magic Planet’. Actually, this is my favorite mall in Dubai.  Now, after the reconstruction, a new uber-expensive extension, which includes several new boutiques, restaurants, and the Middle East’s firsts and only IMAX with a laser screen the visitor will have a new consumer experience.

A huge shopping centre. Dubai knows how to go big and shopping malls are no exception. This place is massive!I've been here several times now and still get lost. This is not your average shopping centre. You can view the ski slopes and snow actives from inside, Yes I said snow. Dubai, often thought of as a desert climate is home to a huge indoor ski centre (they even have penguins!)
Perfect for shopping brands. If u look place for shopping luxury brands with good prices you should try mall of emirates, cinema and Resturant are good too.

Best mall in the world!. This mall is hands down the most amazing mall that ever existed! It has every-single-brand you can think of.. and then some! It's caters to luxury shopping; Cartier, Chanel, Piaget, Rolex, Bottega (to name a few) and high street shopping; H&M, Zara, Mango, Massimo Dutti etc. Not to forget the ample of entertainment available. From their prestigious cinema, where you can recline your plush leather seats and order a meal, to indoor snow park, the little ones can mingle with the real penguins while you ski! Yes, indoor skiing in the middle of the desert! And if you don't know how to ski you can learn at the snow park! All this in a MALL. This mall truly sets the bar so high no mall has ever come close enough!

Great for brand lovers. Rated it one point less because had to put Dubai mall a notch up. It does not have a Burj or Dubai fountains but otherwise most shops and dining options are similar. It's actually a better option for those who want to focus on luxury brands + ski Dubai is definitely worth one visit.

All in one mall. It is easily connected with the Metro. My hotel was nearby so I used to walk till here.
The mall is really nice, particularly the electronic items. Other products are also available in wide variety. Great place for shopping.
Indoor ski is the highlight.

Amazing !!!!! truly Amazing !!!!. Its Really A nice Mall to Visit. In this Electronic Market Is their And Huge Variety Of Products are Available and new and innovative Products You can Buy their . Its amazing place for Shopping Electronic product
Like it. I like this mall but I think the Dubai mall is better, it has a good food court and you can ski in this mall ! ! ! but Dubai mall is bigger and you can see the fountain.

One of the best Malls. Mall of Emirates as it's name suggests is one of the best Mall in Dubai. All branded products of well-known business houses and companies particularly electronic goods are available here.This mall is well-known for the ice rings.An artificial Iceland has been created giving a feel of ski resorts in an enclosure in the mall.Ropeway carry ice enthusiasts in open Chair-Lifts, Ski-Lifts from one end to the other.Snow walkers find it very thrilling and enjoy their stay there in minus zero temperature.Entry to this place is by tickets.Restaurant and fast food shops are aplenty.For relaxation Cinema halls are also there Mall is connected by metro and buses.Huge car park is available.

Huge and glitzy with helpful staff. My husband and I visited the Mall yesterday, just before the call to prayers. It was busy, but not difficult to navigate. We bought a gold chain to take home for a friend and the Indian salesman was really helpful, directing us to other stores we expressed interest in. Our experience of Dubai has been only with workers from other nations. We wonder if the Arab population works at all, or if it just takes advantage of the oil resources. Whatever, Dubai gives employment to many people from poor nations and they are really appreciative.
Selective Shopping. If you are away from the Dubai mall.. this is the best mall to go for selective shopping. Mostly people go to this place with the Ski Dubai perspective.

Amazing mall . My boyfriend and I visited this mall during our stay in Dubai 1-8th June. I absolutely loved this mall. It has all the essential stores and even has a giant supermarket on the ground floor. They even have an cinema, ski Dubai and various other activities that's children friendly aswell. Throughout my stay on Dubai I realised that the customer service was 10x better than what I receive at home in London.Mall of Emirates even contains my favourite restaurant.. CHEESECAKE FACTORY!!Also, there's a taxi stand so it's easy to go to and from the mall with no issues. They have exchange rate stores and many restaurants to choose from!Definitely a mall to visit Whilst visiting Dubai !!

Big Mall. The Mall of the Emirates is a great big shopping mall, close to the palm and easily accessible, the mall offers a good variety of shops and dining options all well as a huge indoor ski-slope.

Huge shopping experience with easy access by metro. Huge collections of shops for all tastes and wallets. Easy access by metro. Fountains show are a must at night - really nice experience but allow you a many hours to explore the shopping as it is very big !!!

Best mall in the asia. main attraction of the mall was the underwater aquarium . outside of the underwater aquarium was free to visit and it was beauty beyond . there was also a waterfall filled with men diving down was a great view. Most of the shops are expensive and but it was worth watching

A Huge Shopping Mall But.... Compared to Dubai Mall, Mall of the Emirates definitely is not as interesting. Unless you live/stay in Jumeira, Dubai Marina, Palm Island (or points further south, toward Abu Dhabi), Mall of Emirates is also further away from the old city center (Deira and Bur Dubai).However, one thing that Dubai Mall doesn't have, is that Mall of Emirates has the largest indoor ski slope in the world. For people who are not interested in skiing on a "fake" slope, you can still take pictures from outside.Just like Dubai Mall, it can also be reached by Dubai Metro train (Red Line). It is much closer to the station.Shopping-wise, there are also endless choice here. However, beyond shopping and skiing, I find that there are not really that many interesting things to see or do here.

Very good . If you want to visit a mall in Dubai but can't be bothered with all the walking about, Mall of Emirates is one you should visit. It is the smallest of the three Dubai malls, but is still hard to find your way about! Their food court is on the east side of the mall on the bottom floor and has lots of varieties of food to try. The only downside is that it is very hard to find seats. I particularly enjoy the Victoria's Secret and the Harvey Nics. But they have lots of different stores. The first floor is all mainly designer shops where as the bottom is more your high street shops such as top shop, river island, h and m etc! Definitely worth a visit!
