Beware of Carrefour!!!. I bought some cardamom powder at Carrefour Mall of Emirates last Sunday before my international flight. When i opened the bottle at home i realized that someone broke the seal and stole a good amount of cardamom. I shop at this Carrefour all the time and know there is a lot of staff watching the customers. How did this happen? I will not shop here anymore.
Great mall. It's great mall for who looking to brand name and middle cost for another brandThe design of mall very nice with a lot of restaurants available and coffee shop

Centre point is amazing for tourists . Loved mall of Emirates. Had everything I needed. Their supermarket was cheap and cheerful for fellow tourists and the centrepoint shop had lots of amazing goodies for gifts. Had all the fast food places as well!!!

Next to the Mall of Emirates metro station.. This shopping center can be found at Mall of the Emirates metro station (red metro line). Huge number of shops, almost all big brands can be found. It is worth to visit Ski Dubai, it's a great experience, however, it is quite small for people regularly skiing.
Mall of the Emirates. This shopping center can be found at Mall of the Emirates metro station. Huge shopping center with cafeterias, amazing shops of all big world-wide brands, etc.
10/10. It's like a city everything you need or even looking for you can find it in dubai they sell mostly everything and all you need kids fun and even adults fun

Retail therapy . This is not the largest Mall in Dubai but if you are staying in the marina area it is worth a visit as it will offer you a couple of hours relaxed shopping and you can eat on the balcony and watch the world go by

Lovely Mall!. The Mall of the Emirates is a lovely Mall with plenty of shops for both high end & affordable shopping! It house plenty of British household stores such as M&S and Debenhams to name a couple! Plenty of sales to be had too! There's plenty of choices to dine! (Use 'The Entertainer for good discounts including BOGOF!) If using public transport the mall is easily accessible by the Dubai Metro!

Grand mall. Our first impression was WOW! An enormous place where you can actually get lost, but thanks to the maps we tried to cover at least 1/4 of the mall! Branded stores where you can go shop till you drop. It also has a ski place inside where you can have a feel of being in Snow land. A lovely entertainment place for both children & adults. A must go place!
Nice. Huge place. Indoor Ski, IMAX, great places to eat. a whole day might not be enough. easily accessed by metro.
Shopping. It's amazing place to shop. U can reach directly through metro . All major brands are available . Food is also great at food court.

Guge. Another enormous Mall in Dubai. Loads of shops you would find on the British high street from M&S, Next, River Island and Debenhams. There is loads to do including a ski slope with a chair lift, toboggan runs, penguins etc. Vast choice of places to eat with many different nationalities.

Fab mall, lots to do and lots to eat!!. Lovely clean mall...with everything you need. Lots of lovely shops and even better that there is a local supermarket inside. Lots of fresh fruit and veg and all reasonable prices. Good amount of food courts and a wife range of food and seating area available! Easy access on the red line on the Metro as well.

One Big Mall. Surely not as huge as the Dubai Mall, nevertheless, one of the biggest in Dubai if not the middle east or the world.So many shops, restaurants, attractions and things to do that u need more than a day to finish it all.Its home to the Ski Dubai and Dubai Penguin Encounter which you should not miss once there.A lot of parking lots so no need to worry about any car park.Not too far from the JBR
Just like any other mall but HUGE.. Back then in Singapore, it is similar to mall name "Great World City" only that its pretty huge. Very clean. If get bored, go to the indoor ski.
just like any other mall. nothing great about this one...all the malls of dubai are nice huge with lot of brands and designer wear..entertainment options etc.
COOL. simply awesome..its very big mall...but mast for weekend..everything is there for shopping, eating and fun

Favorite most comfy mall in Dubai. Is my fav mall, all shops for every pocket and demand, has improved renewed VOX cinema with VOX theatre (luxury segment), SKI Dubai, wide range of restaurants and coffee shops. Unlike Dubai Mall, MOE is very comfy to walk and explore, you don't get lost.

Holliday tour. Very great n super quality material neet n cleen place honest n help full person.very big space top quality infrastructure realy good place. i will go there the beautiful place again n again.

Ultimate Shopping Experience. I'm not overly into shopping or malls but I can appreciate that this mall is phenomenal and has basically anything you could possibly ever want to buy - all in the one convenient location.

One among the best malls in Dubai!. The next best after Dubai Mall.. The architecture, size and decor are simply awesome.. The mall hosts a number of entertainment options like Ski Dubai, Magic Planet, Vox cinemas etc. And also got an impressive list of department stores..

big mall lots to see. as with most of the malls in dubai. this has all the major outlets. it is the closest mall to the Mina A' Salam Resort. the food mall is not very big but caters for all food types.
the supermarket is huge where you should find all and any food types you may need.
it also have a multiplex cinema.
Amazing Mall!. Never fails us. Fun, eating, shopping, entertainment, nice views. All to top in... Great! Crowded, main reason is...everyone love it...
Lovely As Ever. The Dubai mall never disappoints, lovely as ever. Wanted to spend an hour plus ended up spending more than 5 hours. Amazing

Huge mall!! Ski if you get bored...... Huge shopping mall with hundreds of shops including well known high street brands from the UK. Well spaced out, very clean and even though it was busy it didn't feel like it as the mall is so spacious. Prices are on a par with UK prices so no great savings to be had. Ski slope inside if you get bored of shopping! if you get a cab back to your hotel, be sure to agree the price beforehand - we were advised by our hotel it should cost around 30AED but our cabbie tried to charge us 70AED. We eventually agreed on 40AED but the cabbie wasn't happy and drove like a lunatic all the way back to the hotel without uttering a single word to us. Only example of poor customer service we experienced on our whole trip.
Fun and more. I could not even cover a quarter of the stores. The maps were very helpful so i was able to quickly find stores .

Plenty to see. With a massive indoor ski/snow centre to keep the kids happy while the parents go shopping, it's a win win situation. The rail service runs under the shopping mall and there's plenty of bus and taxi services all the time making getting to and from the mall easy. It has got to have the largest array of shops to visit outside of the Dubai Mall which I have seen, I couldn't get over the size of the place and main atrium.

Huge Mall. It is real huge mall with plenty shops of most of the universal brands. Prices are reasonable and you can find there your budget. Many shops do sales discounts along the year.There are two food courts where you find the fast food restaurants like Kentucky Burger King Pizza Hut and othersThere are cinemas too and multi options for kids entertainments.The mall is connected to two hotels Sheraton Mall of Emirates and Kempinski as well.You can reach it through the metro which is connected to the mall as well and cheaper and faster way for transportation in Dubai.

Best mall in Dubai. This mall is great! It has everything you want and need and the new Vox cinema is way better than the previous one! Avoid going to the mall on the weekends!! The best time to go is in the morning when all the shops open up

A real shopping mall. Highly recommended mall , well maintained they keep amazing us with new brands and activity you won't regret taking the family over there cause they also have a very good restaurants and kids entertainment like kids cinema and ski
A LOT of people . Seriously. It's anthill. Millions of shops whatever you would like. Not so clear foodcort. But the Ski Dubai is there!!!
Fab mall. Really enjoyed my visit to this mall. It's pretty big + has a great selection of shops and eateries.

Second Best Mall in UAE. Prior to Dubai Mall used to be the best Mall. Mall is well connected either by road & Metro as well. It also has Big Big Carrefour store on ground floor.With two food courts & Ski Dubai, Movie Halls it has everything what you wish for.Can easily pass a half day at this mall. Near the upper floor food court there few good restaurants as well.
Best mall. One of the best mom in the world,very luxury electronic, brands etc.... , design everything is wawwwww will comeback for sure

The classic mall. It has almost all the brand shoppe in the world. It is yhe best place for those who only wants to shop. Food court on top floor has many options for your hungry tummy but least option for the vegetarians. You can spend a whole day in the mall.

Awesome area but watch the 1% people.... Great hotel the view was awesome and accessible to everything. They give massages for a low price and the hotel staff was great. You have to be careful with the locals they feel privilege so they are rude and do things to show they belong. Luckily the staff made sure we were accommodated even when the locals tried to skip line and felt they should be served first. Overall great trip so much to do, lots of shopping and outside of the locals being a nuisance everyone else was great and hospitable. Don't get me wrong from what I can see their government has them feeling that way. If all immigrants left their country they would be lost. I don't care where you go if you pay your money you deserve first hand service. I did meet some locals who were nice but you can see they feel some type of way. I would go back with the understanding that they are that way, but it didn't interfere with our trip. I was a little perturbed at the airport when the guy allow some locals to skip everyone just because they were locals and had on the outfit that signifies they are locals. Its a game I choose not to play with them. Thank god for the staff...
Best Mall in World. From my point of view, this is really the best mall i have ever visited all over my travels around the globe. Every Time i visited it i found new stores and activities.

Great Mall. This mall was just around the corner from where I was staying. There is a good range of shops - mainly well known brand fashion shops. There is a food court and many food restaurants to choose from. Ski Dubai looks amazing and would be great if you where a keen skier or have kids. There is a large supermarket where I did buy some things to take back to my hotel.

Great mall . This mall is huge but more manageable than Dubai Mall. It's got a huge variety of stores and restaurants and everyone can find something to suit them. What's unique about this mall is Ski Dubai - you can actually go skiing and see Penguins here! If you don't want to go in, you can just watch from the outside. You can get to this mall by the Dubai Metro.
One of the best shopping experience in Dubai. We have visited the mall and it's one of the best attractions in Dubai. With a lot of fun for kids , even worth to go for window shopping. ..
Great Mall!. This mall is great and has all the shops in you could want for a great shopping day. It also has lots of entertainment with a cinema and ski slope! A huge amazing mall.

Dont think I will ever see it all. I love the place, its a one stop location with entertainment, fine dining/fast food, luxury chains/affordable shops... it has everything within. I have visited around 15 restaurants and cafes so far and there are still so many more to go!!!

Excellent mall in Dubai. Fantastic mall in downtown Dubai. Easily accessible by subway (Metro) at Mall of the Emirates stop. Open very late, with excellent shops, food court, & attractions like Ski Dubai. Lots of food options, including The Cheesecake Factory. Great escape from the heat and to pick up Dubai souvenirs to take home.
Awsome. One of the best mall i ever seen in my life. Streets looks like Europe nice clean and tidy.must seen place in dubai
Wow. You'll need more than a day to shop....eat and play... excellent facilities....with prayer hall....plenty of activities on the go... Dubai Ski is a must.... be prepared for the chill

Shop until you drop!. Not so huge as the Dubai Mall but well worth a visit and you won't get lost here. Great designer shops and restaurant choices. Check out the ski centre from the top floor viewing window.

A regular mall, exept for the ski slope!. Especially if you compare it with Dubai Mall, it is "just" a mall above the average for size and aspect. Several places to eat distributed across the three floors, the best ones are quite busy and may require 30mins+ queuing. The exceptional attraction is the ski slope: a genuine slope + neighbours, close to the sea in the desert.

Grandeur. Kempinski Hotel, Ski Dubai, Cheesecake Factory, some of my favourite places in one Mall
It's fun to walk around, explore, eat, relax, shop, chill out and get lost
It's grand in all senses
Craaaazy. Crazy to see that many shops in one building! Even skiing is possible?! On the ground floor you'll find the cheaper shops, going upstairs the more expensive ones..

just big. of cos it's much smaller than dubai mall, still a lots to shop and eat. the only place i spent $ and time was carrefour. i bought fruits, juice for myself, and coffee, argon oil for my frds.

Great mall!. The best mall in our opinion. Smaller than the Dubai mall but still plenty of shops with a range of price points. Personally I won't pay designer prices so it was nice to be able to browse and buy good quality items at reasonable prices here. Fabulous ice cream parlour selling the most amazing and yummy desserts. Forget your diet!! Didn't visit the ski slope as we are not skiers but was great viewing from air conditioned comfort.

Smaller version of Dubai Mall. A nice alternative to Dubai Mall. Might be slightly cheaper, seemed like there was more shops with sales on.But still a great selection of shops and restaurants. The ski slope is incredible, but you cant get a great view of it without going to one of the restaurants.With the shops then there is pretty much everything you need.Location wise it is away from the airport and financial district. There is the metro nearby, and you don't have to walk a mile like at Dubai Mall.

Winter in Summer. Lots of places to eat and shop. Lots of money exchanges. Not as big or glitzy as the newer Dubai Mall, but it does have the indoor ski fields where you can snowboard, ski, ride the cable, or just experience something otherwise impossible in Dubai. It's a surreal experience to eat in a restaurant overlooking the ski fields in one of the worlds hottest desert cities.
Shopping time.... Nice mall with many shops and places to visit..has Ski Dubai inside..free parking..nice food court..tons of money to spend..must visit if your in Dubai..
Great place to visit. I bad a realgoidwalk around a very busyplace every shop youcan imagine andlotzplaces to eat soa realworth a visitt place

Shop till you drop then shop some more. They have two malls, so forgive me if I get them mixed up! To say mall,mis not the right word, to say experience us! They have one of the largest supermarket, or should I say hyper market, Caraforte it sells everything,and us amazing, they even have wait rose, m and s, and other English store, water fountains, and ski dubi,at the top, is a restrunt, you can look and see the dancing fountains,mid it's the one I'm thinking,it also revolves round the top, so if you eat at night( you need to book), you can see the water dancing to music, lit up,It's very exciting!Plenty of shops, food,,just enjoy

Beware, NOT duty free prices!. A quick warning regarding shopping in Dubai, my wife purchased a Louis Vuitton clutch bag and a 100ml pot of Creme de la MerCredit card statement just arrived, the bag on Louis Vuitton's own UK site with free postage was £995, Dubai price, £1,254, and the same with the cream, £300 in John Lewis, £413 in Dubai!!!We have been visiting Dubai for 18 years, when the Dirham was over 7 to the pound, now it is 5, and the prices have been steadily ramped up as the Russian and Chinese arrive, it is no longer a viable holiday shopping destination!!!Beware!

Lovely to wander round. We had a good wander round, so much to see and so many shops to go into! Lots of fab paces to eat, we ended up eating at the cheesecake factory which was nice. There is the ski slope located here which looked fun! Worth a visit if you want to do a bit of shopping!

Restaurant Choice not bad. There are plenty of eateries at the Ski Dubai end of the Mall: from Sushi to Lebanese to Iranian to Indian to Steak to Pizza - so plenty of choice. Mall itself it a little less upmarket than the Dubai Mall. Prices are not any cheaper than Europe - in fact more expensive.

Amazing Shopping Centre. We visited Dubai for the 6th time last November and are still being amazed by this Shopping Centre. Clusters of childrens' clothes shops, electronic shops, jewellery, china and whatever else you could ever want. It is a beautiful shopping centre in every way. While having coffee we were looking next door to "Ski Dubai" a man made indoor ski area where you can hire everything you need to go skiing. We have visited Dubai several times and cannot help but marvel at the Mall of the Emirates Shopping Centre.John and Gail Laney

Previous to the Dubai Mall, the largest mall in Dubai and still quite a trip. Its quite an experience to go to a ski slope in a mall. Aside from Ski Dubai there are numerous stores including two groceries, exchange bureaus, cell phone hookups and a huge variety of places to shop and eat. Definitely on any list of places to see and shop in Dubai.
amazing place to be in. just an amazing place to be in all that you need to be entertained for the day, excellent places to eat, shop or just window shop.

My favourite mall in Dubai. Mall of the Emirates is definitely my favourite mall in Dubai. Their new level is sparkly and delightful with the Middle East's biggest cinema complete with Gary Rhodes restaurant inside (not so good), the first Apple Store in the Middle East and my personal favorites: the Michelin Star Dim Sum place Din Tai Fung & Lululemon.

A great Shopping Destination. My Wife and I visited Dubai in 2016 and took the Metro to this Mall, it was a great mall, smaller then the Dubai mall, but still well situated on the Metro link, and easy to navigate, there is a Geant on the first floor that we used conveniently to get groceries and snacks.

Dubai mall is better unless you really want to ski indoors. This mall is quite far from the center of Dubai. It is accessible by train, but does not offer any restaurants or stores that aren't at the Dubai Mall.Then only reason to spend the 45minutes on the train is because you really want to ski indoors.

Wow!! Better than Mall of America. All sorts of retailers from US and EU. Great place to find chain restaurants from US, Canada and Europe.This mall has everything a Western visitor could want, including an aquarium and an ice skating rink.Easy access to Burj Khalifa and the Dubai Fountain.2020 expo grounds will be right next to the mall.
Lots to do. Great mall, and very near the hotel we stayed. Lots of things for the family to do, in addition to visiting the many shops, lots of places to eat, ski Dubai, etc. well worth the visit.

A must see- cool, calm and lots of things to see and do. Unlike Dubai Mall, this original is more varied with eateries clustered together, home stores, the ski area and the high end designer boutiques and restaurants. It's a good activity to escape the heat or rain. Spotlessly clean. However, serious lack of lifts/elevators so if you have a buggy, a search for one or the use of a travelator is not ideal to freely move throughout the mall. For younger children, under 13, Magic Planet is a must! And safe that they can be left up there whisky parents re charge at Costa below :-)

huge mall with exhausting experience. biggest mall in dubai in the size of a small town. you can reach it via dubai mall metro station then you have to walk for around 1 km in a covered glass labyrinth above the highway to reach the entrance. always crowded very noisy. the big touch direction screens are most of the time not working. you can get confused inside finding your destination. you run into most shops more than once in different sections of the mall.

Shop till u drop . They have everything you can think off . Excellent perfume shops .very friendly staff at all the shops we been to . Lots of restaurants. Dancing fountains and under water zoo . Excellent for the kids if u taking any .

Great mall - car parks need improvement. We enjoyed our visit to the mall including ski Dubai etc. There are some great restaurants at the mall too. The negative point for us is the car parks. The main issue being exiting the car park took almost 45 minutes this is mainly due to there not being enough exit lanes for the number of cars. This is further compounded by the mall charging for parking and issuing tickets which you need to stop and validate through the barrier machine this further slows the process!

Perfect mall. The mall was awesome. I really liked it especially that large super store...... Things were cheap and relieble however other shops are pricey and secondly the mall is so big that u cant visit it in one go.

Stunning . Stunning with the huge space and her beauty and crowed, if you are shopaholic I am sure you will get some back( bags) home, varieties choices easy access by cab or either metro right in front of the bldg. Big carefoure ever and Ski Dubai is crazy.... ;-)
A Unique Experience. The Mall of the Emirates houses not only an abundance of high end shops but the Ski Dubai ski slope which is an incredible innovation. A totally fascinating and enjoyable mall

Yet another outstanding Mall in Dubai. Fantasic mall. Shops galore....with a Ski center!! We did not have time to do the skiing but had a great walk around. Myself and kids went to the Magic kingdom (i think that's what it was called) while the 'ladies' went shopping. Both groups had a very enjoyable time. Brought kids to the Cheesecake factory for a treat... expensive enough but we ask for a table looking out on the ski slopes (just waited 10 mins) so they enjoyed that.
Amazing Mall. One of the best I have been to. Soooo many brands... where do you start.If your a shopper you will be in heaven!!

Lovely Mall. This mall is not as big as Dubai Mall so I found it more easier to find my around. Yes everything is Expensive in Dubai but my kids found they stock things we cant find in Australia so therefore many purchases were made on sport shoes. Also its a great place to have dinner with many food outlets and restaurants. Also easier to get to with Metro and some hotels have a shuttle service to this mall like Atlantis does. Of course there is a ski field in this mall just to to add to more entrainment. Definitely recommend a visit here. You can also pick up many souvenirs from the supermarket there so very handy.
Its a shopping centre. Its gaudy and opulent but ultimately a little empty of experience unless you are shopping. Strangely, all the shops appeared to be empty of shoppers.

Good but not the best. Mall of Emirates at Dubai is a good shipping mall but if you compare it with Dubai Mall then you may not find it huge. However in self it's good. Spread on Titan three floors. Good centralised AC, good court with all options. Carrefour hyper Mart available.
Connecting point for going to miracle Garden and changing big Bus routes.

Very impressive . Personally not a fun of shopping.. If you wanna see the luxurious side of shopping in dubai that's the place to go.. The view of burj Khalifa and the fountains + the souk al bajar located behind the mall makes it even more worth visiting if just wanna walk around.. May I suggest if there during "winter" take a walk in the Boulevard besides the mall.. It's really pretty with nice restaurants and a bit more quiet than the chaos that is in the mall..

An attraction. We had a great time but we didn't do any shopping. It is simply too much, plus it's very expensive. There are so many things to do except shipping. You can see the fish in the big tank at the entrance of the aquarium without buying the ticket. Do not miss the famous waterfall. Or just enjoy a cup of coffee and watch the people. The entrance to the Burj Kalifa is in the Mall and Dubai fountains close by.
Just another huge luxury mall. This mall is just for rich people. It is too big, the only fun ist the view to the ski dubai from the restaurants, for watching stupid people trying to ski...

Simply the best mall in the world !!!. Hi Folks!!You can't see it all in a day !! There is too much to see. It's a city on its own. Do's: where comfortable shoes... lots of walking.Take a sweater or warm jacket.. for those who are sensitive to the cold. As the AC is turned up high.Know what you want to see.. the distances between can be agonising long especially with young kids.Do schedule time to observe the fish Aquarium. .. it's breathtaking with the diverse fish and sharks.You can easily spend the whole day here ... so keep a track of time.It gets crazy over thursday night, Friday. .. which is the weekend here.You will need reservations for popular resturants like PF changsha, cheese cake factory etc. Do get to cab lines early to avoid the rush hour when the mall closes.To Avoid 'treasure hunting' for your popular stores... make good use of the info kiosks and electronic kiosks.Lil tip: you can cut through the mall using the souk on the ground floor and the food court on the second floor...Great entertainment for kids at Sega republic,kids zania and reel cinemasEnjoy, be warm and hydrated.

Expensive mall. Dubai aint a place to shop. Expansive mall. Most of the stuff i checked were expensive. I cant figure why would tourists like me wanna come here and shop....tax free? But its still more expensive than if duty paid in most other major city

very good for shopping. Compare to Dubai Mall, the emirates mall is much smaller, but very convenient to reach by Metro, and because it's smaller than Dubai Mall, it's also easy to find and shopping for those brands, it has a supermarket,all top brands, many options for you to choose.
Tax free but everything is so expensive.. There are much better places in the world to shop. Dubai is a sad place to spend your shopping dollar
Love it. Huge mall with everything you need. Love the sitting outside for breakfast and lunch.The fountain is especially entertaining during the evenings.

The next best Mall. In Dubai, the trend is the newest is always the best, as they always manage to set higher standards for each new attraction. With Dubai Mall open, this is the next best thing. In terms of shopping outlets, it has a huge variety of shops including Harvey Nichols which is only in this mall. The mall has cafes, fast food restaurants and casual dining restaurants, but is missing on fine dining outlets. If the intention is to shop, then that shouldn't be an issue.If u are going there for the first time, then you have to try the ski Dubai, if not for skiing then to at least experience the snow indoors.

Good mall for shopping but not as a tourist. I wanna see culture when I go somewhere so malls are not really my thing but there are some nice malls in Dubai in terms of architecture. However, there is nothing special about this mall. Unless you wanna go skiing and see penguins, then this is the place to go to.

Gigantic Mall. This mall cant really be covered in one day due to its enormous size but has everything to make every member of the family happy. Ski Dubai is amazing and definitely worth a shot. Beautiful architecture, all top brands, many options to eat. If you like shopping and are in love with the Mall culture, you would love the place for sure.
GREAT HANDY FOOD. We wanted to give kids the usual McDonald's and we ourselves got some traditional indian snack from Bombay Chowpati from Food Court

Enormous. This is a tremendous building, very impressive. Wonderful choice of all the designer shops you could think of. Excellent toilets and choice of refreshment places. The map of the mall is not very accurate and out of date. Best to ask staff for directions. Courtesy busses to hotels not always reliable.

Great place to while away the time. We visited Mall of the Emirates a few times, but still could not get our heads around how huge it was. The first time, we were there over 5 hours and my feet were well and truly killing me by the time we left. There are lots of luxury brands - enough to make any shopping fanatic faint from ecstasy and for those like myself whose focus is on food - a Carrefour supermarket which is so huge it could take an hour (or more) to get through the whole store! There are lots of restaurants, but I cannot personally recommend any as we didn't eat at any of them. The best thing to do is ask for a menu if there isn't one displayed at the front and check the prices first. Don't try to cover the whole mall in one day - make it easier on yourself and break your visit up into manageable chunks, so you don't end up with sore and angry feet like mine. You'll really enjoy it!
Nice. Mall of the Emirates is nice to have a look around, the atrium is stunning and the ski field looks fun. Not as big or good as Dubai Mall though and was super packed.
Very nice. Very nice mall..typical size mall to spend a day there for shopping and eating and you can easily finish in a day..all brands are there even apple store
Great. Very busy, but defintly recommend if you want to splash some cash on clothes! Love the wait rose here too

Gigantic !. I have spent a few hours at Mall of the Emirates. The mall is directly connected to Kempinski Hotel. The mall is gigantic and the hotel is gigantic too. SEE photo for massive design. The mall has Dubai’s distinctive SKI resort for all family members. The mall has the DUCTAC, which is Dubai Community Theatre & Art Centre; it is the only non-profit, multi purpose creative center in UAE. The mall has the famous Cheesecake factory adjacent to Kempinski Hotel. The mall is a great destination; every member of your family will be happy. The choices are unlimited.

Look out for Pingu!. I love this medium sized mall (!). Has all the shops and places to eat you can imagine. Great for escaping the heat outside. The ski area is amazing and if you wait, you will see penguins!

Smaller than Dubai Mall, but better in some ways. We traveled as a couple in January 2016. We have stayed just next to this Mall so we visited a lot. There is a Carrefour inside with good prices and also a good food court. there are also less places to entertain than Dubai Mall.

Perfect name.. For Shopping: Definitely Yes!!!! you have all the major luxury brands as well as regular fashion clothing!!!!For dining: yes there is a lot of variety available and you will need it considering the kind of walking involved !!!Entertainment: Do not miss SKI DUBAI!!!Also do not miss the huge fountain.If you have a thing for cars, do not miss the main entrance. PLEASE CARRY A MAP AT ALL TIMES!!!
Dubai Mall. Grand , incredibly huge, could not see it all in one day, , great place to spend the day especially the Aquarium , Ice Skating Rink, Flying Fox etc

Big Gigantic Mall. Superb Mall to start with. Huge in size and very reasonable as compared to the dubai mall. There is also carrefour store where your can get almost anything at reasonable price particularly watches, gadzets and chocolates
Fountain show . A must do thing for visitors coming to Dubai an awesome dancing by fountains of Dubai mall. Extra ordinary looks so beautiful while the fountains dances on beat of music

Visit after 10am. Visited Dubai Mall because it was raining. Yes, raining. In Dubai. Just my luck.I'm not gonna mention Aquarium, ice skating, waterfall, tallest building in the world...it's all there. What I will mention is, don't show up before 10am. Shops open after 10am.Its a marvelous place, don't miss it if you visit Dubai.

One of the good malls in dubai. it was a nice experience being there.. awesome place to hangout with friends and family.. best for shopping maniacs.. we can have many superb pics be clicked from there..hehe...i guess one day is not sufficient to explore the mall completely...

Typically Grandiose & Extravagant Dubai!. One of Dubai's many 'show-stopping' shopping & restaurant centers...chock full of high & lower end shops (and shoppers). Not to be missed in Dubai, and THE spot for viewing the 'dancing fountain' performances...with the Burj Khalifa (world's tallest skyscraper) as backdrop. A truly amazing mall...and the 'people-watching' beats London or NYC, hands-down!

Expensive. Nice Mall but if you think its cheaper than other countries you are mistaken.Very expensive examples belowBoots £3 more than UK itemsSephora £10 more than UK itemsNandos £5 more than UK itemsAll each

Good mall. This is older and smaller than the Dubai Mall (which enormous) and easier to get around if you have little time or are already a little foot sore from your travels. Don't be fooled - it's still pretty big. The architecture is nicer here too. It has most shops that anyone from the UK will know and many from around Europe too. Eating in the malls is more expensive than outside but it is convenient. It's been several years since I was here and there have been changes to the Ski Dubai viewing opportunities. Not as good as I remembered it. That's progress! Still a nice day (in). It was pouring with rain today and all the streets flooded, so we were grateful to be inside.

Pleasant shopping mall. I would strongly recommend to visit this mall before the visit to the Dubai mall. This is easy to visit, and well organized. At a first sight, it also seems very big. Then, after the visit of the other, it seems not as big as it is.

A gd place to spend a day. My N'th visit to Mall of tje Emirates.Its a wonder full place to spend a day.U hv a lot of wonderful Restaurants & Fast food outlets.The Ski world Dubai is a very fun place.The adults as well as Kids can N'joy the snow & the penguin show.The super markets r also v well eqp. & u can find whatever v req. ( Electronic's , Clothing, Food items etc)All in all a day well spent.- RuShaad
huge mall. Plenty of restaurants and the cinema is amazing they have the 4D cinemaworth the visitall the shops are thereand SKI DUBAI of course
a great place to shop. Enjoyed shopping here - designer shops, marks and Spencer, supermarket, lots of choice for shopping and eating. Spacious so did not feel at all crowded.

Wear your walking shoes!. So much to see in one place. Even if you're not a shopper there's the aquarium, the ice rink, the waterfall the outside dancing fountain and of course the Burj Khalifa.The selection of resturants is endless. The shops are beautiful. The window displays are works of art.Put your walking shoes on and get ready for a wonderful day

Huge mall. What can I write about this gigantic mall? It is big. It is easily accessible by taxi, metro, bus or car. It has a huge aquarium, a big ice rink and a waterfall. Absolutely nothing useful for the average consumer of goods, but it adds a nice flavour to the place. Also, the customers here are more diversified than in the other malls. A lot of tourist mingle together with a lot of niqab dressed people. Sometimes you read that you need to dress modestly. I don’t really know what that means, but people were dressed in shorts and tees and no one cared.It is absolutely unnecessary to visit the mall other than in a purpose of seeing the biggest thing on earth. All shops selling western goods are more expensive than at home. And since almost all the major chains are represented here and no local stores, all prices are equally more expensive. You can find anything though, from consumer luxury goods to cheap non-descript tees. Don’t forget to watch the beautiful fountain right outside.Overall I was a bit disappointed, I had imagined something even more extravagant beautiful.

Actually better than Dubai mall. The smaller sibling to Dubai Mall. One the biggest mall outside of the US. I found this mall nicer than Dubai Mall, easier to walk around and find things and frankly less overloaded with basically everything. It sports its own skiing facility. Grab skis and go downhill for two hours if you like.The shops are pretty standard. The mall concept is spread all over the world, and you seldom find any surprises. there are a multitude of food stops and cafes, so feel free to spend a couple of ours here if you like.
Nice Experience. It was a real good experience. Shop shop shop n shop .. I had been with my friends and the experience was good.
Shopping extravaganza. Shops shops and more shops. Also an ice rink, huge aquarium and waterfall. Shop until you drop then enjoy some refreshments admiring the burj khalifa.

Great Mall - Better than the Dubai Mall. Now - I enjoyed going to Dubai Mall and it had some great shops but it very big and very confusing. I enjoyed Mall of Emirates more than Dubai Mall - it has some wonderful high end stores and great grocery/multi purpose store (Carefour) where I purchased dinner one night, water and snacks for my hotel room and travel necessities I needed. It also has equally good restaurants as the Dubai Mall.

Unique Shopping Experience!. I had first visited DM in 2014. We were a group of 3, and time was an issue. I was determined to go back and visit this place PROPERLY - and so I did, by myself :) Best decision ever! I visited during Dubai Shopping Festival, where stored had massive discounts going on.There is a mix of brands from low end to the absolute luxury ones, all under one roof, sections dedicated to kids stores and home-ware as well as jewelry, watches and diamonds -- you name it, you find it!Dubai Mall is the largest shopping mall in the world. I totally recommend that you arrive at the mall early, upon opening time, to avoid crowds.The mall is crowded and buzzing in the afternoons. I spent a day wandering around shops, and arrived back at my hotel around 8pm .. totally exhausted from all the walking :)There is also Dubai Aquarium within the mall, if not keen on entering, you might as well just spend some time in front of the huge glass pane, it is free!Make sure to wear comfortable clothing and equally comfortable shoes. There are tons of food places to choose from and if you just need a rest there are seating areas all along the mall to chill without the need to buy anything.A must visit once you're at dubai mall is burj khalifa, the tallest building, the dubai fountains and souk al bahar all just few minutes away.

Good brands, food and fun activities under one roof. Before my flight out of Dubai, I went to mall of the Emirates. Enjoyed the ice rig a Lot. Truly a wonder and once inside no one can even imagine it's inside a shopping mall. Extremely friendly staff at stores help me in selecting the right products. Highly recomended for shopping

You can find anything here - but for a high price. As it says in the title, the place is amazing and boasts a huge variety of stores. Everything is extremely expensive though, even when on "sale" compared to prices in Europe.
Wow. Shopping..fun..dunning. No matter wots ur age and what you like. You would have something for you there.It us really big mall.
Good but.......... Good mall but thinking twice to get back here. Its too crowded n cant really enjoy my shopping experience.

Preferred mall in Dubai. Shopping in Dubai is by no means a cheap experience, but as malls go this is the best of the lot. It is less glitzy than Dubai Mall, and so much better for it. Mall of the Emirates offers a more comprehensible navigating experience, and good mix of stores. If you are so inclined, the indoor ski experience appears to be a hit with the kids.

The best in the "mega mall" category. The Mall of the Emirates takes the silver medal of the "mega mall" contest in Dubai. It essentially offers the same array of stores and shops that Dubai Mall does with what some - as myself - might consider a big advantage: it is not half as frantic as the aforementioned. Maybe because it is not located at walking distance from any other major Dubai attraction as Dubai Mall is. In addition, if you happen to feel like it is getting too hot you can always get your skis on or go see the penguins at Ski Dubai.

Huge. Just Plain HUGE. EVERYONE in UAE talks about going to the Dubai Mall. You would think we were teenagers. Although I have to say, you should definitely go see it. Over 1600 stores and it is under construction so as to stake its claim as the world's largest. Really cool information booths (interactive touch-screen) and the line of cars in the valet is pretty sweet.

Fine mall. Yes we like this mall better then the Dubai mall given the shops like Abercromby, Apple Store etc. No fountains and towers yet a magnificent indoor ski. In Dubai everything is possible. Bring the money and you can buy whatever you want. US style mall.

Awesome Mall. It's such an easy mall to navigate!! And has all the good shops ! By the time you've walked around half of Dubai mall you're feet hurt. Whereas the mall of emirates is structured really well and there's a good chance you feel really satisfied once you've done the length and breadth of it ! Great restaurants great food court ! Smiles all the way.

What a great Mall. Simply superb - all brands and all kinds of people. This is a small Dubai in itself and just a lovely place to be in. Plenty to shop and really really nice stuff. Have fun !! Highly recommended

Most amazing mall. While on a visit to Dubai, we visited this mall several times. It was close to where we were staying and simply amazing. There are bakeries and restaurants for every taste. Basically there is a type of store for every type of shopper from absolute luxury to souvenirs to a great grocery store. There is an ice rink and aquarium as well. This is a great place to walk around and just look around in amazement. It opens early for coffee and pastries and closes late for shopping and dinner. A must see in Dubai

outrageously opulent. what a shopping centre. if money is no object then this is the place for you. situated directly below the burj khalifa you cant miss it. arived in dubai on royal caribean splendour of the seas. took open top bus tour to the mall and wasnt dissapointed. go through the swing doors and directly in front is Cartier, Bulgari and rolex. over 1200 shops to have a look around, could take you all do. the aquarium is amazing in the centre. sharks, rays, and lots of other exotic fish. lovely waterfall will silver divers. the exotic parking lot beneath is a dream to see. most expensive cars in the world here, Everywhere. lovely shopping centre will be back

Must be visited . This mall is my favorite in Dubai. During my stay I visited 5-6 malls in Dubai, and just 3-4 times I was in Mall of Emirates. So it's very big but the same time very comfortable for walking and doing shopping. One can easily remember the places of shops and not to get lost. Of course here you can find most of international brands. Food court was good, very comfortable and wide. To say that it's clean and with amazing service, is to say nothing. And taxi getting system when getting out from mall is something really amazing. So there is special place where you Stand in the line, and wait for your turn, and there's special worker just for organizing this process. In one word, if you want to enjoy your shopping, go to the Mall of Emirates! Highly recommended!

Awesome place. Visited on February 26th ,huge shopping mall .Aquarium was impressive , lots of restaurants , skating ring, cinemas , shops , access to the fountain and burj khalifa.Highly recommended.

Shops Galore. AMAZING - so beautifully finished. Its a whole new level of "retail therapy". Nice eateries and easy to get to by taxi or train. You can go all day and still not see it all. The high end outlets eg Hermes, Chanel are great to see even if it's just for their cool window displays. If you love ❤ shopping this is definately a destination MUST.

Amazing. What more can I say about the Dubai Mall? It's bigger then any other mall I have been in. There's a hockey ring, a Sega amusement park, and an aquarium. It is easy to navigate and the personnel at the information desks will assist you. It is a must visit.

A Quality Experience. Although not as big as Dubai Mall (it has 500 shops) the quality of the shops is first class, the decor is beautiful and certainly during our visit it was not over busy. It has some UK shops such as M & S. When you get fed up with the shops you can visit the ski centre with real snow. It hosts a St Moritz cafe, a ski slope, toboggan run and an area for kiddies big and small to use their sledges. Well worth a visit

Nice. This mall is a bit smaller than Dubai Mall but much nicer. You can find all the same stores here but it's less busy and therefor a more relaxing enviroment. While here you have to see Ski Dubai.

Big!. Of course you have to visit Dubai mall since it's the biggest one in the world(?). There's a big aquarium with sharks and other fishes and its impressive. There's a waterfall and nest to there's plenty of restaurants if you wish to hear water falling while eating. And there's plenty of shops! But it's too big, it's hard to take it all in. So go there and see the place but do your shopping in one of the other malls.

You need all day and then some. There are over 1200 stores in the 4 story mall. You need all day and then some, just to walk through it. We like the ways that they had stores categorized in the same areas so you did not have to look all over for specialized one.. I wish they did this in the US. There are indoor water features and the Dubai fountains are just our side for night viewing.

Biggest mall in ever. Did you know the Dubai Mall is the size of 50 football fields put together? This is by far the best mall in the world. You could close your eyes and wish for a brand and you would find it here. It also harbours the world famous dancing fountains and has views to the tallest building in the world, the Burj Khalifa. The Dubai Mall is simply a must visit. No other way ;-)

Beautiful but .... This is LARGE and beautiful mall and an excellent place for shopping, and a must visit. Yyou can get everything here, but look out. We found stores with huge savings during sales but the prices in the 'brand-stores' (Nike, adidas, etc.) is 20-30% higher than what we see in Denmark.

Contains Ski slope, tramploines, climbing wall, arcade, food courts and shops. Contains ski slope.Magic Planet is large arcade area (games and slots). Contains Trampoline and climbing wall attractions. 140 (£28) dirhams for a combined trampoline session and ski lesson.Magic Planet is hard to find as the signage is not brilliant (disapears when you are close). Bascially head for TGI Fridays find the escalator up to the next floor (Magic Planet sign is on the ceiling)Has two food courts and Carrefour supermarket inside.On the metro line.

Leave your shopping guilt at home, and be ready for some walking. I was impressed with the Mall of the Emirates. I have seen my share of big shopping malls around the world - but this is different. The mall smells of money. The shops are large and grand. You can spot every large luxury brand on planet earth here. The mall has everything - movies, fashion, diamonds, computers, high-end phones, f&b, and indoor ski (seriously !), the largest carrefour I have seen, everything !It is easy to lose track of time here.

Breathtaking Mall !!!. The mall is massive and spread out over a very big area.It houses most of the branded and world renowned designer outlets and boutiques and the mall is always packed with visitors.There are many restaurants to suit individual taste buds. You may have to walk quite a bit to cover all the various places of interest within the mall. The waterfall,aquarium,underwater Zoo and the dancing fountains which is located at the base of the Burj Khalifah which is incidentally part of the Mall and the entry point to the to the 124th floor view deck. This Mall is a must see and should be on your itinerary.

Can't get enough. Although you might forget where did you park the car because of the enormous shopping area, Dubai mall is one of the best shopping distnations in world. Lots of brands and attractions like aquarium, dancing fountain and more.

Dramatic Dubai !!! Majestic Mall !!!. We went to this Huge Humongous and Handsome Mall on 03rd Feb 2016 and spent the whole day, our journey started from Jood palace hotel (Taj palace) in Diera area, Al Rigga metro station is just 0.6km, with in 20 minutes we reached Dubai Mall/Burj Khalifa station, AC walkway connecting station to the mall is wonderful, it's around 1km walk to reach Dubai Mall and Stunned by its Beauty.At 10.15am we went to Burj Khalifa at the top 124th floor, the 360* views from the top was really top class, AED 120 each includes visit to 125th floor,high speed lift takes us to the top in just above a minute (65 seconds) at 12.15pm came down and roamed around the Dubai mall up to 6.15pm visiting Dubai Aquarium , Ice Rinks had our lunch at one of the restaurant, the Waterfall was fabulous.At 6.15pm went to catch Abra,as we have already booked our Abra ticket costing AED 65 each, it's a boat circumventing around the Dubai Fountains and it was a once in a Life time experience, please experience this experience for experience sake.Only few things comes free of cost in Dubai , Dubai Mall is also free to visit, it's a must visit place for all age groups when we are in Dubai, remember we have to walk a lot, actually I walked 11.5 km.Hint; If you are on budget, you should use all modes of public transport including Dubai bus service which connects all major sightseeing places with Metro rail, route map available at all metro stations, please use it and save your hard earned money, Avoid using Taxies and purchase Metro rail card.Happy travelling ... Enjoy !!!

Amazing Mall I have ever been to. All variety under one huge building. First i would express that I was impressed at how they manage both car and human traffic at the entrance. Being the a major tourist attraction safety is key and how it was handled was really impressive. The mall is quite impressive. Think of any designer or international brand and name it, you cannot miss it at this mall. Only challenge would be to locate it due to the massive nature of the mall. So if you want legit designers definitely the place to shop.The human traffic is well controlled perhaps due to the fact that it is such a massive mall. And if you are into cars, watch out for them at the driveway as all sorts of cars come into the mall (though not for display but for individuals). The Mall also has a variety of restaurants as well as a hotel just next to it which you can access through the Mall. You can also access the Metro through the Mall too but brace yourself for a walk. What really impressed me were the activities that were within the mall. E.g the waterfall, fountains, aquarium and underwater zoo. These were actually the highlight for me. It was even time saving as I got to see 4 spectacular things all at the same venue as compared to going to 4 different venues.
big and good mall. one of best mall in the world, next to tallest building of world. all facilities of mall available. all kind of shopping one can make

A must see!. While a "mall" doesn't usually make the "must-do" list in most cities, the Dubai Mall is not to be missed... Even if you don't like shopping! This mall is surrounded by chic restaurants that overlook a lagoon in the middle. There is a fountain show set to music that rivals the Bellagio in Vegas. Try to go in the evening to see the shimmering Burj Khalifa in the background. It is amazing. Inside the mall are other attractions like the aquarium that is a couple stories tall and can be enjoyed from many floors. Oh yeah... They also have all the designer stores!

Huge Mall- but expensive compared to other cities. It is such a huge mall. Shopping may be good for some special season but not February. The prices are expensive compared to Hkg , Paris, NYC. The shops are just the same as any big famous malls in the world. Except that they have a nice fountain to watch. Mostly high end brands too. Anyway, there are also good places to eat and so many good restaurants. There's one Mexican place we liked too .

Lost Some of Its Sparkle. Comparing this mall to the Dubai Mall brings this one up short. We could tell it's older than the Dubai Mall especially in the food court where it is a bit worn. The Ski Dubai was really neat, but the feeling of the rest of the mall was a bit underwhelming.

Vast shopping, eating and entertainment venue. Where else but Dubai would you find an indoor ski run in a desert country?Apart from Ski Dubai the mall offers countless shops, restaurants, movie theatres, banks and other service facilities.There is not much you can't buy here.Go early if you want parking close to the supermarket entrance.If you don't have to watch your pennies, there are countless luxury stores to frequent. If you are on a budget, try Carrefour or Centrepoint.

An extraordinary Mall. It is a very big mall, smaller then Dubai Mall. You can get there by train, because there is a station in it. There is free Wi-Fi with an excellent connection. There is something for everybody, from big stores, coffee shops, restaurants, fast food shops to skiing inside. There is a very big Carrefour supermarket and there are the hop on/off bus stops.

MAGNIFICENT !!!. This mall is one of the biggest malls in Dubai.It has within it the "Ski Dubai" for family leisure activities (the Middle East’s first indoor ski resort and snow park),The multi-level shopping mall features more than 700 retail outlets, over 100 restaurants and 80 boutique stores. There is a mix of restaurants catering to the needs of every individual. P.F.Chang a Chinese restaurant serving good authentic Chinese food is also located on the ground floor of this mall. A good place to shop and hang out.
Great place. Amazing mall with lots of shops and activities. Definitely a must for shopping addicts. It was the place we visited just for the sake of enjoying a good moca at Starbucks.

Allow a lot of time, and walking. Everything is here, plenty of shops, free and good wifi, cool,and air conditioned. Be aware during Ramadan the tables will be upside down, and you cannot eat or drink in public.
Angelina Paris. Really delicate and sophisticated tea from China, sweat the same delicate deliciousness. Nice atmosphere
Like the UK but not crowded. The mall is very similar to good ones in the UK but bigger and not as crowded. Similar shops and prices are a little higher. If you need a shopping fix it's a no brainer.
Amazing architecture. Loved to visit there again and again... It's so convenient to roam there with child. The options available there are really attractive foe shopping and fooding.

Sooo big . Shopping mall is amazing but supper supper big me and my boyfriend kept getting lost, great range of shops for every type of person great of your looking somewhere to eat aswel so much to choice from we eat in chillis was soo good would recommend it
world class mall. i was really amazed how big this mall is..lots of shop to choose from..high end fashion you can find..branded clothing and nice scenery..i love to go back to this place.

Second largest mall in Dubai but the best. MOE is the best mall in Dubai. Not only does the metro go directly inside the mall, but it's home to many stores, Ski Dubai, restaurants/food courts, cinema court etc. It's also connected to a five star hotel Kempinski. The good thing is it's not too massive so you can get to other stores pretty easily. It's also the only mall in Dubai which has bars on the top floor selling alcohol (Apres bar), which is a good one with the ski slope view.

Best Mall in Dubai. Even though it is smaller that Mall of Dubai, Mall of The Emirates is better. They have a better mix of stores inside and you get what you want to shop for. I highly recommend the indoor ski which is different from anything else in the world.

Big mall with lots of shops & food places. Perfect mall as it has shops for everyone - designer, electronic, home, toys, clothing etc.The food courts offer a wide range of food and drink to suit anyone and everyone.
Wow. Big and clean and a bit overwhelming. Fun to see people skiing indoors!Finest shopping available and easy access via train. Great food and helpful maps.

Big mall. Beautiful mall in Jumeirah area. So many shops, Some expensive and some cheap. The mall offers a lot of restaurants and cafes as well as a cinema. The mall is reachable by car, public transportation. To see the whole mall you should spent day in it. Also here you have ski Dubai and of course the ping wings

Interesting mall - designer & mainstream shops, various cafes, Arts Centre, ski slope. The Mall of the Emirates is one of my favourite malls in Dubai. There are a huge selection of shops - various clothes from designer to main stream shops, some excellent Interior and furnishings shops, sports shops and Carrefour supermarket. There are probably more coffee and snack shops than actual restaurants, there is a very good Food Court in the lower levels. The ski slope is the large attraction here but there is also DUCTAC - arts centre, theatre and old library accessible near the round fountain, near the restrooms entrance. I often visit here as alot of women's coffee shop groups meet here but it is always pleasant to visit. There is also a Debenhams (good for sales) and Harvey Nichols for more expensive clothes. Overall, this mall is very clean, beautifully decorated and new shops are frequently being opened.

not better than dubai mall. nothing special more than dubai mall.
you can find better places instead
they are so many malls in dubai and i think fubai mall can cover all.check the stores before heading to any mall.

Too big. This is probably considered one of the best malls in the world but i find it too much to handle. Its just too big and to be able to enjoy it you will need to walk more than 15km inside the mall
Simply , the best. This mall has everything , including a big carrefour supermarket. Size is convenient and well structured. Easy access from the metro as well.
Mall of the Emirates. Second largest mall in Dubai after Dubai Mall with a metro link can be reached from inside of the Mall.

Loved shopping here!!. Luckily, our visit to Dubai was in January which meant we were able to enjoy shopping during the Shopping festival! As our hotel was a couple minutes walk away from the mall, we were here quite often! I absolutely love the variety of shops here and I recommend it to anyone! Range of activities to do and also a food court!! In my opinion it was the best mall I visited in the Dubai! So if you're a shopaholic remember to visit The Mall of the Emirates!!
Shopping. Cool! Impressive architecture very accessible to metro. Drop by anytime and enjoy your shopping. Lots of restaurants to choose from. Great place to visit.
Huge with access to Ski Dubai. Absolutely massive mall, Ski Dubai is located here as well as the Penguin encounter. There is also a great selection of restaurants and food stalls

If you enjoy shopping this is it!. So many shops to do justice to this enormous mall you need two full days if you are strong enough as it is quite exhausting.Prices are not cheap but acceptable and somewhat similar to the UK. Carrefour has some great deals especially in electronics. Lots of restaurants but none look that interesting.
Amazing. We were impressed that on a Saturday we still felt relaxed. This is absolutely worth a journey. It was great finding some top end shops we were relatively alone in.

Best mall. It's the best mall in the world!It has everything you could ever want when shopping. Every type of shop is here. You can go skiing too if you're feeling the need for some thrills!Outside you will see every type of super car you can dream of as the rich and famous drop their wheels at the valet!Quality, on every level and definitely the way to shop!

Huge Mall. This is the biggest mall I have ever seen! Four floors with loads of different shops to suit everyone An ice ring, cinema complex, loads of places to eat food and awesome attractions like the fountain show and the indoor fish tank that is as big as a small shopping mall in Manchester!Shops are very expensive and expect a long walk if coming by tram.

Way to Hot to be Outside. Spent alot of time in most of the malls in the area i was staying. This mall with the downhill slop was brilliant. I found the prices in the mall to be reasonable as well. considering everything is imported. Nice mall

Avoid the weekends . The mall is simply outstanding. However check reviews on the restaurants before choosing one, as some restaurants specially those in the souq area are not that great yet quite pricy. Avoid Thursday night and Friday night there as the mall is usually packed then.

Poor sales. Although I went during the Dubai shopping festival in January I was disappointed at the sales. Many outlets had mediocre ones at best and the semi decent ones were not better than what the same outlets offer at other times of the years. DSF used to be a time to visit for bargains- seems those days are over as second year in a row that I'm disappointed with MOE

Good experience. The shopping is better than the Dubai Mall. A bit less expensive than the Dubai Mall, however if you are after visiting the Skiing park, especially if you are from the West or Australia, be prepared for you to think that it is overpriced.

Elegance & opulence. The Emirates mall is an opening to the grandeur of Dubai. A lovely collective of brands, an even more happy ice skating ring and an entertaining fountain side. Time spent here is the time you could shop, catch up with a friend or just enjoy the pleasure of skating, maybe get some history updates too.

Ski -> In a Mall -> In a desert. Clearly, ski dubai is the highlight of the MOE which offers options to ski in a desert and a chance to play with penguins. Other than the Ski Dubai, the mall itself is quite good with the usual collection of stores and food joints. Costa coffee in 1st floor offers great views of the ski dubai and allows you to watch the penguins, but on the day that we went, there were no penguins to be seen

Worth checking out if you like shopping. If you like shopping this is the place for you! It is probably the most impressive shopping mall I have ever been to. The entire mall is paved with beautiful marble tiles. Taking a walk along all the high end stores is quite spectacular. Even the not-so-high-end stores are still impressive. There's even an indoor ski field!

Great shopping mall. Beautiful shopping mall although a little on the pricey side! Lots of good cafes and restaurants and every shop you could hope to find. Very handy for the Metro, and if you get bored you can always go skiing....
How big! . Lovely clean mall and good to see the snow and skiing etc. Don't honestly think it's better than Dubai mall and out of all the malls Ibn Battuta is the best. Well worth a visit though

This is a must see place for Shopping, Dining, Sights and Sound, Tallest Building, Fountain and Light show. Dubai is a Top Destination. Dubai Mall is one of the best place in the world to shop. This is on the route of the Big Bus Tour. Many thins to do. Great for the entire family or traveling Solo.

Only worth a quick look. This very expensive mall of so many shops has absolutely nowhere to sit down at all. Everything is completely overpriced, including the food & coffee. I spent 8 hours there waiting for family members in Ski Dubai - it felt like forever!

Big mall but able to handle. I liked this mall vety much even i wasn't really moid for shopping. Even this mall is huge it it easier to handle than Dubai mall. I also like more the architecture of this mall than Dubai mall. This is kind of old arabian style which i like a lot. In this mall is Kempinski hotell where is located awesome bar lounge that is also worth to visit. Easy to access by metro.

A great experience. We are a well traveled fun loving group in our late 50's and this is our options based on our experiences.THE GOOD BITS- Easy to get to by metro or taxi, the metro station feeds right into the first floor of the mall Open on Thursday to 12 midnight Friday open to 1am (not sure of other days) Floors 1&2 have every designer shop available so you can get anything without travelling around the cityHas well know dept stores like Debanhams and Harvey nicks The stores have great customer service The car parks feed into each floor SMOKERS - you can smoke in the car parking area on each floor, there are doors all the way down the mall so you can shop and smoke at easeClean, loads of loos Ground floor has more 'normal' shops and there is a huge supermarket where you can her snacks or pop if you wantTHE NOT SO GOOD BITS- Don't expect the designer shops to be cheaper!We went on a Friday and after 12 noon it was heaving Wear comfy shoes its vastMake sure you respect the dress code try to cover shoulders and knees The mall maps are quite hard to read

Huge mall !. We were staying in al barsha.So MOE was the nearest mall to us.Its a huge mall with all brands and needs you many be looking for.Before you enter here, be prepared to walk like hell. Superbly maintained, nice crowd, helpful and disciplined security people on service.Go by cab and when leaving try to take cab by coming up on road , you can save hours by not going to taxi que in mall .Yes, ski dubai is amazing.Must try

One day for exploration + One day for Shopping = 2 Days of Mall Madness!. This place is ridiculous! It's like an endless foray into "the land of the lost" - the Mall Version. The key attractions are- The Aquarium- The Ice Rink- The fountain with diving men- The Burj Khalifa view - The Fountains- The Souk- The Souq Al Bahar- The Fashion MallThere're two kinds of visits that people do at the Dubai Mall1) Shopping2) ExplorationIf you're here for shopping, KNOW WHAT YOU WANT...if not, you'll be lost forever. Also, would suggest going during the Dubai Shopping Festival because the offers you get are CRAZY!If you're here for exploration - Get a map from the information counter...decide your route before you get going. Every corner of this place looks different...and there's enough eye-candy to take loads of photographs.
Awsome . What I Like : 1- The Various Shops. 2- The Mall design. 3-The Big Cinema 4- Include Hotel. 5- The Location. What I didn't like :1.The food court design.

Giant and Luxurious. Enterance is Marvellous.Royce Royals , Mercedes Benz , Ferrari and Lamborghini are parked in front of the Mall enterance and which makes people mad clicking pictures.It's superbly made and too big.FOUNTAIN SHOW which held there is very famous through out the world.People stand and wait to see this Fountain Show.Burj Khalifa is also beside this Mall.Must visit place in Dubai.

Slight improvement on Dubai mall. Only because of the incongruous ski slope and penguins. Why? All the other comments about ridiculous prices and why anyone would want to travel half the way round the world to shop apply
Visited Dubai 25 - 28 January 2016. Huge building . Nice scenario. Many branded shops. Dine in restaurant. Very clean with lot of people and tourists.

Veryy big. I personally like it more than Dubai Mall. It is smaller than the dubai mall and less brands in comparison but it has more information counters and security personal who can guide you around, unlike dubai mall.

If there ever was a mall, this would be it. This mall is huge, which is one of the main reasons why it is not for everyone. It is not only a mall, however. It gives you access to the observation deck of the highest tower in the world, has a very impressive aquarium inside (complete with sharks), has a ice-skating rink, an awesome cinema (try the platinum class if you like to cinema-splurge), a massive "arcade" for kids, access to the Dubai Fountain (quite the spectacle), not to mention the best shopping in town. And I am probably forgetting some things :). If you're visiting Dubai, even if you're not a mall person, you should visit. Parking is ample but always crowded and huge to navigate.

Shopping with friends . Amazing shopping centre with ski slope within the centre , you can't help but be blown away by it , I prefer here to Dubai mall because it's a bit easier to negotiate , had lunch in the Armani cafe upstairs , food was lovely staff were extremely nice too , good variety of shops for all tastes and wallets ! Highly recommended

Go there during the Dubai Shopping Festival. Returned form Dubai 2 weeks ago. Was there during the annual DSF. Great shopping, able to get everything under 1 roof, great deals. I'm used to the Mall of America, but this one was just ridiculously huge! Great exercise just walking around.If you are looking for Al Nassma Camel Milk Chocolate...it's there!

Overrated. We had previously visited Dubai mall ("the biggest mall in the world" close to Burj Khaifa. This mall practically has the same stores, except for the big inside ski slope - witch is not that impressive for us Scandinavians. But fun to see and to enjoy if you don't have snow at home.
Excellent . It's a place where you can every brand under one roof.You named any brand. You will find here.For shopping lovers, it's a good place.
Fabulous mall.. This is a great mall where you can find almost anything. It is extremely safe, clean as well as air conditioned.

Seriously crazy huge mall. Never got lost in a mall before until this. Never needed a map before just to figure out where I was and how to get back to where I started. This is a ridiculously huge multilevel mall with every kind of name brand and then some. Go just to see the spectacle that is this mall.

Big Mall with access to multiple stuff. If you are a tourist it is a great place to be also if u r going to burj khalifa you will have to come here.....Since dubai is famous for its big malls and brands you have to feel the city vibes and see this....
A good for a day out. Its huge and has every brand store and has a lot of activities for kids. It will take more than a day to go through the mall.

A great mall with the most exclusive stores and a great infrastructure. Visited Dubai to my friends place. And when we headed up towards the Dubai mall the entrance was fabulous. The infrastructure again is awesome with the best of the stores. Spread across a huge area. Loved it really Dubai with such greats malls and variety of options amazing loved it!!!!

Is a decent mall. Went to the Mall of the Emirates today. We'd been to the World's largest Mall "Dubai Mall" a couple of times, so decided to try this other large, but not nearly as large, mall also in Dubai this time. They had some shops my wife was happy to see which we don't have in the malls in Abu Dhabi, such as the women's sports ware shop she likes. The only complaint was that we had to wait over an hour to get a taxi to leave. Partially, that was because it might have been close to a Muslim prayer time, and also it was rush hour. Next time, we'll wait for a taxi at one of the two hotels we saw next to the mall and hopefully have a better chance to get one.

Dubai Mall. A shoppers paradise. All the designer shops you could ever want and some reasonably priced shops, so something for everyone. It can take all day to get through it, but plenty of places to eat and drink. Out side is spectacular when lit up at night. Early evening is a nightmare with hotel buses and private buses clogging up the entrance. Taxis are a very reasonable price, but there are long queues and a long wait. Taxi rank underneath the mall and quite a long walk to find it, but worth it.

Huge. Bigger and more ostentatious than the Dubai Mall, the Mall of the Emirates is simply huge.All the most exclusive fashion houses are here, so you could most definitely break the bank.Lots of choices for food from cages, fast food to fine dining.Also plenty of attractions (including indoor skiing), so it would certainly be possible to spend a whole day there.

Great mall, with fantastic attractions nearby. We visited the Dubai Mall on our first evening. Get off the metro at the Burj Khalefa stop and take the walkway to the mall.Inside the are enough shops to keep you busy all day, and some great places to eat.Located just outside the mall are the Dubai fountains and the Burk Khalefa.

huge complex. it is one of most huge malls located next to sheikh zaed road and near to dubai mall .you can have a good experience of shopping there .every thing available and facilities are very good.

Big and a little crowded. This mall is a little less crowded then the Dubai mall and a few less stores. But is worth it if you are in the area instead of going into the city center for the Dubai mall.

Mall, which can be compared with the Hermitage. Mall, which can be compared with the Hermitage in St. Petersburg, where you walk all day, looking to end not inspected. Tired to walk, take a taxi for internal transportation. Here you can find everything and only branded goods.

Easy metro access. This huge mall is definitely worth a look. Heaps of international brands and retailers and everything else you may need. Has several food courts and it is easily accessible via the metro.

Get on your comfie shoes and shop. Like the dubai mall the mall of Emirates is huge, full of top of the line stores and some for those of us without such deep pockets. Great fun wandering around shopping and lots of goodies purchased. Definitely worth a visit if want to shop however plan where want to go else can get tiring quick retracing your steps!

One of Five best in Dubai. One of Five best in Dubai
i like it
it is in my route map when visit Dubai
easy walking and shooing
they add new third floor and moved Vox Cinema to it near the Sheraton
with many stores
one of them Abercrombie & Fitch

Every shop conceivable . This mall has everything albeit most is above my pay grade. Food establishments to suit every taste the aquarium is a must to see. You can walk for miles, we used the train from the marina and it cost 4 pounds for the day, we also visited using our red bus tickets easy access recommended to all even if it's to see how the other half live

2nd best mall in Dubai. This is really beautiful building in a really nice location (you can get here by metro easily). Easy place to burn money (for shops and dining) and it has Ski Dubai inside it if you want to cool down from hot Dubai weather. The movie theater is also quite magnificent and you should definitely go see some movie there either in 3D imax or 4D.

Fantastic and plenty of good shops!! During Christmas time it is very nice decorated!. I was there on December 15th 2015 (right before Christmas) and I must recognize that it was amazing! I came here before, but decorations at this time of the year make it very attractive!I think it is my best mall in Dubai, because relatively big and you can find all you are looking for within few minutes walking...

Great shopping experience . Has a great diversity of stores to shop from with awesome cinemas and of course Ski Dubai.Food court has a great selection, my personal fav were the Mexican fast food Teqado and Shake Shack.There are a lot more fancier restaurants but we didn't have time.Best way to access it is via the Metro or taxi. Warning when it gets busy, it can get quite crowded. Taxi wait can be as much as 20 mins. Also, wear your walking shoes as its a huge mall and walking end to end can wear down your feet.

The best mall in the city!. This is my favourite mall in the city! The place I always shop, and I lived in Dubai for 3 years! Super comfortable, amazing location with the metro station connected straight to the mall! With Ski Dubai inside, great cinema I freaquented, all the favourite stores are there! Unmissable!

Excellent. U need to have wheels on ur foot if u want to see dubai mall in a day. A huge shopping destination under one roof. U dream it and u will get it in this mall. From clothing to fashion to food to household items everything and almost every brand you will get. Attractions like aquarium, burj khalifa,ski all are linked to it and most important is it is connected to tube station. Awesome place to spend a day

Oppulence. Never seen a mall like it..but please don't go if you're watching the pennies!! There is even a ski resort at the end of the mall!! Log cabins skiers the lot! There are some normal shops but you will be green with envy at the ones you cant afford!

Shopping paradise. If you got the money to burn this is the place to do it. It you are a car fanatic the car park at the mall is the place to be. If like me you love high end window shopping, it doesn't get any better. All the top named shops assembled here. You need days/weeks to sample all the delights of this place. For all exercise freaks walking around this mall is a marathon in itself. A must visit.

Must see. Great experience to be in the massive mall with an aquarium, massive food court, waterfall, ice rink and so many more things to explore. It's not cheap there, so shopping might not be the main purpose, but being there and see the giant size, the people and the flair is worth visiting it. If you go there by metro it will take you 10-15 minutes walking from the metro to the mall.
Nice mall. Nice mall with good restaurants and ski resort. Good music stores. The food in the restaurants is tasty. Good place to have a lunch and dinner.

Mall worth a visit.. Easily accessible using the metro, definitely it is worth a visit. Here also, this mall is a window to few attractions, we found it relaxing and able to move around doing window shopping. Bought some perfumes and other titbits. Go for it.

fantastic shopping mall, you can find ANYTHING from super luxury to affordable. I booked Hilton Garden Inn Mall of the Emirates which is situated just 5 minutes on foot from the Mall of the Emirates on purpose. I wanted to visit this shopping mall so bad.I visited the place during Dubai Shopping Festival (taking place between 1st Jan and 1st Feb). Super discounts everywhere!The area is MASSIVE and very beautiful. Do not worry, you will not get lost, there is signage everywhere. The mall has an ENORMOUS Carrefour supermarket (where prices are super cheap!), Ski Dubai (perfect for a fun day out!) and VOX Cinemas at the top floor (for movie fanatics! Star Wars is showing RIGHT NOW!)To really see everything inside the Mall you have to spend a morning and/or afternoon or else you are in too much of a rush. Best is to arrive at opening time ie 10am so that you can start exploring the area before hoards of people start coming.There are sooo many places to eat and drink you will be spoilt for choice! Shopping is available for everybody from bargain hunters to the avid designer fanatics.
