great attractions for family. From the falls similar to LV, to the ice ring and the aquarium we did enjoy taking family photos in all these attractions as well as enjoyed the sale in Dubai shopping festival where we bought stuff at great value discounts, keep up good work

Huge...!!. the Dubai Mall....gigantic shopping experience.i doubt that any one who goes to the dubai mall can come out without spending some money...there are so many options, and brands and activities and entertainment options inside. the atrium waterfall is beautiful, the aquarium is gigantic, the fountain out side is marvelous.... i can go on and on...key points:if you are short on time, or going there for a small visit, visit their website.download the dubai mall app on your phone. keep water with you as back upthe walk from the metro station to the mall is approx 1.2 km long...so be prepared.ask for directions inside. and always keep in mind that you do not realize how quickly time will pass inside the mall...

Just too big. Huge mall.. great place.. keep an entire day for it.. understand the map of mall properly before you split.. in many stores you lose mobile network too..Ps- if you are visiting this mall on weekend and planning to leave by taxi.. then better leave before 10 pm, as there is only one pickup point and there is a massive long que.. i had personal experience.. longest que i ever stood in for cab took at least 90 mins to get a taxi..
Holiday . Nice place to shop and just hangout it's all inclusive major brands and food places all under one roof

Everything you can find. This mall is one of the best malls in Emirates . And the new expansion is great with a big place for Cinema . All brands are there and the good thing in this mall is you cannot get lost on it.
Really vast. A big mall, if you crave for shopping then this is a place to be, large size stores top brands, added bonus of vast aquarium.

A lovely Mall - better than Dubai Mall. We were staying in Sheraton Mall of the Emirates. The advantage is 2 lifts and you are inside the Mall itself. This Mall is great and affordable shops for every breed. A Massive Carrefor which is bonus on the ground floor and can stock up on practically anything as they are the Asda/Tesco equivilant. 2 Main food courts at either ends of the Mall. Every fast food name brand you can think of is available - prices like the UK so don't expect anything too cheap. The Mall has Ski Dubai as well as a direct link to the Metro so this makes it a triple bonus especially as we had everything in our reach. Beatifully designed this Mall really is better than Dubai Mall for a good day out. Plenty of dessert shops such as Baskins and Hagaan Das. It has the first 4DX Cinema and the star war film was being shown at AED 250 - a must for star wars fan.IHOP and Cheesecake factory are round the corner from Ski Dubai. For those who want a view of the ski Dubai at room temperature then book a table at the Cheese Cake Factory and enjoy the views!
Huge shopping centre. Like the Dubai Mall, the Mall of the Emirates is like a city. Plenty of shops and restaurants and even attractions (Ski Dubai) to keep everyone entertained

Dubia mall. If you are into shopping this is a shoppers paradise. We aren't shoppers but just strolling though it was amazing it is so beautiful and a great place to get some exercise especially early in the day we were there when it first opened so it wasn't very busy.

Dubai mall is great. You need more than one day to finish it it's huge..But the mall is nice it has fantasy resturants like switch and a great cafe like vintage if you up to a great sweet and a cup of coffee ..Cinemas is great also but all movies are updated there you'll not find an old one there..in the last of my words you'll never stop shopping in this place..

Busy and huge. The first thing that hits you when visiting this mall (via the metro) is the long walk (air conditioned throughout though) from the station - around 8 minutes. The next is the sheer numbers who visit this mall. Would recommend getting a mall guide as soon as you can, as you can get turned around without one. There are a number of interactive mall guides to help you find your way around as well.Great range of stores from low to high end brand names. You could easily spend days here and not go outside. For families with you kids, I would recommend Kidzania. Great place to drop off the kids and keep them entertained whilst you shop!
Everything under one roof. Great massive mall. Lots of shops and very convenient. Minutes from our hotel at Ivory Grand. Shopping under one roof.

The second best mall in Dubai.... If you only have time to visit one mall in Dubai, visit the Dubai Mall not the Mall of the Emirates.There are still plenty of shops here though that range from high street to designer - you can still find everything that you need here. But whilst the Mall of the Emirates has more character, it isn't as large or as spectacular as the Dubai Mall. We had a couple of days where the weather wasn't great and it was nice to have a walk around and then enjoy the view of Ski Dubai, but we wouldn't make a special trip to go here.

Not as enjoyable as Dubai mall . And very average in comparison , while the mall has a famous indoor ski centre with penguins and a lot more , there is a clear lack of attractions within the mall , and so is really good for shopped only .

Massive Mall in Dubai. I visited Mall of the Emirates in the early part of last year. The mall is massive; basically all the brands in the world are present in the mall. It is a great place to go shopping, although everything is high price. It is not as big as Dubai Mall, but still a good place to go to for entertainment while in Dubai.

Huge place. Be careful as its very big mall and you can be lost easily. Even if outside is 40 degrees please bring with you a jacket or cardigan as inside is very cold because of the A/C. Otherwise there is a plenty of shops . Just have in your mind that during Ramadan month places for food are not working- most of them - until 8pm

The ultimate shopping in Dubai. This is a spectacular structure of mall. A full day is not enough to finish touring all of its shops and points of attraction. But be warned, to visit it on a weekend or a holiday is quite a challenge

Great huge Mall. This is a great place to visit and shop.
It's so massive that you cannot imagine, can find anything and major brands.
It's connected to train station so easy access.
It's a must see place when visiting Dubai.
Good shopping mall. This mall is far better than dubai mall.It has simple layout and good collection of shops.I didn't go for skiing so can't comment on that.

A mall, magnified. What can you say? This place is so big, so massive, so over the top (a giant aquarium, waterfalls, more shops than you can count, dozens of restaurants and so on) and yet it doesn't quite reach the stage where you want to run out screaming -which is a good thing since it is so big you would be running and screaming for a long time before you got out.If you like massive electronics shops, American fashion brands, luxury jewellers, coffee or candy - then you will find your special place here.

Spectacular but expensive. All the posh brands under one roof but prices are extortionate. The only good thing there is the new apple store in Dubai and Vox cinemas. Worth a visit but only for the wealthy

Better than Dubai Mall. We thought this mall was better than the Dubai mall due to it having more character.While the Dubai mall had more designer shops which is out of reach for many shoppers, this mall is more affordableIt also has an excellent ski Dubai which is definitely worth a visit and the moneyThe toy shop was also a lot cheaper than Hamleys in the Dubai mall for the same products
Probably one of the best. MOE is probably one of the best malls although Dubai Mall is right up there. Def worth a visit once while in Dubai.

That what a mall means. Huge mall that you will never see it all in one dayAll the brands can be found thereA lot of restaurants are thereYou can have a dinner at the fountains you will be amazedThe aquarium there is wonderful

Spectacular place. We first said wow. That many shops in one place. It was spectacular. But be aware - before you spend your money - have a look on the internet. We found out that prices on some items could be overpriced from 6 to 55 percent. (Fx. Porsche sunglasses a specific model we found. In Europe, eBay and Amazon: 350 Euro- in the Porsche design shop in them all. ad 200 euro ) So use the wifi in the mall and make a pricetjek.

Super mall. Everything from Harry Winston to H&M.PLUS an indoor arcade and ski slope. Only in the UAE. Not as overwhelming as the Dubai Mall in my opinion.We had a good experience and found everything we were looking for for an afternoon of eating and shopping. Situated close to where we are staying. Very helpful, friendly employees too.

Has a few unique attractions, but Dubai Mall is better. Similar to the Dubai Mall, in that it's a massive complex crammed with stores catering for every budget. Grabbing a map from the stalls at the entrance is essential.Lots of chains that Europeans will be familiar with, including Carrefour & Harvey Nicols, though most of the stores here also have branches in the Dubai Mall too, though the Apple Store here is the only one in Dubai.The Ski Slope is a great feature, and there's a massive food court with plenty choices. The mall is more difficult to navigate though, but is closer to the metro station for those travelling in on the train.

World's Largest Mall. Pros:Great Mall with everything under one roof.It has an aquarium, cinemas, entertainment for kids, ice skating ring, great outdoor view over looking the dancing fountains and Burj Khalifa (The World's Tallest Building).Spend the whole day with the family, friends and couples...Enjoy fine dining as well as coffee shops and huge selection of fast foods that serves everyone's budget.Cons:It's Huge.

Insanely large mall, has everything. Definitely worth spending an hour or so just strolling around to see the over-the-top stuff...all kinds of shops, restaurants, etc...plus an indoor ski hill with a chairlift. Very much "modern Dubai".

Great Shopping. Similar to the Dubai Mall in that it has shopping for everyone - from budget to luxury with lots of restaurant options and skiing! There are a few customer service desks around the mall providing assistance. Though there seems to be free wi-fi in many public places in Dubai, the wi-fi at this mall was lacking significantly. Nice way to spend the day even if just to window shop.

Huge mall. This huge mall has something for everyone. You can just window shop/shop/go grocery shopping in carrefour/ catch a movie/ eat in the foodcourt or restaurants. We were here twice for food and also to exchange money as it was abt 10min walk from our hotel. we had indian food in the foodcourt n did some shopping.A gd place to pass ur time...

Great mall. Luxurious mall with several stores and many entertainment attractions. There is a huge aquarium in the middle which is very interesting. Most of stores are a little bit more expensive compared to the UK.
Beautiful infrastructure, nice shops. You can find everything here! There's a lot to eat, see and do and it still need multiple visits to experience everything. It's less crowded than the Dubai mall.

Prefer this to Dubai Mall, except for wifi. Near to the metro station (through the help of the travellators too), and it's easier to manoeuvre around compared to Dubai Mall, though with lesser luxury brands. A great place if you are looking for affordable shopping as most of such brands are there too. Went twice during my trip, and finding the places in the mall is very easy. Customer service is so-so but understandable with the volume they have to cater to daily. Wifi is very poor in the mall, very unstable and weak.

Amazing Mall with 400+ Shops. This mall is huge and one of the best malls in the world. Incredible variety of shops and entertainment with a new movie complex that opened in mid 2015. IMAX has a laser screen ... Only one in the Middle East. Dozens of food outlets, 400 shops, 400m long ski slope where it's -2deg even in Dubai summer.... Amazing !Two minor criticisms. There are no seats in the mall to rest. You have to go to a coffee shop! Also, it would be a good idea to have a spa or foot massage place ..... After 4 hours my feet were falling off! As a shopping destination, this is world class retailing in a great environment. Dubai Mall is bigger but not better!

Good size mall for different budgets. Emirates Mall is a good size mall for you to spend a whole day shopping. A good mix of high end and mid end shops. Also contains a well stocked souvenir shop. Dubai mall on the other end is really big and you would not be able to see everything in a day. Most shops there are towards the high end budgets. However Emirates Mall lack the variety of entertainment that Dubai Mall offers such as the aquarium, musical fountain, cinema and children's amusement park. And it's parking is expensive whereas Dubai mall is free.

Difficult to navigate with kids. . Not so many toilets, elevators,and far to long waiting time for a taxi. That basically make your life very hard. On another way there is anything you want to shop for. I personally would like more traditional shops and products. So many shops that you se everywhere across Europe.

Wonderful. This is one of Dubai ' s high end malls. Wide walk ways and high ceilings give it a luxurious ambiance even on crowded weekends. High end shopping is wonderful here. Many restaurants and cafes to relax in, as well as many wonderful attractions. Worth a visit even if you're not keen on the shopping.

Good. It's good mall but I personally prefer Dubai Mall more. For Mall of the emirates you must pay for parking your car while it's free in Dubai Mall. It's little limited options than Dubai Mall but that's people living in Dubai like it. It's easy access. Very well organized. You can easily reach your required shop easily if you asked for assistance or followed the map.

it is Huge. This is the largest mall in the world, you can find anything, but it is expensive, however you can take a walk to the aquarium, the Dubai fountain and many things all within the area of the mall..

No bargains. Expensive. Nothing is cheaper than London from what I can see. This is probably the price of globalisation. Everything everywhere is the same at the same prices. It's a nice enough mall though but it is just a mall. I wouldn't come here unless you want to see it for seeing it's sake. Don't expect to snag anything unique or cheap.

Modern and Inviting. Good places to eat, and attractions. Aquarium, Bhurj Khalifa, and the dancing fountain. beautiful. You can get tickets to go to the top of BHurj Khaifa, right outside is the dancing fountain. The bathrooms are clean and for foreign visitors the crowd is extremely metropolitan and modern.
A good place for shopping. One of the best places to do shopping in Dubai with an excellent super market at the basement and also with a nice food court..

Huge. It was a Friday so expectedly the mall will be crowded. It is huge, it is crowded, to wide for both of us to explore but it was fun. Lots of cafe and restos to choose. The cinema looks unique :), ticket booth and the food store is in one counter which is somewhat convenient but crowded.

Great Mall Of Dubai. One of biggest shopping places and malls I have ever seen in my life that containing more than 2400 shops and brands .. worth to visit .. my favourite place to chill with friends and family in Dubai since Dubai dancing fountain is close and Dubai aquarium inside and a lot of attractions like kidzmania and sega republic ..

Mall With Many Other Attractions. Huge mall with many other attractions viz. Aquarium, Underwater zoo, Burj Khalifa and dancing fountain. You really need a lot of time to view all the attractions. Plan well in advance and if possible split it across 2 days. From the parking slot to the mall is well planned. We had to go twice in day, one was for Burj Khalifa in the morning and fountain show in the evening. Better to go around lunch time. Have lunch at the mall, visit Burj and later in the evening view the fountain show.

Another another large mall with indoor skiing. This another large mall with many many shops of all sorts. A reason to go here is the indoor skiing. If you don't ski you can have a look through the window to see this.There are plenty of restaurants and other dining options. Although none of them will serve you an alcoholic drink

Wow . Like having all your shopping habits in one place before the Internet. This place is huge and has so many attractions it could keep you there for a whole day. Luckily I had a quick stop for food and a quick look around.

Worth a walk around. The Mall of the Emirates is large and flashy. It boasts an indoor ski attraction and several high end stores. All things considered, it proved only to be a decent place to walk around and people watch. All things considered, anything I could possibly want in the mall is obtainable at home or online for a better price. I was tempted to ski, but was turned off by the large crowds and the price. As mentioned by previous reviewers, it is not the largest mall in Dubai. Overall, the Mall of the Emirates is worth a walk around if you are in the area and want respite from the heat.

Interesting. It's a good way to pass time but it's only high end items and was out of my price range for most of it. There was a couple interesting stores that were littered throughout. Worth a see at least once though because of how beautiful the building is.

shop until you drop. It is accessible with public transport. It is impressive and this place is one of a kind. A great place for shopping, you can spend hours nor day easily. There's aquarium,skating rink inside the Mall - you never get bored.

You name it - they have it. Great place to lose yourself in when shopping. Quite a large place located directly beneath the Ski Dubai. Any shop or store you can think off - it's there. Located conveniently with its own Dubai Tram stop.

Good shopping spree. All brands over Europe u can find here and good food outets as well, nice place to hang out ,only difficult faces was not that many signanges to find the place in the mall although good experience

Everything you need as a clothes shopper.. I have been dragged here kicking and screaming many times by my wife and sons girlfriend whilst visiting Dubai.Fortunately there are many decent coffee shops to amuse me whilst the girls shop. I have of course walked round and on the odd occasion when I needed some extra clothes I have always found what I needed. From high end to reasonable priced items you will find it hear.Girls you will love it....Men you can always go skiing and warm up with a coffee when finished.....

Amazing. This place is amazing and well worth a trip, not every mall has its own ski slope with penguins. Although there are many shops which we get in the uk there are others we don't and you can grab some great bargains. They also have high end shops like LV, Dior etc if you fancy splashing out.There are some lovely restaurants and coffee shops for a rest stop.

A great Shopping Location. Whils not as Lage as the Dubai Mall the Mall of the Emirates includes Ski Dubai if you fancy some snow sports whilst you shop. There are shops to suit all budgets as well as the high end labels.
Crowded by enjoyable. A mall of brands, ways through Dubai.Where you can enjoy your whole day in,Without getting bored.It contains many variety, many enjoyable things

Amazing Mall. Wonderful time with family and friends, walking the entire mall inside and out. It's a colossal piece of work and attached to the famous building Burj Khalifa. There are so many food establishments on the food courts, or other fine dining restaurants inside the mall or out in the Souk. Also, plenty of coffee shops to just relax and enjoy the view.The water fountain show is better at night as one can see the lights and the Burj Khalifa in the background with the tower lights putting on a show of its own. There is a giant bookstore next to Virgin store offering many items not seen in any other bookstores. Clothing items are everywhere and available from low prices to top brand, babies to adults. There is also the Dubai Aquarium lower floor which offers the largest aquarium in the world and an Ice Skating rink if you're into skating. For those aviator want to be or pilot enthusiast there are two simulators, one Airbus 380 Emirates Airlines next to the Apple store lower level and one upstairs next to the Reel Cinema Boeing 737 Simulator. There are maps available at all information desks throughout the mall. And if you look at it you are exercising the entire time as you will walk many kilometers/miles when it is all finished, unless you take the golf cart taxi's around the mall (Really). It may take you days to be able to see all of it but it's worth it and it truly is one of the best malls in the world. Happy Shopping. Enjoy!

Shopping And More Shopping. Firstly I would say this very much depends on where you are staying in Dubai, most friends/people told me that "The Dubai Mall" is the place to go first, then this and then any other mall afterwards, the difference from Dubai Mall to Mall O.T.E is around 15 minutes, we were staying near to the Bur Khalifa therefore the Dubai Mall was better for us.At the end of the day it's a win win you will be happy to do this mall or the dubai mall or if very lucky fit in both with - over 600+ shops and around 100 places to eat, you are going to find everything you need or want for what ever budget you have dont forget also you have an indoor ski centre if your tired of shopping.Again like with the Dubai Mall, get the metro or taxi parking can/is a nightmare at times.Definatly a place to visit, it just depends on how much time you are staying in Dubai and how much shopping one can do.

World class. So big so big you can't see in one day . Very expensive showrooms , showrooms of even those high brands that we have never heard in our life. For kids you can hire car for 60 dirhams for 4 hours as they won't get tired of walking. If you are not going to lost chambers then see underwater zoo and marine life inside this mall. Go to hamleys toy store on 2 nd floor for kids . It's a great store.
malling. malls in dubai is very cozy and cool... we had a lot of fun walking and shopping... awesome choices of booth... I love it

It's the heart of the city. In the true sense this was our point of start and end for the big bus tours Our day started and ended thereIt has a fantastic aquarium. .. must visit and a waterfallAnd an ice rinkIt so huge you can spend 3 evenings just walking in different parts and that's what we didIt has the entrance to the address hotels... My recommendation go to the address downtown and visit the neos pub on the 6 3rd floor and have a great view of the city and burn Khalifa!

Great to keep fit and Shop. First of all. This mall is huge . If you are looking to walk and exercise while you shop, this is for you. Great variety of outlets. They have a ice rink, cinemas. You have it all. You can spend the whole day at the mall, and in the evening watch the musical fountains next to the burj Khalifa.

One of the most interesting Malls in Dubai. International fashion brands, international food courts, some department stores, indoor Skiing, some cafes and restaurants and some other facilities and entertainments. All of these facilities make Mall of the Emirates one of the most interesting shopping malls in Dubai. If you are a shopping lover, Mall of the Emirates would be great and could be one of your best choices in Dubai. It means, that is one place which everyone would like to go in Dubai. But be careful because Mall of the Emirates is too large and if you are going to go there especially for shopping you’ll need take some hours to visit it, so I really suggest you use suitable shoes for walking, but don’t worry if you’ll get tired because there are lots of cafes there that you can enjoy your time. Mall of the Emirates has sensible convenient and you can go there with taxi or subway. Please pay attention that if you are looking for fashion with reasonable prices you shouldn’t miss Debenhams department store in the ground floor. Moreover, if you can manage your time I extremely suggest going to Dubai in January for Dubai shopping festival.

Shop till you drop - an understatement!. Dubai mall or Mall of the Emirates? Hard to choose. Mall of the Emirates is close to the metro line so accessible from most parts of the city by public transport. It is a vast shopping area close to Jumeirah and next door to Ski Dubai. Be prepared for a long walk around the shopping centre - it would fit most of the UK's shopping malls into a part of it. Busy? Yes! Variety? Yes! Expensive? Well there are shops for all taste. A tip - leave the credit card back at the hotel and enjoy the experience.

Huge.... Huge mall with almost all brands available. Food court is worth a visit. Reel cinema really gives one an experience. also dunno about others but ben cookies is available on ground floor. regards

Ideal Shopping place. the mall never dissapoints always something new to see and do and experience the food at the food court was yum but when you want to avoid the crowds Go to FRIDAYS the chicken wings are yummmmm same as the potato twists oh dear am hungry again :-) the paris gallery is on point has staff ready to help can be overwhelming if you dont know what you want but yaaaay its awesome the toy stores are a kiddie heaven the banks and exchange points are cool my favourite place in Dubai will always come back .

Shopping food and ice rink. Great for shopping, good restaurants and amazing view of the dancing fountains. The aquarium and the ice rink(inside the mall) are major attractions. Good restaurants eg: social takes the mall to a new level.
everything you need.. what ever you need, you will find here. clean and spacious, it opens till late every night. you can even book an indoor taxi to get around.
Stylish mall. This mall has an artistry that stands out. Elegant and huge!! Good variety of shops and leisure facilities including skiing arena. Good parking facilities. Spent much time here!

Worst parking ever bad attitude staff at barrier. We visited this mall and the mall parking attendant at the barrier was rude, we puchased clothes at the mall from a high fashion store and some how our parking ticket fell out in the store whilst trying on some clothes, so when we got to the barrier we could not find our parking ticket, the rude boy at the barrier refused to let us leave, we explained our circumstances and he insisted that I return to the store where I lost my ticket, with out any common sense or dignity thinking that we were go to leave our car at the barrier, this was an immature childish behavoir of a person employed by this mall, coming from Europe we would expect the person to understand our situation but this person seemed to be rude and poor in politeness, when we get back to Europe we will be sending our Phone video to the TV channels to show what poor service this Mall offers, the should be ashamed of themselves for such bad behaviour.

The Mall with a major Sky initiative. Never to miss this Mall if you are visiting Dubai as there is a man made Sky slide with sub zero snow and Ice . To do such a thing in a desert is really great. Hats off to the leaders of this country for converting this place. A must do activity in UAE / Dubai
Dubai fun. A wow mall. Connected with two 5*hotel's. Lovely ambience. Superb infrastructure. Worth watching. Connected with metro. Easy access to taxi too.
Very good and emblematic.. Big with all brands, services and products that you may need. Under refurbishment buy still good.Excellent option for shopping at any time and with 2 hotels integrated.
Good place. Good mall to visit in Dubai...nice brands...parking an issue....ski resort good place to visit...penguin show also a good watch...

A shoppers dream. Located next door to the auris boutique apartments everything you need is here. Also you can have a go at skiing here...truly magical...not as big at dubai mall but equally as fantastic.

Mall of Emirates now has a new vibe. Mall of Emirates new extension upwards has given the place a new vibe, with the recently opened section containing,reputedly the largest Apple store in the world. The new VOX cinema in the mall means you can see movies in Imax, even in 4D, eat gourmet food in comfy chairs. At the end of the new addition is the sport store GO which has a decent selection of out door climbing gear and gym equipment. My gripe with the GO, is that they haven’t priced everything, which is frustrating at times,when there is no one to serve you,so GO please get it sorted. Tom & Serge new off shoot Common Ground is located next to the sports store. Borders book store has finally re -opened at MOE, after an absence of over a year, while not as glam as Kinokuniya books in Dubai Mall its a welcome return after an 18 month absence.Abercrombie & Fitch is opening an outpost in the Mall.I doubt there will be shirtless male models by the front entrance though. Dean & Delucas has opened,while the famous global chinese dumpling restaurant Din Tai Fung is choker block, so get a buzzer, be prepared to queue,as the dumplings are to die for,yes they do have usual chinese favourites, yet it defeats the purpose of eating here. Mall of Emirates is still user friendly,except when you get dropped off by taxis near the entrance, so be careful getting out. Hopefully the mall management will have sorted this out soon.

EXCLUDE THE SNOW MOUNTAIN YOU ARE LEFT WITH ?. If large malls are your idea of fun, Dubai Mall is much larger. The Walmart (carefore market) gives you a sense of America. The taxi pickup is on the east side, first floor and takes a minimum of an hour. Take the Metro out, then pick up a cab.

User Friendly. Perfect place for a nice afternoon to relax and enjoy! I have been to Dubai Mall also but i found this one a lot more user friendly, the signs are absolutely accurate inside, good shops to suit all budgets and types of shopping, it has items at prices for people on a budget and for of course your usual sheiks.The Ski Dubai area is just amazing how hot and dry it is outside.A huge department/supermarket shop on the ground floor with huge selection of food to buy at cheap prices and in bulk too, shop was filled with expats from all countries as well as locals and tourists getting some bits and bobs.Food court had numerous shops with all cuisines, Lebanese, Oriental, Indian, American, Italian. Everything!Shops such as Mango, H and M and Zara man make this the perfect mall for all.
Nice place. It was perfect.it doesn't end.even when you are there for 12 hours...Don't miss it.It really worth seeing.And don't miss the ski Dubai

Excellent. I preferred this Mall to the Dubai Mall as it did seem smaller and was easier to navigate around with maps easily accessible. A shoppers paradise but as per my other review, Dubai is not somewhere to get a bargain!
My favorite mall in Dubai. The best shop selection and less crowdy than Dubai mall. Direct access from the metro station called MOE.
Supercar Paradise - Shopping Ain't Bad!. I Love The Mall - Always Make A Visit For Last Minute Shopping & Pics & Indian Pavilion! Best Time To Visit Thur-Sat Open Until 12am.
EXCELLENT MALL WITH MORE AFFORDABLE STORES. The is again a very impressive shopping mall, with more affordable stores than the ones at the Dubai Mall, plenty of choice of shopping and eating places.

My favourite mall with lots of choices in shopping spree. mall of the emirates is my favourite mall as its king of all the malls. If you come to visit Dubai you must put this on your visit list as it has various choices of branded store to shop nice trendy restaurants food court and the must see Ski Dubai visit the mall especially during the Sale season to get the best bargains

Decent mall but not better than Dubai Mall. Mall of the Emirates is a large mall with offerings great shopping experience in Dubai. It has a large number of outlets across all categories. However, this is not as huge or popular as the Dubai Mall. For people, who do not love to walk as much or who hate crowds, Mall of the Emirates is a better shopping destination than Dubai Mall though.One of the other attractions for spending time at the mall is the Ski Park Dubai which is located within the Mall of the Emirates.
Bling at it's best.. Huge, stunning. Full of designer labels,and some wr 'at home' are more familiar with.....enjoyed a few hours here. Worth a visit.

The new floor a must see . You must take a look at the new floor with its cinema. Truly unique and like no other cinema in dubai.The restaurants quite gourmet not your regular junk food not here (they do have your McDonald's and fast food food court downstairs too )Take a shawl as the air conditioning is really cold but on a hot day it's perfectly refreshing

Large Mall with tons of stores . This Mall is nicely appointed and has every store you can imagine. Additionally, it had Ski Dubai that's kept at -4 degrees so you can take the chair lift to ski down the mountain or try the snow luge. It took about an hour and half to make it through the entire Mall (and that was without buying anything) . If you're a shopper give yourself a lot of time because you'll need it.

Decent but busy mall. Always enjoy visiting MoE, for shopping/ski Dubai amongst other attractions. Avoid evenings/weekends as it gets very busy. Recently completed an extension and huge cinema. Plus the Ductac theater also has good value shows.
Nothing better than dubai mall. The only supeising part is they can ski without a hitch in somehow a snow-park.you can find almost everything in dubai mall instead.

Best mall in Dubai. I believe this is the best mall in Dubai. It might not be the largest one, as Dubai mall is larger, but this one is better in the sense that you will find almost anything you need, without getting lost.

Not like dubai mall, but has "ski dubai". MoE is a big mall with everything you would expect. Besides that it is home to Ski Dubai, the indoor skiing slope. Imho Dubai mall has a more diverse, open and friendly architecture and if you only plan to visit one mall I would suggest to go there instead of MoE.
As big as The Emirates!. Big indeed, to shop around. Also lots of places for eating/ drinking (I mean cold drink & water). Easily accessible from the metro stn

Huge Mall to get around. The Mall is very nice inside and quite light. There is over 550 shops in the Mall. The high end shops are Tiffanys, Loius Vitton,Chanel and the list goes on. There are lots of food courts there. There is also an indoor ski field complete with slopes and toboggans. The Metro is very close to the Mall.
Dubai. Excellent tour organised by city one tours llc dubai. Organised way. Places worth to be seen in a life time.

Excellent experience. We spent whole day at Mall of the Emirates and loving it. There are all-sort of activities to do beside of course Shopping. Beautiful aquarium, indoor skiing and other fun things for kids.

Average mall not the Dubai glamour you think it is. A huge shopping center, just like the Dubai mall. But it looks more plain and basic.I guess the reason for you to check it out is the ski Dubai attraction. It costs a lot of money and seems pretty lame for people who ski regularly in nature. On the other hand it seems like an hollywood winter wonder land. One of the walls is glass - so you can peak in from the mall.Otherwise you can eat and shop while hiding away from the arabic sun.
Best place for time pass. Love to spend an whole day with friends or family at MOE... great place. Nice branded shops and lots of places for kids too to have fun.. The movie theaters r awesome too..

Big mall. It's second largest mall of dubai after dubai mall. Almost all top brands of world you can finds. Some of good restaurants is also there for food lover. Must visit thing is ski dubai one can Experience snow in middle of desert . Must visit for all.

Everything you could possibly want.... If you're into shopping, look no further! The Mall of the Emirates is MASSIVE with something for all sizes and budgets. There are several restaurants and even hotels attached to this space so go now...and shop 'till you drop!Remember to wear respectful clothes for UAE (cover knees & shoulders ideally)
A great mall and shopping experience . A very good place to visitIts in albarshaThey do have the Emirates Ski And lots of shops and restaurants A not to miss attraction

Mall Of Emirates. Located on Sheikh Zayed Road , Mall Of Emirates can be considered as one stop shop . I has various options for kids like SKI Dubai , Magic Planet etc etc. There are lots of option for dining also.

My favourite shopping mall in Dubai. There are many shopping malls in Dubai but the one I like most is Mall of Emirates. There are ample of parking spaces above ground with good daylight. There are good variety of shops from branded items to supermarket. The food courts serve western, Asian to Middle East cusines. There are also restaurants around. Prices are reasonable.

Typical High End Mall. Rejoice mega mall lovers. This is it for you. Huge mall. Lots of high end stores... think 10,000 US dollars and more for a handbag at some stores.... if that's your thing, definitely worth a visit. Very crowded in the parking lot and inside the mall.

Amazing shopping mall. This would have to be the best shopping centre in the world.the place is enormous with every major brand in the world.highly.recommended to visit as the place is simply.breath taking.
Al most everything in one roof. Offering many shops of signature clothes and accesories. Many restaurants and coffee shops. A great stop by while in dubai for your shopping needs

Good place to shop. Quieter than the busy Dubai Mall but shops and eateries are great. Ski Dubai well worth a visit. Big food court on the top floor but prefer the lower ground floor eateries which are not as noisy.
What doesn't it have. This place has everything. A mosque, food, dessert, shops of all sorts, and an indoor SKI SLOPE. You can spend hours here. It was a nice place to see.

A more human scale. This mall is much more to my liking than the renouned Dubai Mall. Although big it is smaller and much more likeable. I hear it is preferred by locals. The Indian food in the food courts is superb!

Good place for shopping . Mall of the emirates is one of the best places for shopping in dubai you can find in it all what you need from simple till luxurious objects and clothes. It also has nice restaurants .

Nice Mall to do your shopping and sightseeing. Most of the big clothing store chains in Europe have retail outlets in this Mall . Most importantly you could access the metro from inside this Mall and go around Dubai easily.
Shopping. One can do all their shopping here... Plus lunch or dine at the many restaurants that they have to offer

Again similar to Dubai mall. If you want to kill time go to the malls..
Expensive! Too many shops half a day needed. can easily get there using metro. But allot of walking so wear comfortable shoes.

This is something else. Fabulous mall in Dubai. Plenty to see and do; great food court and you can go skiing. Its big and brash and has everything that you need. Adjacent to the Dubai MTR and to the main highways. Great mall but I think that the Dubai Mall is still better!

It's B-I-G!. If you like shopping you'll enjoy Mall of the Emirates. As with most things in Dubai it's big and spotless. All the major designer brands and stores are available under one roof and there is a great selection of eateries to enjoy throughout the mall and in the large food hall. It's also the only shopping centre I've visited with its own snow. Ski Dubai the world's largest indoor ski slope is a remarkable work of engineering featuring ski runs, toboggan course and secure children areas. Don't miss the chance to hug a penguin. On the top floor you'll find bowling and an amusement arcade, entertainment for all ages. If you enjoy films there's an excellent cinema complex showing all the major releases.It gets busy in the evening so we preferred to visit during the day to escape the high temperatures. Make sure you wear comfortable shoes as you'll find you will cover a few miles exploring all the mall has to offer.

It's got everything now! . No need to go to the Dubai Mall now as The Mall of Emirates has everything Great selection of shops including designer brands such as Louis Vuitton, Chanel, Van Cleef, Breitling etc etc all under one roof. Brilliant food hall on the ground floor and some lovely restaurants and cafes sprinkled around. We had a great meal at Tribes & at Ashas. Now has a brand new cinema on the top floor. Also has Ski Dubai the largest indoor ski slope, magic planet for the kids & bowling! Our favourite mall in Dubai but it does get busy on Thursday Friday & evenings!

'every week there'. MOE in short, always go there for my.home need to buy from Carrefour.
Many ATM located there are very useful.
Watching movie or restaurants are best idea to do there.

Very busy. Its really big but simultaneously very busy. Parking also very busy and complicated for those who are not familiar with it's system. You cant find any instructions or enough signs to help and its very annoying. By the way the mall is very big and any thing could be found although the prices are high.

Big big. Enjoy the big crowdy mall.ice sking.various brands and prices
You will find carefour there for decent prices for any needs.
if you hit a discount in any mall you will not beleive prices are some times 90%

would be average except for Ski Dubai inside. Good selection of shops and restaurants - as always in Dubai it is huge and you can pretty much get anything you want. However, what sets it apart is the Ski Dubai area - and the arcade is also very fun.

I prepared this mall to the Dubai mall.. The decor is stunning, vert classic. We looked on our iPads and it stated 12 midnight for shops closing but someone needs to tell the shops this as 9.39 10.00 they were all closing except a few. The new Apple Store is not opened here yet!

Favourite Mall in Dubai. Its less crowded than Dubai Mall, because Dubai Mall has other attractions that pull tourists. I like to be able to work around in the Mall of the Emirates and not feel like people are in my way!

Good shopping mall. This is a very big shopping mall with a lot of facilities. They have branded shops, budget shops, for babies, women and men, so many choices. The only thing i would wish if they could open an ADIB bank branch in it, it would be prefect.
No benches. The mall is amazing as most of the malls in dxb are! But there is no place to rest.no sofas or benches provided
Big. There were so many shops, restaurants and the snow fields. So much to see, shop and do. Need a couple of days there.

Big nice mall. I think the most popular mall after dubai . Is MOE
It's big but u will find securitits to ask them about the way 😊
Nice collection of brands . Shop. Restaurants and coffeeshops.
And of course the most important thing in it is ski dubai ☺

A smaller alternative to Dubai Mall!!. A smaller alternative to the Dubai Mall, less likely to get lost. I liked this mall better as a better choice of shops. And easier to get a taxi after. Spotlessly clean but not as we'll air conditioned as the Dubai Mall.

Everything and all that you want under one roof. From the 15 Dhirams to the 150 000 Dhirams handbag. Mall of the Emirates have it all. Restaurant. Shops. Skiing, Hotel. Cinemas, Electronics. Ice cream bars .... you name it .It's all under this great one roof . I stayed @ the Kimplensky hotel and I literally spent the week inside the mall . It's got so much to offer there is no point going shopping anywhere else

Better than The Dubai mall. We thought this mall was better and had a more pleasant atmosphere than the Dubai Mall. It feels more sophisticated and the most unique feature is the Ski Dubai ski slope. But again...it is just a mall!!

Excellent . Ski dubai is located in mall of emirates and itself mall of emirates is a place to see and explore. It's not a small to be covered in a go and it has been beautifully structured and designed
Pick up a map of the Mall to stop you going round in circles. Large shopping mall lots of people window shopping, plenty of places to eat, Found items to be expensive for the ordinary people.

Everything In One Location. Dubai has multiple malls but this is my favourite as it is nothing short of a city within itself. If you have little children you can leave them at Kidzania, which is the greatest concept for kids anywhere in the world and hit the shops. The mall has everything including the huge indoor aquarium which is very impressive. We visited the mall on a public holiday in Dubai this time and it was honestly wall to wall with people. It was quite extraordinary to be in such a thriving atmosphere and overwhelming at the same time which all the lights, noise and levels. If you want to attend the mall when it is quieter, I suggest going first thing in the morning as the locals seem to be late starters. Be aware of local customs and you should wear clothes that do not show your knees or shoulders as a sign of respect. However it is not absolutely necessary and Dubai seems to be alot more relaxed about this than it was 5 years ago or in places like Oman, where dress code is mandatory. If you do visit the mall you can make a day of it due to its size and all options from food to fashion are covered ten times over.
Excellent. Super mall has everything that you are looking for well laid out. The expansion will add some more pizazz.

An everyday mall with lots to do.. Great range in food, shops both high end and high street. A gigantic Carrefour for grocery, electronic and souvenir shopping. There are many electronic stores, along with beautiful cafes. Head to cafe in Harvey Nichols for a coffee with beautiful surroundings, be warned though the coffee/juices are very expensive there. I have been there plenty of times I the last few weeks,.

You won't be disappointed. You must go to this mall just to see the indoor skiing. It's 110 degrees outside and you walk into the mall and their are ski lifts carrying people to the top of the man made mountain to ski down. There is a movie theatre called the Vox that is insane. Definitely upgrade your ticket to the VIP theater where you will be guided to a full recliner chair that will lay completely flat, you will be wrapped in a beautiful purple blanket and handed a pillow. You will also have a full menu option. Gourmet sliders, finger sandwiches, beef tenderloin. All served to you by your private waiter on real china. You have a call button that you can summon your server at any tie during the movie for another mock tini, popcorn or more food. Soon fun!!! This mall has it all and is a bit more doable than the Dubai mall.
Huge. Really interesting shopping center with slope inside,many shops,food courte with many kind of restaurants. Easy ecces via Dubai metro.

A bit of everything. Lots of shops/stores, a lot of expensive designer but some cheaper ones too. If you are looking for cigarettes there is a shop selling 200 for the price of 1 (20) packet at home and cheaper than duty free! Very clean and light, lots of places to eat and a designated taxi rank too. Worth a visit.

Snow all year round. A vibrant shopping mall at the outskirt of Dubai city center towards Abu Dhabi. The center is filled with major international brands from clothing, accessories, electronics, and many more. Other fact that puts the shopping center one the top attractions is the all famous Dubai ski. And in here you will never run out of dining options, you might even get confused on deciding where to eat and what to eat. My advise, come using the metro. It gets very frustrating during weekends with the rush and traffic plus the parking fees during the weekdays.

Fabulous for shopping !. A must for anyone visiting Dubai who likes to shop ! This mall caters for anyone with designer shops to your every day ones. You really are spoilt for choice here. They've also got Ski Dubai as well as a great play area for children which includes a soft play area fit younger children. You can't come to Dubai and not visit this mall.

snow park only good with superpass/ extra charges for gloves and locker. visited the snow park at the emirates mall,snow park is good but they charge you additional 25 aed for gloves per person and acitivities is provided only for super pass. you have to pay 45 aed for locker and 20 aed will be refunded.

Great Shopping Adventure !. Mall of the Emirates being attached to the metro station makes it easy for anyone to access it. It has beautiful stores to purchase from whether it's a designer or just a normal shop. Here you can watch a and kids can visit Ski Dubai where they enjoy ski slope and seeing penguins.

Emirates an experience you have to do. WOW. You could spend a week here and not see all the stores.It is a mind experience. I just like watching the people and sit and have coffee as they shop and shop and shop. There are always sales. What I really like is to walk across bridge by fountains to the Restaurant side and sit outside the hustle and bustle.
Nothing special just like any mall . Just like any mall nothing special but the only thing that was good was the staff in the mall. They are very helpful and kind
nice place for shopping. money matter's a lot here,, a very fine place for shopping u can get brands of worldwide ,people from whole world under one roof ...
Good . Was 2 minutes from our hotel Nice shopping centre and plenty of eating places.ski dubai here aswell. Also got the hop on hop off tour bus here aswell

Shops shops and more shops. Not quite as big as the Dubai mall which makes it less tiring walking around. Lots of shops for ever body, s taste. Great to see the skiers and families playing in the snow. Well worth a visit but they do get a bit boring after a couple of hours walking around
Nice mall. Good mall more everyday shops and you see a lot more locals here than the other malls. Worth a visit if you're at a loss.

Very classy. All the top brands are here
Nicely engineered with a glass dome and a nice decor
Quite big but not the kind you get lost and exhausted to find something.
There is paul cafe downstairs but you may have to stand in line to get a table (quite small)

A Unique Mall. Unlike other malls that I have visited, Dubai Marina Mall is unique in many ways. It was my first experience disembarking a metro train and walking directly to a mall. Anything you need, is available; shopping, food and even adventure.

Nice selection. Great mall with a good selection of retailers.
My biggest gripe is the shortage of seats for taking a break amid shopping.
Second mall. It's second big mall in dubai you should visit it and inside it you will find ski dubai the snow games in the desert city

Family Familiarization. Quiet big mall..a lot of shop there but quiet expensive..can only do window shopping and done shopping in carrefour. The mosque is nice and the access to there is very easy. There is a metro direct to MOE

World most luxurious shopping centre!!. I have to say this is the world most luxurious shopping centre!! I have been here few times and every time I go I amazed with atmosphere and Brand in this place..
Love the offers here. Nice place if you want to have a relaxed mindset and want to shop till u drop. And dont miss Ski Dubai which is right in this mall.
One of my favorite malls . Mall if the Emirates can not disappoint you..Go ahead it's beautiful mega mall ..with multiscreen cinemas and many many restaurants. .totally recommend it

Good place. The mall is near to my hotel and it was a convenient place for me to do my shopping.The mall has soo many shops and good place of anything you want.The staffs are too helpful when you ask for directions or location of any place.And the cinema, i really enjoyed.i couldnt have enough of it.It is the best place to shop whenever im on vacation in dubai.
A mall with an indoor ski park. It has got to be one of the grandest mall in Dubai. Three words to summarize the mall - huge, modern and sophisticated. And gotta love the indoor snow and ski park!

Giant and interesting attraction. It is a huge mall with all the shops you can ever think of. Interesting also to see the Ferraris, Rolls Royce and other great cars parked at the main entrance. I enjoyed lookng at the local people in their attire and in family. I would say eectronics is around 25% more expensive than in USA, but you can find articles of brands only available here. The Ski Dubai resort is insode this Mall so you can imagine the magnitude of this building. Very easy access throug metro.

Nice day out. I am not much of a shopper but even I was impressed by the variety of merchants. I am sooo glad my wife stayed home this trip, guys make sure you leave one credit card at your hotel. the mall is always busy and with the selection of dining options and lets not forget the indoor skiing, it makes for a nice day out.

Less busy but modern. Has a metro stop. Less busy than dubai mall and still has great food selection. The food court further away from the entrance near the ski dubai is much better. Large selection of shops but way too expensive for us. Same brands as Asia and North America but 2x the price.

Cosier than Dubai mall. I actually liked this one more because it isnt that huge as Dubai mall. Lovely decorations all over and many nice shops. Shame about the wifi, really not set up for foreign visitors!

Site seeing. Amazing and lovely place to visit and shop. I enjoyed every bit of my vacation at dubai and with the help of the big bus with the air conditioner it was as if I was using a flight. Though the big bus has a speed limit but it was an amazing cruise.

My favourite mall in town . If you want to find elegance combined to the best deals in town this is the place! !!! The most homey and refined mall on town. The quality of the structure and finish is amazing. The choice offered by the retails outlets provide the best brands at a reasonable price and there is always some sales going on!!!!!You have a strong dynamic and every body carries shopping bags in a vivid atmosphere ... not like in Dubai mall where you loose your way in desert lane before reaching what you are looking for. Nice clientele of high medium range. In regard of the restaurants you will find every type of food at different range of prices and a multiple array of exquisite places either facing the ski slops or looking at the people strolling down the mall.

Something for everyone. All the hotel shuttle buses seem to go to this mall. Mecca (appropriate word here!) for shopping, food and entertainment and air-conditioned bliss. If it's fast food you want, here it is. If it's something a little more formal, here it is. If it's luxury labels you want, here it is. If it's High Street labels, here it is. Not the cheapest place to shop though.
Ski indoors. Not as big as Dubai mall but no less impressive. The home of Ski Dubai. A great selection of brands to chose from along with plenty of restaurants.

Good Mall. Like to go to this mall when we visit Dubai. It's not too big but has all the shops you could want. Good places to grab something to eat including food court for cheap eats. Good place to change your currency. Huge supermarket should you need one selling just about anything you might want. Shops range from High Street brands to designer goods. Nice to get a coffee and watch folk in Ski Dubai. Must have a go sometime. Not too far if you are holidaying on Jumeirah Beach and cheap taxi ride.

There were Dubai life is!. I am a bit hesitant to call a mall located society, walking through air conditioned tunnels - an example for tourist observation, but that's what Dubai people are. Here you can find everything and everybody. Getting crowded after 10 pm , so that special police arrangements in the tunnels and parking is needed. Another rush comes after midnight on walking back. Metro work till 2 am, but that's not the typical transportation for the people here. Above that curiosity - large and all brands full mall...Probably a nice place for shopping maniacs also!

Luggage Storage and Airport Access. This mall is higly recommended for travellers who want to do last-minute shopping before catching ther flight. They offer a free luggage storage and the mall is connected to the metro station so this is a perfect place to visit on your last day in dubai.

Cool mall. The mall of the emirates isn't as big as the Dubai mall but the good thing about it is that it's also not as crowded. The shops are pretty much international brands. We went around the Eid season so there were some cool discounts. The Skiing place is also amazing. We will probably try that soon :)

Shop and Experience the Indoor Ski. This is a good shopping centre which isn't as big as Dubai mall. It has the Ski Dubai here which is fantastic. Enjoy the penguin experience where you get to pat King Penguins. You can also ski the slopes and go on a toboggan ride.

Perfect for the shopaholic . Every shop you could ever wish for from your cheaper end like gap, next, river island right up to the expensive tastes! Plus there is a Tiffanys which was just gorgeous. The building itself was just beautiful.

Nice Mall. You can enjoy Ski in this mall. This mall in again loaded with all the major brands of Dubai. You can de board metro at mall of emirates if you are travelling from metro. You can also get taxi from basement of the mall. Major fast food Giants like Mc D, Pizza Hut, Burger King, Chilis are on the first floor of mall. You can enjoy games at 2nd floor of mall in magic planet. 4**** and 5***** restaurants are also available here.
great attraction for all tastes. This mall has something very unique being the host of Ski Dubai, but I mainly visit it for its unique restaurants

Great shopping !!. Big but not the biggest shopping centre in Dubai, the Mall of Emirates is an excellent shopping centre with all of the kinds of shops you could need. I have never seen so many stores selling good quality children's wear. And if you are into snow, there is a man-made ski park. Well worth a visit.
Indoor ski slope in the desert, yes please.. This place has an indoor ski slope and is in the middle of the desert. Lots to see and do, expensive as is Dubai but certainly worth a few hours!

Shopping in Style. Mall of Emirates is one of the top shopping attractions in Dubai and we can consider all middle east.It is designed in way that make it easy to shop.What is special about it is the restaurants district in the ground floor as you can have your best meal along with marvelous fountain. There is two hotels attached to the mall Sheraton and Kempinski There

Great mall. Took friends there for the first time & they were stunned by the indoor ski slope. Usual shops that are overpriced but it's a great place to wander round. Great choice of Lebanese restaurants offering good value meals.

One of the major Malls where you must spend sometime during your stay in Dubai. The Mall of Emirates - although not so huge as Dubai Mall is , and barring a 500-seat Dubai Community Centre and Arts Theatre and Ski Dubai , it lacks the major attractions that Dubai Mall has . Yet, it is well worth a visit . The Mall is expanding and adding more facilities and attractions , now that it is celebrating its 10th anniversary . The visit to Ski Dubai is a fascinating experience, although a tad expensive @ minimum 250 Dhs per person . The designer shops and restaurants are a treat for the eyes and you can find all major global brands represented here . You are also spoilt for choices so far as food is concerned with close to 90 restaurants, cafes and eateries at the MoE . Worth spending half a day at the Mall of Emirates during the visit to Dubai . To get there via public transport , board the comfortable Dubai Metro [ Red Line ] .

Ski and Shop. This is a good shopping centre which isnt as big as Dubai mall. It has the Ski Dubai here which is fantastic.We did the penguin experience where you get to pat King Penguins. You can also ski the slopes and go on a toboggan ride .

Very big Shpping. This shopping center won by luxury, smaller than the Dubai Mall, however it is recommended to also collect a map to not get lost. The type of shops and restaurants is more refined and this shopping center has the peculiarity of having an ice rink where the temperature is constant -2 ° C, in contrast to the 45 ° C outside.

Not as good as the Mall of Dubai. Although I spent around an hour here I didn't feel it was as good as the Mall of Dubai. Both were similar perhaps but the Mall of Dubai had a Souk, Fountains, and Burj Khalifa on its doorstep. This mall is maybe targeted as locals more than tourists.

Another Mega Mall in Dubai. I have visited this Mall regularly since it opened nearly a decade ago and took our overseas guests there today for a look around and lunch.The Mall has the usual array of designer shops, food courts, cafes, coffee shops, restaurants, a multiplex cinema, etc.as well as the adjoining Kempinski Hotel. However, the MOE is unique in the UAE for its indoor Ski Slope aptly titled "Ski Dubai" which is a major attraction for tourists.Dubai Metro also has a station here for easy access while the multi storey parking lots provide ample parking for vehicles.In summary, the MOE offers a thoroughly enjoyable shopping experience with entertainment and extensive dining facilities.

Good alternative to the Dubai Mall. Dubai has no shortage of shopping malls to visit. We took a lunch stop here and felt that this mall offered shops that were a little less upmarket than the Dubai Mall and hence more affordable for the average shopper. We took a look at the ski slope and wondered why you would go skiing here but I guess it is a novelty and you can say that you went skiing in a country where it was 48 degrees Celsius outside! The Dubai City Sightseeing bus stops here so take a look if you have the time.

Mall of the Emirates first timer. Truly a large mall compared to the Philippine malls.Excellent hygiene in comfort rooms, wide selection of restaurants, fast food and garments/boutiques.A must-visit place in Dubai.

Customer service - the worst I have ever experienced. In January, Mall of Emirates launched a food contest on their instagram account. I have baked some nice cookies, posted the picture and together with other 9 people, I won the contest.However, their marketing department never contacted us regarding the prize and never replies us on instagram.It is not about the prize, which I really don't care but it is unbelievable that such a great shopping mall allows their marketing department not be responsible for their name. I have tried to contact them over 10 times and I never got an answer. It is such a shame!!!!!
Nice Environment.. Good accessibility. Nice shopping mall with all the options required and accessibility is good. No need to visit any other malls if you are in this area.

A good place for a visit. I usually go to The Mall of the Emirates whenever I am in Dubai. The place is easy to reach with big size parking. You might get stuck in traffic at rush hour, but you will get there however. It has some unique places to see, like snow boarding, cinema, etc. The Virgin store is really nice and big. You can find everything you need for a 16 yo kid. The only thing bothered me on all my visits to this mall was one of the staff in Pierre Cardin who started chasing me all the time since I stepped into the store,asking me what I want there. I told him I was looking for a winter jacket, he took me to coat section which did not have the coat I was looking for. I showed him on my ipad what type of the coat I need, he was persuading me to buy one of the coats which was quite unlike the one I showed him. Finally he rudely told me I am confused and I had no idea what I want!!! Pierre Cardin is famous enough to be introduced here by me, but such great name needs respectful and professional staff.
Huge shopping mall .. Lots of expensive brands. I am not really into walking around a shopping centre of expensive designer brand shops However this home of Ski Dubai -- great fun
Mall of emirates. Biggest mall ever seen with a large parking of vehicles. clean like a glass of floor tiles. Good cares for customers. Amusement park for children's.

A clean and bright mall. This mall is smaller than the Dubai mall and I think I preferred it this was the mall with the ski slope which was surreal you can watch through a glass wall and my daughter was intrigued to see penguins crossing over, it does make me wonder if they are happy in this environment though. You can see the slope from a long way away it looks strange. Again this mall is easy to get a taxi to and from. We had some food in the food court which was good.

Impressive but Expensive!!. Mall very impressive. Clean and tidy, however so very very expensive. Been coming for years and this year walked away with nothing. All the UK shops around you. We have Westfields at home in the UK, reminds me of Westfields but much bigger. Keeping my mo eye till I get home. Coffee was nice and watching the locals shop!! Sorry not as good as years gone by. However still looks very impressive.

Best Mall in UAE. HUGE mall which requires you to have comfy shoes LOL!! Something for everybody at the amazing mall from department stores to exclusive outlets and has two food courts as well as a gigantic Nike concept store.
Good for some regular shopping.. Many shops, expensive goods. Huge Carrefour supermarket inside for some regular shopping that you may need to do during your stay.

Opulent. This mall is not as big as the Dubai mall but it has great shops still. Interestingly it also has a quirky snow zone where there's real snow all times of year... typical nice touches in Dubai. This was lovely. Worth going to as a shopaholic

Great upmarket mall. Met a friend here for lunch and did a spot of shopping. They have a wide range of shops and exactly what I was looking for (an Asics shop) from top end down to affordable. Iw as only here for a few hours but if you are a shopaholic you could spend all day here. It was nice too as there were no crowds and grabbing a taxi was easy with no queues either.

Pleasant respite from the heat but prices are steep !. During our stay on the Palm in Dubai we decided to visit this once famous mall which has now been surpassed by the Dubai mall in popularity ........... and size. It soon became apparent that generally speaking, compared to UK shop prices, you are looking at approximately a 30 to 40% uplift! sometimes more which I must admit was a bit of a shock. All the main brands are there. Thankfully we were only looking to grab some lunch and a coffee. There is also a large Carrefour inside which is a great place to buy provisions for your rental apartment or hotel room with prices here on a par with the UK which was a pleasant surprise.

Great facilities for young family but couldnt access free wifi.. Visited here with my family and it was great place to browse/shop and had great facilities for baby changing etc. Only downside is that you needed a UAE mobile number to register for the free wifi which isnt great if you are a tourist like me!

Too far . My only concern it was so far from my hotel @ deira
And no metro get you there
The brands are cool
Also the food court
Great time
Shopping world. One of the biggest shopping mall with world class brand.huge area you can spend whole day here nice environment.

Shopping, ski fields fantasy & great cafes. I loved this mall. From the totally amazing ski slopes created inside this mall to the great shops & many places to eat it is a good place to spend a few hours out of the desert heat. It has all the usual outlets, high end to budget. It covers all budgets.
Good day out. Mall of the Emirates is still expanding and whilst some international brands not present for various reasons, still a very impressive offering including some excellent food options

Beautiful & breathtaking Mall. Beautiful Mall and very spacious. Lots of shops and restaurants.
Ski Dubai - indoor ski resort is pretty amazing though I have only seen it from the mall.

2nd best shopping mall in dubai. It's smaller than the dubai mall but not less than it in its shopping facilities cafes and restraints. ... personally I like to do my shopping here as it's smaller and more organized and easier to window shop before u pop in the store and if ur feet get tired and need to boost ur energy there is a wide range of choices that fit all budgets and tastes
Beautiful . Absolutely amazing . I wish I had all the money in the world to get something from all the shops. Truly wonderful place
A shopping experience with a difference.. I've really found this walk-around relaxing, refreshing and entertaining. Something thrilling around every nook and corner.

Large shopping center that has a man made snow on offer!. My wife and I met a friend from University here and spent a good couple of hours. We walked but didn't really buy much as Dubai is just way too expensive to shop. Istanbul is only 4 hours away by plane and has the same shopping, but at a much better value for money than Dubai.

Great mall not as big as Dubai mall. Dubai has malls , malls, and more malls I like this mall because it has a supermarket that's like a super walmart unlike Dubai mall which took us 2 days to do because it's so massive. U can catch the Big bus here too.

Great Shopping Centre. This is my favourite shopping centre in Dubai as it has all the high end brands together. The selection of shops is very impressive and seems endless when you wander around the mall. We were there during Ramadan so all the cafes were closed which made it difficult to shop during the day for hours on end with no place to sit and have a bite to eat or coffee. If you go during Ramadan then my advice is to shop at night as they keep the mall open much later, only trouble is you miss out on some of the other attractions Dubai has on offer in the evenings. As its so hot in July shopping during the day in an air-conditioned mall is preferable rather than being outside.
Best mall ever for me. Best mall in UAE ever and my fav really. You just can get everything you want without getting lost like in Dubai mall.

Ski Dubai lies here!. This is a nice sized mall, conveniently connected to the metro station of the same name.The biggest attraction here is the ski slope with its snow park for kids and penguins. You can buy a ski or snow boarding lesson or hit the slopes if you already know how. All equipment is available for hire.

Nice mall. Dubai is of course renowned for its mall experience everything is on a large scale. We enjoyed Mall of the Emirates our hotel bus dropped and picked up from this point.We noted that there were no seats for resting unless you went to a restaurant unlike the other malls we had been to. Nice mall had a great supermarket on the lower ground which is value for money!

Not your just another Mall. Dubai has many many malls. Dubai Mall being one of the biggest across the world, Mall of Emirates must have something unique to offer. And it has some unique offering.It has all the big brands, fashion logos, merchandise etc. However, the most exciting feature for me is their mini Ice world. It has Ice sculptors, Real Penguin family, Ice sports and ski slope. Feeding food to little penguins is a lovely experience. They are just adorable. Then you have Zorbing, tube skiing and few small ice sports. However, the main battleship is ski slope. How they maintain such a big slope is something really commendable. The instructors are very hospitable and teach efficiently. Ohh, they have a food outlet across the hill as well, it gives you a complete feeling.All and all, I love my experience at Mall of Emirates. It should be in must-see list for any visitors of Dubai.Cheers!!

My favorite Mall in Dubai. Love this mall. It is smaller and less confusing than the Dubai Mall. It has all the Western and luxury shops you can ask for. Great food court and wonderful restaurants as well. Also a big Carrefour supermarket. Nicest mall in Dubai as it is not that overwhelming.
More sore feet. With over 700 shops do you need to go anywhere else? Lovely clean shopping area with all the names. Do not forget Carrefour. A vast superstore.

Great Mall with all the extras you'd expect from Dubai. Mall of the Emirates is one of my favourite malls in Dubai. It has all the extras that you'd expect from Dubai like Ski Dubai where you could see penguins, ski down the slopes and visit the ski park but also has a range of shops from designers to mid range. So something for everyone. It also has some great restaurants too. My personal favourites are Cheesecake Factory and Butcher Shop and Grill.

Big mall - with a ski slope!. Great facilities, massive range of shops - and a ski slope! We just watched people skiing, hard to believe it was below freezing in there given the August temperatures outside the mall. Perhaps a bit too Western, could have done with a bit more character.

Dubai mall much better!. This mall for starters has the worst parking in the world, takes about 2 hours to find a space. There's a lot of good, luxurious shops here, more than Dubai mall but it's much less westernized than downtown.

Another great shopping experience. Mall of the Emirates does not appear to be very big from the outside. I thought it would be nice to walk around in a "smaller" mall after the Dubai mall. I was however very, very wrong. It is just as big. Ski World is a great attraction, especially for people coming from tropical areas that don't have snow. The mall itself have all the usual high end fashion and electronic shops and a great food court that serves almost all tastes. Beware though that the mall is very conservative and follows strict codes of behavior. These are posted on warning signs at the door.
Beautiful Mall... . It was really big mall.....Metro station is very near.....Skii dubai....Penguin experience. ....And great food court and cafes. ....

Brilliant Mall - smaller by comparison to the Dubai Mall but less over whelming.. Enjoyed looking round this Mall. Prices didn't appear to be any different to the UK but it was still a great experience if you enjoy a bit of shopping. Lots of lovely stores and it was funny to see Marks & Spencer, River Island, Top Shop amongst them. There is a cinema, ski area and lots of food options as well. Getting a taxi back to our hotel was so easy. I loved the system here - you just go to the taxi area and they are staffed so it all flows really well with a guy directing people to taxi's as they become available.
Huge mall. its quite big mall but maintained well. its skiing too. there are lot of restaurants, cafe and branded shops that one can visit. one can easily spent half an day.
good. lovely mall has everything you need, food shops, fashion shops, resturaunts, cinema. great that we got a free shuttle from our hotel too.

Huge. its huge place you would get tired walking from shoppes to shoppes, It's better to plan out your shopping interest area before you start, you could get the help of help desk and map their, if you go havoc you might end up no where it's a place where u spend all day still u would able to visit every shop.SoPLAN, MAP, ENJOY

Visit in march 2015. Very good mall, huge, clean, a lot of food, stores. We went to SkiDubai, they gave us all the coats, boots, had to purchase the gloves though. They do have SNOW! Went all the way up in the ski lift. Very friendly staff.
The shopping paradise. Nice place to be when you have lots of shopping to do. You can find everything you need and the prices were reasonable.

Great!. This Mall is large and has a wide selection of shops. The shops are both high end and high street with plenty for everyone! Close by are a Ski slope and kids club to be used/enjoyed. There is also a multi-screen cinema within the Mall, so you can make it a family day too if you have children. Go take a look!

Lots of shops . Lots of shops and restaurants. A place for every member of the family.you can find anything at moderate prices. One bad thing that you can easily got lost inside. Needs more signs of what to find and where.

Not just for the wealthy. If you like shopping you will be in paradise here. Massive range of shops including the high end designer shops make sure you have plenty of money as it is really easy to spend here!

Must Stop at Dubai Destination!. Take the Dubai Metro as it has a walkway that extends into the mall so you never have to go outside. Make sure you see the ski slope as well as restaurants that share a view with it. This mall has everything including the best grocery store in Dubai, Carrefour which is more like a superstore that sells groceries as well as a little bit of everything else at good prices making this a convenient and useful stop. If you need a SIM card for your phone, stop at Etisalat which offers prepaid as well as post paid services but make sure you are one of the first ones in the morning or you may have to wait as much as 3 hours.

Arifkanji786@gmail.com. Excellent up market mall.although expensive but good original and designer stuff.good food outlets where you can bite a good snack or even have a cosy meal.the highlights are the snow skiing and skating for all ages.a visit to dubai is incomplete without a visit

Shopping choice 101. Fun place to shop ... hang out... freak out and grab a quick meal. You will find shops catering to all your needs and the food court has offerings that will delight your taste Buds.

Crowded. Go to it just to take the kids to skate on the ice. Place is always very crowded. The last time it took us nearly two hours to find a place to sit in it. Even restaurants all have waiting list. Not to mention the crowded parking.

Shopping emirates style. From food to shopping to casual strolls .. They have everything. A must visit place. There are a few hotel situated right on top of the mall shereton and kempenski to name the two i know off, incase the shopoholic inside you decides to wake up.

Preferred it to the Dubai mall. We had visited the Dubai mall on a previous visit to Dubai, and my over all feeling was that I think I prefer Mall of the Emirates - probably because it seemed less imposing and easier to get round and see most things.Everything seemed to be set out in ways like all of the home shops,together, all of the shoe shops together etc.
Wow. Dubai is just wonderful , our first time so had to check out the malls. What an experience it was amazing . So many shops we barely scratched the surface. Expensive though :(
Chill out.. Great shopping experience. Fancy a break from shopping enjoy the facilities of indoor skiing. Spotlessly clean & a cool break from the heat outside.

The best mall for shopping and entertainment. I have recently reached Dubai ..I love everything in this country but I like the Emirates mall which is awesome and good for a person to spend his evenings.. Very interesting . Great shopping..
