Everything designer label you could possibly want!. I first visited this mall 10 years ago and it was all the rage, now of course there is the Dubai Mall which is bigger. To my mind however everything you could possibly want is available here. This is smaller and much less crowded than the Dubai Mall and in my view more of a pleasure to wonder around. Ski Dubai is still a big attraction here as is the Magic Planet that has bowling and other family activities. Several eating options and a large Carrefour supermarket.

Malls malls malls. This a city of malls each a little different from the other with their own charms. Normally visit them only for the food courts and restaurants plenty of choices to suit all palates. Shoppers will enjoy. Also many other options for entertainment.

Everything you need. This mall has it all. It's big but too spread out that you lose where you are at and can't find your way.I've been snowboarding in Ski Dubai, walked down to get lunch in the food court, went back to boarding, and then stopped to get groceries on the way out. All within being there for 6 hours.

The Unique Mall Of The Emirates.. This is really a very nice mall. I don't rate it as the best, but one of the best in the world. It's so big and large and has so many choices and options. You don't just go there for shopping, but for activities as well. Shopaholics would find the heaven of their dreams. There's everything that you never imagined. The shops are also so clean and well modeled to invite you in. The choices are so many be it clothing, electronics, toys, nutrition. shoes, bathing, health, sports, hobby, etc. The activities there are really unique. You can even have a ski experience in the middle of the Arabian summer desert. The area around it has so many choices of hotels and hotel apartments. You won't go wrong. You can also visit this mall by Metro. It's really convenient. This was, or maybe still, the largest mall in the world. Not bad.

worst mall. all in their own fantasy world, the security personnel do not assist customers when needed only chit chat among themselves, lack of customer service, rude very rude filipino's working in the mall ! remove them and replace them with some other deserving staff !

Rivoli Group- the watches shop. Came to these mall to look for some gift. Decide to get a watch as present. Walk in few watch's shop,but the services is really bad. Made me feel I'm not welcome! Mayb because I'm alone, and the way I dress shows that I'm not a rich person. They don't even talk to you.. Or try to help. After that I step into Rivoli Group, the sales person came to me, explains everything.. Show me different price range watches so I can decide which to get.. I really appreciate due to I really have no idea before he explains everything. Strongly recommend this shop to all of you.

Traditional Mall!!. Mall of Emirates is quite nice place to spend some time. There are many brands and National/ international outlets with great displays onthe shop fronts. Gate 3 serves Bid Bus and City Site Seeing buses so be careful of your preferred gates.

Mall of Imagination. I have to say, I have been to this Mall many times but each time there is so much to see and do as it is enormous with more shops that you could go through in a week and great food court with a variety of restaurants to please anyone's pallet but one of the biggest and best attractions to this Mall is the Indoor Ski Slope that any and everyone can partake in and enjoy either skiing, snow boarding or tubing and if that is not enough this Mall has a state of the art mega theater with more screens that I have ever seen in my life so while in Dubai, it is a must to go to the Emirates Mall and spend the day in wonder and amazement.

Great place. I visited this mall in july with my family, loved it as it was easily accessible by metro. Had all the major stores and wasn't too huge like the Mall of Dubai. One could remember where the shops were after roaming around. It also had an amazing grocery store in it from where one could buy almost anything. It was convenient as we were living in an appartment hotel nearby.

Big Mall with a opportunity to go skiing .. A big mall with everything you can ask for. Felt not so expensive as the Dubai Mall but still need for deep wallet. And the Ski slopes in the middle of a dessert country is something you don't see everyday.

Nice Mall with lots of shopping and Ski Dubai. The mall is nice I must say not as nice as the Dubai mall but it has its perks. Inside is ski dubai which looks amazing for those who love to ski and you get to ski indoors when its 114 outside. This mall is large as well - everything in the UAE is large. Very easy to get to on the Metro

Abs Fab !. You cannot go to Dubai without visiting malls, whether you are a shopper or not. It is an experience ! Sales and luxury, coffee shops and pastries, restaurants and food courts, supermarkets and smallest tiniest booths, wifi access ... you name it, you get it ! I know this particular mall is not the newest but there is something nice about it. Perhaps the fact that it is located in a popular area makes it different a more representative of the cosmopolitan living city of Dubai.

It was only OK. This mall is alot more relaxed the The Dubai Mall which is a welcome change for someone who does not conform to the rigid rules of the country. But to be honest, there isn't much in the Dubai Mall apart from the Ski experience. The shops are standard and not a very wide selection of restaurants, disappointing actually!

Another big one. Dubai is known for its crazy and outstanding mallsModernHugeLots of choices Branded and non branded shopsSo if you are in dubai and not tired from visiting malls then go ahead it is worth the time.

Good shopping. Some good shops in the malls, if you want something different you can get it here, just the right size if you don't want to go to the very large mall, everything is still under one roof.

Shop to your hearts' content. This mall has a lot of shops to look at. If you are a crazy shopper and don’t mind spending that extra buck on expensive brands, this is the place to be. All brands from around the world are here. You should probably take a map before you start going around the mall. It helps a lot. Important – Don’t miss out SkiDubai.It's even got a hotel attached to it.
Average shopping mall. Not biggest fan of shopping malls during touristic visists but was advised to do.. too average. Wouldnt recommend unless u have plenty of time
Awesome. Under one roof you will find all the top brands of the world and on top of that you have the ski dubai,magic planet for the kids to fun too. All in all an excellent place for whole family.

Showing its age...out done by Dubai Mall. This mall is still sizable with the same shops as in Dubai Mall. But it's starting to show its age with dated decor. There isn't the same rush as in Dubai Mall so if it's near and you know what you want to buy then go to The Mall of Emirates.

Its a shopping center !!. Its a shopping center, a BIG one!! What more can you say? Its clean and has every type of shop you would want. Has lots of places to eat and the Metro station is adjoined to it

Convinient mall. It's great mall, smaller then Dubai mall of couse, but pretty much big and enough for fun and shopping. Lots of different brends, restrants and coffee shops. Connected directly to metro station.
And this is the mall where you can ski. )))

Busy busy. Great range of shops but super busy. Go early in the day to avoid the crowds.
Nice restaurants, cinema and lots to do.

WOW!!. Everything you can imagine in one place! You can ski, shop, eat, arcades, cinema you name it you can do it! Such an amazing place! Breath taking views, the most exquisite fashion! They pump smells in the air it really is an experience! It's the only place in the world you can hug a penguin! What an incredible opportunity! You can ski, bobsled see penguins it has it all! Has to be a priority on your visit to Dubai!

A great place. It is a great place for shopping what ever your budget is. I spent over 3 hours in there and would probably spent more time there if I wouldn't have to go. Has a great choice for food and a great choice for shopping too. A must visit in Dubai.
Big Fabulous Mall. This big mall full with hundreds of shops with brands from all around the world , cinemas , food yards , playing yards , ski Dubai is also a nice place to visit .

Great place to shop!. I have been to the Mall of Emirates many times in the last 3 years. It’s the second biggest mall in Dubai, yet manageable and easy to get around. Plenty of choices for all ages to shop. Full of great places to eat from fast food to dine in different types of restaurants. Plus it has the wonderful attraction 'the ski Dubai'. One of the must visit places if you have an extra day during your visit in Dubai :)
Nice Place. Second biggest mall in Dubai ( Dubai mall is first ) but I have to say is grate also. Full of shops and restaurants, every one will find something interesting.
Mall of the Emirates. Wow wow wow. This place absolutely caters for everyone. Plenty of shops and Arabian delights. Love the late night shopping. facilities are fantastic

Pleasant place to shop. Although older than many of the malls in Dubai, this mall is much nicer than others. The shops are classier, well kept, and friendly. Everything is spotless throughout the mall. However, the only places to sit and relax are in the coffee shops or seating areas within the washrooms.
Great Place to Buy and Eat. Very good place to buy and eat! you'll find dozens of brands from cheap to very luxury and expensive one, the food court has great food brands and the quality is ok.

Great. Mall of Emirates is one of the largest malls in dubai. Has a variety of stores for shoppers and variety of restaurants and coffee shops for diners. The banks operate till late evening in this mall.

Smaller than Dubai Mall but shorter walk fro metro. This mall is smaller than Dubai Mall but is a shorter walk from the metro station. It has a wide range of both high end and high street branded shops. There is also a ski slope which you can view without having to pay an entry charge for and there is also a penguin parade at the weekend. It has a large supermarket which is a plus but to be honest, unless you have a real interest in the ski slope or nearby Dubai Marina, there is probably more to see and do around Dubai Mall
Good mix in food court. This was my go to place when in was staying at a hotel 100 mtrs from the mall entrance. The food court has a good mix of restaurants. Visited mainly to catch metro.

Theres and M&S!. Compared to Dubai Marina Mall this mall has everything I needed. My favourite shop here is M&S due to the great food and great clothes! When I visited it was about 2pm and there was penguin show by the ski slope. It was quite interesting to see them by the pool and learn abit about them. You do not need to buy tickets to see them, you will be able to see them from the glass by the ski slope. On weekends (Friday and Saturday) there is free parking at any attraction in Dubai, which is great. You can also catch the metro to here.

I never expect the people in middle east is so friendly. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rciMXKJ0Ljccopy and paste the above link before you visit there, dont miss.I really had a great experience to have in this mall. I ask people to take pictures with me, they never say no. Very friendly middle east people. The mall is very big. And have restaurant. Great to kill time.

Not as good as Dubai Mall. In comparison to the Dubai Mall, the Mall of the Emirates pales in comparison. Do visit this mall if you want to see the Ski Dubai as you can have a good view of it from inside the mall without paying to enter Ski Dubai itself.
Go, if only to see the snow. . It's a mall, much like any other mall in the world. But it does house the worlds only indoor ski resort. So if for no other reason, go to see the ski slope.

Cool place to chill out. Cool and crowded place to chill out. Ease of access to metro station. Fun, food, films and much more. Ski Dubai was a great attraction. Wanted to watch movies, but was too crowded so had to back off. Good place for luxury brand shoppers.

Liked it better than Dubai mall!. In terms of shopping, I found Mall of the Emirates far more pleasant tan Dubai mall. You will find same upsale stores. The latter, gets too crowded because of the other attractions inside: Aquarium, entrance to Burj Khalifa, and Dubai fountains. Becasue of its location, include a visit to Mall of the Emirates the same day you visit: Dubai Marina, Souk Madinat Jumeirah or Burj Al Arab. It´s very near!
This is a real centre :). All the possible prime brands you can dream of. We had an impression that electronics was relatively cheap there.

Smaller the Dubai Mall, but more accessible. Mall of the Emirates is smaller than Dubai Mall so personally I prefer it - you can find your way around more easily and it has all the good chain shops - clothes and house stuff, as well as a very large Carrefour.This, however, is not a review for a local living in Dubai, but for travellers thinking of visiting therefore I would say, if you want the "Dubai Shopping Experience" you really need to go to Dubai Mall! Mall of the Emirates, while nice, lacks the impressively large, so massive you get lost in it "appear" of the bigger, shinier Dubai Mall. It also lacks the huge selection of restaurants - while there are some nice ones in this Mall, there are far fewer.The other issue lies with the taxi rank which has recently been changed meaning you sometimes (particularly during shift change which I think happens around 4pm) end up waiting for ages as they don't come through so frequently and don't drop off in the same place they pick up from.It has a cinema, restaurants, lots of shops, and is lovely and clean and cool inside ... but none of the extra bits that make Dubai Mall an "attraction" to visit. For me, unless you are coming to ski, Mall of the Emirates is much more a mall for locals living in Dubai to visit in order to avoid the busy tourist filled Dubai Mall

Another must visit. I have visited this mall twice during separate trips to Dubai.Situated on Sheik Zayed Road it is smaller than the Dubai Mall but I thought more beautiful.It has around 560 stores and over 90 restaurants and cafes.It also houses a 14-screen cinema which includes Vox Gold that has giant screens, huge reclining seats, an exclusive lounge and butler service ! It has direct access to two beautiful 5-star hotels the Sheraton and the Kempinski .Most amazing of all it is here you will find Ski Dubai which has the world's first indoor black run.So incredible to enjoy snow skiing in the middle of the desert !I do not ski but wanted to experience the penguin encounter where you can interact and have pictures taken with trained penguins ! Unfortunately you had to book days in advance.Never mind, there will definitely be a next time !

Fantastic Shopping and Friendly. In my view Emirates Mall is far better for shopping and eating than Dubai Mall, and is more cost efficient in goods and services. The area is well organised for shuttles and taxis.

EXCELLENT SELECTION OF SHOPS, RESTAURANTS & CAFE'S. I visited MALL OF THE EMIRATES twice during my recent holiday in Dubai mostly during May 2015. This wasn't my first visit to the Mall after previous visits to Dubai, however during these last visits I noticed no seating inside the Mall, I did ask one of the security staff why ? he said the seats had been removed within the last 12 months and one reason being some young shoppers were littering around the seating areas !!! I'm not sure if this is true, shopping or window shopping can be fun and relaxing, taking a rest in-between is a bonus especially with families with young children and the aged. The only seating area is either in a restaurant or cafe. Overall the Mall itself is worth visiting with a great selection of shops with some high end fashion shops like Chanel / Dior and other top fashion designer labels. Mall of the Emirates metro station is the main entry point to the Mall unless you prefer catching a taxi or public transport bus, it takes a good 10 minutes to walk from the Metro Station towards the Mall, great air-conditioning through the walkway & inside the large Mall. Great Mall to visit for all ages and budgets.
Visit once. the shops are not as good as Dubai Mall. how ever the prices are lower here. it has a great architecture and you can go there Via metro.

another massive mall. another massive mall and still a must in Dubai, you may find what you really miss in your luggage but don't loose the chance to see the Ski attraction. may not really Big but if you think of it as insider of a shopping mall that's insane!!! Food court around the mall and again...lots lots and lots of shopping. good food market if you're planning a grill night out with friends.
The meaning of Luxurius and Indulge. Mall of The Emirates is like a remedy for those who has shopping maniac...many options and a variety in everything to suit all tastes...

Not as large as The Dubai Mall but a mall nonetheless. We took this mall in last June and this June as part of our trip to go up Burj Khalifa as it is a good point to pick up the Metro to go further on. Knowing we would be doing The Dubai Mall too, we did not spend much time here but at the end of the day, it's a mall and has all the right shops. If you go in Ramadan there are loads of sales on too :)
Not Such a Big Deal.. All the high end designers, but... Unless you're just into malls, kind of boring. Sorry, I just prefer more originality which I find sadly lackin here.

wow!. this mall has a ski area! where else would you find that in the middle east? wow right?! just get your warm comfy clothes and rent the skis. and you can start. the mall offers a wide variety of choices of fashion and food. i didnt even get to finish looking at everything in one day. the food court offers a variety of food for everyone. it was crowded during lunch hours. but its worth it.you can reach it by metro or taxi. also, the big bus tours take a stop here. it is also the pick-up point for the trip to abu dhabi.
Great.. Great not as big as Dubai Mall but still very impressive. Ski runs here mean husband can ski while wife sprees!
Its good but not as good as Dubai Mall. This place has plenty of ships however it has nowhere near as much to do as Dubai Mall. The ski slope and penguins being there however does make it great!

A place to visit. The mall is place you want to visit while in Dubai. This mall requires a lot of time for one to go round. There are very nice places to shop, very good and friendly environment that is quite spacious. The food court is inviting. The ski area is a must go especially if you are with children. Because the metro station is right outside the mall, access is very convinient. Dont be told about the Mall of the Emirates when next you visit Dubai.

Lots to do!. I wish malls in the states were like these in Dubai, everything from movies to skiing. The boys can enjoy their day as the women shop. I highly recommend taking the family or going alone to the Emirates.

not the biggest. There are of course lots of malls in Dubai, why chose this one. Well despite the fact it will have one of the largest Apple stores in the world shortly in their current expansion, ironically it is because it is not the biggest. There are many to chose from in Dubai, this one has most of what you could need, in one place. Parking is straightforward, I would always recommend approaching from Shk Zayed road heading South and go straight to the top floor up the direct ramp. If you get caught in the actual car park it can be somewhat frustrating getting through it at busy times. Avoid peak times if possible on Thurs and Fri night. There is a cinema with gold class, various cuisines, loads of shops from H and M all the way up to the Designers, plus Harvey Nicks and Debenhams. `all up, easy to wander around and find all sorts of interesting things

Beautiful Mall but no place to SIT. This is an impressive mall in Dubai. What place in Dubai is not impressive! Yes they have every kind of restaurant imaginable, and the famous snow ski slope. They have stores that anyone form why part of the world will recognize. I do have one major complaint...there is literally NO PLACE TO SIT anywhere in the mall except in the eateries. This place is huge and there is no place to get a rest for a moment. This is a huge oversight I think. The other large malls have adequate sitting areas for the shoppers but not here.

Pleasant atmosphere. Amazing range of brand name stores and high end department stores from around the world.Prices on the lowest floor in some stores unbelievable (eg Pierre Cardin evening gown for approx $25 Australian dollars). Prices on the highest floors also unbelievable ( ie through the roof ridiculously expensive) but fun to gawk at. Indoor ski slope an interesting touch.We took a taxi from our hotel to this mall.... Easy access from parking area. We then used the metro to visit the Mall of Dubai from here ( it has a different atmosphere from this mall).

Good. Not the largest mall in Dubai but still a grand and impressive collection of shops and food outlets. It wouldn't be out of place if this was the primary Mall for any big city in the world. Worth a visit but not an essential visit if you've already been to the Dubai mall. Indoor ski Slope is fantastic. Far superior to the indoor skiSlopes in UK

Huge Mall. All the major brands here including the British stores Debenhams, M&S, Harvey Nichols and more. Highlight has to be the indoor Ski slope. There are a few restaurants here but check out what looks like a food hall, there are approx 8 traders there most have a banquet set up, they are far superior to anything I've experienced, 3 course with extras of plenty of non alcoholic drinks. Reasonable cheap and great quality.

My favourite mall in Dubai. Huge but not the largest mall in Dubai. What you really need to see is the Sky Dubai which is a really unique experince, coming in from 40 degrees and see people skiing. Get a table in the Cheesecake Factory next the windows and enjoy the view. The mall by the way is beautiful inside, fully covered with inlaid granite and huge open spaces. It's really worth to visit!

A great mall with something for everyone and many hidden gems.. The Mall of the Emirates (MOE) was the first mall I got to know when I moved to Dubai. It is quite a large mall and it is being extended, but it is not intimidatingly big like some others. There are cinemas, restaurants, a huge Carrefour, the famous Ski Dubai, food courts (one near the Ski Dubai section and one at the opposite end), many stores, banks and an infinite amount of cash machines for your convenience. This is a bustling mall, but it also has quieter sections, like Armani Cafe - where you can take a rest and watch the world and fancy cars go by, if you need to recharge.There are also 2 hotels at either ends with direct access into the mall:The Kempinski - which has a fun and delicious tapas restaurant at the bottom and a cocktail bar with many wonderful recipes on a higher floor.The Sheraton - which has a great Taste of Japan night weekly and very helpful staff. I still go to this mall on an almost weekly basis, yet I am still discovering little hidden gems. There is more to this mall than I had imagined!
Indoor Ski. Indoor ski lift and downhill would make you want to forget you're in the middle of the desert. Gigantic mall with a Sheraton attached to it as well.

largest mall in Dubai. mall of the emirates is the place where you need to go for everything. Famous brands in the world you can found there. two hotels kempenski and serator, big carrifour supermarket, money exchange, cenema, and also the famous ski dubai is inside of Mall . So this is the place you need to go for everything.

Great mall for tourist and short visit at Dubai. We were there in Dubai for only 2 days and we ended up visiting the mall twice despite many other option to see in Dubai. Apparently Mall of the Emirates and Dubai Mall were the only two malls where the food court is open for lunch during Ramadhan month- that's what I've been told. The food court has plenty of option from Asian food, American food, and Mediterranean food. The mall is big but not as big as Dubai mall. So with young children in tow, this is a perfect size. We just strolled around, watching people have fun inside the ski Dubai from the glass window. Before we left the mall to our hotel, we stop by at Carrefour inside the mall to buy bottle water and snacks for the kids. One stop shop.
HUGE. Only in Dubai the biggest brands all in one place next to a ski slope??? great food outlets for all tastes and budget. Not just another mall.
the shopping haven. superb brands to pick from, variety of eateries as well. a good place to visit with family, kids, couples and friends as well. not a minute will go boring.

Nice Mall. People working at the mall are really friendly and helpful. The mall offers a wide range of shops from the affordable to the most luxurious and expensive ones. I really enjoyed the fact that I got to experience crazy shopping as my stay ended up with Ramadan where you got amazing sales. The mall is easily accessible by taking the metro. The downside is inside the mall you don't have any chairs all the way long to get a rest of 5mins. You can only sit when you are at the foodcourt or in shoe shops.

Enjoyable time at the mall. It has good attractions for Kids like snow world. This attraction even adults can enjoy. Lot of shopping places but expensive.Many good restaurants like Cheese Cake Factory which is worth mentioning as the cheese cakes are just fantastic. Also Vox movie theater is there if you are interested in seeing a movie.

Wait...dinner! Wait...a ski hill? Wait...Penguins?. Ate dinner here after wandering around Dubai without food/water during Ramadan. Really interesting experience for a westerner!After eating, I just HAD to see the ski hill...seriously? In a mall? In the desert? And there's penguins? Total excess...and total fun!

Favourite Mall. I love Mall of the Emirates, it may not be as spectacular as Dubai Mall but it is great for a well rounded shop trip, having the huge Carrefour downstairs to do your groceries after looking at clothing. Mall has free wifi too! Only downside is the parking which is ALWAYS full, have had to use valet at 50AED in moments of desparation!!
Large. Here you will get everything you need, but bring some good shoes. Its large and you will spend a lot of time walking.

Well designed Shopping Mall in Dubai. Well designed mall in dubai which has indoor skiing facilities(And other snow related fun activities). This mall has 535 shops including world's top retail brands, Department Stores, Furniture, sporting wear, cinemas, restaurants, coffee shops etc. Mall of the emirates is not huge like dubai mall. But you will find everything you need here without walking thousands of meters. I have been to mall of the emirates many times. But it has something new to offer everyday.

Ok .. A little small... We wanted to check out this mall, but they don't have that much to offer i feel. The shops look poorly ... We decided to go to the foodcourt to get something to eat, and i am serious, the staff working there looks like they are have a really bad day .. Don't go here unless you want to go skiing ofcourse. But everything else is so much better in Dubai Mall!

Lovely shopping. What a great mall. I did get lost once or twice. But a great selection of shops and restaurants. I found a great steak restaurant very similar to Moyo's with African inspired cuisine. The indoor snow scape is great fun for young and old! A great visit and with easy access to the metro it is simple to visit.

Snow World in Desert City of Dubai. As soon as we Entered in snow area we just forgot that we are in Desert city, it was so cold that it was just unbelievable, one must visit if got time, just amazing!

a great shopping mall. This mall is a few minutes to the hotel we were in, so it proved to be easily accessible. however taxi service is plentiful and well organised. a very large mall with plenty of shopping opportunities and reasonable to high prices. all the big and best brands are here.

Probably the best mall in Dubai. Dubai has malls like Vegas has casinos. Some malls are so large or so flashy that I find it hard to just get what I want in 1-2 hours because I spent ages walking between sections. MOE is like the Goldilocks of Dubai malls. It is not too large, it is well planned out and it is stocked with essential things that you need. It is a safe bet for shopping, picking up groceries, getting taxis, eating well and entertainment. It is easily my favourite mall in Dubai and I live closer to other larger malls in Dubai.The gargantuan Carrefour alone has everything you could ever need starting from groceries to electronics to garden furniture to household items. Some of it is tacky but if you need to do a big shop, you would be hard pressed to find better for cost-friendly grocery shopping in Dubai.The food court is probably bit of a let down but there are good restaurants near the ski area - that's right, this is the mall in Dubai with the indoor skiing facility.

I don't like shopping centres but this palce is amazing!. My local shopping centre challenges me so think what over 500 shops looks like! However although this place is massive it is also well set out with info desks and a great map! Didn't go into Ski World but there easy viewing platforms where you may watch people getting cool in Dubai. There restaurants and coffee places all over so getting a snack wasn't a problem. The Big Bus dropped me off here and I picked up again about 2 hours later. You got to go here just to see! Must be easier than the larger 1000 shop (building another 500) at The Dubai Mall!!!
great mall. You can ski or catch a movie. It seemed to be having a few renovations and upgrades going on. Lots of good stores and places to grab a bite.

One of the Best Malls in Dubai. Mall of Emirates is one of the best Malls (only seconds to Dubai Mall). Its huge and have all famous brands. Its big so to cover it fully, you need lot of time and energy specially when it lacks resting area. Thats really strange that in such a big mall, there is hardly any place to rest or sit. Its very popular and attracts big crowd. Your trip to Dubai is never complete without visit to Mall of Emirates.
Huge. A big shopping center. Not as big as Dubai Mall but you can find a lot of places here, stores and restaurants. And the ski attraction.

Amazing and wonderful. one of the lovely places to visit and spend whole day in it and go for adventure with Ski Dubai. Also wonderful shops and brand names in addition to great restaurants where everyone can find his favorite.kids areas are found in many area so they can enjoy.I love going there every time I visit Dubai

Beautiful Complex of 535 Stores. It is an enormous complex, beautifully designed with high arches and stunning marble floors. There are 535 stores including; department stores, banks, books, stationery, toys, confectionery, fashion accessories, entertainment, furniture, jewellery, watches, lingerie, luggage, pharmacies, cosmetics, sportswear, tailors etc. there are 97 restaurants and cafes and 2 hotels.
Truely luxrious Mall. This Mall has every brand,Snow park in the mall is just Amazing,the biggest mall in the world.from Armani to Burberry to Calvin klien you find everything over there.
One destination. I think this is probably one of the few malls in Dubai (along with Dubai Mall) that has almost every outlet. There are a few information desks to help us find our favorite store.

Great shopping experience . What I like best about the Mall of the Emirates is that it is manage able. That means you can actually walk around a see it all. All shops you are looking for are there plus you may go skiing if you like. Definitely one of my favorites.

Nice mall. This mall was very nice, even just for walking around and taking photos. We mostly went because we wanted to see Ski Dubai, even though we weren't planning to ski. We took lots of photos in the main atrium, which was very pretty all decorated for Ramadan.
Nice. A relatively nice mall, compared to others.You just have what you need, the entertainment is very limited.

Good place for shopping. I am a budget traveler, Dubai is known as an expensive place to hang around. The thing i like in this mall is they have so many popular brand name shops with good designs and decor and i think the prices are suitable for most of people, it's easy to get here by taxi or train and i do like the supermarket inside the mall too. It's my favorite mall whenever i come back to Dubai

Needs half a day. Another huge mall in Dubai, you'll just simply get lost in this big mall, its really too huge that it has got an indoor skiing trek which maintains -2 degree temperature inside its premises.

Indoors skiing? . We visited mall of the Emirates just because we wanted to see the indoors skiing facility. It's INSANE! Only on dubai! Like dubai mall it's way bigger than you can imagine. It's impossible to see it all. We were there during the pre Ramadan sale and went shopping at 70% off at almost all stores. It feels like the mall of emirates is more conservative than dubai mall. More women, men and children dressed in traditional clothing. You'll see more women in nhijab than in ordinary clothes. Officially they don't allow indecent clothing like tanktops, cleavage or showing of knees. But I don't know how hard they inforce it. No kissing or showing of affection in public, including holding hands with your boyfriend, is allowed. It's hypocrisy on a whole new level when they at the same time have posters of girls and women dressed in bikinis and underwear around the mall. We had a nice evening shopping (tanktops, short skirts, bikinis and other indecent clothing) but I get tired just thinking of the double game Dubai is trying to pull off.

If shopping is your thing - then don't miss the experience at the mall of the Emirates.. I entered the Mall of the Emirates from the long walkways and travelators winding their way from the Metro station. On the level I entered the building there was a helpful information office where the guy was more than happy to direct me and give e a comprehensive map. As usual, however, I didn't want to open out the map as I wandered about giving the correct impression that I was a helpless tourist. Instead I marched purposefully around, getting hopelessly lost but looking like I lived here. I finally found the Hollister store that I was looking for with a huge TV display of surfers on Huntingdon beach in California. Pity that the store didn't really have what I was looking for. But never mind, I still had the Dubai Mall to discover.By the way, this is the Mall with the indoor ski slope - naturally...

Still the best place to shop in Dubai. This is still my favourite mall in Dubai - OK its not as big as Dubai Mall but it seems to have a better range of shops I'm interested in. Whilst its no longer the largest in Dubai its still huge so you need to refer to the maps to find the stores you want. There is a reasonable selection of eating places as well as a cinema and of course the ski slope. Unlike a few years ago getting a taxi at the end of the evening was easy.

Paradise of shopaholics. I personally LOVE to shop and the fact that most of my favorite brands are located in one single place that alone just gives me the chills. Whether you prefer a designer shop, such as Chanel and Louis Vuitton or a normal clothing store, such as Top Shop and Forever 21 you can have it.

What other mall has an indoor ski area with a chair lift?. They claim this is the largest mall in the world, and that may be true (though I didn't do any fact checking). With three floors of upscale and luxury shops which goes on and on, it certainly is huge.Though we didn't go skiing (not a huge attraction for someone from a place with good skiing), we did enjoy looking through the windows at Ski Dubai, the indoor ski area at one end of the mall. It has a chair lift (very slow), and a variety of snow-related entertainments (sleds, skis, sled runs, inflatable balls a person climbs in). What we really enjoyed is the spectacle of it all, with all the middle-eastern tourists and locals in their rented coats, boots and helmets experiencing snow. It was a blast.As for the shopping in the mall, my impression is that prices weren't that different from the USA or Europe, so it was more about people watching and seeing the extravagant stores. Where else to you see women in mini-skirts and women in full burqua with only eye-slits and hands showing? The clash of traditional muslim dress and western luxury results in a very interesting mix of people and activities. It's clear that visitors from Saudi Arabia and other conservative neighboring countries come here to shop for western items, and perhaps to let loose a little.

Oh my days. If you want it, you can get it. This place is huge and so easy to get lost. Just when you think you get to the end, turn a corner and it starts again, and on 3 floors. Just go to experience, even if you don't want to buy anything...

Something for everyone.... In my opinion this is one of the worlds best shopping and entertainment malls. It is not only huge, it truly does have something for everyone. Fantastic store brands from across the globe including UK favourites Harvey Nichols, Debenhams, M&S, Next, River Island, Ted Baker and Boots as well as designer boutiques from Louis Vuitton and Cartier to DKNY and Diesel.If you need a break from shopping there are plentiful restaurants and coffee shops such as Costa, Starbucks, Cheesecake Factory, and fantastic authentic local cuisine including a superb Lebanese restaurant as well as global brands Pizza Hut and McDonalds.There is a multiplex cinema and even an indoor snow centre where you can go skiing, tobogganing and snowboarding!!There are two hotels on the mall complex the Kempinski and the Sheraton if you plan to be in spitting distance of the shops.Overall well worth a visit and you may even pick up a bargain!!

Shopping time. Large, well air conditioned mall with a great selection of shops and restaurants.I was there when they had a great selection of sales on so managed to bag a few bargains Yes it's got all the designer shops you could ever want but there is also a selection for those of us mere mortals you are on a budget

Impressive. Like Dubai Mall this is also amazing! Here you can find anything your heart desires. From the Cheesecake Factory you can enjoy a view of the indoor skiing rink - this is a must experience.

Mall of the Emirates looking good…….. Mall of the Emirates has been going through bit of a make over. The luxury fashion section is looking very classy, with the biggest Apple store in the world scheduled to open in MOE around September. Those who use to wait for taxis in the outside rank, where one could ogle all those luxury toy for boys cars in the summer heat will be please know that a new taxi pickup location inside the mall is now enclosed and air-conditioned. MOE is bigger than most, user friendly, while not on the grand scale of Dubai Mall it ticks most boxes. All that is missing is a couple of really good restaurants and a decent bookstore.

Good shopping and ice ski experience. While the shopping was good and nothing unusual, the kids specifically loved the ice park. While we oversaw them from he cafe next to it, the kids had lots of fun. found US restaurant cheesecake factory and was very happy to enjoy the famous cheesecake in dubai

Huge Mall. You can find anything you want in this mall. Restaurants, shops, an arcade and beauty salons. We accidentally spent a whole day here and then finished it off at the Sheraton Hotel (inside the mall) on their rooftop terrance with a drink and some shisha, Perfect!

Huge shopping experience!. This mall is old compared to other malls but still manages to take a breath out of you if you plan to cover the whole mall because it's simply huge.. You will get everything you want here cheapest to most expensive stuff.
Good. We had been there for shopping a few electronic stuffs. Its a good place for shopping, a huge mall by itself with lot of attractions inside.
it was nice. This place was nice! However, if you want to get the ultimate experience I would suggest taking the extra effort and going to the Dubai mall!

already too old compared to the Dubai Mall. I don't know how it felt when it opened, with its amusing ski slope. But now that the Dubai Mall is open, this Mall of the Emirate looks old.The ski slope is OK for young children, but it is too small for average to good skiers.

Mall of emirates VRS dubai mall. Both have their pluses and minuses. Dubai mall has a much better range of restaurants, it has the famous fountain show which is a must-do in dubai. It also has a bigger range of shops....and when i mean bigger....i mean the biggest in the world. it also has a huge aquarium.Mall of the emirates is a bit quieter but is famous for the indoor ski slope. It really depends if you want to ski or to see the aquarium and fountain show really.....

Excellent mall where you will find everything!. This mall has everything you will need for a great holiday, They have entertainment for kids, shopping and much more! I can spend all day here. We arrived easily by metro and thoroughly enjoyed our time spent. They have carrefour supermarket where you can also get your toiletries etc. Enjoy your time & money spent here. : )

You can't Shop enough Here !. Amazing Mall.Its huge , cannot be covered in one day.All brands are available .Shoppers paradiseEasily connected with metro and taxi's Variety of good quality for available

A must do and see while in Dubai. Every brand, label and designer is here - such an experience, not to be missed. We were there for about 6 hours but prob only saw a quarter of the place!! Walking shoes are a must.

Impressive. This is a huge mall but not as big as the Dubai Mall. It is away from downtown and you could get there by Metro or taxi. There are numerous stores here to sustain the interest of most shoppers. The high end designer shops are found in the second level. The other attractions include Ski Dubai which is a major draw.The layout is not complex and easy to understand.

Massive. Wear walking shoes! Lot's of great souvenir bargains if you don't like to haggle at the souks. Also plenty of choice for clothing, shoes, perfume and a massive Carrefours supermarket for drinks and snacks.
Fantastic . First time I was in a shopping centre with a ski resort,unbelievable and only in dubai I presume, loads of great shops and a great experience

Great Shopping & People Watching. The Mall of the Emirates is not quite as opulent as the Dubai Mall, however, its very large and has a nice range of stores (from an economical super market selling souvenirs to the more exclusive shops for the label-conscious. A convenient taxi queue is readily available.

Big affordable mall. Its like any other mall anywhere. the usual brands. the usual restaurants. But the plus points are Skating rink (charges are high but kids will love it). There is carefour shop for your reasonable shopping. Affordable food court with usual options. In short, a normal mall.

Shop till you drop. This is not only the biggest shopping Mall in the World but also one of the best with every designer label shop you haver ever dreamed of. Parking is a drawback but they are imporving it which is one of hte current problems when hat is finished it will be a lot easier.Next door is the Address Hotel one of teh very nice egant hotels adn that too will be soon expanded to have yet a third on in Dubai. You can get food of any nation you desire adn clothes from all over the wprld, book shops childrens toy shops and cinemas. You cna get lost but there are plenty of securty staff on hand to hep as well as big glass and lit up Directories in bot Arabic and English.
The mall. The mall offers a wide array of restaurants and clothing shops to spoil you. Is also very easily accessible.

Shoppers Paradise - Mall of the Emirates. We loved shopping at the Mall of the Emirates, its got everything that you would just need from groceries, electrical gadgets, clothing and it meets everyone's budget from. The staff within the Mall are quite friendly and helpful. Do not leave Dubai without passing by this amazing Mall. If you are staying at Dusit Thani there have got a shuttle that takes you to the Mall and you shop all you want and they pick you up at specified times.

Shop and\or ski!. I'm guessing that if you can't find what you're looking for in this mall then you'll either need to visit Harrod's or it doesn't exist, but Harrod's doesn't have a ski slope tacked onto the side of it !So, well worth a visit for a browse and marvel at the indoor skiing.

It was good choice for shopping. It has a lot of brands and it wasn't too big same as dubai mall that make you tired, you find what ever you want , from ordinary brands too luxary ,
The restaurant and food court are also good

Moved the taxi area!!! Why???. Been 100s of times over the years but they have recently moved the taxi area from the middle of the mall to the far end (Carrefour end) a small queue of 20 people took over 30 minutes! There was not a line of taxis waiting like there used to be. Only as someone got out of one could you get in one. I've seen a queue of 200 people at Dubai airport go quicker than that did! Put me off going again!

2 levels of high end shops plus a surprise. I had visited Dubai Mall however came here as a shop had some shoes I was looking for in my size.The mall is large but not as big as Dubai Mall. The layout is a rectangle on three levels, ground, first and second.The temp was excellent considering it was 45 deg outside. This mall has some very high end however it does have some shops I could afford to shop in. There is of course ski Dubai which had a lot of people gearing up for the slopes.My biggest surprise was an excellent full service food shop where you can get all your food needs plus some electronic needs.Not worth it apart for your normal shop.

Best mall in Dubia.. This mall although smaller than the Dubia Mall (not much) is better laid out than the other malls in the area. It is so large they have carts inside to drive you around. Anything you want, and I mean anything you want is there. Also seemed like a better class of clientele shopping there. A must visit if you are in Dubia

Same As Other Malls. Once you've been to Dubai Mall, Mall of Emirates seems average by comparison. It's a nice mall and has all the top brands but you will be underwhelmed after having visited Dubai Mall. If you are a shopaholic like me then you will enjoy the variety of Dubai Mall but if you want to go to specific boutiques like Chanel, Louis Vuitton etc then you can go to Mall of Emirates direct as you don't need to walk too much. Mall of Emirates is a nice mall to shop in similar to KLCC, Pavillion and Gardens in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia and ION, Takashimaya in Singapore.

High end shopping. The general impression I got from this mall was that it was aimed at higher end shoppers. It did not quite have the same 'buzz' to it as the Dubai Mall but was worth a visit. We went mainly to have a look at Ski Dubai, which is impressive.

Convenient and easy for shopping because of its size . Mall of the emirates is one of the oldest and used to be the largest . It's located on Seikh Zayed road . Almost all luxury brands are present . All levels of shopping are available .There are hundreds of restaurants and coffee shops , few food courts on ground and first floor , huge supermarket , pharmacies , beauty salons , hairdressers . The mall is easy to explore because of the smart layout . They are two corridors from beginning to end with a dome in the middle . The whole of the mall can be walked in 3-4 hours .

More than just a MALL!. I wouldn't say its just a mall. It is everything what can possibly fit inside a world, but instead they have made everything inside a mall. The best part is the SKI DUBAI.. And there are many other events which are organized everyday regarding many fields. One of The Best Malls in the World.
Huge place. Interesting and beautiful mall. Very large, a lot of stores for different type of visitors-from the budget travelers to the ones spending a lot.
Bluewater with hijabs. nothing to write home about. Loads of shops. Standard mass market food options. No sign of a sports bar. Fair number of those aloof shops that have guards on the door.
Excellent Mall In Dubai. It has a indoor ski park,a Huge Cheesecake Factory,Excellent food court,a variety of branded stores.

Big but ££. I had been heavily recommended to visit the mall and as an avid shopped was excited to go. Yes the mall is huge with a large variety of high street shops to luxury end brands however, as an accountant, I noticed that the prices were higher in the mall than back in the UK. A Longchamp bag was £11 more than at home for example. Was good to have a wander round and browse but left feeling disappointed
Five days in Dubai. Nice mall if you like shopping. Lots of high end shopping. To many stores to list. You can buy anything there
So much choice. This mall is certainly worth a visit whilst in Dubai. It has every shop you can imagine from designer brands to everyday high street shops. There is a large food court and a cinema
Large mall, more for locals. Another large mall used more for locals. More shops and restaurants, less designer stores than Dubai Mall. Expensive.

Very Nice shopping Mall. I think a little bit smaller than the Dubai Mall but as nice. The food hall has a vast choice of different countries. Nice shops. I like it because you can find brands not available in Europe. There are strollers for children with games integrated in the strollers.

Great evening entertainment. The mall serves a purpose in this desert climate. You can go for hours and see various entertainment, eat and people watch. There is an amphitheater that had concerts and talent shows when I was there. Ethnic dance shows at restaurants. Camel milk chocolate and Latte to try. Lots of pastry and ice cream shops. Art, including sculptures surfing on a water wall. It's the only place you really see the emeriti's out and that gave me the best photo opportunities sitting at a front table with a telephoto.

Make A Day of it!!!. There is so much to see and do in this mall! There are tons on restaurants and shopping places! They have an indoor ski slope! They have movies theaters!! Just go see for yourself! You won't be disappointed there is something for everyone in this huge city of a mall!

missing Dubai. I lived in Dubai for about 4 years. This shopping mall is really beautiful. It is home of the famous designers and home favourites too. It is really big and also many restaurants to choose from. If you happen to visit Dubai, please don't forget to go to this mall coz it won't disappoint you.

Shoppers heaven .... Albeit the fact that I am utterly not a 'shopping' bloke, I must say that this mall does have it's own charm. It's small but not at all.Wonderful selection of boutiques, a good mix of luxury and mid-scale varieties and hence a mall for 'almost everyone'.I particularly like the enormous Carrefour on the ground floor, simply everything under one roof!The Ski Dubai in the mall is certainly a draw for the tourist, young & old alike. I wouldn't really say a romantic venue but a fun hangout for fun loving couples ;).The food options in the mall are aplenty and do have great patronage. I have only tried TGI Fridays at the Magic Planet and had a fabulous experience there.Next stop will be the infamous 'Dubai Mall'.

Haven..Heaven . Completely jaw dropping! Full of fabulous shops from top designers to home favourites such as Victoria Secrets, Zara, Topshop! Loads of places to eat restaurants to fast food outlets, definitely a crowd pleaser. The mall is huge with 3 (may even more!) floors, which although may seem overwhelming, there's loads of points where you can check your location, people to help and maps. Could probably do with a good half a day there to enjoy all benefits (if not longer!)On visiting to Dubai, I decided I wanted to emigrate there, the people, the surroundings, the weather, the culture, the laws..the mall of the Emirates was a HUGE bonus!!!!

My favorite!. After living in dubai 7 years ago we recently went back for a holiday and even after al those years the mall of the emirates is still my favorite shopping mall. Great shops, oversee-able and a very nice atmospfere. Also great little lunch/breakfast restaurants..
Shoppers delight. If you are coming to Dubai this shopping centre has everything shopaholics desire. Metro stop is connected to the mall and the snow field is attached as well
another well equipped mall. all brands, good eating joint, good coffee at the cafes inside, ski is the main attraction.get good quality products.

Another ripper mall in Dubai. Shopping is A1 here plus the indoor ski run, cinemas and plenty of good food outlets. Ask for a discount, not always offered but try. Put aside 3 to 4 hours here and bring your credit card.

Hundreds of shops for shopaholics :). Not as big as the Dubai Mall, this mall offers also a lot of stores for all ages and pockets. For entertaining, other than cinema and kids area and play area we were happy to see the famous indoor ski resort. In my opinion it’s quite an inspired place considering the temperatures in Dubai and the indoor ski resort has a lot of guests from the Middle East area where snow can be seen mostly on TVs. Believe me, not only kids enjoy the snow, even grown ups enjoy it so much.We enjoyed our time in Mall of Emirates because it was less crowded than Dubai Mall.

Unexpected place. A mall but including a ski place! In a place with high temperatures you may feel the snow and low temperatures... Unexpected!A nice please tor eating and shopping too. The atmosphere is amazing and for sure it must be one of the visit place in Dubai!

very nice place for shopping. its one the best place to visit , it has many showrooms,shops and best architecture. touring the mall needs lot of time.almost all the premium brands are available to shop in the mall. must visit place

Great shoppinf and dining experience. Mall of Emirates is well designed inside and outside. It is not as over crowded as Dubai Mall, but being smaller than Dubai Mall (well to be honest - everything other in the world is smaller than Dubai Mall ) it still offers all major brands, and is great for shopping. It is spacious, full of natural light. It has some really nice restaurants and a big food court. It also has a great indoor ski park, which seems amazing!

A grand mall in the emirates. You get almost all the top brands on the world like Gucci, Zara, LV, Diesel etc.The only place in Dubai or probably where you have Ice skiing. Though its bit costly, you can enter for an experience. Its a big mall and very crowded. The best thing is that its right at the metro station. So check your wallet and go shopping.
Superb!. Best mall in Dubai! Go there when you have atleast 5-6 hours in hand! Amazing brands..great for shopping!

Huge mall with Ski Dubai. Mall of Emirates is great place especially in an area where there is nothing much happening. A metro station in the mall makes it very easy to get here. If you are staying Atlantis the palms or jumeirah area this is closest mega mall around. Lot of shopping and dining options around. A carrefour supermarket outlet, cinemas, magic planet and SKi Dubai, dubai's only indoor skiing slope are major attractions. Parking is ample and was free wen i visited.

Very disappointing Mall. Dubai boasts several great Shopping Malls of which the Mall of the Emirates is not one! It's architecture not only feels dated, with a dark unwelcoming atmosphere but there is very little help in finding your way in this badly outdated Shopping Mall compared to the other wonderful Malls in Dubai!

Brilliant shopping. This mall was just a short walk away from our hotel. We visited it daily and at first it seems huge and overwhelming like most things in Dubai, but once you know your way around a bit, it's a great place to shop and has a vast variety of shops and prices to suit everyone. There is a brilliant super huge hypermarket called Carreforre where you can buy spices cheaply and basically anything else you need, including souvenirs at great prices. I should have bought dates from there, they were half the price than at dutyfree! The food counters are vast catering for all. We also saw the indoor Ski Dubai which is inside this mall it was amazing to see the people in ski suits inside with over 30 degrees outside. We ate at the Magic Planet food court and the meals were wonderful, there are so many dishes to choose from. The mall was spotless and lots of people around to help.

Very nice mall.. A very beautiful mall with very nice ambience. The great part of about all the malls here is apart from famous branded shops they also have various convenience stores, food courts and some or other good attraction or theme park within. The parking is so Hugh that you have to remember the parking lot with precision otherwise you will get lost.All the major malls have facility for wheel chair for the needy, simply produce your photo id and you can use it for free.

Extroudnary . Amazing place to visit Like the temperature was 30 C outside and -40 inside Love the penguins as well skiing classes are little overpriced and renting the equipment will stretch your bell further other than that you will have a nice experience in an unusual place !

Wow, even a ski field. A great mall with affordable shops, and even a snow field. We had fun watching the skiing whilst in a warm climate. A good little food hall that had a great range of food. This location is where the big hop on hop off bus arrives from Abu Dhabi. You can also catch the metro to this shopping centre. Access from metro is under cover walkway and access is easy.
Shopping heaven. We enjoyed just viewing the various shops and entertainment. Wonderful shops and great eateries. The whole area gave you something to look at, every turn was something different.

Decent Mall. The mall is well located and connected by road and Metro. We love to visit this mall by metro as it is connected through an air conditioned way from metro station. A very small walk and you enter the mall. The both sides of entrance have electronic shops where you can shop for mobile phones, computers etc. the mall has all brand shops for apparels and body care products. There is a good food court and a large provision shop Carrefour and a huge electronic shop Jumbo electronics where we bought memory cards and mobile phone covers. There is a 5 star hotel Kempisky attached to the hotel. Overall a decent place to chill out with family and friends.

Almost the best shopping mall in Dubai . Everything you can think about you can found it in Mall of the emirates even Skiing in the snow and penguins !!! Yes penguins in Dubai in Gulf area !! It's for me the best shopping mall where almost all known brands of the world are available (fashion - kids - shoes - sports - coffee shops - perfumes - watches .... Everything ) The mall layout is friendly and easy so sure you will enjoy shopping in it .

The Mall to go to in Dubai . Once a week at least for the last eight years. Love the mall. Have everything the heart desires. Ample parking though difficult to get sometimes. Have some thing for everyone. Nice location and has a big hypermarket.

Huge mall but lacks signage directions. It is a huge mall. It seems everything is here but shopping here is quite costly. They have mostly designer and branded products. If you are looking for bargain shops, this is not the place to go to. It's just ironic that this big mall lacks signage for directions. It is very difficult for newcomers to locate certain areas or even find directions for lifts and washrooms. Food choices are also limited and spread quite far from each other.
too big to be a mall. what can not be at this place , there is everything you wanna buy , everything! too big , best mall in dubai , fancy cars lined up outside mall ! loving it!
Nice Mall. the most preferable mall for me in Dubai , all my needs are there. the general environment is nice. there are two luxury hotels in the mall, Sheraton and kempinski. VOX Cinemas is great.
Nice shopping with snow experience. After shopping eons dinner at one of the restaurant with a panoramic view on the indoor snow and ski experience. The Lebanese restaurant Karam is a perfect choice.

Great mall!. Mall of Emirates is a very good option to shop in Dubai!, with a lot of shops, restaurants, food court, also you have a Carrefour inside!. Ski Dubai is just inside and also have a metro connect station for a better and easy transport in Dubai.

You will get lost and poor signs. . It's a Mall. Loads of shops and brands. No different to any other. Very poor signage means you go round , and round and round. Decent supermarket in the lower floor with a nice fast food restaurant on the side which was very good value for a quick snack. Also if your walking to the mall it is a nightmare. Took ages to find an entrance to WALK in. They design the mall for car access.

Very nice, older style Mall. Quite different to the Dubai Mall in its layout, I liked the architecture and décor of this more "traditional" type mall. You can watch the skiers if you feel the urge and I was lucky enough to be able to watch the penguins from the outside too. Decent food court, although the McD's there must be the most chaotic, frenetic, and disorganised branch on the planet - quite good entertainment actually!

Very good shopping center. It is a very good shopping center, lots of shops and restaurants, inside ski slope and easy to access via metro. It is not as big as Dubai Mall but it was more convenient for us. Shops are a bit pricy but that's normal for Dubai.

Dubai's second mall. Only in Dubai could such an improbably huge, beautifully decorated mall be dwarfed by a different mall that's only a few miles away (that's the Dubai Mall). We initially came here to hug a penguin at Ski Dubai (yes, we're both adults) but left without doing so due to the $30 charge (we'll find a more reasonably-priced penguin-hugging experience in the middle of a desert, thank you very much!) Nevertheless, we spent a few enjoyable hours wandering around the Mall of the Emirates spending what remained of our dirhams. Check it out to glimpse the novelty of Ski Dubai.

Goo dtitle. Brilliant shopping area with vast amount of high street brands.
My son shopped in Superdry and Hollister

What a beauty.... Dubai's malls are just like attraction parks, with the only difference that you can consider the stores to be your games. This mall is very spacious and big, did I mention BIGGG...It seems like Dubai's malls are all huge, but you can find some great bargains!!!

Indoor skiing and shops galore. A visit to this mall is worth the time if only to view the indoor ski slope and toboggan run and the delighted children enjoying snow on a day when the outside temperature is approaching 40*. What imagination and engineering creativity went into designing and building this attraction! The mall has a wealth of shops and dining options that can be found in numerous other world wide locations, but the Ski Dubai attraction makes this mall unique.
A lot of Shops. You can find a lot of brands... good mall... facy var is parking on the front... I went with friends car and come back to hotel with metro. it was nice trip.

Handy location, fantastic family mall, something for every shopper and leisure activites. Mall of the Emirates is a multi-level shopping centre located on Sheikh Zayed Road which includes Ski Dubai an indoor ski resort. It has beautiful architecture with roots from Arabic as well as Mediterranean themes. It features a huge range of shops and there’s something for every shopper including family leisure. There are also a wide variety of cafes and restaurants from its multiple food courts. Make sure to try The Cheesecake Factory and Al Habibi Lebanese restaurant. The shopping mall is easily accessible from Mall of the Emirates Metro station located on the Red Metro Line of Dubai Metro. Allow plenty of time for shopping as like other Dubai Malls, you can spend the whole day here with ease.

Luxury Shopping, But At Quite A Price. The mall of the emirates is simply stunning, from the architecture to its massive size and abundance of shops. This place is quite simply a shoppers paradise.Having said that however, the shopper in question had better have deep pockets, prices are on the steep side.I spent about 3 or so hours just wandering around, getting lost and then finding myself again, the fact that it connects directly to the train station is also a plus as cheap transport is readily available.Definitely worth a visit!

LUXURY. It's worthwhile to visit this mall only to see its architecture. There are expensive shops,a lot of cafeterias and restaurants and you have to see the Dubai SKI. There is a metro station there.
Fantastic . A visit to the mall of the emirates is a must while you're in Dubai. You can find everything inside and even go to Ski Dubai.

Beautiful mall, luxury stuff!. Absolutely a luxury shopper's heaven! Full of premium stuff and huge. It also has ski dubai. Connected with metro station. Even if you are on a budget its good for window shopping :)

massive mall with everything on offer. Mall of the Emirates is a massive mall with various stores and places to eat.also the place for Ski Dubai which is good for watching the penguin parade every hour if you get a chance to catch it.
Ok, but expensive. The mall was pretty but filled with a lot of expensive shops. Apart from Ski Dubai and the Carrefour Hypermarket this mall was average. Worth a visit once though.

Luxury. The Mall is great many different shops, Nice atmosphere. The arcitacture is great aswell. Even the toilets are luxurious! The staff is helpful. One downside is it is too big like the Dubai Mall. You cant seem to get a hold of the directions. But it is well navigated if u may.

Luxury.. The Mall is great many different shops, Nice atmosphere. The arcitacture is great aswell. Even the toilets are luxurious! The staff is helpful. One downside is it is too big like the Dubai Mall. You cant seem to get a hold of the directions. But it is well navigated if u may.

Totally amazing. We were here 10 days before Christmas and the mall had an excellent Christmas display for the children to experience, a full ski slope and much more. highly recommended for a visit when in Dubai.

nothing like shopping to keep jet lag at bay!. High end stores and chain stores alike. Absolutely massive. Quite a lovely way to shop, the stores offer to charge local currency or your home currency on credit card. Had Lebanese food at the food court - there is a selection of affordable multinational cuisines to choose from. Lots of taxis available.

Love this Place. I Just Love this Mall. Everytime I visit Dubai this is a MUST Mall!!! Shopping is just great fun here. You just need loads of hours and money and you can shop till you drop.Kids love the Ski Dubai there!! Plus MOE has loads of play areas and Entertainment spots too for Kids.For People wanting to stay there, there are 3-4 hotels close/in the Mall.
"Shop till you drop". A large mall with the point of difference for MOE being the ski/slopes. Usual large mall inclusions with high brand shops.

Another Chic Arabian Mall !. As our hotel was a five-minute walk from the Mall of the Emirates, we visited this shopping artifact a couple of times during our recent vacation in Dubai. Yes, the grounds are extensive! The place is also stylish and squeaky clean, and the scent of money definitely fills the air! The sight of a AED 2800 (approx £523) price tag of a cashmere scarf almost gave me a heart attack-- of course I kept on moving. My husband fared better as he got some good deals on (90% off) shirts at both the Azzaro and Pierre Balmain's end of season sales. Families with young children may want want to note that it can be a bit hard on the feet as seating is mainly restricted to the food courts. All in all, a chic Arabian mall that celebrates opulence.

Just a an expensive luxury mall. Apart from Ski Dubai the Mall of the Emirates is nothing special. It's just a very overpriced shopping mall. The only thing going for it is that it has cheap places te eat (in a pretty cheerless environment).

S0-so of a mall.. We werent exactly impressed with MOE. Clean place quite a number of shops, food choice was ok. We went there once and decided to just hang out at Dubai Mall eventough DM was a bit farther from our hotel.

Too Chaotic for me!. We have visited this Mal a few times when in Dubai but for us, it is too busy. Yes, it's got every shop you can think of but it is no cheaper than the UK. For me, I prefer the Marina Mall as it is smaller, less busy but still has a good selection of shops.

Shopping distenation . Wonderful shopping mall in dubai..
Big variety of shops and brands.
Dinners will have different types of cafes and restaurants to enjoy ..
Families will have a great time as well

take a look , donot buy !. Our hotel was 10 minutes far from Mall of Emrates by walking .It has many attractions for all age groups , but shopping can be done in a cheaper place like Outlet Mall in Alaein road .
Yikes. Huge Mall, taxi line up, which is really the only way out is at least two hours, if not more. Not sure if I would come here because of that. :(. Lots of stores. Extremely noisy.

Huge mall. Huge mall, you definitely need several hours to see it all. Lots of luxurious cars parked in front of the entrance (some just for showing off). Took ages to take a taxi as the line was very long but the organization was good overall. You can also take the metro there.
Paul's cafe. Paul's cafe food was awful. Worst almond croissant I have had. Cappuccino wasn't much better either. I definitely will not go back there again.
Shopper's haven. Great mall with a wide array of shops conviniently located in Jumeriah area. Its a bit far from the town centre but great for those on sheik al zayed road

shoppers delight. The shop staff are very frienfly, only downside was not very hood english wad spoken so had to repeat myself a few yimes to be understood .got some brilliant bargsins. Something for everybody a definant worthwhile visit so much to see and do.

Snow in the middle of the desert!. On being dropped off outside this mall, your attention is turned to the most extravagant and amazing cars lined up outside, I'm talking swarovski crystal encrusted Ferraris amongst other fabulous rides!Entering the mall has a mix of high street shops, on off boutiques and high end designers shops & jewellery. It also houses a huge snow dome where you can ski & toboggan!!Lovely food halls where you can choose from any type of cuisine.If you love shopping... Or skiing then you need to visit!

massive mall with all you could want and more. got it all this mall with indoor sking too !good shop selection with usual European brands high st and designer.Good link to public transport too if not driving

Emirates Mall. Hands down the most stunning malls I have been to, and I am not really a big fan of malls in general but this one is worth checking out. They have skiing in the mall......need I say more?
Instagram: @tommiesox
More shopping!. Don't knock the malls! They are nice and a wonderful place to cool off. Lot's of store and food options.

Great selection and designers galore. Mall of the Emirates is an awesome shopping mall, not least for the relief of the air conditioning. From the numbers of super cars in the car park to the presence of seemingly every designer label you can think of, this place is intended to cater to the wealthy locals, expats and tourists who pour through its doors. Positives: great selection of shops and labels. Ski Dubai. Great food halls.Negatives: shops are the same as you can find in London and prices appear to be roughly 20% higher than you would pay at home.Top tip: There is a Carrefour hypermarket on the ground floor - stock up on snacks, soft-drinks and essentials at low prices rather than paying expensive hotel rates.Travel time from east crescent of the palm in a local cab: 20 minutes, 30 dhs

Drop by to see the infamous ski hill. If you are a shopper or not, it is still worth a visit just to see the indoor ski hill. Unfortunately it is hard to see the skiiers coming down the hill but you can go to the viewing areas to see a bit of the area which included seeing kids pulled on sleds and going down the slides as well as the live penquin show. Easy to get to on the Metro for a brief stop.

Mall of the Emirates. Its worth going to this Mall for visiting Ski Dubai or taking pictures of the supercars valet parked at the main entrance.Its like visiting the showroom of a Oil Tycoon Arab.Some amazing vehicles.There is some nice restaurants in the Mall that are relatively cheap to eat in.The shopping center is huge and plays to the Mall culture of Dubai.It gets boring walking around them with your wife for hours on end. Thankfully my wife has been there and got the t-shirt.Carrafour is a good for food shopping.There is plenty of money exchanges in the mall as well. You get good exchange rates for changing English money into Durhams.

Great Mall. This is a great mall, not as crowded as Dubai Mall, but has eveything you need, lots of shops and dining places. In addition it has ski place with snow, one of its kind. Highly recommend to visit this mall.
Females will love it. It goes on & on & on. Huge is a small word for it. You name it and they have it. Most of the brands under one roof. Females love it.

Everything you need is here!. Flanked by Sheraton and Kempinski Hotels on either end of the mall, this is the place to meet, eat and have some fun (movies, snow ski). There are many restaurants and even a food court in the basement. You will find many luxury brand shops including a large supermarket.
Large. Very large mall with anything and everything you could possibly want. I found it a bit confusing though. It was very well maintained and kept clean.

a very huge mall with two wings!. this is our first time visit to the mall and it has also metro connecting to the mall. It has two wings east and west side and both sides have its own food courd and shops! the food court were huge with so many selection and we love the Indian food at the food court and prices were ok for the portion of the meal serves! we found the dessert especially cakes serves at the cafe inside the mall to be very expensive compare to desserts serves at the best cafes in Europe especially where we came from Vienna, Austria!

One of the most modern Mall..!!!. Dubai,is also famous for its Malls all had diffrent Architecture and style,this one was most modern and huge one,where there are Branded showrooms where one can buy the most expensive Mobile to Diamonds,This is the Mall with the Snowworld with Ice skying,It is such a huge Mall where even one day is not enough to see the entire Mall.

Great classy upscale mall. Not as big as Dubai mall but holds its own no doubt, different stores.
Loved it indeed though I thought I was hard to be impressed after Dubai mall

Grandeur, style and varieties. Arguably the best shopping environment before the erection of Dubai Mall, this mall offers so much excitement, fun and pleasure under 1 roof. From costumes, cuisines, cinema, fun-fare and what not. The best way to enjoy the mall is to plan being there for at least 6 hours and more if you intend to watch movies as well. With kids? Then, ensure that they visit the ski Dubai and/or magic planet. It will surely be a holiday to cherish for a lifetime. The Starbucks at the center will offer an excellent brunch after a long sight-seeing walk. In this mall, you will never be bored.

Lovely huge place, great bargains when we were there!. Was lucky to be there during lots of sale and saw many of my fellow mates from my birth country though I am an Aussie citizen. I got heaps of bargains and the boys also loved their souvenirs. They got original rubik's cubes and I got Guess watch, wooden pens for rellies of my husband, t-shirts, all good value, I got some to this day and they are of good quality!We love the cafes, clean toilets, lots of shopping options, not just for the very rich!
Shopping trip. Lovely clean Mall but the prices in the stores are about 4 times more expensive than in England. Good choice of food restaurants. Watched the indoor ski

Mall for the Expats. We decided to get a free bus from our hotel on the days we arrived, because we could not check-in early. We were jet-lagged; hence, not the ideal time to go.It seems more for expats living in Dubai rather than tourists - the mall was quiet. Nice design, clean, clean toilets and variety of shops; we got some basic items from the Carrefour supermarket (e.g. water bottles, tissues, etc). We decided to get a taxi back to the hotel rather then wait for the free shuttle bus - if you do need to get a taxi back, get the cream coloured taxi as they are cheaper.

Ok for expats - nothing you won't find at home. I went to the Mall of the Emirates because it had been recommended to me as one of the attractions. Apart from a huge Carrefour, where you will find everything your heart desires in terms of Western household items, I was disappointed to realise that this is just another cloned mall where they sell exactly the same stuff you find back at home, only much more expensive.I understand that this may be a good thing for expats living in Dubai, however, if you are just visiting, don't bother.The Mall can be reached by Metro; the Metro station is above Carrefour.

Amazing choice of shops. Amazing mall, great choice of shops and restaurants. Also ski dubai and penguins! The only problem with this place was we went there after we had been to the Dubai Mall and nothing can compare to how amazing that place is! Well worth a trip tho.

Needs more Chairs!!!!!. Every year I visit Dubai I visit this mall. But this year I found that there is no Chairs for setting in the corridors such as others mall in Dubai!! I think they must put some chairs specially for people who cannot walk for distance! (Chairs were only available in the restaurants & Cafes!)
Skiing in a shopping mall? Why not?. Amazing mall - when stay in front of if, there is many of luxury cars. This mall is really big, and the best thing in the mall is Ski Dubai.

Anything You Want. This mall has it all from high end retail to low end clothing shops. You can take an indoor snow ski and have a hot chocolate in one of the restaurants near the slope. An exciting adventure for shopping lovers. Don't expect to find much of a discount there though.

A Ski Hill in a mall. We diciided to go inhdoors to a mall because Dubai was having a sand storm. What a delightful place to visit! We went to a movie but the highlight was watching the patrons ski down hilll and the was a large plastic ball somewhat see though that you got into and it rolled down a less steep hill. jusr a fun sight.
