Worth Going. Nice mall,with lots of brands.Food court is also good. Big and specious also. Best part of mall is "Ski Dubai",maintained at -4 degrees. Connected to metro directly making it convenient to reach.

really a huge mall!. this is really a huge mall. the ceilings per floor are high, and the intricate designs on the ceiling are obviously very expensive to make. there are so many shops and places to go, i dont even know where to start. it is easily accessible to all modes of available transportations.

Western style mall. It's not that this isn't a good mall, it's just that it is very similar to many of the shopping malls in the United States. Victoria's Secret, H&M, Forever 21, American Eagle Outfitters, Bath and Body Works, etc are all in this mall so for an American such as myself it is all the same stuff I have at home. This is why I gave this score of "Average" for this mall.

Known for its Ice Skiing. Its a huge mall located a little further from Shk Zayed road. The mall is best renowned for its ice skiing. Children love playing in the ice and experience the fun of a hill station. The mall has all the famous brands outlets to provide s good shopping experience. Its a little far from the city , hence private vehicle is a must. Worth seeing if u r in Dubai.

Best place to shop if you do not have more than 1 full day to shop. This Mall has almost all the shops you would be looking for. It is definitely not as big and fancy as the dubai mall. But because of this you can actually cover a lot of shops instead of wasting time looking for them.

SKIING AND AQUARIUM. Great mall with extensive shopping...Highlight of the mall is the huge aquarium.Skiing IN ANOTHER GREAT THINGS. Lots of fun, besides shopping. Add to that, the convenience of having variety of restaurants at the food court.

Ripped off. No consumer protection I bought a ps4 It did not work I tool it back for exchange or refund was told by shop to contact manufacturer when I complained in writing I was called up by local police officer asking me one question. Did I want to make a complaint against UAE was threatened. So basically Dubai is a backward country who rip people off and dazzle you with scams

Has literally everything!. This mall literally has everything you need under one roof! It is well connected thanks to the metro connection as well. Do not miss the cute little french cafe on the ground floor!

Better than Dubai Mall.. Thrilling shopping experience, entertainment for kids, skying, great food court, extremelly helpful and nice info point staff.
The best thing is that you cannot get lost, everything is very well organized.
Good conection to the Metro.

fantastic. great place that as everything combined under one roof
multiple brands and great location
don't forget to visit the skiing area
you will enjoy it

No place to seat and relax!. Mall of the Emirates was opened in November 2005 .The multi-level shopping center currently features more than 560 international brands, more than 700 stores, 11 anchor stores.The family leisure includes Ski Dubai - the Middle East’s first indoor ski resort and snow park, DUCTAC- the 500-seat capacity Dubai Community Theatre and Arts Centre and more than 90 international dining and cafes.In my opinion it's one of the best shopping mall in dubai But strangely no place to seat and relax !
very big shopping center. take your time and it's a very good place to eat and shop. you can reach with metro easily. it's not crowded as dubai mall but I think this is better.

mall of the rich and famous ! if u need higher brands ! go for it. this is a mall with good gentry of people coming , heavy brands , clean mall , with other attractions , if u r a brand freak this is a place to go , leave ur kids in the snowworld and roam around ! we liked the inside built as well , gives a great feel and lot of light , taking taxi was easy !

Great shopping adventure!. This mall has it all from excellent eating places (like the Cheesecake Factory, Japengo, Butcher Block to name a few), stores for just about everything from electronics, clothing, shoes, watches, books, Virgin Records, Sports stores, Home Center, etc, etc. The Indoor Ski Slope is there where you can watch the kids and adults ski and have fun. The metro drops you right off there at the mall. Big department store called Carre Four is there too.
Dubai's best shopping mall. Dubai's best shopping mall. Greate mall with lots of shops of all kind, many good and cozy restaurants and Ski Dubai With its Entertainment.

You do lots of time. This mall is a masterpiece , but you must have the luxury of time or else you will not do justice. It is definitely high end, has all the top fashion houses and caters for all types of shoppers. the mall is linked to a few hotels, which offers an escape from the hustle and noise.Well worth visiting

Dubai's equivalent of Westfield. Big mall with loads of shops from designers to high street brands. The food court has a wide variety of foods to choose from. Worth a trip if you come to dubai to shop. This is dubai's equivalent of London's Westfield, except this one has a ski slope.

nice place. MOE being near the metro station makes it easy for one to access it. It has beautiful stalls to purchase stuff may it be designer or just normal.for supermarket lovers there is carrefour and for movie lovers there is VOX cinema.For kids the is ski dubai and you got to enjoy seeing penguines.i think id write a whole book about MOE.Its worth a try when you visit Dubai.

Dubai's #2 mall - but still lots of unique features/stores. If shopping's your thing then a visit to the Mall of the Emirates is a must during your visit to Dubai. All of the big name stores and brands are here together with some nice surprises including outlets of Paris' Angelina Cafe (the hot chocolate is to die for) and Pierre Hermes (pastries like you've never had before). One of the Big attractions is Ski Dubai, the simply massive indoor ski hill and winter playground. It alone is worth the visit and you can get a glimpse of the faculty through a very large picture window on the mall's lower level. If you need to stock up on groceries or ther goods including cheap clothes, towels, etc. then Carrefour is your store. It's massive and has everything you could ever need. The dining options are mindboggling. There's everyhing from high end restaurants (some with views over the ski hill) to fast food stands to choose from. Getting to the mall is easy. Take a cab (and there's an enormous taxi stand outside the lower main entrance) or take the convenient and very cheap Metro.

Most Convenient Shopping Mall in Dubai. This is probably the most convenient and best place to shop in Dubai. Very easily accessible by Metro and various other modes of transport. Ski Dubai & Aquarium are also big attraction.

Not as big as the dubai mall but easier to navigate and friendlier shops. I love this mall,it's got more high street shops than the dubai mall,it's got loads of places to stop and have a bite to eat and drink.The shops are more high street,debenhams,wallis.....loved it
cool place to spend evening. it isnt as big as the Dubai mall, but still quite big. lots of good shopsdining options are also nice

Very close to Metro Station. This is the second biggest mall in Dubai after the Dubai Mall. Mall of the Emirates is very close to metro Station unlike Dubai Mall which is a good 15 minutes walk connected by sky walk escalator. Most of the major brands can be found in this mall.
Too big for me. Some malls are just to big to enjoy. Apart from its size it is easy to navigate, plus has almost every brand name known.

Convenient and easy to move around. Smaller than Dubai mall, so u don't get lost, has Carrefour, so honestly we used carrefour trolleys to stack our shopping bags and move around which is a HUGE advantage not found in Dubai mall.Has VOX cinema which is very nice to go watch a movie after spending the day shopping there. I loved their Starbucks too, used to order donuts from crispy creamers and go eat them with my favorite latter at Starbucks.HOWEVER!!!!! Be careful with the taxis guys!!!!Once we were trying to get a taxi not from the assigned place for taxi pick up and the guy LITERALLY stole our bags!!!!Once we put our shopping bags in the trunk, the guy flew away inside the parking and wouldn't stop, and our bags would have been lost except that my fiancée took another taxi to follow and stop him. We reported that to their traffic police but they were VERY disappointing!!!! Kept making excuses for the guy!! I couldn't believe it!!!Be ware, in Dubai, when u r inside a mall, be careful not to take a taxi except from the assigned place in front of the security, other wise they will either refuse to drive u to ur place, like what happened with us once in Dubai mall, or cheat on the meter like this guy who was starting the fare at 14.5 instead of 5.5 AED
Grand Shopping. Dubai is a shopping hub. Mall of Emirates is one of big shopping center in Dubai where every brand of outlet is present. You can enjoy superior class of shopping.

Mall for actually buying things. If you are in Dubai, chances are you are going to visit the big malls, Mall of Dubai and Mall of the Emirates. Both are absolutely worth seeing but I would argue the MOE is better for shopping stuff.Mall of Dubai is exhausting with its size and it has hundreds of very high class shops. MOE is also quite big, but more manageable on a single visit, and it has more shops for normal people. On our trip I ended up buying way more from MOE than Mall of Dubai.Mall of the Emirates has maybe a bit more limited choice of restaurants, and it's a bit more further away from Bur Dubai but those are hardly any problems.Word of advice: don't try to leave around 7 PM and go to Bur Dubai. We learned this the hard way. Our taxi spent fifteen minutes just to reach Sheikh Zayed Road only to be bogged down in even crazier traffic there. We then switched to metro which was packed on a Japanese scale.

High End Mall. The Mall of the Emirates is just like going to a mall in the US, save that most of the shops are high end and the whole building is over the top, just like most things in Dubai. It is fun to take a stroll through and be sure to swing by Ski Dubai to see the slopes and the penguins...

First Rate Mall. This huge mall is really nice. Short walk from the Metro. Very clean, usual selection of upscalestores. Sit-down restaurant section is an interesting concept, with 4-5 different ethnic restaurantsadjacent to one another, all with "patio" seating. We did the Iranian Pars Restaurant, but next time will try another. Food court is huge and extremely busy, even at 3 PM. We had some good Gelato there. Watched Ski Dubai through the windows, which was fun, as many of the skiers lookedlike first timers. Interesting concept to have a 25 degree F ski place in a hot desert country.While the Dubai Mall is the in place to be these days, this mall is also right up there.

dancing elfs. we have been there just before Christmass and I was really surprise to see dancing elfs. I have noticed that people had a lot of fun there. The mall itself is a good opportunity to shop in one place. Also the money exchange rate is quite good there. There is a nice food court also. and the shuttle bus service

Large and westernized mall. It's comforting to be able to go somewhere and see stores and shop at places that you're familiar with. A large portion of the stores are North American brands. There are many European stores as well. Interesting to shop at the large "box" type store that is on the first floor to see some of what the locals buy.
Beautiful Mall. Gorgeous mall, great shops and even an indoor ski area. Definitely worth the visit. I actually preferred this mall over Dubai Mall.

Well balanced Mall. This mall offers shoppers the best mix of luxury brands as well as reasonable ones. Sale time is good for finding great discounts on clothes and accessories. The location near Metro makes it easy to visit if travelling via Metro. There is walkway connecting from Metro. The Ski Dubai is located in this Mall and is one of the reasons to visit here.

iconic mall. This is the biggest and grandest mall of them all in Dubai .All the high end brands are here , all the generic brands that you either love or hate as well as a lot of little surprise boutiques that come and go as fortunes and popularity changes and evolves. The food scene is good here with everything on offer you can imagine . There are high end dining options as well as food court staples . Its a huge mall and not easy to see everything in one day . It gets packed at times so prepare yourself .

Seems less fake than the Dubai Mall. Like everybody visiting Dubai, you will probably visit both huge malls (this one and the Dubai Mall). The Mall of the Emirates was built before and not has fallen behind the Dubai Mall (near the Khalifa towers). Personally, I preferred this one (it seems a bit more authentic, a bit less crowded and you find the same brands anyway). It's also easier to access. Looking at the ski slopes was an experience as well.

Awesome shopping mall. Although there were a lot of high end shops there was still reasonably priced goods available. The ski run has to be seen to be believed. Lunch at a french patisserie called Paul's was also a highlight. Very busy but as the food was so good this was understandable.

Dubai Shopping Festival Disappointment.. Decided to have a look around and possibly grab a bargain.However, whilst there was a wide array of retail outlets; the prices (even with the hyped discounts of up to 60%) were still only on a par with Oxford Street, London prices, as far as we could see and often far in excess of prices On offer back in the UK .If money is no object then a shopping festival makes no odds to you but when such is advertised throughout Dubai promising amazing discounts; unfortunately visitors from the UK will be disappointed overall.
shopaholics heaven. The original shopping mall in Dubai with lots of interesting things to see and do. Try your hand at skiing on the snow slopes inside the mall.

Good shopping Mall. This is another great place for shopping and hanging out in Dubai. The Mall also has a cinema- VOX and skiing arena. Lots of activities for kids and teens. Food court is big and also there are lot of restaurants within the mall. This is a good shopping location for those residing in Al Barsha, JLT, JBR and TECOM.

Nice but not as nice as Dubai Mall. It's a nice mall, but it's not as new and bright as Dubai Mall. To also seems more crowded to be honest. But that might be because it is smaller. On the plus side they have a huge Carre Four so grocery shopping there is nice. They also have a large food court on the ground floor and a smaller on the first floor and lots of restaurants too. It's also right next door to a Kempinski Hotel and directly connected to the Metro. For me the best part of Mall of the Emirates is Magic Planet. It's an arcade/game area. That also has a few bowling lanes and bumper cars. It's fun for everyone. There is also a cinema and Ski Dubai (an indoor ski area). It is Definitely worth a visit.
One stop shopping place. All the brands are available up here as well, quick route from metro to this. Food court has good options available.

Everything is here, just a smaller mall.. We spent most our shopping time in this mall as our hotel was only round the corner. I liked this mall because although it was big, it didn't seem to be quite as busy as other malls. My family went skiing and I went shopping. Relatively easy to walk around without getting too lost, but do grab a map of the centre and this will make shopping a little easier.I did notice that a lot of stores did not stock everything. I couldn't find my size in a couple of items, yet when visiting other malls, they seemed to have quite a few of the particular item in my size, so this was the only disadvantage. I think most prices are expensive in Dubai, having visited a few centres, I really didn't find items cheaper elsewhere.There is a huge Carrefour supermarket here, great for picking up supplies. Kids clothes are well priced at Centrepoint (near Carrefour).There is a cinema in the centre. Movies are cheaper than Australia. And the popcorn is great value compared to at home.

Not as good as Dubai Mall. Just off the redline metro...this mall is signposted and walkway is air conditioned. Looked a little tired in appearance. Plan where you want to visit and get a plan of the mall at the entrance.

overpriced. Items sold in some of the outlets were overpriced compared to prices in the US. For example, a pair of Skechers which I had bought in the New Jersey Garden Mall in November 2014 was retailing for almost double the above price in one of the shoe outlets.

One stop mall. The mall has everything one can ask for. Lux brands, premium brands to hypermarket to Victoria Secret to all possible fashion brands. Strongly recommend visit only this mall if on a holiday and want to cramp shopping to 2-3 days. Only miss was Ikea, for which one will have to step out. Else, all under one roof!

Old yet charming mall. The mall is showing its age and it's younger sister Dubai Mall is fast becoming a favourite. The mall was, is and will always be as popular as before because this is the only mall in the Middle East with an indoor ski resort. Furthermore, the management of the mall have been smart enough to bring in famous foreign brands such as Cheesecake Factory and Ihop as tenants to maintain the popularity. Even though this mall is now the 2nd largest, it's still one of the must see malls in Dubai alongside Dubai Mall and Ibn Battuta Mall.

Zegna shop in the Mall of Emirates. On Jan 25, 2015 I bought Zegna man suit in Zegna  shop in the Mall of Emirates Dubai. The suit’s trousers needed some tailor adjustment and we left the suit with shop tailor for adjustment.Today Jan 27 we went to the shop to pick up the suit and found out that trousers are damaged by hot ironing. 2 salesmen witnessed that the trousers are damaged by extra hot ironing ( Russian speaking sales lady and another male salesmen). We asked to replace the damaged trousers or to refund AED 3265.00 which we paid for the suit. The salesmen advised us to come back after 3 pm the same day.  After 3 pm today I visited the shop however the same salesmen and his 2 colleagues in a very rude way refused to refund or to replace damaged trousers, they told me that I have to take the suit and that suit was never damaged ( they slightly treated by steam the damaged part of trousers) I asked salesmen to introduce themselves. They refused to introduce themselves saying that it is private information , after I again repeatedly asked their names they introduced themselves by most probably fake names Vijay and Mustafa, Russian speaking sales women refused to introduce herself at all. Such a rude behaviour of Zegna stuff  heavily spoil Zegna reputation, I have been shopping in Zegna shops worldwide since last 15-20 years and never faced such an unpleasant experience.

Huge mall. Huge mall with a lot of floor space as well as you can get a large variety of things inside the mall.. Carefour is a good attraction and you can get almost everything inside. Parking space for mall is large and it is surrounded by 2-3 metro stations if you dont have your own car.....
unbelievable. An actual ski slope inside a shopping mall,you have to go and see it, make it a must do in dubai,the shopping is excellent as well

Better than Dubai Mall!. For the average person, this is the mall to go to. Household brands have shops here and most of the stores are affordable for the common person - unlike Dubai Mall. It has Ski dubai as well.
Beautiful mall, huge - truly a shoppers paradise.

Skiing!!. We are in the middle of the desert @ dubai city. To be able to enjoy Skiing at all times of the year is something I got to applaud mall of the emirates for. Lots of fun, besides shopping. Add to that, the convenience of having variety of restaurants at the food court which makes it perfect. 5 stars

Aquarium!. Great mall with extensive shopping...Kids loved the fabulous candy store! Highlight of the mall is the huge aquarium. It is a full sized attraction, and is perfect for men that are bored while the girls continue to shop:) We thoroughly enjoyed it.

Large mall but not impressive. This is a huge old mall where a lot of local people go for shopping.
There are many stores but not so big like similars in Europe.
I didn't like it because was very crowded and kind of unorganized, maybe a subjective impression.
There is also Carrefour and food court.
I wouldn't go back.

Large. This mall have a variety of stores and more enough for the food court .
Carreffeur and the most known stores are there .
I recommend to visit

Very huge mall and must visit. This is a very old and well built mall but not bigger than the Dubai mall. It has the stores for all the posh brands so make sure what you want. I think Dubai mall is a better place to go for shopping in Dubai than this mall .

A very nice mall. Mall of Emirates is a very nicely planned and huge shopping mall. It has all.the. Designer shops and other excellent shopping areas . It has very nice restaurants and food court. Strongly recommended

Shop until you drop. over 500 shops, 90 restaurants and dozens of things to see - you could get lost in the place! The range of stores goes from bargain basement through to exclusive brands and everything in between. Possibly the only thing you cant buy there is the hammer and nails you will need to build the crates to send everything home in!

Better than the Dubai mall. Everything you would expect including a ski resort.
They do lack some classic luxury brands, but all in all it's very good

2nd best mall in Dubai, but worth visiting. If you are excited about the possibility of saying you went snow skiing in the middle of a very hot desert, this mall is definitely worth a visit. (Keep in mind that you will pay about the same to ski at the little slopes in this mall as what you would pay on a low-mid level ski slope in the U.S.) As far as the mall itself goes, it's fine, but compared to the Dubai Mall, it's a bit lacking. It's still a big mall with a lot of stores and a lot of places to eat, though. If I could pick just one, I would pick the Dubai Mall. That being said, when it's hot outside in Dubai, spending an afternoon at the Mall of the Emirates might be a perfectly acceptable thing to do. It also has easy access via the metro.

Luxurious inside and out. The decor inside this mall is absolutely beautiful, it would take you a while to walk the entire shopping centre however from what I was able to see in the four hours I visited, was how tastefully stunning the architecture and interior of the building was. The lack of seats/chairs inside the mall is astonishing though, people were sitting on the floor along the walk ways/corridors/shop fronts from exhaustion having walked around the shops for too long. Ski Dubai was a unique attraction and much bigger than I expected! Definitely worth seeing if you're in the area, and do not be afraid of the long taxi queues outside the mall as the queue moves really quickly with plentiful taxis waiting to take passengers.

Must-Visit. Nice mall to visit for shopping and good restaurants. The only downside though is the long walk to & from the Metro Station if you're taking the train coming here ;-(Will definitely visit this place again!

It's good but outdated. So the Mall of the Emirates looks great and spectacular from the outside, especially with the beautiful Kempinski hotel right next to it. But the inside left much to be desired. The lay out is not very logical, making it confusing to find your way. All in all, it's a great place to visit and certainly a stop to make when in the Jumeirah area. Perhaps we are just a little spoilt with all the mega malls in Dubai that we are now looking at layouts? It's a great mall ya'll, go see!

worth a visit. Good size mall. Variety of high street shops and designer brands and restaurants. Ski Dubai. Doesn't seem to be any seats available in the mall so a tiring day on your feet. Long taxi queues which can be hot.
No proper Sign. Mall is very good but giving 1 star only for no proper signs as where we are, very hard to navigate.Free maps are there

Limitless shopping. Its huge! That is both great and bad. Great because we were able to spend hours shopping on each floor, but bad because we never even visited much of the mall in two days. Take your time to relax your tired feet as you sip coffee and eat cake in any of the excellent coffee shops. There are loads of shops with great discounts in January and February. The information desks are manned throughout and the staff are so helpful. The toilets are sparkling. My niece lost her purse during our lunch break. We did not realize she had misplaced it until hours later as we wanted to leave. We were directed to the security office where we found it had been turned in,with not a single item missing.

full of top brands which u will not find in india. full of top brands which u will not find in india... and they offer good discount as well...so clean but avoid going on friday to much rush and crowded......

Classy. Whenever I enter this mall, I get a sense of elitism. Maybe because of its proximity to the Burj al Arab. It is also accessible through the Metro but not as popular as the Dubai Mall. There is an activity centre that generates snow in winter and is attractive to visitors that haven't experienced snow. It is also attractive to locals but not to visitors from some snowing countries. The restaurants are a mixture of different cultures. It is no problem to find one that suits your taste.

Best service. I actually never used to go to Mall of the Emirates but I found that service in top luxury stores are a lot better there than at Dubai Mall. They really care for the costumers. Great service at Cartier, Prada, Tiffany. WELL DONE!!!!
Familiar favorites!. I love seeing Krispy Kreme and Fatburger but I ate it one of the local café! Also loved to been able to eat at the cheesecake factory!

The Ski slope!. The place to visit if you have children, amusements, bowling the ski centre and lots of children's shops. Bit dated compared with the Dubai Mall although is being upgraded and extended to include a new cinema.

Well worth a visit. Was told this was the biggest shopping mall in Dubai until they opened Dubai Mall, its still worth a visit not just for shopping which covers all budgets, but there's also a huge supermarket & a ski slope!
Shopping Experience. For Everything you need, Mall of the Emirates is your place to be. Especially Splash, Max and Shoe Mart. The things I bought there still marvels us.

So many shops. Several visits to this venue and always getting lost, convinced that all outlets have never been viewed.
Thousands of people at busy periods in the evening - avoid 6-9 if at all possible - and just do not consider using the food-courts the noise level is astonishing - unless you have Bose earphones of course!.

Dubai Mall is better. Unless you are here for the attractions other than skiing (i.e. indoor skiing), then I'd recommend the Dubai Mall over this one. They both have pretty much the same stores, and it's true, Dubai Mall is definitely more crowded, but if you have limited time, I wouldn't bother with Mall of the Emirates.

Hold onto your hats. It's..... A mall..... Yes it's big. Yes, there's a metro station with walkway attached. And yes, there's a marks and spencer. That's all folks, not much else to write home about. Maybe Kate Spade. ......

Not as crowdy as Mall of Dubai. This great mall is less crowded than Mall of Dubai, yet very contemporary and classy at the same time. High-end luxury shopping available with a lot of brand stores. Even good bargains can be made in many shops - especially jewellery, clothing and watches.

One of our favorite malls. You name it and it's there.. Lots of shopping stores, movies, electronic shops, restaurants, high end shopping, skiing, penguins, carrefour etc etc! One stop shop... Though parking is a problem on weekends, but excellent place. It's even connected by metro... So fantastic!

Great choice of shops & dining. Spent several hours here in between shopping and waiting for a friend to return from a nearby business meeting.Found the second cup coffee shop near to M & S / Harvey Nics & Debenham as a good place for snacks and coffe etc and a place to wait and watch the world go by!Some really good shops here to suit every taste and we finished off with an early dinner in the very good food court and a selection from the Thai Express.Plan to return at some point and visit the ski slopes which is another distraction here! Plus point as with most of the malls here is that if you are driving the parking is free.

Excellent mall. This is an excellent mall and you can get almost everything here. There are many restuarants here and an excellent food court. We particularly like the ski dubai area which is great fun for kids. It is also well connected with the metro.

Snow Skiing ? in Dubai. You won't believe it, they have skiing at the mall. 5 ski runs to support 1,000 + skiers. It was just amazing to see the facility. They even have Penguins! The mall has ever shop you'll ever need. 1 of the food courts had to have 25 different types of food available. This is a must see activity when in Dubai.

A GREAT PLACE TO VISIT. Well the mall is really huge. The famous Dubai ski can be located here. World class shopping centre with lots of sights and sound. The Emirates has lots to offer including the fountain.
Close to metro. Good mall and a short walk from the metro. It is having some renovations at the moment but that doesn't affect the shopping experience

Awesome shopping experience with mate's.... While having a relaxing time decided to go for little shopping with my friend.MOE is not the best but worth to have look on it.filled with fancy shops.various cuisine in food court.and ski dubai the best indoor snow world.

Large!!!. Although not Dubai's biggest it is arguably the busiest of the Dubai mega-malls. There are numerous shops supported by food malls, multiplex cinema's and a huge indoor ski slope. Recently a large extension has been built and it contains top end fashion labels. Another extension on the roof is now being built.The best time to go if you are looking for bargains are in the summer and winter sales.

Sprawling mall with boutiques and a hypermarket. The mall is rather spread and the signature attraction here is the Ski Dubai. The mal has boutique outlets selling branded items and also has a Carrefour Hypermarket selling bargain items. Got some cherries and grapes which were awesome. There is a food court at the eastern side (near Carrefour) which serves a wide variety of food ranging from AED15 onwards. There is also a McDonalds and KFC in this food court.

Good choice but expensive compared to UK. Great mall but don't bother if you're looking for different brands than you find in the UK. One of the first shops we came across was Debenhams! Didn't go in as can do that at home, though I realise the goods they sell will suit the local area's market so could be interesting! Good choice of shops and it is huge as everyone comments on. I preferred the Souks etc to see a bit of Dubai's culture, but worth a visit.
Shop untill you drop. Huge shopping mall with food courts, very clean, Nice atmosphère, from cheap to very expensive, super Christmas décoration and already a lot go shop with sales discounts
good place for shopping. its close to Metro train station , convenient, with lots of options for shopping . its worth of visiting.
Good option. Mall of Emirates is good shopping place. Don't miss the Ski Dubai at this mall. Also the shopping is less costly than at Dubai Mall.

Mall Of Emirates. Very attractive Mall full of products with well reputation and very competative prices,
very good location,
Only good thing was Ski Dubai. The only good thing about this Mall was Ski Dubai unless you are interested in shopping. I wish I had given more time to SkiDubai (at least 5 hours)

Hugging pinguins: unique and magnifique expérience. Clean, spacious shopping mall with lots to do. We went inside ski Dubai for a pinguin experience. This program supports research. Trainers have lots of knowledge, you cab tel that the penguins know the teachers well and trust them. The experience is 40 minutes. You receive clothes ( jacket/ trousers/ socks, gloves and shoes) and will meet two different species penguins. You can take time to meet, touch and look at the pinguin. A Professional photographer takes pictures which you can buy afterwards ( 100 dirham each or package deal if they took a lot of pictures). You will receive a hard copy and you can send the picture to an emailaccount. Great and unique experience which makes you smile and happy!

Mall of the Emirates. Great everything that you want a huge Carrefore.Food hall amazing had breakfast and lunch at Toast nicely cooked and very reasonableCurrency exchange got a good rateShops amazing lots of sales on at the moment especially at CentrepointAlso when you go by Metro it isn't as far to walk like other mallsIn all a great shopping experience
Beautiful space with energy. This is a great mall. It is beautifully laid out and is undergoing some significant renovations that should be done in the next few months.
Indoor Ski Slope. Big Mall with many expensive shops. Carrefour supermarket was worth a brose but the highlight had to be the indoor ski slope complete with ski lift and snow.

Fantastic place that has it all. This mall is fantastic.It has everything from food to currency exchange.We stayed just a minute walk from this place and were shopping/eating here everyday.Huge selection of shops and for every budget.There is something for everyone in this mall.Try eating at the Cheesecake Factory.

Mall? Destination? Hang out?? All in one. Mall of emirates with its amazing ICE and Snow Unit, too amazing stores from LV to IWC watches is an amazing destination. And, what to say about food, you have all kinds but do try the japanese and the African ones in the stand-alone section and the food court. Check out the tea place ( has a french name!!) amazing teas and the turkish coffee is a must try. Do eat the caramel macaroons!! Go have fun!! and when you had your full and want to head home and do not have the vehicle to go back, check out the taxi queues they serve you water in bottles and also have fans to cool you down!! ( I visited in the summers!!)...amazing hospitality

SkiDubai. Another thing to add to the Dubai Bucket List. Tip: Pack warm waterproof clothes. They do provide jackets and pants, but the gloves are not water proof and we had to exit a few times to warm the children up.

My favourite mall in Dubai. There is a very comprehensive range of shops here, covering designers, high street names and discount outlets. It is a very manageable size too, and well laid out, easy to get from one end to the other.

A to Z. Every thing is here.. Neat and clean.. You got all type of branded items.. Must Visit..An Ice Skating Rink too is their..Ski Dubai offers an amazing setting to enjoy skiing, snowboarding or just playing in the snow

Great Place. One of the busiest mall you will be in Dubai but also one of the best place to be. Not just a home for Ski Dubai, indoor ski resort, but also is one of the largest shopping mall in the world. You will not fail to be amazed with its selection of shops, plus all the big brands in one location. Good place for families and meet ups.
Such a huge mall. This mall has its own metro stop and is where you can try snow skiing at the attached Ski Dubai. Lots of shops and the food court is good. The Carrefour here is huge too.

Only in Dubai! . Ski and shop... what a combination! The kids will absolutely enjoy their time here. Hot outside.. but winter indoors.Lots and lots of shopping. Great food. Leave time if you love to shop....
Must go. If you love shopping , this is the place you must, over and over again...with an unlimited credit card!

I can ski while my Wife goes shopping. The indoor ski slope may not be bothering St Moritz but it is the biggest in the world and a great place for an unaccomplished skier to while away a few hours. And I can keep my Wife happy with some retail therapy- sadly more expensive than the UK. Some great restaurants but unfortunately they are all dry.

Huge. Absolutely massive and busy place. The ski area looks fantastic but we didn't have time to try it out. Even the walls are European style as you reach the slope. Even though it's big its well sign posted and well laid out.

crowded, busy and lively. this is quite a stressful place to go. it was considered enormous when it opened but now seems pretty regular in size. ski Dubai is the main attraction. the Carrefour is one of the better priced supermarkets but, as such, gets hammered. it is a regular stop for residents and a decent experience for tourists. as with most malls, other than those visiting the supermarket, there are thousands of people but very few seem to have bought anything!

Mall of Emirates. This is a nice small it has ski dubai, where u can spend the wgole day in the snow by paying only once u can come out and go back again u can meet and interact with the penguins, there is Magic planet where full family with kids can play games, sit on rides and do bowling as well, there are cinemas u can watch movie, or there is food court a variety of multi international cuisine available for all

Great indoor ski arena. We preferred Dubai Mall for shopping, however the stores seem to be the same just more spread out. Highlight is the indoor ski rink and snow field. Kids can play in the snow or you can have ski or snowboard lessons or have in up close experience with a penguin. Massive Carrefour supermarket if you are looking for groceries. Good to visit.

Great experience. Mall of the Emirates is a massive place that needs at least a day to explore.Its a huge mall with almost all brand.Great place for shopping, food, entertainment.Definitely a must visit place for all people traveling to Dubai.

nice but pricey. This is one of those places everyone will end up visiting in Dubai but not sure there is much worthwhile if you are a westerner. All the brands you will be used to back home are here (in flagship format) yet the prices are equal to, if not greater than, what you would pay back home so I wouldn't go here expecting to find a bargain.Worth a visit just for the sheer scale of it all and perhaps a restaurant visit or 2....but not so much for the shopping.

Every thing you want is here!. One of the slightly older shopping malls, this has just about every store you can imagine, it also conveniently linked to the Metro and has an in-door ski centre!!The architecture is also very good!!
everything under one roof. Huge mall,you will get world's top brands under one roof. Dubai ski is in here. Nice place for time pass. You won't get bore for sure.

Very Nice Mall. The mall has everything, good brands to shop from, a Carrefour supermarket, a Magic Planet, Cinema, and indoor skiings. Also has a massive food hall on the ground floor. Has so many different shops, which vary from clothes, make up, and many more. A lot of the workers come from the Philippines, they're are very welcome and gentle. Quite an impressive mall.

Worth it, if you have things to buy. First of all, I must say I don't like Malls at all. Not even for buying purposes, I'd rather go to my favourite shops. Said that, I recognize how beautifully designed is the Mall of the Emirates. For a shopping addict, this place will be his downfall. It is huge, amazingly huge. From a brand standpoint, may seem as if it only existed if being there. That's the feeling.

A good mall... One of the biggest mall in UAE..It has everything for everyone..Good brands to shop from, Carrefour supermarket, Magic Planet for kids, Vox cinemas & Ski Dubai. Food zones on Ground and 1st floor, with all types of cuisines. A must visit for all..

Big mall -if you enjoy skiing just give it a go. We visited during weekend so it was quite crowded. We enjoyed skiing and snowboarding for 1 hour and after that we just strolled around shops.Harvey nichols store has such a big variety and good prices! Shake shack burgers offers yummy juicy burgers!

It's a mall. It's a big mall and you can walk around and have lunch there. We are not shopping addicts but we did want to seen the inside. The indoor skiing, very well done but nothing spectacular to us since we live in Canada and have plenty of snow here. It's different and we can see how big Dubai's limits are.

Amazing mall with lots of choice..... This mall is great and has loads to offer, it has tons of places to eat and there's an indoor ski centre as well as a cinema. There are also plenty of desert parlours too. And all the shops you could need including a huge hypermarket 'Carrefour'. Definite thumbs up.

Wow Place. Very convenient and near to my hotel Cassells Hotel....just a five min train ride to this mall. It has one of the wonders, In door Skiing plus plenty of shopping centers ranging from clothes, shoes and electronics plus movie theatres. Its worth a visit when you are in Dubai

Nice but nowhere to sit!. Nice mall, not as spectacular as other malls but with lots of useful stores. It holds the largest store I've ever seen - Carrefours. It makes super Target and WalMart look small. After 2 hours of shopping I could not find any place to sit other than in a restaurant or dining establishment. Great marketing tool but I doubt I will frequent this mall as much as others.
Great Mall. Large and LOTS of options for everything. A must visit. Clothing stores, nails, spa's and lots of different choices in food. Taxi line is pretty long in the early evening beware

Always a pleasure visiting this mall. The variety of stores in this mall are just perfect, ranging from down to earth stores like h&m running up to Louis Vuitton and the likes. It has 2 great food courts with plenty of options, a PF Changs and other independent restaurant options. Conveniently connected to the Mall of the Emirates metro station, it is always such a pleasure visiting this mall. The large Carrefour supermarket seals the deal.

Horrendous customer service - beware!. My wife and I both bought an iPhone 5S when it came out. As long as nothing goes wrong with the item you may get a decent deal here ("decent" - it's Dubai after all), but beware if you need assistance: We have been left out in the cold and had to experience the incompetent complacency of Micro's management.When my (pregnant) wife misplaced her purchase receipt of her iPhone and required an invoice-in-lieu (as requested by Apple to unlock the phone after one too many wrong passwords), the Dubai manager Mr. Shibu could not care less about her, a customer who paid in excess of AED 3000 for a product he provides: He told us bluntly on the phone "Yes, I refuse to provide this invoice". The issue could have been fixed with one rough letter on an A4 piece of paper, but Mr. Shibu did not care that my wife requires a phone in her 9th month of pregnancy - he let us hang to dry. We will now need to buy a new phone. Not at Micro, mind me!!

Best make up find at the Mall. Discovered a make up brand I had never heard of here - Bassam Fattouh - a Lebanese make up artist - absolutely phenomenal make up but very expensive. Picked up some foundation, powders, blusher, eyeliner, mascara, lipsticks...bill was just a couple of pounds shy of £600! However, really worth it as you can't buy this in the UK - only in the UAE.

What can I say? It's a mall!. Very North American in style, the Mall of the Emirates is big! Plenty of choice of shops and eateries but not much public seating if you want to chill out and watch the world go by while your other half spends ages in every shop!

Spacious mall with lots of things to do. This was my first mall visit in Dubai. They had a lot eateries, abundance actually to choose from. As I was new, I opted for my regular Chilli's. Good food and service. Other than that, you have a lot of assistance going around the mall, with 'ushers' at each information board. The Dubai Ski is there if you're into skiing. Didn't spend much time there as I we were tired. Not many places to sit down though to rest. Other than that, it's a worth a visit mall.

Another shopping centre. Bright lights big shops and just more of the same.Nothing really new here although will say ate well which was a nice surprise in a shopping centre.No more than a few hours to walk around and see all the shops we have at home !

Not enough seats. Ok for shopaholics, but would have liked more seats around to help husbands and partners to rest a while, whilst the "lady just pops in to this shop"...Almost too much choice of shops, but I suppose that keeps a competitive edge on prices. Handy for the Red Line Metro.

A must see. This is the most amazing shopping mall I have ever seen. Would have liked more time to do ski Dubai. A ski field in a shopping centre??? Amazing.
Lots of beautiful shops and eateries. The mall is super clean. I will go back

Biggest mall in Dubai. Dubai's vibrancy is supported by its brand new malls that cater to all kinds of people. Mall of the Emirates happen to be the biggest crowd drawer with its ice skiing place ideal for teeners and children who want to experience fun activities being played by people in colder countries. Branded stores are much bigger but not necessarily cheaper. Food court has higher end food restaurants obliging the yuppies and moneyed adults/tourists. They have very good Filipino English speaking employees who are very efficient and warm attending to both local and foreign customers. All malls are directly connected to metro stations via air conditioned bridges with expansive network of walkathons. No need to cross streets or be exposed to the sun.It closes quite late during weekends ( Friday and saturday) and holidays. Usually opens at 10 am.

In from Kuwait and we must pass by mall of Emirates, because it has everything you need or want 😁. My family and I always enjoy walking, shopping and engaging all activities at this mall. Don't miss the ice skating rink and the snow Park and the restaurants that are near it. There are a variety of shops for all ages and some are way pricy. We will definitely pass by the next time we go to Dubai.

Worth a visit every trip. This is one of the oldest (the oldest??) malls in Dubai but still one I find myself drawn back to.For everyday shopping their is a huge Carrefour along with a range of well known shops and independents.
where u can find everything u need. The mall full of everything u need. food, clothes, entertainment and everything else u can imagine.one of the places that you need to visit in dubai for sure
Every thing you could wish for.. I love this place. Everything from Top shop to Dior. So many restaurants to choose from you can easily spend a day here.
A mall. Well, it is big, has all the posh shops you can dream of, but it is just a mall. A visit to check out the ski slope perhaps.

No seating. The mall have no seating at all. My old parents were tired of walking and in the whole mall we cudnt find even one bench to sit on. I dont go there anymore as my wifes pregnant and we cant find a place to sit.

It is very good. This mall is a very good place to visit and shop. It houses the Ski Dubai and the cinemas. The food court is amazing it constitutes the major brands. Also it has Carrefour for your general shopping requirements.

Better then Dubai Mall. I wrote a review about it in 2013 and I am happy to visit it again in 2014 and still believe the same that for shoppers it is better then Dubai mall coz smaller then Dubai Mall in size but far better in collection. I found more stuff to buy in less area then Dubai mall.

Another Shopping Mall!. It is similar to any other mall in Dubai.
The only special thing about it, is that they have Ski Dubai.
Classy. What a lovely mall with everything you could possible want to see. Amazing selection of stores and of course Snow in the desert. Ski Dubai, another wonder in the desert.

It can be as smart as you like but it's still just a shopping mall!. I've been here a couple of times (generally only when i've been to Ski Dubai or have been in the area and required a cab) and it's very posh, shiny and swanky. It can be as grand as it likes but it's still just an over-priced sterile shopping mall, if you're going for a walk wander around Deira, the Marina or 'The Walk' instead - Shopping on your holidays is not entertainment.

Dubai Mall's poor relation. For our latest trip to Dubai, instead of going to Dubai Mall we thought we'd have a look at the Mall of the Emirates. I found the experience confusing, the map I picked up on arrival was a little out of date and misleading, and the mall didn't have the same excellent interactive screens which direct you to exactly which store you wish to visit as you get at Dubai Mall. All in all rather disappointing.

A MUST to experience!!. Mall of the Emirates is a grand experience!! This is a retailing experience not to be missed - my husband and I spent five and a half hours walking around. I might add, my husband is NOT one to enjoy shopping centres but this was something totally different. We sat and sipped beautiful Italian coffee while watching both adults and children enjoying every snow sport imaginable all built within the confines of the shopping centre. Every retailer imaginable seemed to have a shop in the establishment including ALL the world famous fashion houses. The Mall was beautifully clean and tidy, thoroughly enjoyable to walk through every section, staff located on every level to help in any manner possible - the epitome of the retail world I promise you!!

Mall of emirates. This place is a huge shopping mall.Spend entire day there and still could not cover the entire mall.Lots of good restaurants to dine, hundreds of famous brands store to shop at, and of course, there is carrefour for your grocery needs..Getting here by metro train is recommended! Cheap n fast way to get there..

Indoor skiing?. We tried snowboarding here for the first time. While I'm not sure about the sustainability of an indoor ski hill in one of the hottest places I have ever been, it sure made for a memorable day. Get some photos and if you are a beginner get a private lesson. The personal attention will ensure you have a great time even if it is your first time hitting the slopes.
Giant Mall. It is a huge mall. Stores, restaurants, cinemas, hotels. Better to enjoy it at a slow pace. No way to see it all in one day.

Old but still good. This mall has a style - not so perfect as the new Dubai Mall, but has a great atmosphere. People go there to admire the skiing slopes and ice carved statues and it really is an attraction to take a ride on snowboard in - 4 degrees Celsius, when outside is 41 :-)

2nd Home!. Not nearly as crazy busy and huge as the Dubai Mall yet you'll find everything you need and more at MoE. It's got great little restaurants and is easy to navigate - no chance of getting lost here. There's also SkiDubai for more fun if you don't intend only to go shopping. When I use to live across the road from the MoE this place became my second home! Needless to say, you can window-shop and spent no money or you can shop till you drop. Either way, it's always fun!!

Everything You Need...and More. A Shopper's Paradise, the mall--enormous by any standard--offers a practically unparalleled selection of goods and services. The famous ski slope is there; yes, it's incredible to think of a real ski slope with a real lift, inside a shopping mall. But more than that, everything you could possibly need is inside this gargantuan space. From high end Chanel and Carolina Herrera to Top Shop and H&M, you will be guaranteed to find that for which you are seeking. Restaurants are there in a wide variety, too. Cheesecake Factory to ice cream shops to Paul's Bistro. A prayer room is on the top floor at one end. The Tram awaits you at another. Very impressive. Extremely well-done. Perfect location. Kempinski Hotel is attached and most highly recommended as well. MOST HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!

It's huge.. You could possibly get lost in here. If you have an endless desire to window shop, or a bottomless credit card, spend a day here. We spent an hour or so here and enjoyed browsing and lunch in one of the many food outlets. It's also quite fun to watch some of the action on the ski slope through the big glass window. But yes, it is a huge shopping centre.

Only go there if you like to ski!. It is another huge shopping mall, so you don't need to go there if you have already visited Dubai Mall. Same shops, same brands, same food court... but the only difference (that makes it worth visiting) is the Skiing salon. If you're into go there, then Mall of Emirates is a good choice.* You can easily go there by metro (Mall of Emirates station)

Same story as Dubai mall : another large mall.. Like I explained it before : this is not my habitat ! But for those people who like shopping and spending a lot of money, this must be the heaven on earth. Including one of the largest indoor ski domes of the world … imagine : a skidome in the desert, outside temperatures 40-50°C , exorbitant, ridiculous, too crazy for words. But this is Dubai ! Best accessible by metro.

Massive. This is reputed to be the world's biggest shopping mall. It contains most of the usual shops, but in addition you can see extreme high end designer outlets. This includes a De Beers diamond shop, which I've never seen anywhere else.The highlight is probably the indoor ski slope.

Don't miss!. A massive place that needs at least a day to explore. Loads of choice regarding food choices. It caters from supermarket shopping to exclusive designer shops. The artificial ski slope is worth a visit if only to watch visitors while you're having lunch.

Fantastic Shopping experience with an Indoor Skiing. Everything you could possibly want to buy is in this mall. Fantastic range of retail clothes, electronics, groceries, chocolates, souvenirs, beauty products they have it all. All of the international name brands labels you could think of is here, as well as small boutique shops. Wide variety of dining options are available that suits everyone's taste and can satisfy every budgets. They have a food court as well for fast dining. But the main attraction here is the Dubai Skiing, a huge indoor skiing experience. Despite of the size of the mall, I find the shops very organized and very easy to find. So if you are looking for a particular type store such as electronics that they are located in one area and you do not need to walk through the entire mall to look for one. The location is easily accessible by the Metro, very convenient.

Luxury. If you have money to spent or only like to see how the Emirates people spent the money then definitely this is the place. But not only this, here you will have an aquarium inside the mall , places where to enjoy an good meal, terraces across the dancing fountains and much ,much more which I will let you to discover by yourself.
Huge mall with Ski Dubai. Easily accessible through Dubai Metro or through taxis, a must visit for its sheer size and variety of shops. Ski Dubai is avoidable, worth a view from outside only.
One stop shop. My favourite shopping centre in Dubai, you know your way in and out and you don't get lost. It offers a variety of shopping choices, as well as a huge Carrefour and a ski park.
Pleasant. The ski dubai is the main attraction here. Its attached to a metro station and has a decent food court. Nice and clean but always busy (read crowded).

"High end Shopping". Get on some comfortable walking shoes as you are going to need them, as you will be doing a lot of walking at this mall you will find a lot of high end and expensive shops, but still worth going to have a look. As there are still lots of nice restaurants, cinemas and not to forget ski Dubai. A good place to loose a few hours and dollars, just remember when going to any mall in Dubai it is a good idea to be respectful and cover up your knees and shoulders, as this will give you more respect from the locals and better service.

Good ..for spending few hours. Its huge and the legs get cramped taking a tour of the entire mall.The Snow Theme park is an attraction .Tourists are in abundance and its well linked by Dubai Metro.The Food Court here has less choise compared to Dubai Mall and also some of the food joints are scattered..Highly Priced shops, Even electronic goods price is not entertaining.Good to stroll around and very well arranged.

Nice Mall. We went there for shopping and dine along with movie at the cinema. Actually it was very good place to visit in Dubai. If you are planning to watch a movie go direct for reservation then go shopping and dine untill your movie time. You might try the snow city there. Every thing you need in one place.
Lots of shopping. Huge mall (not as big as Dubai Mall) lots of upmarket shops here and the ski slopes looked like great fun.

Not worth it. If you go to Dubai then the mall of emirates is definitely not worth going to. All shops are overpriced and you will end up wasting three hours without buying anything. I would prefer going to the Dubai mall rather than this one.

Mall-to-benè! . Fantastic mall that as the name suggests casters for a higher spending bracket of the Dubai community. Amazing variety of fashion brands for the brand conscious.The mall also features an indoor ski slope! Try a beginner class first for $150 D for an hour. Classes ran at 2pm and 7pm.

Good overall mall. Came here last week mainly for Ski Dubai. We had some time to walk around and window shop. There are a lot of high end stores here. Comparing it to Dubai Mall, which I also visited, IMO this is a nicer mall, more aesthetically pleasing. it looks brighter inside with natural light coming in. However, the Dubai Mall has more attractions (Dubai Fountains, Burj Khalifa, aquarium, etc). I stopped by the Carrefour to get some dates to bring home. I found it convenient to have a market like that at the mall.
Day visit. WOW, what a place to do some shopping!!! It is so large, don't know where to look, too much to see, loads of places to eat, fabulous shops and nice simply people. Simply great.

Great mall. But expensive for sure!. Its a huge mall. With almost all brands. Mostly good for window shopping though, as there was not much discount when we visited. Another draw back is that there is no where to sit. So when you get tired after the walk, it was very tiring.

Shopping heaven. Great shopping mall containing Ski Dubai.
Huge mall with everything you could possibly need or want.

Everything under one roof - great place. Great place for shopping, food, entertainment. This is the place where a lot of original brands are available at great prices, a lot of discounts - you can acquire top quality stuff for a very reasonable price. Definitely a must visit place for all people traveling to Dubai. Parking can be a bit of an issue on weekends. East access to the mall directly from the subway - for folks who use subway in Dubai.
Closer that Dubai mall. This mall is much closer than the Dubai Mall and it can serve most of your needs. Shops are great and there is a wonderful ski slope.
One of my favorite malls. Its a great place to shop and dine ! I really love this place ! Parking could be an issue some times specially on the weekends

Everything you need under the one roof!. A smaller mall but has all the shops and supermarkets which you need. The Carrefour on the lower level is great with their spice and nut section. There are ample cafes, restaurants and food court in the mall.Definitely easier to cover than the Dubai Mall but for more variety and choices, head to the Dubai Mall.

The other Lesser-known Dubai Mall. It's a little bit smaller compared to the Dubai Mall but still impressive when it comes to shopping experience. Many signature brands can also be found here including some famous electronic brands gadgets. I was able to buy a Samsung NX210 here at a great price since its duty-free.

Didn't Really Enjoy This Mall. Well, to be fair we were here having to kill time between bookings at the Burj Al Arab (which is another story lol), so we weren't really in the mood for another mall. We spent time at the Dubai Mall the previous day, but we needed to buy certain things, we wanted to see the Burj Khalifa and the Dubai fountains, so we "got something out of" that mall. At the Mall of the Emirates, we were bored, all the shops we saw were the same high end stuff we saw the previous day and it just didn't have as nice a "feel" as the Dubai Mall.We went to the Cheesecake Factory for a piece of cheesecake to kill time and see the ski slope - we had to wait for a table (only about 10 minutes) and the view of the ski facility was good, but we wouldn't rush back to this mall.
Good for Shopping. wonderful place with lots of shopping,First man made ski good for all age, middle of the Shaikh Zayed Road easy access to Jumeirah Beach,
You cannot see all in one go. They say it is the bigger Mall on Earth, and I believe them! I recommend the zoco side, and the camel milk shop and cafeteria. And the Aquarium, of course!
its good place for shopping. good place for shopping and food... also connected to metro so you can get there very easily.... all multinational brands are there in jewelry & cloth...

Top class shopping, dining and skiing. This is the second largest mall in Dubai after Dubai mall. Main attraction being the Ski Dubai. A shopper's paradise with hundreds of name brand shops, cafes and top notch restaurants. You can spend a whole day just browsing, Grab an espresso from the Emporio Armani Cafe, an American style ice cream from Cold Stone Creamery or for a fine dining experience, try Saint Maxim's for a French cuisine.The malls get crowded on Friday evenings. Great place for people watching.
moe. i find this mall better than other malls . you can actually shop here . brands plus other stores are also there with lot of variety of food . you can enjoy ski dubai also

Ski Dubai Enjoyable but expensive. Ski Dubai in mall of Emirates is good one hour enjoyable experience but with general ticket its waste of money. Not value for money. You have to buy gloves and cap,which they should be providing along with dress to wear in that cold.Secondly in general ticket no ride is included you can just view the ski Dubai.You have to shell out extra money for each ride.You even have to pay for locker to keep your stuff.I believe this all should be included in one ticket. I felt Entire Dubai has some hidden cost in it. Wherever you go in Dubai. You have to shell out extra money everyday.This country visit is not value for money at all. They charge exorbitant amount for every little thing.Basically ripping you of money.

No seating, anywhere!. This mall is great if you want to go skiing or snowboarding, or visit the carrefour for cheap supermarket goods. However, most of the shops are the same as in Dubai Mall, and Dubai Mall for shopping experience just blows the emirates mall out of the water. The big issue is no seats here either, probably to drive people into the restaurants. At Dubai Mall there are plenty of nice big armchairs there to rest if needed.In summary- unless skiing/carrefour- go to dubai mall and give this a miss!

Great Selection of Shops and Restaurants. We took the Metro to the mall and found it to be an easy trip and worth the visit. There are many wonderful shops with pricing similar to what you would find in the U.S. We ate at P.F. Changs and also had some wonderful gelato while watching the people skiing down the indoor slope. If you are looking for a place with a broad selection of restaurants, I highly recommend a visit.
Visit this for the Ski Centre. One of the many malls in Dubai but this one is home to the Dubai Ski Centre - a must to see! The only place in Dubai you'll see snowTIP - Get the metro there

Cinema nightmare. Great mall but it looses a point for vox cinema.The cinema management pay no head to unruly people who shout, talk and answer their phones throughout the viewing. On one occasion we had a family of 5 children none cold have been older than 10 watching a gruesome action thriller for 18,s, the kids where freaking out.Time for vox to manage the viewers experience
Not my favorite mall. The mall of the emirates is a very busy place. Yes their is skiing inside but at the end everything is overpriced compare to other mall.

Mall Of The Emirates. Mall of the Emirates is a managegle mall compared to Dubai Mall. If arriving by the metro its only a five minute walk to the mall itself, currently an extension to the mall is happening, so if you are looking for a Borders it won't be back till April 2015. There is an indoor ski slope, a number of fast outlets, with a couple of decent restaurants. Two hotels are attached to the mall a Sheraton and Kempinsk and yes there are many designer stores to please most people.Mall of the Emirates caters to most taste, if you dislike crowds go early and avoid Fridays, as this is when everyone in Dubai is off.

Huge!! Download the App.... 1200+ shops! There are info desks all over but download the Emirates Mall app to find names or types of shops. Use it as a walking Sat Nav. Very handy if you're 2 couples as we were. Agree to meet as a certain store and certain time and off you go!!!

Skiing rather than shopping. I loved Ski Dubai, it's an amazing experience to be skiing indoors in the middle of desert, the slope is big enough, you can hire or buy all the necessary gear over there.As for the shopping I found the prices quite high and there were almost no sales so I didn't buy much since I was looking for good value.

Good place!!. Ski Dubai!! Thats what comes to mind when one thinks of this mall. Its a must experience place!!The mall is built well and again some of the shops offer great bargains. Its a good place to spend time

Stupendous shopping near Burj Al Arab. This mall is a short driving distance from the Burj Al Arab, and is perhaps most famous for containing a mini-ski resort. I didn't go skiing, though I did wander around the area -- the place to gather your equipment is huge. Lots of children, and the restort includes some fun areas besides just skiing. There are even penguins who come out at certain times.The rest of the mall is fantastic -- just about every luxury, international brand name you could want is represented. The shopping center is gorgeously designed. There are also some souvenir shops and a Carrefour where you can buy items for very reasonable prices. The place is a shopper's paradise and quite a marvel even if you have restricted your credit card. You could easliy spend most of a day here, but don't forget to get out and see the rest of Dubai!

Supa fun. Go here for ski dubai and you will have your life's best time ever. They have maintained a great cooling temperature inside in this heat even. It makes you feel like you are in Switzerland. Games are fun too. Must go for all age groups. I will surely visit again.

You can shop everything at this place. You will get everything at this mall. Food, Clothes, pharmacy and many things. One stop for all needs. It is such a huge that you can easily spend your entire day at this mall. Even if you are travelling alone you will not get bore at this place. It is very near to the metro station.

Shopping heaven. Lots of different shops to browse from the very upmarket to more reasonably priced. Also good range of places to eat. Found the big supermarket to be overwhelming but handy to buy some food to take back to the hotel.
Mall of the Emirates. A shopaholics delight, good restaurants but prices are a bit higher than normal. Watch the fun on the indoor ski slope

Something for everyone. What a fantastic arrangement - the kids and husband go skiing for the day and I go shopping uninterrupted for a whole day. Win/Win. Like most shopping in Dubai it is high end and you will be unlikely to bag a good bargain. It is a wonderful experience just wondering through the centre. We stayed in the Marina area and it is pretty close only a cheap taxi fare. Definitely worth a visit but wear comfortable shoes as you will do a lot of walking.

Above Average Mall Due To The Perks. The Mall of Emirates is an above average high-end mall. What makes this mall special are the various restaurants and original family entertainment venues like Ski Dubai. If you are in Dubai, it is definitely worth a visit.

amazing mall. What is there to say more than WOW.. this gives the expression malls in other countrys and whole new dimension since they have it ALL in these dubai malls. indoor skiing, tivoli/amusement parks for the children etc etc i could keep on for ages with all the things they have here.

Worth the visit. If you are fed up being burned in the Dubai sun then this is the place to go and shop,grab a bite to eat or throw some snow balls in Ski Dubai ! love the novelty of skiing in real snow when its 40 degrees outside .
Wow. this is a Mall on steroids it has everything and you could spend a whole day there easily. The Mall stays open till so late a must

Convenient Shopping. Like:
Short walk from metro, convenient location of Carrefour and centrepoint. Food court (East) is at a very good location :)
Unlike:
Not much
Worth a visit. Not as grand as the the Dubai mall but well worth a visit especially to see the indoor ski slope which looks rather surreal when the outside temperature is 40c

All the essentials of a great mall!. Great way to to keep cool in this hot city and plenty of well known shops to browse through.
Ski Dubai is located in this shopping mall as well.

Over-Rated. I was really disappointed when I visited this Mall on Saturday. Don't get me wrong as a Mall its great - it has shops...so I guess I should really give it 5 stars for that. But its not a tourist attraction unless you like shopping at all the shops you can get in the UK. It's basically like visiting Westfield in London - so if you love shopping you'll love it here but don't go expecting a bargain - we found most products could be bought cheaper in the UK and it really is the same as a mall in the US or UK so if you want to go somewhere with more character it's probably best to visit the Souk Madinat.

Excellent. I just love this mall it has all the best brands around the world a must visit is ski dubai in the middle of the desert which is amazing a must visit for those who are here in dubai for a holiday.

Desingner labels only.. Too far out of town. Will cost you 170 or so dirham to get there by taxi from town or you can use the train. All designer labels you could ever ask for. If this is your cup of tea, then the trip is worth it otherwise save your self the time and visit one of the other malls in town. The food court is rather small and has limited choice.

Worth visiting to look at.. The Mall of the Emirates is an incredibly well decorated shopping centre. Massive pillars/columns and marble look floors.I did find it frustrating that most stores are high end fashion labels, so not good for anyone on a budget. The food options were also quite limited, with a small food court aimed at western food preferences. The shopping mall also has a massive ski slope, which is quite impressive.

Shopping spree. Now, if you love to shop and have money to spend and love luxury- Mall of Emirates is for you- all the nice shops, Gucci, LV, Burberry, I shop at all these places, also if ur budget is lower, there are also places on the lower level floors- there is even a place to go skiing inside, very unique Mall- the Etro and Ralph Lauren and Burberry section have that Italy Theme. You must take pictures, it's a wonderful scenery, there are no taxes in Dubai, so the price you see, is the price you pay- while you are in the middle east, you must visit Dubai and see its wonders, and please stop by my favorite location to shop, Mall of the Emirates

Not quite Dubai Mall but for mere shopping,much better than it !!!. Being a middle east resident and regular visitor to Dubai for shopping, MOE is the mall of choice for me for the purpose, even superior to Dubai mall, why,Well Dubai mall may be huge and has record outlets but its less organized in arrangement as compared to MOE, where everything is better organized and compacted, you want attire, its all in a specific area, ditto for dining and children shops, you can shop more and much quickly than Dubai mall.Another thing is that MOE has all the famous outlets Dubai Mall has but some more, I was surprised when my favorite Hollister was only present in MOE and not in Dubai Mall..As per entertainment, it doesn't have as variety as Dubai Mall offers, but Ski Dubai is nice fun.In short if you are in Dubai for shopping, this is the recommended place.

If you want quality shops then call in here ...... I'm only in Dubai for 6 nights & decided to call into the Mall Of The Emirates during the morning on Tuesday 22/07/14, I caught the Metro from the Emirates Metro Station very close to the airport. It's a beautifully designed Mall inside with many top fashion shops with quality merchandise, not necessarily expensive & really depends what you're looking for or what your budget is !!! Unfortunately you can spend hours in these large Malls and I only spent 2 hours strolling around, mostly window shopping and into one of my favourite stores DIESEL taking a look at the their mens watch selection, being a watch collector and DIESEL being one of my favorite brand name. I would ocassionally forget myself looking for a cafe or a restaurant dying for a coffee and then realising nothing is open due to Ramadan. Overall a good way in passing a few hours looking and most likely dreaming for most of us ?

Worth a visit. This mall is definitely worth a visit. I was pleasantly surprised to find it not as crowded as usual over "their" weekends. Guess since it was summer. Most shops had summer sales ongoing. I like walking with a layout map just to keep some perspective while shopping & also as a reminder to the exits for taxi ramp/hotel shuttles.I like the prices at carrefour supermarket & the well represented food court.Give yourself some hours to explore the mall - don't forget the comfy walking shoes!

Astounding. I thought I had been to large malls before but this place is enormous (or at least I thought it was until I went to the Dubai Mall!). The shopping is comparable price wise to the UK so we found it nicer to simply walk around, eat and watch the skiing! Also the Carrefour is very cheap and I got some wonderful scarfs!Nice to waste a few hours in some air conditioning!

Another Huge Mall. We wanted to see the Ski Dubai attraction which is located in the Mall of the Emirates. Although this mall is also huge by any definition it was half the size of Dubai mall. Nonetheless, it took an entire day to just walk thru. Very similar to the other mall but a little cosier. The Ski Dubai is at one end and we had tea at the little restaurant at the bottom which has windows opening out over the attraction. Amazing to see people trudging thru ice and snow when it is almost 50C outside!

my favourite one in Dubai. mall of the emirates , I love this place, usually it is no one on my list when I visit Dubai , to reach it I use the metro and thanks god that the station is not far away from the building of the mall so you do not need to walk for a long distance to reach the mall , it is full of shops , restaurants and your kids will love it because there is a huge playing area for them , also I love carrefour branch there because it is very large and you can find good deals ,if you really want to enjoy visit it is better to go early in the morning to avoid the crowed and you can spend the whole day inside it and never visit it on the weekendsfinally try to wear comfortable shoes when you go there because you will walk and walk

Profile Ladies Salon Mall of the Emirates. Yesterday I went to salon in Harvey Nichols in MOE,that calls Profile,there is one Lebanese girl,she has cut my hair,she did really nice hair cut for me! I'm in LOVE!!! I forgot her name, but I think her name is Sarah. But ,Oh my God she is an AMAZING! it's really difficult to find such a good Hairstylist in Dubai, but I found one! I advise her to everyone!!! I completely trusted her and did not regret not even second! She is very sweet and attentive master! And the price is not expensive for such a great haircut for my long hair,it worth it! I'm so happy that last night I went exactly to this salon!
Massive. Give yourself at least half a day to fully explore all the shops. Its big and tiring but good at the same time.

Great mall!. This is one of the two malls that I actually like in Dubai. They have great shops, restaurants and ski dubai. However, this place becomes over crowed on weekends. Feels like I'm walking around in Karama. It's better to go before noon... like they say "the early bird catches the worm"

Snow & shop. A lot of high quality shops but with many lower market shops also.
Loads of variety of shops & good & experiences.
We had 4 hours until out pickup do we decided to go for the ski slope & penguins encounter.
Well worth the visit to chill, considering the 40 degree heat outside.
Great fun !!!

No. 1 shopping mall. It is absolutely the No. 1 shopping mall in Dubai. It size is great and shops are wonderfully spreader over. You can enjoy shopping, eating and lots of entertainment in Dubai all under one roof. With family, friends and kids! It is a place where you must go if you are in Dubai

Lovely place. This place is great compared to the madness of the Dubai Mall. A little further out of main Dubai but a free shuttle from the hotel handles that.
Shops are well priced and everyone is very friendly and helpful.
A must go :)

Mall of Emirates vs Dubai Mall. Malls are an important part if you are visiting Dubai. Two most popular malls are Mall of Emirates and Dubai Mall. If you have time constraint and have to choose between either of the two then my recommendation is to visit Dubai Mall. Dubai mall has a better range of stores as compared to MOE. Plus you can also visit the underwater zoo and Ice Rink (ice skating) if you want to have while away some time.
Worth going. Dubai mall has stolen its thunder but still worth a visit as sizes are available here!you have most brands here...good restaurants!Ski Dubai is fantastic...imagine snow in Dubai!!

Do the Penguin Encounter. On visiting the Emirates Mall we came across the Penguin Encounter. For about $50aud we hired snow clothing and boots, we were given gloves. We then had 1/2 hour in the ice rooms that they have there with a guide and we had our photos taken with a gentoo penguin and we were able to cuddle and kiss a King Penguin. One of the best experiences of my life!!. The whole ski run and toboggan run looks amazing, especially in the middle of Dubai. Well worth a visit!!!

Great Mall. This Mall has everything you could possibly want. Food Courts are great with some great choices to choose from. Best spot to eat is "The Coffee Shop" next to Carrefour, It has great Coffee and food and very good prices. Shop choices are fantastic.Ski Dubai is a must see at the Far end of the mall.The Metro is linked to the Mall and is short walk.
