shoes, shoes, oooohs, and booze. this is reputed to be the largest mall in the world - and I do believe it is because it done wore me out!! and I. love love LOVE to shop! it is bizarre, however, to see the women dressed all in black, their faces and entire bodies covered with veils, carrying multiple shopping bags from Jimmy Choo, Armani, and Valentino, When do they wear the stuff?
best mall in dubai. best mall in terms of shopping variety, multi brand stores, food options and entertainment, cinema etc.

Mall of the Emirates,Dubai,UAE. It is a amazing Place to visit,its one of the best attaration is Ski Dubai.appro. there is -2 to -5 Celcious temprature and it experiance of cool place.it was a fantastic experiance to me and my family.very big mall as well as directly connected to the metro train service.must visit once in a life.
A great shopping complex. A very clean shopping complex. Good food and great shopping. The main attraction is ski Dubai, an indoor man made Ski slope.

Mall of the Emirates. This place is enormous. You could easily spend all day in the lovely air-conditioned atmosphere. There are no end of top of the range, well known stores to browse around, all with top quality merchandise on sale. One floor is dedicated to every eatery under the sun and caters for all nationalities. There are also play areas on most floors. The whole décor is amazing and the ground floor boasts a massive wall aquarium full of sharks, stingrays etc. from very large to the smaller species, and numerous other types of fish. There a fountains dotted all around and my particular favourite was the one with the divers (pics added). There seemed to be a surprise around every corner. As with most attractions in Dubai this Mall is easily accessible via the well-operated, clean, efficient Dubai Metro. We spent the whole day around the Mall, Burj Khalifa and ended the evening watching the Dancing Fountains whilst having our evening meal. Would certainly recommend a visit here, and intend giving it another visit next year.
Great cinema. One of the best malls in dubai ! The cinema was great. Nice restaurants with good stuff. It was ine of mu best times in dubai !
Excellent . Suggestion for the Cinema to have movies appropriate to the Arab Families.Comfort facilities are available .Nice for spending a family time.

This is place is amazing!!!. Guyz r u going to Dubai?then don't miss this place...this is so awesome that you don't err feel like leaving the mall.go out to the car park at the basement if you wish to see all kinda luxury cars.Rolls Royce,Bugatti,Lamborghini etc.Dont forget the Ski world too.go for a movie.there's a cool theatre.Before everything don't forget to take more cash with you...

Love this place. You could go by the metro the station is directly connected with mall. Do not miss going to Ski Dubai there a worth visit. You could do other activities such as watching a movie or even playing at magic planet .

Best Mall in Dubai. We loved this mall and the whole experience. For the kids there is Magic planet and also there's the Ski Dubai area. More shops were "our kind of shops" Great coffee places and restaurants. Easy to get to using either cheap taxis or cheap Metro !
Best Mall ever. Want to go snow skiing in the Dubai desert? kiss a penguin at the mall? Or just go shopping? This Mall has it all. Don't miss it while in Dubai.
awesome. awesome place.each and everything you can get here. but expensive.neat and clean place.and i would recommend a visit to the mall.

Snow in the desert...! +4D. I visited the Mall of Emirates for couple of times now; On the 26th July to watch a 3D film (Steps Up).( But You have 4D theater facilities also).The various types of shops attract you for no reason.The most unique feature in the Mall is the snow section (Ski Dubai).(In Dubai Mall you have snow skating place which is much smaller than this.)Here you can try almost all the snow entertainments as in Europe...!Great work by human creation... ;) I mean snow in a desert...!

1400 stores and a Ski Slope. This was our first Mall visit in Dubai.... 1400 stores, an indoor ski slope.. If you need a few hours out of the sun, I would recommend a visit to the Mall. When we go back there, I am deffinately going skiing!!

2nd biggest mall after dubai mall ( in UAE ). This mall is great its located in near al Barsha Area almost near from JBR .. This mall contains everything from clothing ( all kinds of brands ), Carefour , even cafes and restaurants .. There are 2 hotels in the mall ( Kempinski hotel ,cant really remember the name but its something with "man" ) there is also a metro station that stops near the mall .. Also there is Holiday Inn hotel near the mall ( if your thinking of cheaper rooms ) .. The most known thing in this mall is "Ski dubai" its a closed area in the mall that you can ski or play with snow there are 2 cafes there ( down and at the up are that you can go to using a telefriek ) .. Also if you don't know how to ski you can join the ski school to learn .. The clothing , boots , gloves , and socks are all charged when you pay for the entrance also you get a locker to keep your things in and safe ..

Big Mall, no seats... The one bad thing about this Mall is they don't have seating around for husbands to wait for their wife's.......they have the Ski Dubai center inside which is great for a bit of skiing in the desert. There are a lot of high end shops and a few great entertainment areas for kids. If you go to the valet parking area at the front you will see the most expensive cars in the country, the valets leave and swap them around leaving the most exotic out for display.

We absolutely loved this mall !!. We visited this mall on more than three occasions while we were in Dubai. Loved the variety of shops that were in the mall and were very pleased that prices were not over the top. Unfortunately, we did not get a chance to visit the Ski area, but from what we saw, it did look like people were having a good time in there.We were also super impressed that shops were open until 1:00am. (This if course was during the Dubai Shopping Festival).

Very Impressive Mall. Not a real shopping kind of guy, but if it is your thing - may as well come here. I have heard so many things about his mall, I had to finally go see it. Went with my lovely wife, who was not impressed at all. Nearly everything elicited the same response: "I can get that at home, cheaper."She did break down and buy a pair of shoes at Aldo - because her shoes were hurting her feet.Otherwise, it was an evening of people watching.The skiing is the big deal for people here. Of course it is - it's a desert!!! A bit pricey in my opinion; but again, "it's your thing - do what you wanna do."It is gorgeous, a little low key, but still a nice outing for an evening.
Mall. Nice mall went to Ski Dubai really good, loved it, worth doing. 5*.Price 300 AED includes ski outfit and boots gloves, but not skihats which has to be purchased separately.

Shopping experience. The Emirates Mall is a wonderful shopping experience and if you cant find something to suit you then you have no imagination. There all all kinds of shops from the main stream high-street shops to the most expensive boutiques. But If shopping is your partners pleasure you can watch or join in the winter sports on the Mall's ski slope and Ice rink. you can even take in Apres Ski in the excellent restaurant that adjoins the winter area.

Very classy mall. The architecture and spaces within the mall are really impressive and classy..they have a Rodeo Drive equivalent and its definitely 'high street'They have a good variety of eateries and their very own 'ski' experience as well.Visit the cheesefactory if you can while in the mall for a sumptuous meal

Still a fantastic Mall!. Well this mall has everything, as well as being on a huge scale the quallity of the build and fittings is stunning. Many countries in the West would simply dream about having something like this. If you are driving, the Mall has its own three lane motorway spur to entrance the car park, so there are no delays on entry and exit. You can spend hours in here, from the huge cinema complex, the Carrefour shopping, and Ski Dubai, which is really quite amazing. A completely different world and one you will never forget.

Beautiful Environment. We had a great shopping experience. Our hotel was close to the mall so we could easily take a walk or pick a taxi for just 15 d'rhams. The toliet in the mall was clean with sparkling mirrors for selfie' freaks like me. The mall is always open 24/7 for great shopping for both adults and children.

Great Shopping Experience. Had an awesome experience shopping at this Mall. You will find most international merchandise brands at good prices. Trading hours flexibility are a major benefit if you can only shop after hours.
All in all great shopping mall in Dubai.
Wonderful. I visited this mall 4 times in one week, I bought some amazing stuff, i went to the movies there, i had lunch twice, you'll find what you want there with a reasonable price.

Nice!. I was especially thrilled by the presence of Carrefour at this Mall. It has a lot of stuff and affordable too. The Mall also featured a Cinemas where my kids and I had a great time watching a movie. Movement in and out of the Mall was quite stressless and we enjoyed every bit of our time in there.

Awesome Mall. Great mall, Plenty of shops and restaurants to choose from. The mall also houses Ski Dubai. This is a must see when there. snow when its 40c outside is pretty cool. If your into your cars its also good fun going to the valet to see all the luxury cars. lambs, ferraris, G wagons etc.

Eerie out of world feeling. You get a feeling of being in another world entirely once inside the Mall of the Emirate. If you are with your family then don't hope to come out within 5 or 6 hours - it not practicable, at least it wasn't for me. Am quite impressed by the level of planning, the depth of commitment and the strict adherence to aesthetics manifesting in that huge mall. Kudos to the Emirate.
Good place. This mall is practical because of the location you can just hop in from the metro, other than this it's like any other mall.

Shop in Dubai. Went to see the ski slope inside the mall, which was the size of a soccer field. A real snow at zero degree, and outside the mall is a burning 40 degrees. The rail stations were fantastic, air conditioned. The only thing was negative is the fact that Ramadan rules applies to westerners. It would have been nice to have lunch at the beach and enjoy a few drinks with it.

Awesome Mall. We spent hours in this Mall (which wasn't intensional). We thought we would pop in and have a quick look around and leave, how wrong was I! It's got everything including a Ski slope. Really good shops and cafe's too. We came here during the week and it was very busy so I can only imagine how busy it gets on the weekend. Very well organised Mall especially getting a taxi back to the hotel. Definitely worth a visit when you are in Dubai.

Skiing in a mall. We went to this mall specifically to go to Ski Dubai. The mall itself is large. Many shops to see and purchase anything you desire. It was fun to look at all the luxury cars pulling up as we waited on a taxi at the end of the evening.

This has plenty of shops and cafe's. We went to this mall a few weeks ago, it was like a tardis, it has so many floors and also many different arms off it you could be there all day just finding your way around. We found this a bit expensive compared to other shops we have been too, you will find just about every store you can imagine, lots of cafe's and eating places, there is a free shuttle bus that you can get from the exit near the fountain at the cafe part of the ground floor which can take you to and from different hotels and areas, this can be very useful instead of paying for taxi's ask at your hotel reception they should have information for you.

One time visit mall. It's a average mall in my view..ski Dubai is the only place which I only liked..nothing else special..in my view ..Dubai mall is far better than emirates mall..if u want to enjoy in ice and skiing..then this is a best place..

Plenty of shops to keep you busy. I went here most nights after being out all day as it was really close to my hotel. Everything is open really late so its a good place to grab some dinner and have a browse to pass the time after a day of sightseeing.
Ski Mall. The main attraction is Ski Dubai. Approcable by Dubai Metro and worth a visit. Visited this place before Christmas and the atmosphere was great.

Best Shopping center. Perfect Shopping center with plenty of shops and attractions to see. Two food court gives you heaps of options to choose from. Very easy to catch a taxi or metro to
Felt like it was busier then Dubai Mall

Very cool mall to visit!. We had a chance to visit the Mall of the Emirates and really enjoyed our experience. We were in Dubai during Ramadan so during the day the mall was very quiet. As soon as the sun went down, people came out of nowhere to feast and party! Very cool experience!

A fun Mall for all ages. This mall is a little easier to navigate (as compared to Dubai Mall). All big brands have their shops here. Luxury brands--a few have their showrooms here. The main attraction of the MOE is Ski Dubai --an indoor, themed, man made ski slope! The Mall has parking on all 3 levels--free for the first 4 hours on weekdays and completely free on weekends. The Mall is also on the Metro red line. Taxis can be found at the front of the Mall (near the Debenhams and the Harvey Nichols entrance). The Mall has 2-3 banks, ATMs, pharmacies. A large supermarket, Carrefour, is on the ground fl, M&S,or. INOX theatres is located on the 1st level. There are 2 food courts on the ground floor and 1 on the 1st level. There are also restaurants near the movie theatres. Big Bus tours can be booked at the Big Bus Counter --on the ground level, just beyond the Lifestyle shop.Shops include Crate & Barrel, Tavola, Lakeland, Converse, Hollister, Sun Sand N Sports, M&S, Debenhams, Harvey Nichols.

This us a true shopping Mecca, quality clothing at Shanghai prices.. I found this mall to have better priced bargains than the Dubai Mall (the worlds largest shopping centre). I bought way more clothing than expected, even some everyday clothing and tourist t shirts in the massive incredible Carrefour (must be 2-3 tones larger than any other carrefour I've seen in the Middle East or asia). The choice of fruits and bakery goods in this Carrefour was amazing, just jnteresykng to visit and see the labels where all the fruits originate (from Africa, Americas, asia and some even from New Zealand and Australia). No bad prices either, considering where you are in the world and quality of good was excellent, by far best fresh produce on offer I've seem in the muddle east!! The chattels and finishing a of this mall are a tad better in my taste than the bigger more famous cousin too. Plus the coffee shops and restaurants here are more international and cheaper too.Hence, if you want a little time out and not on a tour bus, have 1 night at least at a local hotel (both novatels are excellent for European and asian tourists and Walking distance to the hotel, 12-15 minutes in the oppressive 40s heat but not long out of the air con)!!!!Must see! This is where the locals go.
It has it all. Everything you could ever need and want, so rubbish shops in here, only the good ones... i great place to shop, eat and get lost in.....
It has EVERYTHING!. It's big, it's spotless, it has everything your heart could possibly desire, or wallet afford, the air-conditioning is super effective, it's a one-stop shopping trip!
mall of the world's greatest/best country. beyond excellent ! many facilities and the best place for shopping. Harvey Nichols, ski dubai, magic planet...

emirates mall. this houses the emirates mall and once you enter, it is another world.. such a huge mall and it will take at least one day to roam around the entire area.... but do not recommend to buy goods... you will get cheaper ones outside.

One more biggest Mall. Dubai is a heaven for Shopaholics...!!! One who is not interested in shopping has to see the incessant flow of footsteps into the mall. Not everyone is for shopping. some buy their memories of the dubai trip. Some buy to bag their excitements....!! still a thousand step enter this mall at each second, I believe.....!!!!

Nice and quite. Very nice and quite mall, on the outskirt of Dubai. Has all you need and good thing if you come from Abu Dhabi you dont need to drive tough the bad traffic to reach the mall. very clean

Big mall. We went here during Ramadan so it was pretty quite which was good because there was no crowd. Some shops had sales but otherwise all the brands are pretty expensive. What is impressive is the snow slope. That is cool. I would go just to see that. All the luxury brands are their aswell.
must see. big, comfortable, easy to navigate, and a ski slope! If in Dubai, you must see this mall...carve out plenty of time.

FANTASTIC. never before have i seen such a big shopping complex with so many facilities in it from coffee shops to ski slopes to hotels , feel reassured there is something for everyone , a must visit in Dubai
Variety with convenience. This Mall has everything. Metro station makes it easier to access. Good food courts with varied choices. Prayer areas for men and women. A great place to visit.

Another amazing shopping place. Loved the array of shops and comfort. The mall also has an indoor ski slope that is worth visiting. You could spend a whole day here if you want to as it is large enough but I would recommend spending half a day at both the Dubai Mall and the Mall of the Emirates.

A Quick Trip to the Mall of the Emirates. We passed lots of very pricy name brand shops, but got an excellent deal on electronics near the entrance near the Metro. The Carrefour Hypermarket has everything, at very low prices. We found souvenir t-shirts and caps there. We only had a few hours during a long layover, but we found what we needed quickly. I would love to go back and spend more time exploring. We missed the big attractions, but the kids were hugely impressed with the toyshop.

All you want & more. With everything you'd possibly want under one roof, including an entire Alpine skiing experience with ski slopes, this Mall is where you need to go on a scorching hot day. There are mega-stores (including Virgin's own), fashion boutiques, designer stores, food courts and American brands that'll tempt you & your credit cards to splash out. We did.

Wonderful Mall. This mall is too nice, it is too easy to access and find every shop, it is contain more needed product, and nice food, I think this mall can help all to find the product they need and no need to go to other mall.

Local. This is my local mall, I go here at least once a week, great shops, great food and not too expensive! Parking is a bit iffy at the moment as they are renovating the mall but all in all a fantastic shopping experience!
Shopping Heaven. A place that you won't able to conquer all shops within a few hours. Excellent choice of restaurants, cafes and retail shops. Connected with Ski Dubai.

Perfection in everything. If you are visiting or living in Dubai, this is the place to visit. Shopping, food, entertainment etc. Packed in one roof. Always updating.The best part is all the major brands are there. From 1AED ice cream softy to 20 MAED villa or even more, you get it all here.

Of all the malls I have been to, this is one of them.. Seriously people, it's a mall. Yes it has an indoor ski hill, yes it has every store imaginable, yes it has ridiculously high end stores for toddlers but is this why you travel? To shop at the same stores you can in practically every country in the world. I don't really get it but if this is your cup of tea then the Mall of Emirates won't disappoint you.For more on my thoughts on Dubai Mall Culture see here - http://www.thislifeintrips.com/dubai-mall-culture/

Excellent experience. As we were in Dubai we visited Mall of the Emirates and of course we had to visit Tiffany & Co. As we walked in there were two people serving and couple of customers waiting so we thought we would go and have a coffee and come back.after about 90 minutes we went back and met the boutique manage Naseema who was fantastic, she was patient, knowledgeable and gave honest advice in regards to jewellery. If you ever visit of the Emirates the mall and are going to buy Tiffany jewellery then always ask for Naseema as she is an asset to Tiffany & Co. Brilliant service!!!!

Mall with a very beautiful architecture !!. The mall is in great location with almost all top brands. As soon as you enter the mall you will feel as if you are in a beautiful palace ! The architectural design of the mall is very beautiful representing the ancient art of middle east architecture ! One could spent all day at the mall and will not be bored. Lots of things to do like visiting sky Dubai within the mall where you can take part in various snowboard activities like ski, snowboard, Zorb, meet penguins ! so I definitely recommend you to visit the mall !

Best Shopping.. Visited Mall of the Emirates twice with family. The Money exchanges give a great rate for currency and there are a lot of ATMs. There is a wide variety of shops some expensive but some not. They had everything we wanted there and is easy to get to by taxi.

Shopping and Dining. We enjoy shopping and dining; however parking can be a total nightmare especially on the weekends. Arrive early OR be prepared to be very patient. You can literally spend an hour trying to find a parking spot.

shopping paradice. Emirates mall is Dubai´s second biggest mall, but i think it is the best. You can find easily your favorite shops. And if you want to do some extra, you can go to Ski Dubai, i´m sure you love it.

You can ski in a mall. What's not to like?. Stop by the store and pick up a liter of milk, half-kilo of butter, and a slalom run. Upscale retailers, amazing fountains, lovely amenities, and lots of diversions make this a good place if one must take someone shopping. At least you (the guys) can choose from lots to do while fortunes are being exchanged at Armani, Coach, Gucci, Prada, and Fendi. Marked down for parking - it took us over a half hour from pulling into the lot to find a place, and 20 minutes after pulling out to clear the exit.

Mall of the Emirates. We visited this mall, after spending a good couple of hours at the Dubai Mall and the Marina. It was extremely busy so felt rather overwhelming. Definitely worth visiting, even if you just go to see the indoor ski slope, winter sports ares complete with gorgeous penguins! Most of the shops were a bit out of our way cost wise, but it was great just experiencing the mall itself. Some great coffee shops/tea rooms where you can relax & watch the world go by. We ate at the east food hall...much better value that the west food hall, if you're just looking for a quick bite! Easy & cheap to get there on the metro, but I would suggest you do it on a different day to the Dubai Mall, as doing them together is very tiring (& this is from someone who can shop for an Olympic sport!!)

Worth a stop!. I was staying at a hotel adjacent to Mall of the Emirates during my stay in Dubai. As the weather is bit above the comfort level for spending an extended period outdoors, I tended to spend some time in the mall. It's a sizable mall, and has a lot of different shops for everyone. It's enjoyable to grab a coffee and people watch, or to go to the theatres and go see a movie. I did enjoy the indoor ski hill, which you were able to watch from in the mall (fishbowl effect).It's worth visiting while in Dubai, though it isn't as large, or excessive as Dubai Mall.

It's a mall!. I decided to write this based on my recent experience with the traffic. The construction work makes getting in and out in a reasonable time almost impossible. In my mind they have ruined the place and it seems competing with Dubai Mall on size is all they are concerned about. A good mall but stay away until they finish the construction work.

My favorite Mall in Dubai. Very nice shopping place - you can find almost everything you need here.If arriving on foot from Barsha having to walk through the carpark can be a little time consuming, noisy and hot - but there seems to be some work going on now so maybe it will get easier to enter.Lots of nice eating places in here and some great attractions to try out or simply take a look at - ie - ski Dubai.

Bigger than expected. Incredible building and it is MASSIVE ! Loads of shops to visit with an enormous collection of things you would never need to buy but its nice to know where you can get them if you have too much money for sense.Ski slope in the middle if you fancy it which has artificial snow.

Beautiful Architecture - Lots to see and do. Emirates Mall is in a great location, and near most of the top hotel brands in the city. The architecture does not disappoint, and has a grand entrance and spiral staircase leading up the foyer to the higher level floors of the mall. When entering the building you immediately are greeted by luxury sports cars and men wearing an overpowering amount of cologne. The smell permeates as you open the doors to the mall and breath in the air conditioning, then slowly fades in and out as you navigate the halls of one of the largest malls in the world. There are tons of options for dining, people watching, and of course clothes shopping. One could spend all day at the mall and not be bored. And last but not least is the notorious Ski Dubai where you can partake in several snowbound activities like ski, snowboard, Zorb, sled, and meet the penguins. There are activities for children and adults of all ages, and the prices are somewhat reasonable, so I definitely recommend you try it, they have all the gear for you and its included in the rental price, so check it out. And if you are not into snow sports, at least walk by and people watch from one of the local bars or restaurants that face Ski Dubai, you will be entertained for hours.

Nice big mall. unless you want to make a stop at Ski Dubai, there's no real need to make the stop here. my husband and I came here just to check it out and kill time. we ate at one of the restaurants and weren't really impressed. the size of the mall and the skiing makes it very impressive.
The top notch shopping mall. If you like shopping then this is the place to go. Even better than the Dubai mall due to a broader choice of restaurants including traditional ones.

Huge mall. I have seen many many huge malls through my travel (Sao Paulo, Seoul, Tokyo, Shanghai, Paris, Panama...) and I have to admit that mall of the emirates is one of the biggest. Price wise, electronics are more expensive than in Asia (even w/o duty) and I was not in a mood to check out the clothing, but sales from 25%~75% will definitely beat anywhere else on the globe :)Also to notice how unreal it is to watch/do snowboard when it is 40C outside 0.o

Surreal snow & ski views. I liked Mall of the Emirates, more than I liked Dubai Mall.OK, it's smaller and less flashy but it's also less busy and has a more unique feel. Despite the almost grotesque sights of an "alpine" ski lodge with roaring (fake, of course) log fires and the snow-covered pistes and chairlifts at one end, I thought MotE had a better atmosphere than Dubai Mall. So if you're into the whole Emirati obsession with shopping malls, I'd say that, in many ways, MotE should be top of your list. And yes, it too has a Virgin Megastore, as well as a Borders.
Average. Very average compared to Dubai mall. Nowhere to sit other than the food court, average mall at best. Anti climax after visiting Dubai mall

The ultimate shopping Mall.... Seriously ladies....Take your credit cards re mortgage the house and GO SHOPPING!!! LOOL it is out of this world it is MASSIVE!! and they have a ski slope awesome Love it a must see in Dubai

Stunning Mall :) :) :). After going to the Dubai Mall, we found this Mall alot easier to navigate, and didn't need quite so long there. Great to go and have a peek at Ski Dubai, and also watch all the Super Cars pull up to the car park at the weekend. Incrediably clean and many wonderful shops to explore. Enjoy!

Excellent shopping. Not the biggest Mall in Dubai but great one were you'll find all you could want in shopping, lots of .u.k shops eg Topshop., Plenty of places to eat and a supermarket. This is also home of Ski Dubai where you can watch people on the indoor ski slope. Well worn a visit. Lots of Hotels do a complimentary shuttle bus.

Shop the world. Anything you want to buy, you'll find it here. Among people from any country in the world you'll find stores from the world's top brands with all the latest products and prices for all the pockets. When locals say there's no life outside the mall, it's not only due to the extrem temperatures you might experience in Dubai, but also because of the wide range of experiences you might live in this mall. Starting from a ice rink at -10º until a visit to the worlds largest crylic glass aquarium.Like many other attractions in Dubai, the Mall of the Emirates is an excelent example of the best things that Money can buy.
Must visit. A very good mall to visit, what with the Ski Dubai, lots of shopping and food joints and conveniently located.

Great mall. Emirate mall is a great mall in dubai. It is easily reached by metro. It has a beautiful design with international markets and restaurants. The most amazing thing is ski dubai which is miracle in that its an icy region in hot city that make you feel you are in Eskimo. Ali Waleed. Iraq

Beautiful mall. Smaller mall than Dubai mall. Loved thAt you can shop for souvenirs at Carrefour. Bought mostly spices, dates, igs and turkish delight. Better prices than at the tourist traps. Go there for the experience. but shop here. Ate burger fuel for lunch, and had shake shack for take out.

If you dont want to break the bank at dubai mall, then go to Mall of Emirates for deals. There is a wide range of shops available from high end to mid range. A carrefour is also located on premises. Decent food court selection and restaurants. There are a number of shops offering sales.

Lots of Sales. This mall was recommended by a friend who used to live here. I was so glad she brought it up; loved this mall! It was a short, easy walk from the Metro (as opposed to the Dubai Mall access from the Metro), had great restaurants inside, and I noticed sales in this one that weren't in the other mall. You can't go wrong with this mall!

Excellent destination for the whole family. Wonderful place for all age groups. Can spend days there and pretty much everything you could want is available. SOmething for all budgets. Best is to stay close by - we were at Ivory apartments - a 3 min walk - wonderful place to stay as well,

Could get lost in the mall!. The ski rink inside the mall was amazing to witness..inside minus 4..people skiing and outside 40 degrees. Victoria secret shop is a place one could get lost in...it was great

Out of this world!. Different culture, different lifestyle, amazingly brilliant!Being from England we are completely different to the emirates including that of lifestyle and boy do they know how to impress! Gorgeous place to shop or even have a wander. It's like walking through a shop for royalty. Must visit!

Just another mall.. W a ski resort. Mall of the Emirates is just another mall of the 50 in Dubai... Tons of stores but with one exception- it has a ski slope/ terrain park and -penguins! Cool to see but 200 aed for 2 hrs and 300aed for the day. Where else can you say you've skied in the desert though?

Every woman's dream!!!. This was my second trip to Dubai and I still don't think I saw every store in the mall! They have great shops and it's all designer names and top quality merchandise!!! The Dubai mall is larger and I think I need a whole full day to complete that mall! They have leather couches to take a rest on a mall of emirates because it's exhausting to walk around! I love it!! I will return again hopefully soon. There is lots if eateries and something for everyone there!!! Can't wait to return!!!

Amazing ski resort in mall. The ski resort is well worth the visit, however everything else is just another, expensive mall. This mall however is cheaper than Dubai Mall. The metro station is in the mall and this makes it convenient to travel around. Try to avoid taxis, the drivers are VERY rude and unfriendly. It seems like you are doing them a favour by using their service. Food court in this mall has some good restaurants.

Large, expensive, nice. One more mall in the city of Malls that is Dubai. Plenty of brands and some hidden gems that I guess are not permanent shops but stalls in the corridors. Overall a very nice experience. Far away from the old city (Bur and Deira) but well connected by the Metro and plentiful Taxi services. Very nice dining options as well.

Buy your souvenirs at Mall of the Emirates Carrefour!!!. It's of course a very nice mall. It is smaller than Dubai Mall and when we were there it had many more discounts and special offers. But the surprise was that the Carrefour in this mall had a large selection of "Dubai" T-shirts at very reasonable price and a fairly large section of the shop was set up as souvenir area where we could buy trinkets like fridge magnets, stuffed toys etc. at a fraction of the price of tourist souks. We saved a bundle by loading up on gifts for the folks back home. I have not seen this in other Carrefours we visited in Dubai / Abu Dhabi.
All you need in a Mall .. :). Whatever you need, you'll find it there! It also has a Metro station where you can go to anywhere in Dubai .. :)
My Experience ( Well part of it ). i loved every second i spent there it is an amazing place i hope id go there again i especially like ski dubai.
Nice experience. Good Shopping destination with international brands. Direct entry to the mall from the Metro Station.
the "small" mall of dubai. This mall is a little smaller than the Dubai Mall, yet a good variaty of shops and leisure. Clean as can be. Shops thend to be a little bit hihg priced

Great mall but not quite as wow as Dubai Mall. Another massive mall in Dubai. Has everything you could want, including the skiing. In my opinion not quite as impressive as the Dubai Mall but if you're in Dubai to shop this is a must-do.

Beats the Dubai Mall. The best part is they have Carrefour, and these guys are offering great deals, almost the same as some places in Bur Dubai area. We got some excellent crockery here, stuff that is not available even if you search online.There are some expensive stores but not as pricey as the Dubai Mall. There is also the Artificial Ski Rink.The architecture is of a sprawling air conditioned Souk, with near endless shops. It would take a full day to see the entire place. Great pictures can be taken against the backdrop outside.The quality of food in the food court is second to none. I would recommend the Pizza Slices [11 - 13 Dhs for a very large slice] and the Lamb "Halab" in the Arabian Express counter next to the Pizza. There is a very god selection of Indian dishes too but I did not try them. Interesting to see the collection in "Splash" show room, very tempting products and very competitively priced.A must visit for couples.

This is where you can go for skiing. I went to the mall of the emirates only for the purpose of skiing even tough it was my first time. nevertheless its again a very big mall. The food court have almost all the fast food brands like kfc, pizz hut, fat burger, karam express, nandos, clifornia pizza kitchen etc...

Shopping and more. I love this place and I tend to come here when ever I visit Dubai. This mall has it all. Great shops with a huge range of prices from affordable to luxury. More than one food court with many to select from. Resturants and coffee shops every where and game place for kids plus Ski Dubai. Also super market for those who need to pick grocery too. Many parking spots and many taxis when needed. Metro stops at the doors. Love this place. Worth a visit

2nd best mall in Dubai. Another big mall and just isn't the best because Dubai Mall is way too awesome. This mall is a bit far from downtown but also in an easy access through the metro. Highly recommend the visit since there's nothing much to do in Dubai and the mall is always a good option!

Huge Mall. Went to this mega mall by way of the metro. You can access the mall by moving sidewalks and a totally air conditioned environment. Only covered a portion of the mall and did some shopping on the ground floor in a store that reminded me of super walmart. Was able to use us currency to make a purchase.

My Personal Favourite Mall!. After living in Dubai for 9 years, I can easily say that Mall of the Emirates is my favourite shopping destination in the UAE. M.o.E is a very large mall (manageable in a day though!) full of all the shops you'd enjoy to visit, ranging from the Designer section, regular high streets, department stores (a wonderful Harvey Nicks) and Arabian goodies.The cinema is great, architecture is beautiful, Carrefour is always fun to wander around (even if you're not doing a full shop, plus my family and I would always buy our DVDs here!) and there is a BRILLIANT playzone (the name has escaped me..) upstairs, with an arcade and fab rides. Food halls are definitely some of the best I've visisted) and you can't forget to visit Ski Dubai! Even if you're not planning on going in, be sure to have a look.There are gigantic windows that give you lovely views of the slopes and the snow kingdom. There's a large car park (I believe they do charge for parking since I moved home), large taxi rank and there's even a Metro station that can connect you to other parts of Dubai for those who wish to use it.

Second best mall in Dubai. I've been here couple of times now and all I can say is that it's next to Dubai Mall in terms of shopping. Carrefour supermarket is also here and alot of shops and restaurants to choose from. I also like the design of this mall and its really big. There's also an attraction here named Ski Dubai where you can go skiing on man-made ice I guess. Here also you can find one of my favorite dessert restaurant, the Cheesecake factory where you can choose lots of sweets and desserts. You'll surely love going to MOE but just be sure you have budget coz you will surely spend alot.

Large Airy Mall. This is a large mall and gets busy over weekends. It is home to the famous Ski Dubai. It is readily accessible from the metro. I went by car however and parking was in short supply when I was there due to renovations taking place that extended into the parking lot. A very large Carrefour is one of the anchor stores and I found prices reasonable.There is a wide selection of restaurants and a food court with both the staple fast foods and various other options. I couldn't resist having some cheesecake from the cheesecake factory.
Huge Mall. Its a dream shopping centre for all shopping lovers. There were so many brands. So much variety. It had an indoor skiing area. We didn't go there but looked nice.

Amazing mall. The mall it self is magnificent. Obviously, with shops galore and the food outlets and restaurant's are of a high quality if a little pricey.The facilities are clean, well maintained and all staff are friendly and courteous.
Mall & Mall. Dubai is all about shopping & shopping.. so you get to see some great shopping place here. Not as big as the Dubai Mall but do see the snow park here.
shopping. good place to shop... some of the shops little pricey.. splash you can look out for good deals... food court is good and have quite a few indian food joints..

Amazing, must visit if love shopping. This place was like no other shopping centre I had been to. It'sMassive. The air con is cold so take a jacket. There is free parking for a few hours. Plenty of nice restaurants and large super market.

Fantastic experience. Visited snow park in this mall. Met the penguins. This was the out of the world experience. But it's very costly and you cant even take your cameras in. You've to buy the snaps from them and they charge quite heavily for them.. But worth visiting once!!

another mall. Dubai is only about malls and shopping.. there is nothing else to do.. so this place is accessible by metro.. good connectivity .. not as big as dubai mall.. ski dubai is the only attraction..
Best Mall. Its a great Mall - Best of the Lot in Dubai; Its very nicely decorated, very good shops and has the best ambience. Its better to do this mall rather and any other bigger malls.

Huge modern mall, lots of shops and activities, come dressed appropriately. Read the warnings on the door of this mega mall...please do not kiss ( in Dubai forbidden for men and women to show affection in public), and women should cover shoulders and knees. this is not a bad idea anyway as the airconditioning is cranked quite high so you might even need a cardigan. The mall has good information spots/maps near every entrance so it is easy to find what you need. the famous indoor ski hill is here too...the shops are zoned so don't think it is all Gucci and Prada. There are many stores selling affordable clothing items as well. You could easily spend a day or more here, and there are many nearby hotels.

a worth visiting mall. Not as grand as dubai mall but still really big and fun.spevially its ski area was great.i would rank it as secong amongst all the dubai malls.after all dubai is famous for its malls.it was a lovely mall.good shopping.
Overprice and unfriendly. It was hard getting anyone to help you here and the shop assistants seem lazy and apathetic, extremely overpriced
What else is there to do. Dubai is comprised of malls for entertainment, so everyone goes there. This was my 4th time to Dubai so after a while of walking through all the malls it got boring.

a top quality mall. i was in dubai recently and i stayed very close to this mall, so i was in and out very frequently. the mall has everything in terms of shopping, with 3 food courts, a multiplex and some very fine department stores. the carrefor one opens till 12 am and has everything at reasonable prices.restaurants are also of a very wide variety, and has a ski area for kids as well. a good way to spend a couple of days in dubai
it`s huge. You need to get a printed guide in order not to get lost in this mall as it is really huge. The prices are a bit higher than in Dubai Mall.

The one with the Ski Slope. A massive mall, only just smaller than the newer Dubai Mall. How they keep malls like this cool in the Dubai heat is beyond me, but outstanding retail and every variety of food you could ask for. Many U.S chains people from other countries have never seen before outside the States. A maze of stores. Only grip is the lack of lifts to move between floors if you have a stroller. Worth a visit even to see the (very packed) impressive indoor ski slope.

Shopping & entertainment with easy access. It’s not as big as the Dubai Mall but it’s not small by any sense either… the interior of the mall has a traditional touch which I liked. The mall is connected to Mall of the Emirates MRT station though a bridge… and unlike the metro link for Dubai Mall this one is a rather short walk. The star attraction of the mall of course is “Ski Dubai”… an indoor snow park. There is indoor game arcade with good rides and games. Navigating inside the mall is a bit challenging as there isn’t enough way-finding signage. In fact except for the entry points I didn’t see any way-finding signage at all. There is hypermarket in the mall too…

Convenient mix of basic to opulence. The mall was connected to our hotel which gave us an array of options for local and american restaurants. The mall itself is massive and has every store imaginable from grocery to high end brands. There are some unusual items including an inter ski hill. If you are coming from the US, you will recognize many of our favorite restaurants including, Cheesecake Factory, Shake Shake, P.F.Changs and of course McDonalds. The mall also caters to local and international options that will give you tastes of local culture.

Ski dubai!. It has ski dubai, what else does it need!Entering the centre for parking was a bit confusing. Went in one entrance and took a turn that said parking, and then directly after that said exit...

Shoppers paradise. Mall of emirates is the second best mall in dubai (The best is Dubai mall ofcourse!)
But nevertheless you will find all the brands you are looking for under one roof with an amazing skiing experience!

Great shopping and skiing. I mainly visited this mall to view the indoor ski slope, and that's a sight well worth seeing. There are over 500 fairly high-end shops, and many realtors hawking real estate to expats. Interesting architecture.
Mall with everything you can ask for :). I'm just missing this place so much :( I had my first ski here on this mall which is quite memorable that's why i will always remember this place :)
One of the best shopping experiences in the world. There wasn't a shop I couldn't find at this mall..it's amazing! Beautiful place and great food options.

Not that different except for the Ski resort. The mall is pretty much the same as other malls. Similar shops. The ski resort is really the only serious attraction in my view. The shopping is all about the same. Easy access to the metro which is a plus.

MALL WITH A SKI. Mall with a ski and a metro link. Walk into the mall alighting from the metro, though not as big as the dubai mall it has all the brands under it roof and a hypermarket too. This mall seems very popular with the locals as we saw a lot of them at the hypermarket. It has a ski complete witha 400 metre ski slope with a ski lift etc. can spend an afternoon here feeling good about skiing in the desert.
Good not great, worth a visit once.. Its a nice place and it has Ski Dubai however being a supercar enthusiast I found the car park more interesting,Wow oh wow.

skiing in the heat. we have visited the mall of the Emirates and although it is not as big as the Dubai mall it has one nice attraction: skiing. It is a funny experience once you come out of the Metro where it is hot and see people going down hill skiing.This country has basically everything you can imagine.

Nothing special - except to see the ski slope. This was really just another mall and not that special (especially compared with Dubai Mall) but it was worth a visit just to see the inside ski slope! An amazing feat. Easy to get to as there is a metro station there.
great mall. great Mall It is huge mall and everything you get whatever you want so if you like shopping so must visit this mall

Dubai mall is better . Have been to both the Dubai mall and the mall of the emirates. And preferred the Dubai mall. Both are very big with a great range if shops. Really depends on what non shopping things you're looking to do

amazing if you can afford it. so if you are looking for Harvey Nicks in Dubai then look no further. This mall has all the best shops in the world and then some. However, if you don't have the budget for Hermes etc, it's just another soul less mall. It does have normal high street shops too, mostly from the UK if you need a new outfit for a night out and also an indoor ski slope if you fancy getting a snow suit on when it's 35 degrees outside!.... We did our enjoy our lunch at Shake Shack. It's like a posh McDonalds but a really great burger and shake

So Big !. I was quite impressed with the selection of shops and restaurants in the Mall of Emirates in Dubai ! Not to mention the huge fish tank in the middle of the Mall ! It was really like to be in Boston or NY City ! It had even Red Lobster !!! WOW !!! And to add to the bonus.. one can hire an in Mall mini taxi ;)

Just another mall.. Visited the Mall of the emirates on my last trip to Dubai. Got to say a very well planned out but yet is just another shopping mall. Has a movie theatre and also the Ski slope which is a nice touch. My only grouch is that there is very little seating space available around and near the stores. The place is quite big but there's no seating available for a rest. You got to find your way to the food court for that.The convenience to the metro is good unlike the dubai mall which is a mile away.
It was normal. Well, it wasn't big but I got confused in it ! Not a lot of shopping I did ! Expensive but well , if u had time try it I liked the food court !

A must visit. It's a five star shopping mall with lots and lots of brands and well known restaurants . What makes this mall a unique is the sky slop which it's a marvelous engineering wonder and the best of all it had a metro station

Not the most entertaining. If it were not for the surreal vision of a snow ski run in Dubai, then this mall would be rather ho-hum. There is a lot less walking from the train station than Dubai Mall, but the shopping experience is far less entertaining. A lot of the shops are high end, and there is no "market" section. If you can only fit in one mall experience in Dubai then make it Dubai Mall.
My Second Favorite Mall in Dubai. This is a well designed mall with high quality finishes that is easily accessible by the metro. Take the metro, parking can be a bit of a hassle on the weekends.

Cozy shopping center. It's a good place for shopping, because they have around 800 shops, but stores are close to each other and it's easy to navigate, unlike Dubai mall. Also the metro station is inside the mall, so for hot summers it is a perfect choice. The most interesting attraction you can see there is the artificial ski arena, it's really nice one.

Typical mall except for unique ski slope. It was a novelty to see the ski slopes. My friends tested it out and described it as a short green slope in difficulty. They say they can now "check that one off the list." From a viewing perspective, you can only see the lower part of the slope and the beginning of the ski lift. It's unique but an expensive recreational gimmick. I'll stick to the real deal on the mountains.

This Mall really has the Wow factor....... This beautiful & quite posh Mall really has everything......from normal Carrefour supermarket to mid range Debenhams to the poshest shops generally just seen advertised in glossy magazines......you'll find it all in Mall if the Emirates......with it's own Metro Station it's extremely easy to get to.......It's the only place in the Middle East that boasts it's own indoor ski slope with proper snow which you can view from the Mall - there are even some Emperor Penguins waddling around the snow to add authenticity to the experience. Access to the ski slope is via the adjacent Kimpinsky Hotel.The Mall boasts plenty of eateries & coffee shops to suit all appetites & budgets or if you just want to rest those shopping weary legs for a few minutes. All eateries offer free WiFi - just ask your waitron for the password for their particular establishment. It's definitely worth making the trip to Mall of the Emirates ......
Not Dubai Mall, but still excellent. Good mall with more or less anything you can think of. Has everything from the more expensive flagship stores to the general stuff. Well worth a visit!

Big Mall ...Easy Access too.... You can easily access this LM through Metro. So many varieties of stores of world class brands and unlike the cheapest ones. But you will find things to shop for every one. Friendly staff cares customers very well. Lots of activities, Sky Dubai is one of them, kids would love most. Shopping, dining, coffee, movies (WoX) ....Enjoyable!!. To complete this fun more than a day is required.
Decent mall.. this mall is more midrange than the high range of Dubai mall, now that's ok - 2 different malls and both very nice, smaller than Dubai Mall - worth a visit

Ski Dubai is nice to see. We stayed at a hotel close by so we came on foot. It is clear that there aren't that many people who visit the Mall on foot, because the entries are equipped for cars and taxi's. To enter the Mall you will have to walk between the entering and exiting cars, that sometimes drive pretty fast. It's a nice mall but not spectacular. It reminded us of the malls we visited in the USA, even with the same stores like Victoria Secret, Nike, etc. The Mall can be very busy, especially during the weekends with lots of shopping families. Ski Dubai is fun to look at through the big windows, so you don't have to buy a ticket to see what's going on.

Incredible. A ski station inside. hundreds of shops and people everywhere. Not an ordinary shopping center. Entertainment for all ages, at all times. Easy access and very enjoyable. pay a visit, you won't regret.

Not the best option for shopping but worth a visit to check out the ski slope (if that's your thing). Was a little disappointed by this mall - old fashioned, pretty standard.To be fair we went to check out the ski slope which was impressive - I was 11 weeks pregnant so no skiing for us which was a tad disappointing. However, good selection of restaurants as we wondered around.

tough time finding stores. even though they had maps at each junction and actually situated all the similar stores together but we still had to search for a restaurant for at least an hr. generally, i think dubai mall does have the same stores so definitely i'll recommend dubai mall over this mall. but if u're looking for a place with shopping and affordable supermarkets it is at moe...
Another great mall. Well, although not as huge as the Dubai mall, it's another good huge mall to shop in. I would suggest them to add some benches for people to rest a bit like in the Dubai Mall.
Another massive mall. Hey, you're in Dubai. Go shop. Check out this and the Dubai mall. Anything one could want is within them. Check out the ski slope and take a photo or two.

Not The Biggest Mall In Dubai, But Still Huge. If you are from the US, this mall will be bigger than any mall you travelled to in the US. Huge. 85 choices of places to eat, and thousands of stores to peer through. It would take you a few weeks just to thoroughly shop at every store. Even bigger is the Dubai Mall, and even bigger than that is Mall Of The World, soon to open around expo time. Shopping here in Dubai is unparalleled, from the supermalls, to the regular malls, to the smaller gold, spice, perfume, and carpet souks, you'll find it to be quite adventurous.

nice place. It is worth going to Mall of the Emirates just to see Ski Dubai. Although this mall has all the normal, middle class or upper middle class stores like The Gap, Victoria Secret, Bath and Body Works etc, it also has the Beverly Hills Rodeo Drive type of stores. I personally prefer Dubai Mall, but this one is nice as well. Furthermore, for those with small children, we were only able to find very high priced stroller rentals at this mall verses Dubai Mall where there were complementary ones available.

5 Star Mall. A complete mall with all family shopping needs & kids entertainment you can find. The most amazing SKI area where all family members can enjoy. Many different types of restaurants could be found (Arabic ,Indian ,Iranian ,Chinese ,Italian ....etc + all fast food world wide brand names as KFC ,McDonald ,....etc). A grand supermarket Carreffor is available with all types of human being needs could be found.A 5 star hotel to be enjoyed .Large car park easily could be used with minor charges as a monitored & secured area .ATM machines everywhere is seen. 5 star toilets you feel comfortable with all accessories. As a summary if you are in Dubai it is a mandatory to at least pass this mall.

The best mall. This is in my opinion the best mall in Dubai.It has everything you need, it is big but not too big and not too over the top.It has some fun events going on once in a while.Sometimes is chaotic when you're looking for a parking space.And if like me you try to take on of the shuttle buses I can guarantee you it won't be a nice experience specially with hot weather, the shuttle buses area needs more seats for those who are waiting and need air condition there.Some times to get a taxi can take a while depending on the day of the week and the time of the day.But even with all of these it is still my favourite mall in Dubai.

Large mall but less interest in than Dubai Mall. It is a fairly large mall with all the same shops than anywhere. Worth a visit for the ski Dubai, good restaurants and some shopping. Recommend Shake Shack for good hamburgers.
Small compared to Dubai mall, but still good. Who should visit?: EveryoneDuration of visit: 2-4 hrsEntry fees: NoBest Part: Ramadan decorationsHow to reach?: Metro or CarCan you take pictures?: Yes

Great place to go!. Awesome mall-has everything you coud need including a grochery store. Skiing is of course awesome! I liked that you could pick up the Big Bus tour here so you can get all around the city. Metro stops here too!

It´s a "must see" -place ,when You are in Dubai. Huge mall!! Easy to arrive by metro.Lots of different kinds of stores, many known labels and not the cheapest ones. But there is everything for everyone and for every wallet..Staff is friendly and really ignores and helps customers. You are being served with capital S! :)Lots of activities f.ex. amazing Ski Dubai. But there is snow in Finland also so we just looked it behind the window ;) Shopping, shopping, shopping and some dining and having coffee.. Even the kids could do it! So many shops to go that no day can be enough to see it all. Going definitely there again while visiting Dubai. This is something you just gotta see!

MALL of the EMIRATES, UAE. Prior to the presence of DUBIA MALL, Mall of the EMIRATES had been the MUST visit Malls in DUBIA. It has been one of the most popular malls in DUBIA. Though over-shadowed by DUBIA MALL, it is still very popular with tourists and locals presently! The Mall has many good restaurants and two food courts (EAST and WEST). Some of the Branded Names are in here. It has the infamous attraction: SKI DUBIA; apart from skiing, there is a daily penguin show. CARREFOUR supermarket is at the ground floor, and is a good place to buy local products like dates, date honey, nuts, saffron ...etc at good price and quality. The Mall is connected to the KEMPINSKI hotel and near to Sheraton hotel. The METRO station connects direct to the Mall. Taxis are aplenty. HAPPY MALLING!!!

Beautifully made, very long. its one of the biggest malls in Dubai..it has the famous SKI dubai, which is an indoor park where the temperature is maintained to let the snow stay there.. good place for kids and adults..you have all famous brands here.. good place to spend time with family and friends

Noizy and easy to loose your direction. Huge mall. All the usual shops + a downhill slope indoors.. The avcoustic made the place very noizy. Some "music" was played all the time. A one-note, two-bar tune repeated in infinite loop. The signs to the shops were much less usefull than those in Dubai Mall.

Shopping as it should be. . We visited Mall of Emirates and Dubai Mall. On my view Mall of Emirates (ME) is preferable in comparison to Dubai Mall, first convenient getting there - metro station is just near by; secondly more convenient orientation of shops, but be ready that it is kilometers, miles of shops, ta nu ego nafig tyt hodit konca kraya be vidno, prices - well don't expect big differences, and what is more amazing for me that in Dubai airport term3 prices are higher than in ME. Pay attention ME and Dubai Mall are biggest shopping centers worldwide, so it is must buy palaces.
Huge shopping centre . Centre itself is amazing lots to do not just shop. Very well maintained and everything is good quality. Range of shops is good

Average. We got the free shuttle from our hotel on the Palm Jumeirah. Not on the scale of the Dubai Mall, but still very large. We visited on a Thursday evening and it was packed and very noisy. There massive choice of branded shops and plenty of restaurants. If you enjoy shopping, then it's a good place to be, but I could not wait to leave. As a mall, it's average.

A different world in itself. Visited alone so, couldn't enjoy to the fullest yet enjoyed coffee at Starbucks and some mocktails at other food joint.It was a 5 hour visit on my holiday from work so kept trying new food and also saw lot of places (within mall). The dancing fountains just at the backyard (near Burj Khalifa) was nice with Arabic music. Went to shake hands with Penguine in the Ski-Dubai - one of the best moments of life when I was sitting next to a 1.5 feet Penguine and it just kept looking at me :) love at first sight it was ..

Mall lift off. Our hotel had a regular shuttle to the MOE and hence we made a short visit. We had already been to the Dubai Mall and the Outlet Mall on our visit so it was just more to browse and maybe get something to eat.There are a good range of shops and at the time of visit some of the high end shops did have discounts. We visited Carrefour supermarket, went to the Cheesecake factory, had a look at the artificial ski slope and still ended up doing more shopping than anticipated.

Huge Place. Mall of Emirates are situated near Al Barsh area in Dubai. This mall has every thing in it whether you say Snow world, Best Resturants, Carffour Supermarket, Long parking, Most expensive jewelry stores, Dubai Metro Station, Electronics market etc. You will get all the things at one place even in the city where things are expensive and available only in some places. Must visit place.

Amazing but slightly expensive. This mall is worth just the visit. Of course prices are slightly higher than what you would find in the same store but in the USA, but not over the top either. The aquarium, the layout, the clothes... just fantastic. A MUST for all us who love to go shopping.

good but not the best. it is a good mall, has a big carrefour inside. the metro link goes straight to the mall . and it has 2 food courts , but for shopping it is not the best . i prefer dubai mall where you see more brands and shops. in this mall u will find the basic shops such as body shop, victorias secret, h and m , marks and spencer ...

Great shopping experience. Be prepared to walk. This place is huge and has nothing but shop after shop after shop. If you can' find it here, I doubt you can find it on Earth. The most alluring feature is the Ski Dubai in the mall. Unless you are going to be skiing, it's difficult to see the entire ski run from the "free" window areas. There are restaurants at the bottom of the ski run where you can eat and watch the skiing. If you go in January to Dubai, there are sales everywhere. I believe the dirham is tied to the US Dollar so it's not to hard to figure out fairly quickly the conversion rate. The mall is also easy to get to by taxi or by tram (trolley). If you just want to see a large mall, this is it. If you want to buy something different, this is it. If you want to walk and get in your exercise, this is it.

Big mall looking like any other mall. Although the malls in Dubai are very clean and well build, they look exactly like any other big mall in the world. All the usual brands are present and copied from each other. No uniqueness can be found. Don't go if you don't need to buy something.

WOW; WOW; WOW. if YOU THINK YOU'VE BEEN TO A LARGE MALL - THINK AGAINfrom the brochure this place has over 2000 outlets and 85 restaurant's and for the 'adventurous' shopper it has its own indoor SKI SLOOPE ! absolutely everything you could shop for from a BOOTs outlet to a Ferrari showcase and more gold than the bank of Englandfor services, they recon over 200 taxi's an hour service the mall and its spotlessly clean; there's a whole host of personal shoppers available if you have the cashJust one word of caution - if you're going with the wife, girlfriend or 'special friend' - - - do not take your credit card as everything is expensive - approx. £17 for a basic chicken burger, chips & coffee and well over £100 for a main meal for 2 - - those who say its 'old' or 'cruddy' either blind or too fussy or someone who just likes to complain - this place has everything you want for a full day out (top floor even has American bowling alley & other games)lastly if you don't really like it then just remember ITS FREE TO ENTER AND TO LOOK

Superb!! Definitely worth visiting..... Superb Mall with varieities of shops, Variety of food in restaurants & food court & lots of entertainment with Ski Dubai. We had been to this mall during our visit to Dubai. We really enjoyed a lot each & every moment. We also had fun at Ski Dubai. My son enjoyed a lot here.Really worth visting if you are in Dubai.RegardsAshish A.

old and cruddy. after visiting the dubai mall, this place kind of looks like a dump. yes they have high end stores but the plce just loks a bit tired. you could see that maybe back in its hay day it would have been great but now it doesnt have anything the dubai mall doesnt (excluding ski dubai) so its not worth going to both. sorry.

Didn't go to shop, went to merely SEE. If you're a Modern Marvels show fan, then you've probably seen some excerpt on one of the episodes about the skiing area within this hotel. Being an engineer, I had to see it. So essentially, I didn't go to shop, I actually just went to SEE it on the first trip; went to SKI it on the second trip!Parking/traffic was somewhat of a nightmare the first time we went, but then again it was friday afternoon (their friday is our saturday). Once we got in we found a plethera of big name brand-stores (many of which I wouldn't be able to shop at....$$$). We pretty much went straight for the ski area since you can view it without entering. It was amazing. Well, amazing if you remember that you just parked in a desert and it was 90+ degrees outside. We didn't ski that day, but I did end up using the mall's primary function and bought a nice pair of Carrera sunglasses unavailable back in the US; so that was a score.The next trip I went back with more friends for the sole purpose of skiing. I must say, they've got everything covered! You can rent anything and everything. The facility is very clean and well kept. Then we got out into the ski area and it was wild. Now, it's got to be said that I'm from New England and I was raised skiing and we have some harsh winters. With that being said, it was pretty refreshing to feel the cold and snow when we were living in Al-Qusais (pretty much desert); 3 of us were from northern USA. OK, to review.....from New England....living in the desert....at an indoor ski resort. This is where reality sets in. While the ski park is an engineering feat to be proud of, it's still not a mountain. There, I said it. Being a skier/rider I was "bored" after the first run. But honestly, remembering the heat I'd return to outside, I had a blast; no matter how "brief" the run is! Also, I had to buy gloves and I still wear them; "Ski Dubai" on my gloves is like a conversation piece in it's own. If visiting Dubai, visit the Mall. Ski Dubai aside, the mall is amazing; but I feel the main attraction is the "mountain". Skiing isn't necessary, but it's neat to say you did it when people mention "that ski mountain in the desert".

Very nice place. It is very good place to visit. All famous and luxourious brands are available there. During Dubai Shopping Festival they have attractive shows and activities. It is a modern building and have a very good facilities specially food courts which we enjoyed very much. I recommend it for Dubai visitors.

Elegant .... The mall was built with one thought in mind: Elegance! It was build to impress. Nevertheless, shops are offering competitive prices. Variety of shops make this mall a good destination for shoppers...and for entertainers as well.

Not quite the same wow factor as the Dubai Mall. Went here in search of a present for our son on our last day in Dubai....no joy unfortunately, so we ended up just staying for lunch and an ice cream which were both very good!
Perfect mall. It has every store you need. It has activities and great restaurants. and easy access ( taxi, walking, metro, parking)
Love,love,love it!. I spent many days in this mall, everything is here.Simply the best! Bought some luxury items here as well.

very nice. was very nice with easy layouts, felt a lot smaller than Dubai mall, very clean, there is a sign in the entrance to this mall that showed a t-shirt in regards to your shoulders being covered.

Shopper's paradise. Mall of the Emrates is another big mall in Dubai which houses all the brands, restaurants and activiities that you can imagine. it also has the famous Ski Dubai where you can play in snow, watch penguins, learn how to ski and snowboard - all in a mall.

Biggest Mall with best concept in mall (aquarium). It was the biggest mall we saw and it is near to burl khalif. initially i was confused with the name as mall of arabia. The mall is tooo big and i think an entire day will require to have a compelte look. The decoration of mall is excellent especially when you look down from 2 and 3 rd floor it looks amazing. The main attraction for me was aquarium which is 30/40 feet in hight. One entire sectio of mall is used for this purpose.I came to know that it is one of biggest aquarium (like fishtank) where even shark are also present. The view is really noce and you surely lingere there watching the beautiful fishes. The best concept of attaraction in a mall

Every brand you ever want to see- huge.. Mall of Emirates - has all the shops you ever wanted to see. Top end, and also department stores. Huge carrefour. Takes a long time to walk through this place. If you're into shopping this is another mall for you to try - how many can you try ? Well......for shopahlics the range of shops here gives you enough to keep you busy all day !Large home goods section with huge international selection of items. Wewent during the shopping festival so prices on some items were reasonable.
Well connected mall ..JP MIles 151861522. This mall has a metro which connects it and not a problem for taxi .has the unique ski dubai and a variety of restaurants .
Simply Astonishing. This Mall is just awesome. Love it. But its kind of expensive but still it has alot of activities too like ski Dubai,Aquarium etc. This mall is so Big , that i got blisters :P

Shopping heaven - but no bargains. I have been to many malls in many countries and this was one of the best. Not only is it huge, with a wide range of stores for all budgets, but it is also very clean and well provisioned with fast food outlets and several fine restaurants. We had a great meal from the Indian restaurant that's near the ski-field (sorry, forgot its name). Prices are probably not particularly cheap, so don't go if you are expecting to get a bargain, but the range and the quality of the shopping experience is definitely worth the trip (easily reached via the metro).

Shopping Heaven. going to Dubai for the first time ? this is place to be, if you don't have a long must-see list .. some known international brands, some unknown too;) but good options for activities..
Just another Big Shopping Centre. Expensive, no bargains, just a bunch of shops and as a fair female with a blonde daughter, did not feel comfortable

Breath taking. If you like fishing or you like snow you have to visit the mall of the emirates there is fish aquarium that will take your breath away you can see all the fish in one tank plus the divers who feed them also if you like snow boarding or ski ing you can do that as well all under one roof a must see

A normal mall at last!. At last a mall in Dubai for the ordinary shopper. First impression was the food hall - all sorts of fast food at very reasonable prices but the place was heaving and unbelievably busy but we enjoyed the buzz. The range of shops is quite varied with something for everyone with centre point being typical of a shop for the average shopper. All in all a worthwhile place to visit.

A better shopping experience in Dubai.. Compared with Dubai Mall, the Mall of Emirates seems to have more personal touch. For example, the food court are placed at the corner of the mall so you don't have to worry about shoppers bump into your table or checking on what you eat while they walked by. There is an indoor ski place connected to the mall but I did not have time to heck it out.

You will find everything. I loved the mall of emirates since it is a mall that is clean and beautiful. Even if there was a lot of people it did not feel crowded.They have so many different stores in all price ranges. It is wonderful.I love to see the local culture through visiting grocerystores and inside mall of emirates you will find one huge grocery store that has alot more than just food.Worth a visit especially if you stay in the al barsha area.

Glorious Mall With Memorable Architecture. Mall of the Emirates is a well-priced mall that offers a sufficient amount of shops of all types. Most will be drawn to the mall through Ski Dubai but once there you can see that you will want to stay for more then skiing! The shops are very variable in style, from sport shops to clothing stores to restaurants! The prices are generally reasonable but it would be expected to be a bit cheaper with no tax at all! The actual architecture is stunning and is a high point of the Emirates Mall. Mall of the Emirates is more then a mall with a skiing facility in it and worth a visit even if you plan on going to the Dubai Mall.

Beware of jawad noori phone store . I bought a I phone 5c for my girlfriends birthday 2 months ago from jawad store. After 2 months the screen stopped working so I took it in to get it sorted. They kept it in for 2 weeks to tell me they could not fix the problem. They said I should go to a apple service store so I did. Went to a apple service store in tecom to find out it was not under warranty cause it was bought from the u.s. Tss I went back to the store and they told me it was a hardware problem so they could not fix it. The phone was still brand new and only 2 months old. Be aware of this store they will rip you off and the service staff are so unhelpful. Great mall dodgy store.

mall of the emirates through the eyes of an emirati. mall of emirates is great for shopping and spending a whole day as well, You can take your kids to the skying area, if you are staying longer they can also take classes. What is amazing is that the skying area is not for professionals, there are many slides and rides even for your little kids who do not know how to ski at all, and worry not they even provide you with proper clothing. So no need to shop for jackets for a day. Shopping is also great, there are stores for high end brands, such as gucci, LV, Prada, Micheal Kors, CH and many many others. There are also stores with average prices, such as Aldo, H&M, zara and more. The amazing thing is that there is a store for everything; furniture, clothing, brands, electronics, etc. Restaurants are also great, there is a great variety to enjoy, there is a close by hotel as well. Hope this helps!
Simply outstanding.. One can spend a whole day going from one shop to the other. Everything you ever wanted are there for one's pick, you will never know you have spent so much time.

My favorite paradise. I lived in Dubai for a year when I was a teenager. To me it was the best place to spend my weekend with mates. You can eat good stuff without spending too much, spending time at the cinema or having fun at the arcade. Shopping here is the best way, maybe too good for you but not for your wallet! :)

Mall of The Emirates Dubai. We went to this mall for the second time this year and again my wife and I again thought that it is starting to look it's age and is now a poor imitation of Dubai Mall, in every way, either in appearance, shop variety, comfort and all other amenities.Our advice would be that unless you are going to this mall for the ski area, the Dubai Mall is in every way a better shopping experience for all the family.

Shop until you drop. I went to the mall primarily to go go to Ski Dubai but ended up getting sucked into the shopping. The mall's website will tell you which shops are there so I'll just make some general comments.- Service was very good in every shop I entered, not pushy but polite and attentive. - Do be aware of shops advertising a discount and removing the original price tag. This happened to me in American Eagle. So I went through the pile of jeans and found a pair the the staff had overlooked the original price had been 200AED and the new price sticker said 310AED. So, 310 minus their 40% discount is 186AED. Still cheaper than home so I purchased them. But it did explain why the shop wasn't packed with locals trying to get in on the 'bargain'.- Speaking of which do check prices at home first, some things may be stupidly more expensive e.g. A particular box of Lego I wanted was more than twice the price in Dubai. - Of the two food courts I preferred the one at the Ski Dubai end of the mall. It had a lot more variety.

Consumerism gone mad!. At the outset I have to say that I am not a fan of this type of enormous shopping mall. This is a classic example of shopping as a religion! The range of stores is mind boggling but I found no real value there. Dubai is supposed to be a duty free area but I can buy most of the items that I looked at, cheaper here at home. I found the Christmas exploitation ironic in such a supposedly strictly Islamic society. Money and profit is the only God!

Middle East Awesomeness. If you've never been to a Middle East Mall before, it will blow your mind... brands from designer to regular, lots for the kids to do with the arcade, theatre and Ski Dubai. Some things were good value for money and somethings were skipped as they wee cheaper to buy in Kuwait or South Africa. From a South African perspective, this will rock for you. From a Kuwait perspective... Avenues Mall in Kuwait is better. The highlight for me was Ski Dubai and the Virgin megastore.

Second to Dubai Mall but equally impressive. Not as big or as grand as Dubai mall but still had plenty of shops and places to eat but lacked the stature of the Dubai mall. Still had pretty much every shop you could need and the fact Ski Dubai is added here is great to combine two tasks together. Must visit and you won't leave empty handed!

Stunning. Brilliant Architecture. Not the biggest mall in the Dubai but you will still lose weight walking around in there. Upmarket shops and plenty for all tastes and pockets. One of my favourites malls of the world.

Nice. Really pretty. And a lot smaller than Dubai mall, so easier to navigate. And they have pretty much the same shops so that's fine.On the downside, we did spend the whole of Christmas eve looking for a food court that served fries or burgers- they all seemed to have a lot of sweets. No proper meals.

Snow in the Middle East. Beautiful visit during the holidays - glorious decorations. Located next to lots of smartly priced hotels. You can catch the Dubai metro from the mall and go almost everywhere. Metro is very clean, easy to use and inexpensive. While riding, you get a nice view of the city - rides above traffic and buildings. Every name brand from around the world is here.
