If you get tired of shopping, you can go for an afternoon skiing down the ski slopes in the mall. Only in Dubai.

Great mall with Carrefour inside. The Mall of the Emirates is conveniently located right out on the Red Line on the "Mall of the Emirates" Metro station.Not quite as flash as the Dubai Mall but has the same mass of endless shops and restaurants etc.Food Court is amazing and caters to all the cuisines in the world.Carrefour inside on the ground floor and is very nice to shop for grocery.
Shopping & Entertainment. Very Good place for shopping. You'll find everything under one roof. Also good for entertainment as well. Ski Dubai!

Shop Central. Been a regular visitor to Mall Of The Emirates, mainly to visit Virgin Megastore for DVD and game shopping, and to go to Magic Planet, where I've become a sort of celebrity among the staff due to my daily visits.

Great Mall But Not the Best in UAE. The mall isn’t as large as the Dubai Mall. Even so, it has its own uniqueness that separates itself from the Dubai Mall. Whereas the Dubai Mall focuses on size, the Mall of The Emirates focuses on quality. This mall has many common American stores and restaurants- P.F. Chang’s. This mall offers an indoor supermarket- Carrefour (It’s similar to a super Wal-Mart or Target). I decided visit to this mall. It was very hot; the temperature sitting around 105 degrees. I drank three water bottles in under 30 seconds. One tip about water in Dubai- Prepare to pay for bottle water. Unlike many places around the world, you won’t find any water fountain. Every drinking water is in a bottle. We were dying for air condition and knew that the mall would offer the best relief. We took the bus from Jebel Ali port to go up to the mall. The trip would take 45 minutes- A great opportunity to take a nap. The bus arrived at the mall, and we descended from the bus. We entered the mall. Immediately, the mall surprised me. In the entrance of the mall, I saw a fountain. This fountain had horses designed on it! There was no way that I would pass up an opportunity to take pictures of this. After taking pictures, we decided to walk through the mall. This mall would offer many fancy stores such as Tiffany’s and Rolex. I told myself that I would go into bankruptcy if I brought my wife and daughters to this mall.  After walking around, we found two important places that we had to stop- Krispy Kreme and Dunkin Donuts. We found them surprising that both donut shops would be in a country such as UAE, but they were their beckoning us to eat a donut or two. John wanted to go to Krispy Kreme because he is from North Carolina, which Krispy Kreme stores are popular in the Carolinas. As for Adam, he wanted to coffee from Dunkin Donuts. For him, he is from Massachusetts where Dunkin Donuts are widely popular in the New England states. Robert and John decided to go to Krispy Kreme whereas I went with Adam to Dunkin Donuts. These donuts shops surprised us because no one thought the people of UAE had a sweet tooth for donuts. One unique feature that I thought was smart was the escalators. These weren’t your ordinary escalators. These allowed a person to take his or her shopping cart up to the next floor- escalators floors were flat instead of having stairs. Another unique feature of the mall- and a cool one at that- is the indoor snow playground. I didn’t get an opportunity to play inside, but if I had the opportunity, I would. The playground had a slide that you can go bobsledding on. For many people in UAE, this place is the closet they will see actual snow.  Personally, I believe that once you visit the Dubai Mall; you will realize how small this mall is. Even so, this mall is still worth a visit.

Shopping. Mall of the emirates is the centre of shopping attractions, lettwrly you will find all the brands, ski dubai is a must with cinema with selection of movies, eventually you will never get bored despite spending the whole day in there

The biggest mall in the world. Must download the mall apps before you start exploring otherwise you will get lost inside the mall. I find this mall will get all the things you want for fashion, entertainment, nice F&B etc. They have this big ski inside the mall and a big aquarium where you could experiencing dive in to feed the fishes. Really cool...
more fuss over nothing. a lot smaller than the Dubai Mall, again nothing special, food court is smaller and less choice on offer

Don't forget your wallet. Dubai is hopping, shopping and more shopping. Beautiful building, but more over more shopping and shopping!!
Here you will the ski slope although it is better to go to the Alps to see some real action.
Enjoy you hopping and shopping and more shopping...

A Mall with Typical Stores. Unless you plan to ski or snowboard, skip the Mall of the Emirates. There is really nothing there except a place to grab a quick lunch and use the restrooms. The ski slope is worth a quick look: I found a place where I could see the ski lift but not a place where I could see the skiers or snowboarders. The mall prices seem reasonable.Full disclosure: I am not a mall person. My sisters-in-law would probably love the place.

Just curious about the ski slope. At home we have real winters. So only reason was to see a ski slope in a big freezer in the middle of a desert. Ok, if you want to have something unique, yes I understand. However, thoughts of global warming in our mind and poor visibility in to the ski area without tickets, the whole thing was an anticlimax.
See it to Believe It. Well laid out, plenty of variety for all budgets and tastes. Handy to the Metro (unlike Dubai Mall) and close to several hotels

Our least favourite mall on the metro line!. Its big enough, but the variety wasn't as good, with your more high end shops. The ski slope viewing area is a sight to see, if we had the right dress we prob would have hired a board and tested it out.

Disaster transportation. It is a very nice mall with lots of good places to shop .. But all this is easily ruined by waiting for a taxi for more then 1 hour ... And it was 3 pm .. Not a rush hour ... Living in Dubai for more then 3 years I can say it only becomes worse. Conclusion: if you have your own car or planning to take a metro then its worth going there .. Unless do not waste your time for waiting for the taxi .. Dealing with rude traffic control attendant ... Better go some other place

Multi Cultural Opportunity. There are many great malls in Dubai but this is a great one to see cultures and shops from across the world. Will see very traditional Arab dress as well as Asian and European. Great restaurants or even an opportunity to go snow skiing indoors. Most of the western stores you would see in Europe or the US plus others.
Ritzy but not. Cheap. Great selection of high end brands but did not find it to be any cheaper than. In England. Tiffany, Coach, Prada, Zara, Nike, Skechers, and many more.

Excellent mall to spend a day. Excellent mall to spend a day.
Snow World is an excellent place to be with children.
Shopping is mostly expensive and branded. But in sale it is worth shopping in those shops as sale is genuine

great place for tourists as well as residents :). Its the nearest mall to my place so i go there quite often.. its huge so one really needs to know where to park for targeted shopping otherwise its fun to just go around and explore..Ski Dubai.. great place to hav fun with friends and family but spend nothing less then a whole day if u want to enjoy it fully..Magic planet.. place for kids to have fun.Cheese cake factory.. it is located adjacent to ski dubai and a wonderful place to go for lunch and dinner..Carrefour.. MOE has a huge carrefour and offers almost everything that a hypermarket is supposed to.. the best thing is that it has a separate parking so one can just go park there and come out without having to cross the whole mall ..if you r looking for a particular store just ask one of the uniformed staff and they will guide you.. all of them are quite helpful..

Ski Dubai, Shops, Children's play area and eating places. Allow at least half a day to explore this Mall, longer if you want to go to Ski Dubai. Costa has a super view over the Ski slope. Lots of shops Debenhams, Boots, Borders, Carrefour, Clarks, Lakeland to name a few. Something for everyone. Play area for children and a selection of eating places and food courts. Easily accessible via the metro.
Good mall beside Kempenseky Hotel. its very good mallfull of choices inside it there is sky Dubairestaurants cafes and full of everythingand mall location in albarsha sheikh zaid road is so perfect

My haunt in Dubai!. It is not one of those overwhelmingly large malls, its large, its got all the stores and brands you'd be looking for as well as plenty of lovely cafe's and eateries. Conveniently located with its own Metro station attached to the main mall, it is surely worth a visit for sincere shoppers as well as browsers. The food courts are extensive as well, offering a variety of cuisine (the top level food court also has Burger Fuel from NZ, such a plus!)

Only in Dubai. Spent half a day wandering through this mall. Lots of designer shops, and other boutiques. Indoor ski slope was impressive. Only down side was that the food court was closed as it was Ramadan. A must for any die-hard shopper with a big credit card limit.
Another Mall!. Large mall. You name it, it can be found. Lots of walking, needed to refer to store guide often. Wide selection of places to eat. Not happy to pay for parking!
Lots of shops. Loads of shops and places to eat. The place was clean and lots of people around to help. Food court had loads do variety and there were plenty of restaurants too.

Good place to visit. Visited the Mall of the Emirates and had a great morning wondering round and looking at the shops. Had lunch at the food court which had a great selection of places to eat. Not as impressive as the Dubai Mall but still a great place to visit.

Malling in Dubai. Visited the famous Mall of the Emirates just to see what was what. As far as malls go, it has tons of shops but somehow it feels like a big jumble... a mall with an identity crisis. One section offers posh boutiques and around the corner you find fast food donut shops and a discount-type grocery store. Yes, it was cool to see the people skiing in the mall. Even considered giving it a go just to say we did. Instead chose to eat at a lovely Lebanese restaurant (Karam Beirut) overlooking the skiing area and enjoyed a wonderful meal and great service.An interesting thing about the mall... other than the restaurants there is no place to sit. No benches or chairs for those waiting for the shoppers. Preferred the Dubai Mall.

awesome trip. its the same everywhere... same shops same food courts.... but whats amazing in Dubai is that is has a lot of attraction to attract the crowd apart from its shopping, lots of stuff to do and pass your time with. Dubai ski city was fun we spent a lot of time there. You have so much that u cant get enough of it.....the indoor ski was amazing... the metro that connect it...what else would you want...

Dubai do things in style!. Myself and my daughter went down to the mall one evening just for a wander around for a couple of hours during our holiday from the UK. As usual in dubai, they do things in style. Loads of things to see... Particularly the ski slope, and a good range of shops we had a quick browse in. Taxis from the mall were frequent.

Indoor Skiing. Another great mall in Dubai. Smaller than the Dubai Mall, with "only" about 800 stores. Yes, you can ski inside the mall. The hill is a beginner's size, but nevertheless, with the outside temperatures of 80 to 100 degrees, it is mind blowing.easily accessible on the Dubai Metro train

nice and relaxed!. If you are after a quiet peaceful shopping experience then this is the place, Dubai Mall is always heaving with people both locals and tourist due to the water fountain and large aquarium, Mall of Emirates however is less busy but still really nice place to go and see all shops and brands, Food court has everything you can desire too! All sorts of stores are here both expensive and affordable stores. One of the main attractions here is the Ski Slope, which is amazing and definitely worth the experience! Overall a pleasant place.

Pleasant shopping. Nice shopping area, beautiful shops with nice staff. The shopping area is huge, nice to be walking around without that much crowd. clean place. You can find all known store brands, with both expensive and affordable shops. Worth a tour.

Large and delightful. Mall of the Emirates is a beautiful mall, mainly famous for its ski slope, yes snow and about minus 1 degree and penguins to entertain you. One can hire all the gear to go skiing, need to bring a beanie to keep your head warm.There are a myriad of shops to choose from, you name it its there. And lets not forget the high end stores are just amazing. Newly opened Chanel!A plethora of restaurants to choose from for the foodies out there... My favourite Cheesecake factory and Tribes for a African culinary experience.I also need to add inside Harvey Nichols on the first floor there is a beautiful Moroccan restaurant , Momos. The food is exceptional as is the service. The pidgeon is succulent and delicious..Shops open at 10am till about midnight...
Great!. Stayed in Dubai for two weeks and this mall was my saviour. Went there almost everyday. Coffees, lunches, dinners, children play area, shopping everything in one place!!!!

Enough to stop you being bored. Good shopping with most of the overseas chainstores and boutiques. I would have liked to see a few less chain stores or franchises and a few more small shops. The aquarium is great - you don't even have to go in the aquarium to enjoy all the fish.

Everything you could want!. The Mall of the Emirates is the 2nd largest of the Malls in Dubai. Pick up a handy Mall Guide and you can easily find the shops you're looking for. The Food Courts have a wide range of cuisine to suit every taste. Happy Shopping!!
Shopping for All. As an avid hater of shopping - this wasn't bad and was a very worthwhile experience. The shoppers out there will love this place.

Love It. If you are looking for a wonderful mall with all your favorite stores. This is the place. Eat at Tribes the food has an African Caribbean flare. Calfour is a great place to buy souvenirs. It reminds me of a Wal-Mart (US) or Tesco (UK). Coming from North America, the ski hill was cute. I don't know if it is worth the amount they charge. I enjoyed this mall ALOT!!

Ski Slope in the Desert. This mall has all the best brands, 80 restaurants, cinemas, connected to Dubai Metro and a SKI SLOPE!I am not a skier but my friend in Dubai takes his son skiing regularly and they love it.

Nice holiday experience. We went here not really for the shopping but to see the indoor ski slope. Although we didn't have the schedule to spend time on the ski slope etc, there are views of it from the ground and first floors and it's a bit surreal to look at, stuck within a shopping centre. If you're after shopping it's a good choice. There's shopping for all budgets I would say, it's definitely not all top end designer ware. For example, my wife found the Nine West store prices much much lower than in Australia. We had a 7 year old and no issue bringing children here and we felt really safe. There's lots of eating options and there are also food courts on the ground floor at each end (east and west). It has its own metro station but taxis are easier I found and inexpensive. We spent about 3 hours here but if you wanted shopping, shopping and more shopping, I'd aim for a couple of days.

Very nice.... It was nice, clean, organized, (if you need to take a cab), entertaining. They have Ski Dubai, where you can test/develope your skiing skills, in the middle of a building, built, where there was once a desert. Amazing to see...Shops are high end and they have everything!

Mall of the emirates is out of this world. Imagine a mall in the searing heat of dubai"s 45 degrees which has a snow slope and ski, with alpine features and ski lifts??? where else in the world can this be possible but in dubai.And that is not all. The mall has some of the best restaurants and shopping features. We can happily pass a few hours every day and still not tire. As it is connected to the dubai metro- this makes it easier for commuters and shoppers. A fantastic shopping entertainment destination. It has Asha"s restaurant and bombay chowpatty cafetaria too. And the lovely MORE cafe too. We love the buzz of activity in the mall. The carrefour hypermarket is a beehive of activity too.

Brilliant. After my first visit to Dubai, I was amazed and wanted to back again. This time though, we didn't go to Dubai mall, but went to Mall of Emirates instead. The place was spotless.The layout, ceiling, floor, just create the luxury ambience.Just like Dubai Mall, you see sports car and other luxury vehicle parked on the lobby entrance. It more crowded than Dubai Mall, people tend to shop at this mall I think. From Deberham, Harvey Nichol, Chanel,LV, and all other brand you can name it,are available here. They also offered various range of restaurant, big name from United States also available such as PF chang. Apparently they have indoor-ski available at this place, however don't have enough time as we visited during night time. This mall is good to spend and spoil your day from the extreme hot air of Dubai.

Cool Mall of the Emirates. Easily reached by the Metro and has it's own station the Mall of the Emirates is a high quality shopping experience. Not as big as the Dubai Mall but has the same designer and high street stores. more manageable for time Plenty of good food we especially liked the Butcher Shop and Grill for good steaks and seafood. Ski Dubai is also here and there is a great viewing area on the 1st floor of the mall where you can see all of the activities on the slopes.There is also a Carrefour where you can stock up on drinks and snacks etc for you hotel room. Opposite the entrance to Carrefour there is an excellent money exchange which gives really good exchange rates for all currencies.

You can even snow ski in Dubai. The Mall of the Emirates has everything, including skiing. You'll need comfortable shoes for all the walking you'll do here. Mostly high end shops but there's something for everyone. It's quite enormous and very coolly air conditioned like most places in the UAE. Ladies could wear a sweater. If you want to ski the clothes and equipment are provided along with your admittance. Lots of things for kids and families.

Not as impressive as the Dubai Mall, but you can ski here..!. Since the construction of the Dubai Mall this has been somewhat usurped in grandeur and number of shops but for the sheer engineering impressiveness that is making snow and maintaining a temperature of -3C inside (the ski Dubai venue which can be viewed from the mall) when it's over 40C outside this place is worth a visit!

The best!!!. It was a wonderful experience being there with my family. Great fun, food and most importantly SHOPPING. I was just mesmerised by the architecture and the flashy lounges. Really loved it and surely its the best shopping mall I have ever been to.

Too big!. It's an extra large mall and takes days to visit the whole stores. There was a nice café there which had a very nice breakfast menu (I just don't remember the name). I guess the prices are a little high both in shops and restaurants.

A quieter alternative to The Dubai Mall. If you intend on window-shopping or sightseeing, I'd advise you to visit the Dubai Mall, however if you are actually shopping this was much better. It is not as big, but it has the same designer and high street stores as Dubai Mall but its much easier to shop without crowds of tourists in the stores just there to visit.If you want something specific that they don't have in store, they will happily check if The Dubai Mall has it in stock and have the items delivered to your hotel to save you an additional shopping trip or having to carry any bags.
Extravagant. Very impressive -- elegant, over the top beauty -- and a ski slope in the mall! The marble inlaid floors were spotless and gleaming. The food court was elegant.

Very Good Mall. The Mall of the Emirates has something for everyone, and at a cheaper price when compared to the Dubai Mall. The Mall of the Emirates is easily accessible by Dubai Metro. The Mall is huge, but for me, the Snow Park takes the cake. Kids can really enjoy this hands down.Having said this, the Mall has an excellent super market "Carrefour", wherein everything that one needs for a household is available at atleast 15-20% lesser than the Dubai Mall. I thought all other outlets are a bit high-priced, but go to this super market...its really good. My suggestion would be to go there at around 11 AM, so that one can escape the crowd.

Very nice place to visit. Ice for skying, nice shops and a decoration that blows your mind! The place has a confortable temperature and the walking it's excellent. It's a great place to discover how the city lives his diversity. Please visit this place!
Lovely mall. It's a lovely mall with everything under the stars. Kids loved it. Though personally I still loved city mall the best, I'm sure the shopping experience will be fun!

Something there for everyone!. Whether it is high streets stores you are looking for or designer brands, Mall of Emirates has something for everyone. The vast variety of entertainment and restaurants makes this a really enjoyable place to visit.

Better prices than Dubai mall. We did this mall after Dubai mall and prices where 15-20% cheaper. But it was hard to get a bargain as the crowds were huge. It was big had all the high end retailers and we enjoyed it. Overall great place to fill in a few hours.
Hugggeeee Mall. This is one of the biggest malls I have seen. Huge shops. Lots of brands. Well spaced. Interesting options of eateries.

Not worth it. Lots of shops here it is soooo big you could get lost for hours. Although after going to dubai mall first mall of emirates isnt as exciting. For those of you in London it is the equivalent if westfield stratford city in terms of overly populated and too much hassle to shop. Also in the whole mall found no sitting facilities or benches for a mall of this size its shocking really so for anyone with mobility issues wouldnt recommend it.

If you like malls, take a tour, or a skying lesson. "Mall of the Emirates" is one of Dubai's attractions. If you like going shopping or taking a walk in a huge mall, this is probably an historic one.Here you can also find the famous "snow park" where locals and tourists go for skying.Being a bit old the look of this mall is a bit outdated but its glass ceiling is quite fascinating and remind of Paris's Grand and Petit Palais."Dubai Mall" is a newer and bigger mall just outside the Burj Al Khalifa (the tallest building in the world), so maybe you should visit both to have an idea of the old and contemporary styles.

Loved this place. This mall is nudge but the Dubai mall is tooooooo huge lol this place is wicked has a place for kids old young n big also indoor ski place what literally looks like your in the Maldives or where ever you ski lol has a really cool toy shop lots of known European shops to bit exspenive tho to be honest England's cheaper... Lots to choose from food court and omg the groceries shop supermarket is huuuuugggge n very think in there is edible wish England groceries was all that fresh has everything you would need there present shipshape food snacks all sort forgot the name but its the super market in there it's wicked

Loved that it has a ski field. The amll itself pales in comparison to the Dubai mall, it's like a quater of the size, and some of it was under construction when we were there. The main attraction for us was the snow field, it's kind of mind boggling to go the snow in Dubai!!!! We didn't ski though cause it is expensive and no body was skiing, so that wasn't a good sign. We went to the cheesecake factory here which has windows through to the ski field. good food

I love this place.. Everything you need under one roof. You can literally lose yourself in this mall. That being said, the information maps are very well laid out and can be found at many 'strategic' places such as escalators, etc. Many major brands have stores within the mll and you will want for nothing, although DO NOT expect a bargain. The food court is well worth a visit, where I enjoyed a lovely Lebanese meal.

Mall and sky dubai. If it not have sky dubai was a simple mall. Sky dubai is a fantastic attraction. You can pass from +40 grade to -4 fantastic. Sky dubai is expensive if you want only enter and not skiing you pay 150 aed for person.Into the mall of the emirates you can ind all tips of shop

Lots of shops. You can literally lose yourself here. It is massive!There are the usual bunch of global brands here. There are also an interesting mix of local companies, however, don't expect many bargains here. Prices are high for everything.

Awesome shopping center, but really expensive!!. You should stop here and walk around for a few hours even if you don't want to buy anything. It is a gorgious mall, but the prices are extremely high. Stop by and look at the indoor skiing. This mall has about anything you want or need, but bring your paid off credit card.

Easy to navigate. Mostly uk shops. Nine west, h&m, Aldo, debenham Clarks, etc. You have the ski Dubai in this mall. Easy to coordinate and navigate through. The carrefour shop is there for your everyday need.

Comes 2nd after Dubai Mall. Visited this mall on our trip to Dubai and found it was very similar to the Dubai Mall. There are a few shops I found that weren't in the other mall but I found the majority of the shops were the same

A real life line. The Mall of Emirates is one of those places you need to visit, when you visit Dubai.I always stay near by, I learned that this mall, offers almost all the shopping I need, from high end fashion, to buying groceries.I go to the movies there, I have never been yet, but you can even ski there, yes you hear me ski, they have built a ski slope right in the mall.There is cheap places to eat, KFC etc but the real restaurants, I found to be a very good standard, and not that expensive.Normal food shopping at Carrifour, bags, fish, deli items, everyday needs, its worth a look just to see the variety, staff are ok, not great. Pretty normal really any shopping centre type staff.For a real treat go to the Kempinski Hotel coffee and tea shop.
Another Shopping Trip. Very large shopping mall and you can spend hours walking around. VERY expensive and unless you have very deep pockets or enjoy window shopping keep away.
Amazing Shopping!. This mall has everything you could ask for and more! Shopping, entertainment and sightseeing all under one roof.

Shop till you drop. Every thing you want in one place, shopping , entertainment, food court and good restaurants. Liked the easy layout of the place and transport is via the metro or taxi.....cheap as chips.

Comes 2nd after Dubai Mall. All the brands in your minds you can find em' in this mall, watching a movie in the cinema, great restaurants & friendly staff who can help you if you lost your way or wanted some help or information regarding anything related to the mall.

It is more of an entertainment area. The Emirates mall is very large and contains everything you would want to buy. It is more of an entertainment area as it contains amusement areas and an artificial ski resort, called Ski Dubai. One of our family members (who can ski) tried and loved it. Most days there were sizeable crowds in the mall but on weekends (Friday and Saturday) the mall was very crowded.Prices in Dubai and the mall were not cheap but you could still find bargains as we did.
Better then dubai mall. It has almost all the brands dubai mall has but it is smaller & wont drain you of your energy walking for miles & miles.
Not so interesting. I see everybodys saying this is big. Its not.big is dubai mall. This is sooo boring. Jothing facinating. Same old shopping mall. Nothing catches much attention.

this shopping mall is hugh.. i got lost. You get a Carrefour hypermart and also a cinema here. There's a lot of other shops but the place is hugh i did not have enough time to really shop. There 2 food court here, on the ground level and the first floor. Make some time for Ski Dubai as well. Well worth a visit

It's a mall. I am not a fan of places where shopping malls are the primary attractions; however, Mall of the Emirates has a ski slope inside which makes it pretty unique. Other than that, I had a hard time telling it from pretty much every other mall in the Middle East. The skiing makes it four instead of three dots out of five.

Mall of the Emirates - an excellent choice for Dubai in a Pill. I did choose Kempinski - Mall of the Emirates to stay in Dubai.
It was a very good decision. For two days spent only we had a good hotel facilities, a lot of restaurants in the Mall, and in addition to it Dubai Ski - wonderful experience, not to mention shopping spree.
I can recommend it with no hesitation.

Large!. There where shops for all kinds of wallets from cheap to very expensive. We used 4 hours just to go through one floor.
Ski Dubai was quite special. The mall is an experience on its own.

still a great mall. This is still a very pleasant Shopping Mall to visit when in Dubai.The sky slope has been changed a bit since our last visit and looks even better. Great spot to grab a coffee or a bit of lunch overlooking the sky slope and not that over priced. Lots of great looking ski options for the family and easy to get to.
loved this mall more. Loved the emirates mall more than Dubai mall. If you have kids who need occupying....the skiing is great !!!!! This mall is More down to earth and not so pretentious.

Lots of shops. The mall of the Emirates has lots of shops to choose from but lacks the wow factor of The Dubai Mall. If you only had time to visit one mall I would choose The Dubai Mall. We enjoyed looking at the ski fields while we were eating cheesecake at The Cheesecake Factory. It seemed very bizarre to be watching alpine scenes when the temperature outside is sweltering !

Another Huge Mall In Dubai. Dubai is a very luxurious city. Finding a huge luxurious shopping mall is not something unusual here but if you want something different, you may want to visit Mall of The Emirates. If you stayed at city center, it's quite far to reach here but if you stayed at any hotel in Sheikh Zayed Road it's very convenient. The signature of this mall is the Dubai Ski, the first indoor ski in the Middle East. It is located inside the mall and always crowded during the weekend.

It's a Mall. Just a bigger mall than most, with basically the same shops as every other mall. Very poor food court with less choice than my local mall in Sydney (The East Food Court, perhaps the West one was better). Worth a visit if you want to shop, haven't been to a big mall before, or want to ski, but otherwise, don't bother.

So much choice, bring your credit card. The first thing you will notice is the air conditioning, very comfortable compared to outside. There is an abundance of high end stores to choose from. To be honest none of us arrived in Dubai via business or first class so 98% of the stores just end up as an amusing spectacle. Just make sure you wear your most comfortable walking shows because there is slot to see. One interesting point about the mall is the large indoor ski field, worth a look.

Huge mall with huge surprises. Each time i visit the Mall of the Emirates, it surprises me with something new to discover.The best option to reach it will be by the Metro, especially on weekends. Otherwise keep half an hour extra for finding a parking spot. It's crowded on weekends and rightly so. It is a one stop shopping spot anything you want and offers plenty of options in dining out. Be sure to buy a pair of walking shoes or else you will be left with a sore foot at the end of the day. Better,you can plan your visit by visiting their website which is a smart thing to do if you have something specific in your mind.
Trip of a lifetime. Really good Mall, enjoyed peering in at the snow dome - the cold isn't something you associate with Dubai it was quite novel.

Brilliant mall - not too far from where I stayed. I visited this mall a few times when I stayed in Dubai while my dad worked as a teacher there. It has a surprising variety of shops such as Borders (that went bust in the UK), Marks and Spencer, Lakeland and Virgin Megastore. The Al Jaber Gallery is worth a visit as well because it stocks reasonably-priced souvenirs and has an ornate selection of gifts. I also liked Carrefour and the impressive range of places to eat; two of which I visited were Just Falafel and Tribes. The Mall of The Emirates is one of the many stops on the superb open-top bus tour and Ski Dubai looked stunning. It was no Dubai Mall, but worth a visit nonetheless. 4/5.

Never Boring, just tiring. Everything for someone in this mall, and it is a must do whilst in Dubai, just make sure you wear comfortable shoes, because you will be walking for hours, supermarkets to designer wear, its huge. Ive been Dubai twice and I have still havent been around all of this mall because its so large.

Never lonely at Mall of the Emirates. Dubai is now celebrating a festival called Dubai Summer Surprises. This is a wonderful event for children and families. The mall is offering amazing discounts, a wide selection of food and beverage and lots of fun filled shows. Even if you are bored you can go down to this mall have a cup of coffee and look at shoppers who come from different parts of the world. Everyone is smiling you will never feel lonely if you go alone. There always a Waiter or a shop representative or customer care staff smiling at you and asking you nicely if you need any assistance. However, some if it's main venues need renovation such as magic planet it is getting old this place can be organized in a better way. Well done MOE staff for great work...

My favourite Mall in Dubai. Mall of the Emirates is the second largest shopping mall in Dubai. I just love to spend an afternoon there, but be aware its tempting to spend a lot. No matter, what I am looking for, I will find it there. On the ground floor everything for sports, fashion, Carrefour supermarket (huge variety of everything you can possibly think of, from all around the world), food courts, etc. The best attraction is Ski Dubai. Its kind of crazy, outside temperature about 45 degrees and inside Ski Dubai -3 Degrees. The best thing is, I don't have to bring my winter wardrobe, everything is provided at highest standards. I am not a ski fan, but s just a walk in the snow makes me forget how hot the Dubai summer is right now. All the kids love it too.
nice mall. if you wanna see some snow in Dubai, you can ski here. Shops are almost the same as dubai mall.

Wow. I loved walking around this mall, I think that compared to American malls it was just extraordinary. So many shops and so much to do. The food in the grocery store (Carrefour) even looked so good, my uncle and I even bought random stuff to make a buffet in our hotel room and sample things we had never seen/eaten before.

Another massive mall with the skiing place!!. Apart from the Dubai Mall, this is another one that has many many shops!! The main attractions are:(1) The ski slope with many playgrounds within the compound, especially for little ones. There are ski lifts inside too! (We did not go to this one as we were too tired but am sure there is an entrance fee.)(2) Lots of restaurants and shops! You can really shop till you drop...literally.Easy to get a cab despite the long queue.

Quite a place. A very nice mall with very exclusive high end shops though appeared to have something for everyone. The air conditioning a welcome relief with high temperatures outside. Was impressed the way they have a coffee shop at each main cross junction. Food court had a very good variety of fast food, good choice. Lots to see, very enjoyable just browsing , difficult to see all in a day, especially if actually shopping.

Can't see it all in a day!. Like my title says.... You can't see it all in a day. It's massive and each and every space is put to use real well. I stayed at the Sheraton MOE so it was pretty easy for me to get back to te comforts of my room when my feet begun to ache. This Mall has everything from cheap knick knacks to expensive jewellery. Food and clothes are extremely expensive here. Walk around and do some window shopping before actually buying. You might just find the same item cheaper in a different store!

Worth the trip. Had to check out the ski Dubai. It was nice but nothing especial as far as skiing goes, other than it's 100 degrees outside and you're skiing. The mall itself is very nice and it has a lot of great shops.

One of Many Malls. This is one of many malls in Dubai but this is definitely a beautiful mall with plenty to do. Make sure you're wearing comfortable shoes and have time to take it all in. The shopping is average but all of the other stuff the mall has to offer makes the trip worth it. This is where ski dubai is located as well as ifly dubai (wind tunnel). I have to admit I really enjoyed the movie theater here as well.

It has a ski slope and penguins!. Not a great place to shop compared to the Dubai Mall as this place is very small but has more 'normal' branded shops rather than designer. The biggest attraction is the ski slope! Yes you didn't misread. There is a ski slope and even the opportunity to pay to see penguins!

Mall of the Emirates......or anyone with lots of $$$$$. Wonderful if you want designer brand name merchandise. Forget finding a WalMart or Target here! However, seeing the indoor skiing area was worth the Metro ride. Also, watching the people here for the cultural aspect was worth the visit! Get a map or you'll get lost. They say it is THE LARGEST MALL in the world.

Shop till you drop. Not quite as flash as the Dubai Mall but has the same mass of endless shops and restaurants etc. Looks a little more dated but this is probably because it is older. If shopping is your thing then its worth a visit.

Implore to visit again and again. Mall of emirates is always an experience for us, its trendy stores, easy walk-ways, visting tourisits, cinemas, food courts and the huge carrefour is everything one needed under one huge mall. Magic Planet and the multiplex cinema are also added attractions. Easy availability of cab is also and big plus..."must visit

Expensive, but you could spend days here. We stopped into the Mall of the Emirates for about 2 hours and were simply blown away by the size. This mall has everything you could possibly want, but with size comes price and most things were expensive by AED and AUD standards. Definately worth a look if you are in Dubai and have time to spend wandering aimlessly through a vast array of shops.

another great mall. We thought this mall had a lot more to offer the holiday maker , some shops were cheaper and more down to earth. One great shop was Centerpoint where i bought some shoes and makeup. This shop is very reasonably priced and sells things for the home as well including bedding and towels. It,s strange to see people inside a mall shopping in Carrefour with checkouts in the mall.

Best mall in Dubai. I know the Dubai mall is the worlds largest etc etc and yes it is impressive, how ever for me and my family the mall of the emirates was far more practical. It was 2 floors simple to walk along one side and back down the other had all the shops we needed. an incredible supermarket too inside where we could pick up all the things that make a stay more pleasant. Great fruit, crates of water for the car and weetabix for my 3 year old. Parking was much easier here than at dubai mall and the indoor ski slope is very impressive the food court is a lot more strait forward too. All in my favourite mall, possibly in the world!

Visit to see the ski centre. This mall is overshadowed, not literally, by Dubai Mall. If you have plenty of time visit to see Ski Dubai (indoor ski centre). If your time is restricted though you would be better off going to Dubai Mall as the shops are duplicated.

Impressive Mall with an enormous variety of food. It is a huge Mall and you will need to walk quite a distance to go around the mall once. Mostly filled with designer wear and jewellery, it also has a nice Multiplex Cinema and Grocery store. The mall has an enormous variety of food stalls and restaurants with anything you can wish for. There is one entrance that has valet parking, you will find a number of very exquisite and nice cars parked out for display of shoppers who are at the mall. That would give you an idea about the prices and brands in the mall.The famous inside skiing and bob sleding is also located in the mall. With every ticket you get free gloves and coats etc which is a great thing because it is very cold inside. Good thing is that there are a number of cafes close by where you can warm up after visiting the winter wonderland in the country that was a desert

One of the best Malls in the World. We were staying in Bur Dubai and wanted to visit the "Mall of the Emirates". Take the Metro towards Jebel Ali will cost you 10 AED. The train leaves you at the door step of the mall .. on the way u can catch a glimpse of the Khalifa.. The mall has Carrefour one of the largest retailers in the world and then it has some unique retailers... like De Beers, Virgin and designer shops .. so if you are into shopping this is the place that you got to be. The Food Court is amazing and caters to all the cuisines in the world. I tried the Turkish Hummus and man was it amazing. It also has a ski resort inside and I think its just one of a kind in the world. A place for all and sundry ...

The Mall on the edge. The Mall of the Emirates is conveniently located right out on the Red Line on the Metro down near Burj Al Arab and the Jumeirah Beach Hotel. To be perfectly straight apart from the indoor ski arena we found the Mall to be low standard compared the Dubai Mall. Everything you would ever want is in the Dubai Mall and is more conveniently located. Not a lot to do in the MotE's where as there is far more to do and see in the Dubai Mall.

A bit busy than some of the other malls. This is a lovely mall and has some cheaper shops with lovely household items. It is busier but probably because it has a supermarket attached to it (worth visiting if you want to purchase some cigarettes). Centrepoint is a good shop to visit, you can get beautiful home items.

Nice, but long taxi lines. This mall is very unique. Amazing glass ceiling and has a very nice combination of stores, restaurants and activities. A must visit of any. Be aware of a bit of a long taxi line when you leave

Huge Mall. If you are looking for the more extravagent, The Dubai Mall may be more your scene. This is another fantastic mall, but with a little less glitz and glamour. Dozens of shops, easy access via the Metro, great place to wander, people watch, and shop.

One of the biggest malls. 2 floors largest malls with most of the popular brand outlets. Another outstanding attraction is indoor ski. nearest Metro station to this attraction is on green line- Mall of the emirates. Mall has departmentsl store as well - carrefour. DO NOT MISS

Home from Home. The Mall of the Emirates is my favourite mall in Dubai due to it's close proximity to where I live. The shops are just like the shops to be found in many large town high streets, Debenhams, Marks & Spencers and even has a large Carrefour (forerunner to Asda in UK) on the ground floor. I love the shoe shops in this mall including a very nice Kurt Geiger shop. The architecture of this mall is simple but fantastic and of course who could forget to mention the penguins at Ski Dubai. Something very surreal eating at TGI Friday's and watching them snow board and ski the otherside of the window. This mall also has Magic Planet and has a very good bowling alley. The only thing I would say that is slightly annoying is the people in the middle of the 'streets' with their little counters who are always showing something under your nose and asking you to look, sniff or generally buy. If I was a tourist I might find this even more annoying.
Vast mall. Big mall with lots of shops and restaurants and activities like Ski Dubai. Definitely worth a visit when in Dubai. I didn't get round the whole mall as it's so big.
Good 'normal' mall. This mall is a more 'homely' mall compared to the big dubai mall. Was easy to get to via the metro from the ocean view hotel.

Just another big US shopping mall. People told me before how wonderful the Mall of Emirates was, but as a frequent traveler, what I thought after visiting the mall: It is just another big US shopping mall. It is nothing really special.Inside the mall, there are many US chained stores for clothing, fashion accessories and home decoration. Even the restaurants and food court, you could easily find US chained names. Almost you name it, you could find it. The most fascinating feature for the people living in the tropical areas may be "Ski Dubai" which is the first in-door ski resort in the Middle East and offers the incredible opportunity for them to enjoy snow in the desert.

Mall Crawl. Visited this mall to see Ski Dubai. I did not go inside but did look in like everyone walking through this mall. It is big with the usual shops, restaurants, and entertainment venues found in other regional malls. Bring good shoes as you will be doing a lot of walking. It is easy to get around and has a lot of natural light.
Good Shopping. This mall is excellent for shopping, eating and entertainment. Like most of the malls in Dubai. It had every shop you would want.
Only mall i dont mind visiting.. Very simply, not complicated, easy to find your car, clean, lots of shops to select from. Good Restaurants and entertainment.

Well designed shopping center with more .... The Mall of the Emirates also contains the Ski Dubai and this was the main reason we went here. However, the shopping center, the second largest in Dubai, is well set out and contains many fine shops and entertainment activities.It well worth the visit in it's own right. You can get there by taxi or the Metro.

Snow in the desert!. This mall has it all, literally everything one could want, from great good value food, to skislopes and snow - real snow, I´m not joking! It takes hours to go round this mall - there is so much to see and do. I particularly enjoyed the souk.

Great Architecture but ... We loved the design of the Mall and the clean lines of the interiors, and to have a ski area with multiple ski slopes within a shopping Mall - Awesome! (There is a large glass viewing area of the ski area, but we couldn't actually see much of the slopes, so don't go if you want to see the whole area without going in or skiing).We spent a couple of hours here walking around and shopping, but in the end, we couldn't find anything which wasn't available back home in the UK at a better or equivalent price. There was a large range of food outlets and the place is huge, but we were disappointed.

Better than the Dubai Mall. In my opinion, I prefer this place better. It's less crowded (usually), considerably fewer tourists, more locals, and better prices. Ski Dubai also resides here, which is a must see. I haven't purchased a lift ticket yet, but I will in the future, and will review of course. It's cool to be walking around a shopping mall in the middle east and find yourself peering inside a snowy dome with people in heavy jackets. Mall of the Emirates is smaller, but that word isn't fair. It's still huge, just not as big as Dubai Mall. It's still easy to get lost in here, but there's a better selection of food and overall more friendly staff. I go here to pay my Du bill, catch a movie, and eat on occasion.
loved it. You could be in England! Once again another amazing mall it was fun just walking around as people roller skating on a designated area, if you want to ski aswell then thats fine.
love it. like it so much , a lot of option , people who have passion of fashion must visit this place , like the resturant in this place
Nice shopping area. I spent there few hours. There is a very nice shopping area, a lot of famous brands, very interesting inside ski area...I had a lot of fun visiting this mall.

Great Mall. The Mall Of Emirates (MOE) is large and offers a range of stores, such as designer brands, homewares, department stores and food courts. I personally think it is well worth seeing, especially Ski Dubai. Whilst I did not ski there, there is a large window which shoppers can see the snow fields and skiers. It is easy transportation to the MOE, on the Metro Line. If you're in Dubai and have some time to see a nice mall with lovely shops, then visit the Mall Of Emirates.

the best of everything. this mall isnt well dressed as dubai mall but has products that can litterally blow your wallets. local handicrafts abayas arabic perfumes, all the best quality. prices are high due to the better quality. must visit if u wanna take back some souvinears for ur peers. they also have a shop selling full sized camel sculptures both standin and seated. very intrcate details .

great place just like any other US mall. Ski dubai is like a swiss cottage , you think you are in the Swiss alps until you step outside and back into the desert !ultra modern with lots of choices , can be pricey and high end if you go that way. good selection of shopping outlets. easy access with the Metro or cabs.

Americanized Mall but..... The Mall of the Emirates is easily reachable via the metro making it an easy stop. I found most of the shops to be the same as at American mall but there are a couple good features of this mall. Ski Dubai is located here making it truly unique. You have to atleast go watch the skiers from the big glass window if you don't ski yourself. There is also a Carrefour store located here which has everything from clothes, to groceries to the outlet converter adapter you will need to buy to plug your phone and camera in with so it was worth this visit.

Luxury shoping. Big, beautiful, luxurious.The best Mall, in my opinion ever anywhere. Dubai Mall is bigger but Emirates Mall is better Don't miss out It has many restaurants and cafe worth visiting Don't leave Dubai without a vist
Must See. I visit Dubai quarterly and often stop by this mall. Not quite as upscale as the Dubai Mall but a real gem nonetheless. Hit up Ski Dubai for a true unique experience!

Fantastic Mall. Great shopping,(all your regular European and American brands are here including the designer labels) plenty of dining options, great entertainment including the Dubai ski. The mall is at the tail end of Sheikh Zaid road so its good for guests lodged at hotels closer to the Jumeirah beach. Taxis are easily available from the mall.Thank God Dubai taxis are so reasonably priced!

Smaller mall but quite huge. Ski Dubai is located in this mall and there is a window where you can view it if you do not want to go into ski Dubai. It is quite something to see. We enjoyed this mall as well. It is large but more manageable than the larger Dubai Mall.

If You Have Time to Spare.... This mall definitely isn't as grand as the Dubai Mall, but it has lots of great shops, restaurants and boasts the famous Ski Dubai. We enjoyed walking around, grabbing a bite to eat and watching the snow fun through the windows at the snow dome. The Ski areas were a lot smaller than I thought, but it still looked like a fun time for those of us that don't see snow at all. We actually ate at the Cheesecake Factory and they gave us a seat with a window to the Ski Dubai areas. The mall didn't seem nearly as busy as the Dubai Mall and we enjoyed just milling about though I felt that the mall was still rather warm inside and could have used an adjustment to the air conditioning. The other draw back is that you have to pay for parking after 4 hours and it gets pricey quickly. So go for 4 hours or less and get out of there!
Great shopping. Good value restaurants all over. The shopping not as fancy as the Dubai Mall but nowhere near as busy either. Ski Dubai located here.

A must when in Dubai...lots of walking involved.. Massive, expansive and just huge. Be prepared to do a lot of walking. Not really a mall for the "budget shopper" as there are many high end stores!! There is so much to see and its not all retail.

My favourite.. This is my favourite Mall in Dubai. It has my favourite dress shop and a good selection of electronics shops. Carrefour is a good supermarket, though it doesn't have the international selection it is cheaper than Spinneys or waitrose and has a good selection of cheap electronics. Watching the skiers is also entertaining while you take a break from shopping.

Mall of the Emirates. My husband likened this to Meadowhall in Sheffield! Didn't hang around, had a pizza and ogled the Lamborghinis dumped at the entrance to the Mall. Most striking feature was the ski dome, Dubai Mall is THE Mall to visit if you want to choose one.

THE BENCHMARK IN MALLS. If you are still seeking therapy after your visit to the Dubai Mall, try The Mall of the Emirates for size. It is (apparently) smaller than its gargantuan cousin, and yet they still manage to fit a ski slope in there, complete with chair lift. Nothing is missing from this facility, but it does seem more manageable and less crowded. The architecture is amazing, the highlight being the grand atrium, reminiscent of the grand train stations of the past. Prices appear to be a little more moderate, and in my opinion, Debenham's and M&S are much better here than at DXB mall. The metro station is (thankfully) only a short, covered walk away, but still travelators will assist you if you have worn out your feet bargain-hunting. Instead of Waitrose, you will find a massive Carrefour on the ground floor, and there is hardly any waiting time to get a table at the Cheesecake Factory. If I had to pick between this mall and its grand relative, this one definitely wins, but in the Las Vegas of the Middle East, with its insatiable appetite for consumerism, this mall may sadly end up being 'so five minutes ago.'

Value for money? Not really....... Not as large as its neighbour, the Dubai Mall, the Mall of the Emirates is still huge & we didn’t make a point of going around all the shops. The food court was extensive & good value. We are NOT shoppers & not experts of brand availability. But from checking out a few items we knew the price of at home (UK) they were MORE expensive. So when it’s said Dubai is a ‘shoppers paradise’ I don’t think they mean the prices.

Has all the right things going for it. Mall of the Emirates set the standard for malls in Dubai. It has all the good things that a mall should:- a good selection of stores, from the everyday to luxury - a strong flagship grocery store (Carrefour)- direct access to main modes of transport (metro, bus, taxi, private vehicles) - entertainment (cinema, arcade)- 2 hotels And of course, the icing on the cake: A community theatre (very active)And a ski slope (in the middle of the desert!!!)The layout of MOE (most residents fond name for it) is easy to grasp.
Seems outdated. The Mall is enormous with a huge range of shops but compared to the Dubai Mall it just seems outdated and a little less elegant. The Ski slope was good to see but again looking tired.

Very convenient to the metro system.. I give it 5 stars because of the ski slope. Sadly I have never skied and the prospect of going home with a broken leg put me off a little I guess. But it's still quite a place!I liked the Lebanese booth in the food court. Wish I remembered what that white sauce was, I usually go for the red or brown sauce cause I don't like mayonnaise, but this sauce was pretty good.
Big with ski slope. Pales in comparison to Mall of Dubai but still a very nice mall with skiing and penguins to boot. Carrefour is very nice, busy place!

Great mall. This was our first time to Dubai and we wanted to do some shopping and this mall is perfect for shopping you can find everything here it magnificant there is even a ski slope could you imagine skiing in the snow

Who wouldn't go to Mall of the Emirates?!. Massive. That's the first thing that springs to mind. This mall is one of the largest I've ever been in - with some of the most exclusive boutiques I've ever seen! There are a few "reasonably" priced stores - but not really a mall for the "budget shopper"!! Was worth seeing all that oppulence though!

A shopping centre...nothing more. After hearing so much about Dubaii malls I was really expecting something out of the ordinary...and was disappointed. A shopping center no different from any seen elsewhere except for size and the ski dubai excentricity...Not worth spending time on it
Excellent Mall. This mall has lot of entertainment for kids and families in addition to some of the good fast food and restaurants.
Huge ..... Great shopping ... strange to see M&S and Debenhams branches amongst Chanel and Dolce & Gabanna!!! Views to Ski Dubai are a bonus ... plenty of eateries too!

Nice and Luxury, but the Dubai Mall is better. Wide variety, very nice restaurants (Asian, Arabic, Italian), all luxury brands available. A fountain inside. For me it wasn't the shoppers delight like the Dubai Mall. But it's worth to go for it. (a must see). Go first to the MotE and second to the Dubai Mall. Then you won't disappointed.
Not as nice as Dubai Mall. Slightly more confusing than Dubai Mall but hosts probably almost exactly the same stores. Watching people ski indoors is amusing, tho.

Choice of middle prices brands and luxury brands. Friday was quite to do shopping...
Fauchon is a nice place to have lunch, with quality food.
Cinemas have reduce the choice, too much movies for kids...

Easier mall to get around. It's an easier mall to navigate around than the Dubai Mall but obviously does not have as many stores. The indoor skiing is also in this mall. If you're close to the train it's one of the stops on the line.

Surprisingly not cheesy. I thought that any mall with a ski hill would be silly, cheesy, corny. Surprisingly, not at all. Classy stores, good food, lots to see and do.
And the ski hill is, well, an indoor ski hill. Weird, but not in a bad way.

Fabulous mall, the Ski Dubai is incredible to see. First, as with any big mall, grab a map, of which there are plenty. This Mall is laid in a fairly traditional manner (at least from a Canadian's eye) but it is big. Big in terms of walking space, while Dubai Mall is bigger in number of stores, it is more compactly laid out. Thus the confusion folks may have that this Mall of the Emirates (MoE) is confusing.As I have written in my reviews of Dubai Mall (DM) and Dubai Marina Mall (DMM), they basically have all the same stores. There are specific differences - DM has their Souk, DMM has WaitRose foo store and some specialty shops, and MoE has the Ski Dubai, plus the Fashion Galleria. The Fashion Galleria is fun because of the atmosphere. The stores are the same as the other malls, in most respects.Like the other malls, the food choices are overwhelmed by chains of fast food, instead of local or regional food. But then again, unless you go to Deira, getting local / regional food in the new Dubai is pretty challenging anyway. Unless you have a car and want to brave the crazy traffic.
Great. Just great. Wide variety of shops and brands. Many restaurants, coffee shops, facilities. Somehow expensive, but nice place.

Not great and hard to navigate. If you are claustrophobic never go there. Finding your way inside the mall is very difficult. Too many stalls inside the passages that you can barely walk... Some areas are not well lighted, some areas are smelly... Will never return there specially that I have the option. By metro, I would recommend going to dubai mall rather than moe... And cleanliness is very questionable specially in ski dubai...

Fantantic mall. This is a huge mall and it has hundreds of retail and food outlets in it. It can be accessed by the Dubai Metro Red Line very easily. There is a huge Carrefour hypermarket and two food courts (one on the east side and one on the west side). It also has Ski Dubai shich is an indoor ski hill....it's not very challenging (acording to my ski friends) but quite a novelty to do. This mall has some food outlets that serve alcohol and the mall is attached to a hotel. Lots of parking available but I would recommend using the Dubai Metro as it's quite a bit easier and attached to the mall via an air-conditioned passageway.

good not great...however tomany out there.. The Mall of the Emirates is a huge shopping mall in Dubai, the shopping center is good however not great. You can find pretty much everything there is from brands such as: Gucci Donna Karan to the lower end ones such as Zara and Esprit. On the ground floor there is a large food corner, with a large selection of Asian, American and European food. Unfortunately, the food area itself for the mass of people is rather too small - it's pretty difficult to get a table. Convenience: Direct to the shopping center, there is a large parking lot which is connected (on Fridays and Saturdays free, otherwise - if I remember correctly - the first couple of hours is free).

Shopper's delight. This mall has a huge range of shops and eateries from the food court to elegant restaurants. Parking is easy and plentiful, and there is entertainment galore including the amazing Ski Dubai venue for budding skiers or snow bunnies.

Better Place for Shopping. I liked this Mall, It is big but not in a way that get you lost like Dubai Mall. SKI Dubai is a very nice place for kids. Also many restaurants that have a view overlooking it.Many options for food, and Cheese Cake Factory is also there :)Many good electronics deals in Jumpo shop and very big Home center .
Great mall. This Mall was smaller than the Dubai mall, in a good way. Was easy to find our way around, and had a good choice of shops.
Big. Enjoyed this better than Dubai mall, felt more intimate, better atmosphere and not as hard to shop as units smaller and closer together, taxi from Atlantis to MOE was approx £7

Shopping, dining and entertainment under one roof. This mall is the one of the biggest in Dubai and offers a nice shopping experience as long as you are willing to walk through it's huge areas. It had a variety of restaurants and coffee shops and has an interesting ski slopes integrated in it. It would be worth spending half a day or more there

Mall with a ski slope. Very large mall with lots of shops and a good variety if eatingShops range from top end to more normal with even a large supermarket withinThe novelty factor is provided by the inclusion of a reasonably large ski centreThe mall is very near to the red line metro stop and this cheap air condition transit is a good way to get there. Short covered air con walk from the stop

Fun mall. Visited a few times, always nice. Great selection of nice restaurant and food courts. Stayed in a hotel close by so got to visit often. Something new every time. SkiDubai is located inside highly recommend to try it out, very fun for the family and kids.

Indoor Ski Slope. The Mall of Emirates is about ten minutes walk from the hotel i and my friend lodged in, so this was the first mall we visited. It was an amazing experience. We ended up having all our evening meals here throughout our stay as there were lots of restaurants to choose from. The shopping was remarkable.There were lots of kids here because of the ski slope. I think this is the major attraction in the mall. If you are visiting Dubai with children, make sure you visit this mall. We also took the tour bus from the Mall of Emirates. Fantastic experience

And again ... Another mall!!. It's just another huge mall with a huge variety of goods in all price ranges...?!? So everybody can shop in Emirates mall...!!Have to say that me personally found that quiet good and unique... Most of the malls wherever on this globe... Are directly classified as a high/middle/low end -mall... Due to the brands they are selling...So people who cannot afford the more costly goods/brands... Can not 'walk' with that paper bag, with the name of that fancy mall... And I know: some people are very 'proud' to walk around with certain bags... What I mean is..: malls are usually already specified as an upper or lower class mall.. And that....Phenomenon is NOT in Dubai... Either Dubai mall or this one... Want to buy for example Manolo B shoes or Keith something shoes... You will find it, or whatsoever brand...So... Operation succeed... !! Malls are for anybody and whatever budget...As a sub attraction apart from shopping... There s the amazing Ski Dubai... (With entrance fee!!) With all the facets of winter sports... In every sense.. So even the après-ski!!Again.. This is only possible in Dubai!!! So if you like shopping or window shopping... Or seeking for something to kill time in DXB... Especially during the hot period of the year... Going to a mall is an option... But be aware ... It can be very crowded...!!

What´s the fuzz about this mall?. Prior to my trip to Dubai I heard the greatest things about this mall, so I was glad to have my hotel next to it. When I finally was inside the mall I was heavily dissapointed. I don't think it's that big, luxory or even remotely great. To my surprise there were even South-East Asian people with 1square meter shops selling hair products in the middle of the walkways. Is that what 'one of the world's best shopping mall' looks like?

its huge. when I visited this mall, i thought this would be like any other mall in the world..but no.. this is a very different mall i had been to.. all luxury brands are available here.. along with a ski zone about 400m long its a whole new world..

We enjoyed this mall. Mall of the Emirates is great. It may not be the last mall in Dubai but its great. The ski area is a miracle and we enjoyed having lunch at the italian restaurant there. Its very well organized and we made most of our shopping.

Just another mall... Too big, to many things to see and too many expensive brands, prepare to bring enough money if you gonna spend your whole day here!And dont you worry about not looking for anything you want, they have anything under the sun. Sushi, Sephora, H&M, Chinese shops, English tea shop..This mall is so international!
My fav. i visited 3 malls (Dubai Mall, Ibn battuta and Emirates) this one was my favorite, first its not as big as the others, plus its very organised .

spend a day and still miss something. so many shops to browse and coffee shops to relax in. You could visit here every day and still find something different. Ski Dubai is fascinating even just to peep in and see!

Shopping paradise. Aside the vast selection of shops and restaurants, we were extremely happy with the playground service (if I remember correctly it has Pekaboo in its name). We spent there an hour with our 22 months old son and it was extra fun. Lots of toys and activities to keep him busy and happy.

the mall of malls. This mall is huge enough to visit several times in order to finish seeing it.the most amazing thing is the snow region they have made.ice in a hot country is a wow and for those who want a mini view of Switzerland this place is a recreation.with the snow gear they give you on hire you and your kids can have a ball of a time out at a shopping mall! Children like to come here again and again.the shopping experience is very good as you will find a large variety of everything.at the end of the day to get out of the mall there are long but fast moving queues and taxis are provided for and managed very well. the aquarium is so beautiful.children love it. a novel shopping spree with many different memories to take home which will stay forever in your mind. if i go again to dubai i would opt to go there at least once. please take a group of family or friends to enjoy all the fun,specilly the snow region.
LARGEST SHOPPING MALL. This was a facinating place to visit even from a non shoppers point of view.The aquarium was just mesmerising and an ice rink?

From Carrefour to Prada. Great choices.. I prefer this mall as compared to Dubai Mall because:1- I don't need musical fountain and tallest tower. Been there, done that.2- Shorter distance from metro to the mall as compared to Dubai Mall3- It can be crowded and difficult to find carpark but here, miles better than Dubai Mall. I will come early morning and leave in the afternoon4- Better selection of affordable and high end brands5- I will avoid to come evening time if I drive or else I will take metro

Luxury everywhere. Ye be warned! Top designer boutiques, everything you ever wanted to get you can find in the Mall of the Emirates. Bring your checkbook! Very nice to stroll around and take a walk outside near the fountains.

An Excellent Place for Entertainment and Shopping .... As ChrisP says in another review. this is the "second choice" for mall-shopping. First one being Dubai Mall. Rest assured, almost anything you buy in Dubai Mall is likely to be costlier. This place felt less 'touristy' and might explain a bit about the cost. A case in point is Carrefour, a chain-super market. Nothing beats stocking up on local goods to take back home from Carrefour.MoE has it's share of Perfume shops (Ajmal, Rasasi and Abdul Samad Al Qureshi ASAQ), souvenir and Branded clothes shops.If you really wanted bargains and don't care about brands, you would probably look at Meena Bazaar or Naif Market or venture boldly into more traditional markets in Sharjah / AbuDhabi.To keep kids occupied, it has Ski Dubai, Magic Planet etc. Although large floor space is devoted to these, I feel only older kids would appreciate these.Overall suggestion: Window shop at Dubai Mall and buy at MoE
Plenty of choice. A great second choice mall after the Dubai Mall. This mall has many similar shops and the Dubai Ski World can be found here as well. A good day out for the family.
Fantastic Shopping. This mall, as well as the Dubai Mall, are "must see" when in Dubai. This is like no mall I've ever seen. You can find anything.

Worth a visit but don't expect many bargains. Large mall, rather crowded all the time. Pricing was the same as in Australia if not more expensive.A good selection of shops, cafes and restaurants.Especially on Thu and Fri evenings you may have a very long wait to get a taxi out of the place.

Decent mall. This is one of the biggest malls in Dubai and well worth a visit. Although compared to some other malls in Dubai such as Mercato or Ibn Battuta, it is not architecturally beautiful. It is just like any other generic mall in terms of interior decoration. But shopping is great and the best is the Ski Dubai.

Wow.... This mall, is absolutely massive. It is the most beautiful mall I have ever seen, and the sheer size is incredible. You will literally never be bored. What I liked is not only do they have american stores (Marc Jacobs, Michael Kors) but they also have arabic fashion. So cool. WOMEN: be very suer you dress appropriately - yes even in the mall - When I went I wore a long maxi dress but my shoulders were uncovered. The looks I was getting by locals were so bad I had to go buy a sweater. Be very respectful of their culture please, even though you may want to wear those short shorts ;)
Great stay, Great City. Very fancy... well worth taking it. But remember your walking shoes! Some stuff is very mainstream, but there are some international brands that I had never heard of before.

Ski at minus 3. Hard to believe an indoor ski resort complete with ski slope, chair lift, chalets and al fresco dining at a temperature of minus 3 can be enjoyed in a shopping mall in Dubai where temperatures outside are 40+. Got to be seen to be believed! Great fun!

Excellent Shopping Experience. We went to the Mall of the Emirates primarily for Ski Dubai. Later we went into Carrifour to do some shopping and finally ate at Burger King. We were impressed that the toilets in the Mall were clean and well maintained. The only dissapointment was that we had to wait a while before we could get a taxi back to our hotel. On the whole an excellent shopping experience.
Fantastic. Visited the Mall of the Emirates during the January shopping fest and loved it. It wasn't as grand as Dubai Mall but it was still amazing to visit and shop there!
nice place. Very nice place ...good place for Shopping.good dewide range for designers outlet. Food court was massive and had wide range of western food.

Another giant mall, excellent people watching.. This mall was big.. but not West Edmonton Mall big...Now that is a big mall. MofE I had expected more. I really had this thought in my head that a mall with a ski hill inside was going to be INSANELY huge, but it wasn’t. It’s big but not "oh my god I need a golf cart to get around big".Its a very cosy mall and has very nice stores. It caters to the rich and those with money to burn. All the Luxury brands were here. I even found a Canadian second cup coffee place. I watched a movie at the theater. Very nice too. I The food court was great with many vendors to choose from. I just really enjoyed the people watching. You know.. grab a coffee and just watch who walks by you and wonder about their lives.

Great variety. Loved checking out SkiDubai, and great variety of shops and food court was extensive. We walked here from our Hotel and had a lovely meal at a Lebanese restaurant facing on to the Ski Slopes so we got to watch the action while we had a delicious meal.

Shopping and more. I took my kids to see the mall since I loved it in my last-year visit by myself. They loved Ski Dubai which we could see from the mall through large windows. There are many shops where you can find what you need and many places to eat. The kids enjoyed playing xbox at Virgin stores and browsing the large selection of books from different book stores. The mall design is distinctive, particularly the designer shops' section and the bridge to the metro station. It may not be the biggest mall in Duba but it is really the most elegant. We went as the mall was closing after shopping, eating, playing and site-seeing. It was a really nice experience.

Great shopping and people watching. Even with the Dubai Mall being much bigger, I enjoyed Mall of the Emirates much better. I found that the shopping deals were of more value. The food court is fun, and you can find everything form KFC to Chili's to fine dining. Just walking around is a day well spent. I don't know if it was just the particular days I went, but there are so many beautiful women, it is hard to concentrate on anything else. They were literally everywhere.The only downside: Much like casinos want you to get lost in order to have you sit and gamble a little more, the Mall of the Emirates has almost no directional signs, and the maps are impossible to decipher. You will have to ask several people where the taxi stand or metro is.

Mall of Dubai is way better!. We'd already spent 2 days at Mall of Dubai during a tourist holiday to Dubai, so we landed at Mall of Emirates one day. Its a big huge mall with large food court, mid range to high end stores, and hyper marts. The indoor Ski slope seemed like its big USP. But if I was on limited time, and had to choose, I'd go for Mall of Dubai, which seemed like a newer, glitzier and larger version of Mall of Emirates!
Great shopping!. Much less confusing than Dubai Mall and even less busy! I'd prefer to go shopping here over the other malls in Dubai! :)

Always unique. I have been there a few times during my visits to dubai. Each time I see some unique stuff in that mall, in addition to all the standard outlets. This time, I picked up a nice cover for my iPhone which has an attached keyboard and battery, something I haven't seen anywhere. In addition, ski dubai is anyway a great attraction there. Did not go in this time, but have seen it earlier. Overall MoE is a good mall to go to in addition to Dubai mall. Best way to reach is metro, though we also used our vehicle.

Top Class. In extremely close proximity to my hotel made me give this place a full 5 rating which might be biased but this mall had it all in terms of the variety and range of shops from mid range to the most lavish. The cinemas were at par with most you'll find in Dubai.With multiple food courts you can find most to eat from arabic to fast food to continental.The best thing about this place was the snow park and skiing. Truly amazing in the august heat of Dubai.

best mall in dubai. simply because your spoilt for choice. great food outlets and if you go at the right time (shopping festival,eid,summer,Christmas) there's always entertainment for the family go on in the mall

OH WOAW. everytime I go here iI am still surprised by a) how huge it is b) how crazy it is while it is 40 + degrees outside; inside people are enjoying the snow... Shopping wise you will find everything one can desire; from gucci to zara . there is also a huge carrefour and not to forget 3 really nice food carts serving fast food, but also indian chinese thai and vegetarian.Not to forget a cineplex with the latest international and bollywood movies Of course in its original version
shop...shop & Shop. decent crowdgood salesgood entertainmentgood range of shopsexcellent security and Mall staff ready to help you through any question
Nice and Big mall. Visited it before Dubai mall. I can say it worth a visit and specially if you want to see the Ski Dubai and have dinner on its side.

the best mall for shopping. I think this is the best mall for shopping. You can find expensive brands on the 1st floor and medium priced brands on the ground floor. It is not that huge and bad organized as the Dubai Mall and not empty and dead as Wafi Mall. It has the best selection of brands from most expensive to cheap ones. Apart from shopping you can go Sky Dubai for sky or sledging if you have never seen the snow in your life. Otherwise You can see it through the glass wall and save your time not standing in the long queue.
Worth a look. Lots of very very expensive shops to press your nose against the window and sigh or just wonder why anyone would pay that much money for a pair of shoes! lol
Brilliant mall. Beautiful mall has ski dubai inside great shops and places to eat well worth a visit great toy shop great homeware shops

Worth a visit if you are going to do Ski Dubai. We decided to visit this mall mainly to see Ski Dubai, plus it was nearby the Burj Al Arab (we had dinner reservations & wanted to kill some time before hand). The mall is large with 520 shops, 85 coffee shops/restaurants, a magic planet family entertainment area, & 14 screen cinema. It has 2 levels. The mall is easy to navigate around. It has the largest Carrefour supermarket in the city. We spent just about 3 hours here & still didn't see everything in the mall. I found the currency exchange (UAE Exchange Centre LLC) in the mall, across from Carrefour, had the best exchange rate (US to AED). We saw Ski Dubai, but we did not try it as we have excellent access to skiing nearby Vancouver. Its a shame tho, you can't really see people skiing if you are viewing from the mall side.
