Unless there is a spot that I don't' know of. You can only see people playing in the snow park area. There is an Arabian souk area. The high end shopping stores are bunched together in the middle of the mall. The mall is attached with the metro station. The mall also provides a complimentary shuttle bus service, which will pick up and drop off at a number of hotels on Sheikh Zayed Road and along Jumeirah Beach. You can catch a taxi @ the front main entrance. Sometimes there are long queue for a taxi, but it moves along quite quickly. I would only recommend this mall if you are going to actually do the Ski Dubai or if you prefer a smaller mall then the humongous Dubai Mall. With so many shopping choices, after awhile they all seem the same.
nice mall. we visited here as at ski dubai. it is much smaller than dubai mall, but still has a good choice of shops for all budgets and food choice within the food court. easy access with the metro.

Well worth and visit lots of places to eat.. The Mall of the Emirates is quieter than Dubai Mall and has a lot to offer. Didnt try out Ski Dubai but will be back to do so. Plenty of places to eat and it has some shops that Dubai Mall doesn't have.

My favourite Mall in Dubai. A wide range of prices from very cheap (Carrefour) to extremely expensive with many interesting boutique shops. Excellent food courts again from cheap (KFC, McD) through to expensive. There are several major brands almost permanently selling at big discounts (Azzaro, Balmain, Pierre Cardin, Timberland, Columbia). Connected to the Metro and massive car park. During cooler months its best to drive to top floor where there are nearly always parking spaces. Only issue I find is the variability of the Security Staff when you ask for directions, sometimes extremely friendly , knowledgeable and helpful, sometimes the complete opposite.

a must visit while in Dubai. this is a great place to spend a full day as there is so much to see and do ven the kids will love this place, anyone who has been to dubai will tell you that this is a must see

Nice Mall with Lots to Offer. Although the Mall of the Emirates plays second fiddle to the spectacular Dubai Mall, it has a lot to offer as well. First of all, it is home to Ski Dubai, the amazing indoor snow skiing adventure in the middle of what Dubai is - a desert. Secondly, it has hundreds if stores to while away the hours including a huge Carrefour, two large food courts, and the amazing luxurious Kempinski hotel right next door. It is also accessible via the Dubai Metro with the stop right at the foot of the mall. Overall, the Mall of the Emirates is not as breathtaking as the Dubai Mall but it has a distinct charm all of its own.

Shoppers Paradise.. Shop until you drop! Literally. It offers perfect dining experience, entertainment (indoor Skiing, Magic Planet and Vox cinema), Hotels, Services and Shopping. All the top designer shops along high street shops are here. Prices range from normal to expensive. Opening hours Sunday to Wednesday 10:00 am to 10:00 pm, Thursday to Saturday 10:00 am to 12:00 midnight. The décor is immaculate. Everywhere in the Emirates Mall is clean and well looked after you could eat your dinner off the floor. This could be said about most establishments in Dubai. Although it can get very congested at times but this is understandable.

The best compromise between awe and convenience. My favorite mall in Dubai, because I can enjoy the attractions like the ski slope and at the same time actually find what I need for my everyday life, like reasonably priced clothes and shoes,music and DVDs, a supermarket and a variety of nice places to eat or have a brunch or coffee. The architecture is lovely as it is airy and bright, with art nouveau style domes.

Something for everyone. This is a great place to spend some time even if you don't buy anything. There are designer shops but also main high street brands are here too, so something to suit everyone. There are some great restaurants too. Can get a bit crowded but that would be the only downside to this mall.

Just ok.. I so much prefer the smaller malls (like Burjuman, Marina Mall) for the short visits, and totally prefer the Dubai Mall for the half- to full-day excursion. This is a quite spread out design, posh and all, but not very easy to navigate through. Of course, if you're into the top brands, you have them all here, but for the more exciting and exotic stuff, go elsewhere...

Your best bet. Have Visited all the big malls in Dubai but this is the place where most of our shopping happens. Its huge, and brands range from affordable to exorbitant depending on your pocket.
A few novelty shops and great restaurants wrap up the package nicely.
my favorit shopping paradise. you can see many good brands in this mall with entertainment like ski in this mall and i love the design and architecture of that
Very big, simmiliar to Mid Valley Megamall in Malaysia. Very big and nice, simmiliar to most mall in Malaysia, went there shopping alone during my short trip in Dubai

Great mall. It's a mall, but what a mall! 500+ stores, and while we were there there were many sales, so we had a blast. If you're into menswear, check out Balmain - the sales staff in there are very helpful and pay a lot of attention to you! There's great food here too, and catch a show at Ductac if you can!

don't forget the ski slope. Well, they have a indoor ski slope and penguins who you can visit. Besides that it's the first place where I've seen a food court with almost every fast food chain situated on one location. Impressive
Lavish !!!. This mall is truly a lavish one, huge building, lot of high end brands have their shops here. You name it and you get it. The ice skiing is a must see here.
I love it. Its a very good mall, i cant say excellent if u compare it to dubai mall. The best place there is ski dubaiSo dont miss it it is enjoying
mall of the emirates. beautiful shops, a bit out of our price range, but it was fun to see the shop windows of all the top brands

A shopping paradise. Mall of the Emirates is the place we like when outside temperatures are above 40ºC!From restaurants to food courts, from sportswear shops to hypermarket, from Ski Dubai indoor skiing to mere walking through the mall ... we find all we need until outdoor activities resume after sunset.
High class status!. A lot of stores as well as a lot of people. It's very huge with a water fall and sculpture in it, also an atrium with sharks and different sea creatures. No dislikes at all
Well organized. U'll find it's much easier to shop there than Dubai Mall..I loved the ceiling of this place and the whole atmosphere.

Fantastic Mall- Something for everyone!. Shopping available for all budgets~ Groceries to Designer labels~ Restaurants to 'To-do's for kids & adults alike. Can't forget to mention Ski Dubai- Indoor Snow Skiing! A very cool place to have a wander or spend the day~ enjoy!
Best Mall in Dubai. Really enjoy this mall. Its bright and cosy. Great food and shopping experience. Location is great and is almost 15-20 by taxi from any location within Dubai city

Luxorious. Luxorious place with many shops.
There are many-many shops, you can spend here about 5-6 hours to visit the whole mall.
If you want to go skiing, you can do it, as well :)

Awesome Ski Field. This Mall is huge but very interesting...mostle the Ski field that is attached. Amazing to see what you can do inside a shopping centre. Shopping was pretty good too as was the food court where we had lunch.

Way Too Big. Depends on your view on shopping. This place is so big it would take 2-3 days to visit all shops. And what's the point in that if you are on holiday. Prices approx 20% below UK on bits I looked at.

mall of emirates. beautiful place to be with acess both by metro and bus .these are cheaper way of coming to mall ,and the food court there is a huge one self service nice selection for all kind of food lovers.shopping there means branded mostly but genuine .for average purchase also can be done .nice place
Shop till you drop and then ski. A lot of great stores (compared to other places in the Gulf) with a variety of restaurants. Take in the ski hill or just watch it snow for a while.

Spoilt for choice!. Visited this Mall recently with some frends and can say that I was impressed by the size and the number of shops here from designers to boutiques. There is also a large supermarket (Carreforre) which is very handy especially if you are stayiing in an aparthotel close by. I lost count of the number of shops and the prices are not too expensive and certainly cheaper than the Dubai Mall. The layout is very good, it is clean and tastefully decorated and impressive architectural designs all around the mall. There is a foreign exchange store and cash points as well. They have a taxi rank and a metro with the Mall. Ski Dubai is also located here should you have a burning desire to try your hand at skiing! There are a lot of eating places as well that you can easily spend the whole day here. I would definitely recommend this Mall for quality retail therapy.
Shopoholics!!!. Great Mall with all the shopping you will ever need what a great ballance of shops and food. And you can Ski if you wish

Lose yourself in a shopper's paradise. This massive mall has interesting architectural features and a wide range of shops and brands to suit many tastes. I particularly enjoyed shopping for clothes and homewares / furniture. Prices seemed not particularly cheap, and there were some notably bad prices (particularly for some of the UK-based retailers; an extreme example was some kids clothes marked as GBP2.50 originally on it's UK sales ticket but with a local price of AED100, or almost 7 times more).That said, some of the sales priced items were good bargains. And some non-sale items were unique or interesting enough that I felt ok paying the asking price, even if it didn't seem great value.It was handy to be staying at the adjoining Pullman hotel, since it was easy to return to the hotel periodically to offload the shopping haul.Pretty cool to have Ski Dubai - indoor skiing - available within the Mall too, even if all you do is watch it while enjoying a coffee.

If you're a Shopper!. If you're a shopper - welcome to heaven!Otherwise - not a good idea!Lots and lots of shops, Ski Dubai (with no one on the slopes) and lots of people watching.Worth a look, and it's air conditioned, and there are some bargains - but be careful because the place is addictive!

Much more than just shopping. Even if you dislike shopping you have to appeciate this Mall, you could spend the whole day here and still not see it all. This is the one with the indoor ski slope, not to be confused with the Dubai Mall which is the one next to the Burj Khalifa and has the giant fish tank. This Mall is truely massive, on 2 levels with 2 sides and large food courts at either end. It also has an area of more expensive restaurants and a 20 screen cinema. The centre opens out with a huge, decorative glass dome over it, very impressive. If you stay in Al Barsha you can walk to it, if not take a taxi or the metro as it has it's own adjoining station. There's also a massive Carefour supermarket so ideal if you're staying in a self-catering apartment. I like to sit in the coffee shop that overlooks the ski centre.

Incredible Masterpiece!. Wherever you go, you will never find a special mall like this one, it will stay attractive to everybody with its uniqueness in many countless aspects, best of them is Ski Dubai where you can play your winter sport indoors while others shopping or having hot drinks @ Costa just few layers of walls made from glass seperating two worlds! Not forget mentioning the special offers that you will never find in other shopping malls around.

Amazing shopping experince, with skis!. If ts shopping you want, you've got it all here.All the designers you could ask for and all the generic brands too.The most amazing part is, you can stop for a coffee and watch the skiers at the worlds largest (or is it only) indoor ski resort!

My favorite mall. This mall is very elegant and has many high end stores. The prices are high also but you can save during regular sales and no sales tax like you have in Toronto, 13%.The best bargains are to be found at the City Center Mall during sales and of course in the souk.

If its shopping you want.. When in Dubai, theres one pastime that shines above all other and that is shopping. The standard of cleanliness and variety is amazing and made for a pleasant day out. This mall seems to have a higher proportion of high end shops but it is balanced by everyday stores also. The decor is elegant and the service is good.

Ski inside the mall. I've always been a bit curious about this mall ever since I watched an episode of Amazing Race that featured this place. Although once the reigning retail hotspot in the burgeoning city of Dubai, sadly the the title now belongs to the Dubai Mall. Nevertheless, this is a superlative shopping centre packed with exquisite brandnames all over the world laid out in a stylish, contemporary manner. I also came across Pinkberry here which is a mindblowing treat. The ski-slope however just looked a bit odd....Do go if you are in the amazing city of Dubai.

SHOPPING AND FUN.. Dubai is a fabulous glitzy city- but often the choice of where to shop is daunting.Tough choice. The Ibn Batuta Mall is great,(especially for Arab history displays and recreations) but for a one stop shop, it is the MALL OF THE EMIRATES. It is varied, not too large (like the Dubai Mall) and has some amazing shops. You can brunch with salmon and scrambled eggs, saunter along the perfume and big name shops, then wander through the Carrefour spice and cheese section-one of the best in town for variety. Ski slope is great fun- even for older folk, who just want a gentle wander through the caves and snow- then a movie- it is all there. The contrast between the reasonable shops and the seriously costly is great for all budgets- or just walking through the scents of Arabian perfume and OUD incense is worth it alone.
A place to see. It is such a big Mall. You will find everything you need. They have a big parking area. It is a must visit shopping Mall to all visitors to Dubai. You have to walk a lot.

Something different. The mall of the Emirates its close to burj al arab and you can enjoy shopping because its not as big as the dubai mall. For people that doesent like the very big malls this mall is good. You can find anything you want. You can enjoy the ski and snow in this mall and you can enjoy your coffee and your food also. You can go to the hotel that is conected with the mall and you can enjoy your coctail there.
Directly connect to the metro. great mall with great shops and food. directly connected to the metro.in second floor there is a fantastic Indian shop with nice collection of accessories.

Better than Dubai Mall. We went to both the Mall of the Emirates and Dubai Mall and can say that this one was better because it WAS NOT AS BIG. The Dubai mall was too big and you couldn't get through all of it easily, especially if you wanted to go back to a shop you had seen previously. Ski Dubai is also situated here (but we did not have time to participate). Plenty of places to eat and drink as well as shop.
huge mall. many brands, different prices, nice resto's..cenimas. huge supermarket..lovely cafes..ski inside the mall..pullman hotel is a fantastic hotel attached to the mall

Mall of the Emirates. This has got to be one of the most Astounding malls in the World. Easy place to get lost in (in a good way). Easy place to spend lots of time in. If one were to have a free day to spend some time - this is the way to do it. It is a bit of a ways from the airport (DXB) and lots of other attractions however. Probably about 20 minutes drive with taxi from the airport - traffic depending. I'm posting a couple of photos with this review to show a few neat things encountered at the Mall of the Emirates from a collectible shop in the mall.

Don´t miss this shopping!. Perfect shopping, has all the stores you want and need, easier to get around than Dubai Mall. It has cinemas, great variety of fast food and restaurants, the famous Ski Dubai is there (my advice is to get there early as it gets crowded). They also have a great Carrefour hypermarket and two hotels!! Another advice would be to follow them on twitter, they give constant notices and updates on the shopping deals, and if you ever have a question, they do answer you back on twitter in such a kind and gentle way that you feel very welcome!

Good varied shopping. Not as high class as the Dubai mall at Burj Khalifa but that suited us better, nice range of designer shops without it feeling like you're in the scene in Pretty Woman when the shop assistant refuses to serve her! Great for Ski Dubai too. Bit hot waiting for taxis but they are really frequent and cheap.

One of the Best. One of the top malls in Dubai! (Though, I personally prefer the Dubai Mall.) It's got everything - a big grocery (Carrefour), tons of shops and restaurants, the VOX cinemas.. and of course, Ski Dubai. Quite massive, but easier to navigate compared to the Dubai Mall. Very convenient and accessible especially for those staying in nearby hotels. If it is your first time in Dubai, I do strongly recommend getting a hotel near the Mall of the Emirates. You will never get bored of this place. Love, love, love it!

Mind boggling. It is quite something to step into this mall. To see the indoor ski field and slope is just something that you have to see to believe - it is just mind boggling. because of its size, its easy to get lost in the mall, so make some mental notes of internal landmarks as you wander around.. There are any number of eating places in the mall, all serving wonderful meals. Carrefours is also located within the mall, so if you need or want to do grocery / food / fruit, then its all there. Some of the prices in the shops seemed to me to set at 'tourist' prices, so you need to think about 'value' if you're going to be buying gifts for the family or even yourself.My wife and I went to the movies there one night and had a great time - its fascinating to sit in an English language movie and see it with Arabic and French sub titiles. Just remember that its a shopping mall at the end of the day, but what a shopping mall ! ! !

Birthday cake icecream.. I would advise anyone who goes here to go to a ice cream shop, cant remember the name, but it is on the floor and very close to the entrance to Ski Dubai! Have birthday cake icecream!!!!!! Best icecream I have ever tasted.
Stunning mall. Easier to navigate than the Dubai mall and getting to see the ski dubai makes it a worthwhile trip! Lots of dining options and an amazing luxury area!

Massive!!!. This is the worlds largest Mall so be prepared for it to be busy. The mall has been designed so all certain types of shops are together. I like this concept. The food court has a massive choice of food and I enjoyed a tasty Meal there. Definitely worth a look at.

Don't foccus on it!. This mall is huge, but dissapointing! There is NO place to sit,it is poor signalised, the prices are very high, in the food court a strong smell of fried oil was present everywhere(I didn「t enjoyed my coffee due to it). This mall is not a friendly indoor environment, it doesn't hava any personality! Don't loose your time there!

Great if you like designer brands. Mall of the Emirates is one of the must do things in Dubai and if you're visiting, it's worth a look. I don't think it's worth the hype though. It's mainly designer brands and as a resident I would only go if I was visiting Ski Dubai. It is a beautiful mall though and it's always very clean.

So Many Places to Spend Your Money. This is one of the larger Malls. It is also the one with "Ski Dubai" in it, which is worth a look. Unfortunately as we were there in the holiday period it was rather busy so perhaps next time. There are so many shops in the Mall and you can easily spend the day there. You need to be aware that during Ramadan you cannot get food or drink during the day so don't think you will go and have a coffee during your shopping trip. There are a couple of restaurants behind closed doors if you are in need but this is something to consider when booking your holiday to Dubai.
Amazing. The mall is clean and amazing! The samsung store is a very good place in the mall. All the shops are very expensive but it is a great place to visit!

Like it. any time I visit Dubai, I like to pass to Mall of the Emirates, specially in the morning, I like the atmosphere there! Dubai Ski is very nice too.Too many shops and restaurants there! you can spend around 3 hours there or more!
Beautiful Mall. I didnt get a chance to see everything but what I saw I loved, its a beautiful well laid out Mall and I look forward to many more trips to explore and discover it.

An all-in-one mall!!. If you need shopping, if you need spending some times, if you need some fun or if you just need something good to eat, you can find all of them here. Just while walking around, mark your way to avoid of getting lost!!!!!
Upmarket. Massive shopping mall with hundreds of shops ... many designer and quite a few unusual speciality shops. Loads of food places. Very clean and a welcome break from the heat outside
Mall of the Emirates, Dubai. First visited the MoE in 2007. Love the ski slope and there is a great selection of shops and restaurants.
Amazing. This mall is the best mall that I have gone to. I could have spent the whole day just walking around.

Best mall in Dubai that is not the Dubai Mall. This mall is second only to the Dubai Mall in the city of malls. The mall has a bit of everything -- of course it has a ton of shops, but there's a good, diverse food court, and even an indoor (and by now infamous) ski slope which can be viewed from inside the mall via the glass panes. A big bonus is the mall's proximity to a Dubai Metro station -- an air-conditioned bridge leads from the metro directly into the mall and vice versa, which is invaluable in the summer months.All in all, a very good mall. It's grand, it's accessible, and it's got lots to offer. It's also easy to get lost in, so the first thing every visitor ought to do is to get a mall directory and map. There are surprisingly few physical stands with the maps, so be sure you get the little handbook.Also, if you're short of time on your trip as we were, this mall is not far at all from Souk Madinat Jumeirah -- it's about a 15 minute drive away, so you may want to consider taking a cab from here for that. Well worth it.

Best place in Dubai to shop. I have been several shopping malls in Dubai. Among all Mall of Emirates is the best. I was staying in Media One Hotel, and it was very near to the hotel. Just a 10 mins of drive away from Dubai Media City. Comparatively, I think the goods are more affordable here. I shopped a lot from this place. There are lots of shops of cloths and electronics. If you are in Dubai, you shouldn't miss it by any means.

Favourite shopping mall. Apart from being spectacular, we visited this mall quite a few times. Easy within reach if you travel by Metro and wide variety of shops as well as a supermarket/ hyper store with lots of bargains at very cheap prices. Well worth a visit.

Second biggest Mall in Dubai, to not miss!. Mall of Emirates (MoE) is the second biggest mall in Dubai after the Dubai Mall located in Downtown. To reach the MoE, you can go by car, from Dubai direction Abu Dhabi (MoE is located before the Marina) or by Metro (there is a station MoE).The MoE opened in 2005 and has plenty of shops (fashion, lifestyle, sports, electronics and home furnishing stores and the largest Carrefour in the city). Also, the compelling family leisure offerings include a Magic Planet family entertainment area, a multiplex cinema, the world-renowned Ski Dubai, and finally a five star Kempinski Hotel, Also, in the MoE numbers of cafés and restaurants that offered all the cuisine of the world.Therefore, you can not be bored during your visit.

My Dubai Favourite S.C.. I'm not a Big Fan of Shopping Centres, especially HUGE ones, as M.O.E is, but this one is "Different", out of Town, easy to get to and get in/out, Free Parking (You can even get your car washed in its space, while shopping for only afew Dirhams!). And as for the Shops, they've got most of them, incl my Favouritwe "Carefours Hypermarket"!

Good Mall with lots to do. Mall of the Emirates - more accessible than Dubai Mall in terms of size - perhaps like one of the big out of London Malls like a posher version of Bluewater, but a Bluewater with a Harvey Nics and one where you can go skiing. Also some of the more 'normal' shops and a little more accessible than Dubai Mall - good food courts and access the the Kempinski hotel if you want to stop for lunch with a glass of wine (I have posted about other Malls in the relevant place) Queues for Taxis can be ridiculous, especially during public holidays, but if you have not bought too much, there is easy access to the Metro, especially in comparison to the other malls. (I am a Dubai Resident from the UK, please feel free to PM me with questions)

Too Big. I love the Mall of the Emirates but I find it too overwhelming especially when navigating with kids. I agree with the person who said you need a whole day to go thru this mall. Unless, you are going there specifically for the Ski Dubai or the Magic planet arcade with the kids, I dont advice trying to navigate this mall with small children. They will get tired and cranky after a few hours and you will only be a third of the way through. To thoroughly enjoy this mall, go alone as a couple or only with kids from the preteen age up. Otherwise, it is a very wonderful place to be in. The architecture from outside is simply FAB especially if you are viewing from the train.

Shoppers heaven. Another shopping paradise with lots of shops we liked. Great to visit during seasonal sale as the prices are not cheap however, has lot of variety and choices. Would recommend to have a map of the mall and visit during Fridays cos car parks are free.

It is # 1 Mall for me in Dubai. I really like the connection to the metro, hotels, it is my favorite mall in Dubai.
Good variety of shops & food.
Love the restaurants area.
And of course, the ski Dubai attraction!

My First choice amongst All Malls In Dubai. I love this mall since i first visited back in 2005~2006. A modern architect. Huge Dome areas allow natural light to enter-in. Love to shop here at brands like Splash, G2000, Bossini, Aeropostel.
Food court and cinemans are good too.

Perfect sized-mall for an all-day adventure. This mall may be smaller than the Dubai Mall, but it's a stunning building which presents a shopping experience that fits into a full day. You might have to spend days or weeks to feel that you've thoroughly given the Dubai Mall a chance-- but the Mall of the Emirates, with its smaller array of stores and Ski Dubai is a more friendly and comfortable experience. The selection of stores is excellent, and there are plenty of great food choices as well. Definitely a don't-miss attraction!

Second best mall in Dubai. There is no question that Duabi Mall is number 1. This mall would have to be a distant number 2...but that is not to say its bad. Quite the opposite! This is an amazing shopping mall and there is nothing like it in my country by a long way. You can spend a lot of time here(and a lot of money). I found it a bit more up-market than Dubai mall.I would definately recommend going here unless you are limited for time in Dubai then go to Dubai Mall instead.
Is it a dream. For a shopaholic like me a real wow experience! It's Westfield x3! Great shops you need a minimum of a day there and we'll worth a revisit! Star spotting good too!

What an impressive place!. While staying in Dubai recently on vacation, my family (wife and toddler) and I visited the Mall of The Emirates. It was nicely located with only a 15-20 minute taxi ride from the resorts located along Jumeirah Beach. Our initial impression was very good, and we enjoyed all the visual interests such as the architecture and in-door ski slope. It was a fun atmosphere to be sitting in a mountain type lodge with "faux" fireplaces displaying big wood fires. (LCD tv's but actually quite convincing if you don't look too closely). The Mall has every type of store for those interested in shopping although prices are steep all over the middle east. If you are looking for a bargain this is not the place for you! Overall, this is a great place to visit for people of all ages and interests. There is something for everyone!

Beautiful shopping experience. Perfect place to shop at, all big brands under one roof, easy access as you can get there by train or by a cab (prefer a train as its cheaper), 2 food courts + amazing other restaurants, magic planet (area where kids can play) Best time to go shopping there is the summer shopping festival great sales and bargains throughout the mall that happens for a month for mid the first week of June to July. A must see attraction here is the indoor ski slope. If you'd like to have an alcoholic drink, you can do so at Après

Many Brands but Expensive!. The Mall of the Emirates is a great place to be and 'must see' for anyone travelling to Dubai. But as I reflect, Dubai once used to be a shopper's paradise but I sincerely feel - No More! Though the taxes are negligible here yet mechandise is more expensive than probably you can find in your hometown, Yes you may be able to find more brands in a product though.MOE is very well designed, beautiful and has a lot of variety to offer but a mall is mainly meant for 'shopping' and comparing items to what I can get in my country, I'd rather buy at hometown than carry all the load and yet pay more!

Endless shopping!!. This mall has everything for everyone, including small children. What a great place for shopping. And the food court is pretty good too. The Ski Dubai was so much fun for the kids & adults alike. Calling all shopaholics....
Mall Of The Emirates. An upscale shopping centre with an excellent variety of shops and eating places. It is handily located adjacent to the metro station of the same name.
more shopping. Good selection of shops with lots of designer brands.Bit dissapointed with the ski slope but seeing -3degs when it was 42degs outside did make us laugh!!!!

full of brands. huge mall with a lot of brands from armani to zara...nice food court,carrefour,ski and cinemas...i prefer emirates mall over dubai mall beacause it's easy to navigate than dubai mall and was nearby my hotel (mina a salam) about 25 dirhams by taxi.
magic planet is nice to keep children entertained with a lot of rides and games.
"WOW". Need a day to look at everything and if you like to ski here you go, indoor skiing.

very nice. nice mall every thing around of you
i was happy to stay in PULLMAN hotel there

Mall with skiing slope. I have visited this mall many times since it was newly opened. It is nicely designed with beautiful architecture. The new thing is that you can reach it with the metro as it has a direct stop there. It has a variety of shops but before you start shopping take the mall map to guide you. The indoors skiing slope is nice for the ones never seen snow before and for kids fun. They have big food courts with different kinds of restaurants with different cuisine and budget.

Very good electronics shop - Micro Electronics. Well, this is not a tourist attraction, but you have to admit that, once you're in Dubai, you're thinking about buying at least a gadget for yourself or as gift for the people back home (Dubai being one of the most competitive city - as prices- for electronics devices).We were not in Dubai either the middle of the sales season, or during an electronic fair, however after a quite comprehensive tour in the well-known local malls, we found this small shop with very good prices: over 20% less than the price in all other shops!It's probably because this place is a liitle difficult to be found (we only did by mistake, going to the ladies room :)). However, as we found later on, it appears on the Mall's map, so don't forget to include it in your 'to visit' list, if you're interested in buying such devices. And, don't worry - its neighbourhood is not contaminating :))))
Shopping paradise.. A magnificent piece of architecture for this really big shopping mall.Expect to find one of the cleanest shopping mall you can find.

Convenient, exceptionally big, practical. I visited it very quickly since I was on business. I must say Im not fond of shoppings and malls, but this is something out of your mind. It is sooo big I couldnt manage to see it all, it has a skiing area in the center, many options for having food (from 4stars restaurants to Mc Donalds). Same with clothes shops: most of the brands, if not all, are known european or american brands. Yet, I have never seen aplace where I could find them all in one place, in one city! From luxury brands like Channel, Armani, YSL to H&M, Zara and River Island. And many, many many more! If you're there on a Monday and like sushi, I would suggest you to have dinner at the restaurant in the entrance where they offer all you can eat very good quality sushi on Mondays for 25 euro only

Bustling with usual middle to high end shops. This mall isn't too far from Dubai Marina and thats why we decided to pay it a visit. It is very big as all things in Dubai so you need to scout out shops if you're looking for something specific. There are many London west end shops here along with the designer brands. My boys (9 and 7) wanted to buy nintendo games and boy are they expensive here! With 5.7 dirhams to the pound, most games were around the 250 mark, ouch! I convinced them to buy them from back home.There is a really good food court catering for everyones needs and desires but it was so busy even at 4pm and we took around 15 minutes to get a table. Some food outlets only take cash so take some with you, although there is also a currency exchange service there too. It's nothing spectacular and not something to go out of your way to see unless you're a shopaholic!
A Must Visit. Great shopping experience and a ski resort in the middle of a mall.. Amazing
Awesome. Excellent Mall.....not as big as Dubai Mall but great selection of shops and a great food court.

Great mall .. but too large perhaps. Dubai is known for its malls. This is just too large for my liking. A wide selection of everything you could want but again expensive when compared with the UK standards.

the mall. simply this is the Mall.if you consider that you visit most of the big malls all over the world so may be you are wrong.come and visit this mall and you will see the difference.it is very big very clean very good decoration , shopping is very attractive hundreds of shops with brand names , recreation activities for children are unlimited. food court is a trip by its self.you need more than one day to complete it my children enjoyed this place very much and keep asking to revisit it.it is one of the land mark of Dubai city.

After Dubai Mall sorry, the only cool thing about the mall is Ski Dubai. This mall is a bit of a disappointment, especially after Dubai Mall opened, the choice of outlets is out done, the location of the prayer room is very inconvenient. You cannot find anything in the mall, very poor maps and the fold out maps are incomplete and poor. There is not a lot of staff to help. They charge an arm and a leg for parking, we went during the week and they stated at the parking the first 4 hours are free, we were there for 4 hours and 12 minutes and they charged us 20Dhs, I asked the staff and they said one minute over the 4 hours and you are charged for the 4 hours. Bad, so bad. If you have not been to Ski Dubai that is a reason to visit. The two major problems I have stated are major and I certainly do not intend to visit this mall again unless they seriously make some changes. The mall is beautiful otherwise.

Shopaholic Paradise. Dubai loves its shopping malls, and the Mall of the Emirates is yet another example of a retail wonderland of unimaginable proportion. The Mall is located in a suburb away from the City Centre, but has a Metro stop of its own. All the brands you could imagine are here, and there are good offers to be had during the Dubai Shopping Festival. Only worth a visit for serious shopaholics, and also if you want to stand by the huge floor to ceiling windows and watch people slide, tumble and occasionally ski down the slope of the world's most famour indoor ski arena :) It might take a little bit of trekking, but do hunt down the tucked away Cold Stone Creamery for an ice cream treat that's definitely worth the walk

Would you like skiing with your shopping?. Ski Dubai, an indoor ski area. Rent clothing, gloves, boots, skis and take lessons. Even an area for children and parents who merely want to watch. And a March of the Penguins several times a day for the kids. What more is there to say. You can also have dinner in a selection of restaurants overlooking the ski area. Amazing.

BEAUTIFUL MALL.....ALL THE SHOPS ARE HERE!. There is a good blend of UK and American shops here. Found a lot of my favourite shops here...except Marks&Spencer which was conspiciously missing and I wonder why. Although this mall is smaller than the Dubai mall, I found it a lot more convenient and interesting. Very busy mall with a standard food court. And the famous ski Dubai is here as well. I spent an entire day here. Definitely a must visit while in Dubai!

Mall with substance. If you like world best brands starting from D&G, Versace, Ferrari. this is the mall you need to visit.Positives: World best brand under one roof, Well organisedNegatives: Difficult to locate stores, even though it is smaller than Dubai Mall. Parking fee after 4 hours of stay.

Shopping Heaven in New Dubai, for Tourists and Residents!. This is the place to go to for all kind of international and local brands, you will find pretty much everything and the stores here have regular promotions. The mall itself is very well designed, while huge its easy to navigate and get around. There are also lot of restaurants and food courts here, a huge multiplex cinema (vox) and the infamous SKI dubai indoor ski park is located inside this mall. We go here pretty much every other day for all our needs. Love this mall its our favourite, its always full of life and people from every culture. Located convieniently at the heart of New Dubai. Highly recommended for both residents and tourists.

Another shopping mall. It seems that wherever you go now in the world now it is just 'brand shopping'. There are a large number of shops that don't seem to give great service. Having a look at the ski slope was interesting, but not to my taste. It is a shopping centre that is well served by transport. There are better places to shop in Dubai. The prices are not cheap, particulary in electronics, so don’t expect any bargains or really interesting buys. It is a difficult place to find somewhere to sit down.

Ski, food and shop. I paid a return visit to the Mall of the Emirates after visiting the Dubai Mall and the Bur Jurman centre earlier on the same trip.Dubai Mall is huge but fascinating even if you have no desire to shop till you drop. Bur Jurman has dropped the ball. MOE still has the ski slope but still has shops to visit, shops that cater for different markets ranging to affordable high street chains to more premium brands.The food courts were rather nifty and enjoyable even though it was busy and rather a stand out for me.

Huge. Big but still friendly Mall. Took me half an hour to reach the middle and made UK shopping look tiny by comparison. So clean and there are a lot of UK chains as well as local bargain stores too. It gets Very busy as the residents escape the heat and the cinema is really comfy and reasonably priced. You could easliy spend a day . Dont miss out on the coffee bar in KAMPINSKI HOTEL. Excellent service. Enjoy.

Wondeful. Breathtaking mall full of surprises and attractions! You will fall in love with every nook and cranny of this mall. Every twist and turn is an adventure in shopping or unexpected sights: aquarium, cascades, Burj Kalifa, waterfalls, Bloomingdale's and Galeries Lafayette, etc...Bring some comfortable shoes because it is a very extensive mall! You will not be disapointed!
good if you are going to visit the ski area. it is a normal huge mall but worth a vist if you are going to the ski area,

Good, some shops unuseful for tourists. A very large mall located along the Dubai Metro line. Many shops present, great food hall. Some shops will be interesting for tourists, but most of them are will satisfy people living in Dubai, such as Carrefour, tv shops, furniture shops, home decoration etc. Worth seing!

Very big mall, lots to do.. When we arrived, my daughters and granddaughter were very impressed. We were there to shop for a few hours before going on a desert safari. Our pick up location was the mall. We thought it was great to have such a wonderful location to visit. There were many diverse shops, plenty of various foods from which to choose, and everything was clean. We departed for our safari, and when we returned, we found there was a very large charge for parking! We had to pay 140 dirhams for the day which translates to over $40. We could not believe it! We had spent a great deal of money at the mall, and to be hit with that high a cost for parking seemed to be unfair.

Ski Dubai is an ok gimmick. Best thing in the mall is skiing. Its funny to be skiing in the middle of the desert, and you really have to try it, but to be honest: This is more a gimmick than a real skiing experience. It takes 7-8 minutes to get up the hill and only seconds to get down. Try it 4-5times in one hour and you gets bored.

Great Shopping Mall. Though the Mall of Emirates is not as big as the Dubai Mall, it will still take a few hours to check out the Mall. You are less likely to be lost in here as the mall is nicely organised. The main attraction is the ski slopes, which looks amazing, but I didn't have time to give it a go. Of course the mall is great for shopping with many top brand shops, and the food court is pretty good as well. The Metro stops right at the Mall which is very convenient. Also plenty of taxis available.

Mall of the Emirates. Brilliant place. Its got all u need and still a common man's mall. Its got Carrefour which has everything u can dream off not to mention all the other electronics/apparel/Household stores.Truly a shopper's paradise.

Easily the best Mall in Dubai. We went to all the big malls; Mall of the Emirates, Dubai Mall and the Deira City Centre, and found that even though Dubai Mall was newer and more beautiful, the Mall of the Emirates is the place to be, you can hang there for hours on end, enjoy the food, the shopping and ski dubai. Love the mall and hopefully will be back there soon.

You find EVERYTHING here!!. I like how organized is this Mall, I get lost inside it less than I do in other malls..I found everything here! I even found brands that we never thought will exist outside the US, like Victoria's Secret and Aeropostale!Armani Cafe is awesome there...And a nice Food court! two different levels, one expensive and one normal..Even the Metro goes inside it, it is the best mall in Dubai I would say..

Mall of the Emirates, ski Dubai. Mall of the Emirates is now a well established mall in Dubai. There is a direct access with the metro and a good covered car park. In the week days, if you come by car, you have to take a ticket at the gate but, if you stay less than 2 hours you don't need to pay anything. In the week end the access is free. The main attraction of this mall is the ski Dubai. I cannot comment too much on that because I only went to the "children" part of it, where you can play a little in the snow and enjoy the cold, but I didn't ski. You can rent warm clothes and all the equipment but some people who do it "seriously" have their own ski equipment. There are sport shops where you can find everything for winter sport! Otherwise, there are many cinemas, a very big food court, other restaurants and cafes and a good selection of shops, from the most luxury like Dior and Vuitton, in the new extension, to the bargains one like Splash and Forever 21. If you need some grocerie shopping, there is a good Carrefour, which can be very useful, even if you stay in a hotel. There you could also buy some souvenirs but there is a nice souvenirs shops in the mall called "al Jaber" (if I remember well). Mall of the Emirates is a pleasant mall, quite family oriented and I would recommend it.

Another large mall in Dubai with ski slopes. More disorganised than Dubai Mall but we like it as it is more interesting to shop. Also more elegant. The ski slopes are mad in a desert. Next to it is a surprisingly good food court, restaurants & Magic Planet which is a great place to spend a couple of hours on indoor rides, fair ground games & video games to earn tickets to exchange for cheap toys. Kids loved it.

Second to Dubai Mall only. Mall of the Emirates used to be the largest Mall in Dubai before it's rival Dubai Mall took the centre of attention. Being second in size is just nothing bad. It is another huge mall which studded with all the top brands under one roof. Ski Dubai is just wonderful, follows the tradition of Dubai to surprise everyone, this one being a ski resort in the middle of a desert

Not great at all. I was not enamored by anything with this mall. Except the fact it has the indoor ski place, this place is just a giant string of stores. It's the Mall of America in Dubai. Goto the Dubai Mall. That IS something spectacular (if that is such a thing for malls).

Second best mall in dubai. Second best mall in dubai there is notting wrong with this mall it has all the brands and that you can think of it's really big and it has sky Dubai, which is great the only problems is that the Dubai mall is just much bigger if you are visiting an want to shop go to the big oneBut do not forget to visit this one and go skiing
one huge smogasrbord!. you will find everything here from weath grass shakes to linegrie its a one stop shop to get lost in and fun for kids if any

Mall of Emirates--excellent place for familes to visit. It is 11th time (a total in last 4 years) that we have visited (twice present time) Mall of Emirates (MOE) during our recent visit (in July) to Dubai, and again found it captivating and full of FUN. Due to near-coming of Ramadan-most of the shops are on sale--which was very good for us. The children pay area--on the toop floor of MOE was an excellent place to visit-my twins went on fun-filled rampage that lasted 3 hrs, but still werent able to enjoy every ride due its variety and vastness. We also had a lot of fun shopping and eating all 3 days--what was the most satisfying point is the availability of public facilities (exceptionally clean washrooms, helping staff of MOE) and transport late midnight. Before leaving for Dubai, always, we always made sure to visit MOE and my twins and spouse (and offfcourse) loves to go there-again and again.

Wow. The Mall of Emirates is great. If you do not fancy shopping you can go Ski Dubai like what we did , we paid 200 dirhams for an unlimited pass sans skiing. It was freezing inside but it was super fun. It was my best activity in Dubai. The attendants are very accomodating, they offer information and answers to ignorant questions from 2 girls from the tropics graciously. THe sledding was okay, fun but hard to capture on camera, the snow tubing was great, we got one for two people and the crystal ball was super fun, you get to roll off a steep slope inside a bubble ball. I have been to other places trying to do a Snow City Theme, either the slope for sledding is too short or the snow on the slopes are too thinly layered that you get to see the stainless sheet forming the base of the slope. While in Ski Dubai, the snow /ice was layered deeply, you can even go snow digging without reaching the bottom. the lifts were great for getting an overall view of the attraction, it is really humongous, what it great also is when you go sledding down, they have provide thoughtful conveyor belts going back up to lessen your energy for truding to save it more for sledding. Even it is an all day pass, by the second hour, you can feel the chill through the bones , you have to thaw out in the mall and get right back in. Great idea for fun in a mall in a desert country, who can beat that !

So big but shops are easy to find. I've been several times in all Dubai Malls and this is my favourite because it's big, it has everything but you can still find easily what you want. It is well organised so if you look for electronics you have all in one area and you don't need to walk through all the mall.There's a big Virgin store, they were going to open also Marc & Spencer. There is all range of shops from luxury to casual and a big variety of restaurant bars and cafès.
A great experience every time again. We've been in Dubai a couple of times now and this mall is certainly the one anyone should visit. You won't be disappointed.

Wealthy. I had never seen snow in my life , until visiting Dubai Mall of The Emirates...
A snow mountain indoor....so crazy.
The luxury of the mall is impressing...even me that hate shoppings , enjoyed , well , a little bit ...hehehe
Easy to go there through the subway.

Stifling hot.... Tried to have a coffee in Costa on 1st floor near the food court at the Ski Dubai end of the Mall. Yuk! It was so incredibly and uncomfortably hot! No air conditioning in this area. I attempted to try on a leather jacket at retail outlet "Faccionnable" but they wouldn't let me try on the only piece in my size because it was on the mannequin in the window! They're not allowed to 'adjust' their window displays during retail hours. Good grief, what a stupid rule. For whom is the display intended if not the customer?

Amazing shopping centre. We have visited this mall on several occasions and have found the Ski facility to be not only a fun experience but also unique considering the desert location. One price gives you all the equipment and you can actually snow ski inside the Mall and lessons for skiing and boarding are available. After your ski experience you can relax in Apres a restaurant with a view of the ski hill and skiers/boarders and having a beer,wine or hot chocolate. It is a fun esperience in a desert climate. the city has many other amazing attractions as well as beautiful sandy beaches on the Gulf.

TOTAL DISAPOINTMENT- Dubai has far better shpping expreinces. I was there in last week June, 2011 with my family of young children.I found the mall to be anything but shopper freindly. First of all there was no place to sit, and relax. when my choildren got real tired we sat down on the floor and a rude security guard showed up and ordered us not to sit on the floor. The lifts and washrooms are too fewfor the size of the mall. we had an infant in a stroller and had to literally wait in a long que outside the lift for our turn. ZFor the washrooms we had to walk a lot too/ The visit was a total disappointment. We had alocated a full day for the mall but were out of the place in 3/4 hoursand headed straight to Dubai Mall, where we had already spent the last 2 days.No comparison at all. So my recomendation dont waste time going to Emirates Mall.

Fantastic shopping location with unique indoor skiing!. Everything you could possibly want to buy is in this Mall. Fantastic range of shops for clothes, electronics, groceries, confectionary and chocolates, souvenirs, beauty amongst other things. Range of dining options at reasonable prices, which is a great escape from the more expensive option of dining in your hotel. I ate in an Italian restaurant when I went to the Mall for the second time, and it was lovely. It also had a view of the indoor ski centre, which is huge and has a floor to ceiling glass wall!  The mall also has a food court for fast dining, I had Japanese food and it was delicious. Was only about £5 for a huge portion (even tho I asked for small) and a bottle of water too :)  The corridors in the mall can get a little busy at times, but this is probably cos its air-conditioned and I went in summer so it was a hot 54degrees outside! The mall has its own taxi rank and is linked to the Metro, as well as having tourist buses stop there during the day. There is also a large cinema and a games arcade which would suit children.

Shopping The Way It Should Be. This was on my wifes " Things I must see " list on our holiday in Dubai , so after putting aside a day to go to the Mall Of The Emirates the next thing to do was plan how we could get there and back , it wasn,t as hard or expensive as we thought .Consulting the street map from the hotel lobby ( we were staying at the Hyatt Regency ) and a few handy pointers by the ever helpful staff there it was decided to take a taxi down to Union Station and then the train to Mall Of The Emirates on the Jebel Ali line .At a total cost of only $7.50 AUD round trip for the both of us this made it very good value , the trains are the latest and very clean , quick and as I noticed totally un maned which is a little disconcerting at first until you get used to the idea .Having arrived at the Mall Of The Emirates ( the stations are announced in english and arabic on board the trains .) we were pleased to see that we didn,t have to walk thru the heat to get inside as there is a air conditioned walkway provided to the mall but once inside WOW ! this place is massive although not the biggest ( Dubai Mall is Bigger ) it shore does impress with it,s shear size , space and variety , the best tip i can give you here is to get hold of a map of the floor plan on its many levels and use that to navigate around , these are available from the information desks dotted around the mall and if you still get lost there are always the fixed table maps at just about all the major intersections with the usual " you are here " red arrows on them ( once again in english and arabic ) .There is just about something for every body here from the classy " Bling Bling " shops that my wife loves so much to the almost K,Mart like department stores ( more my style ) .and everything in between , as far as food goes there once again there is everything for every taste from fast food ( burgers and chips ) to the more upmarket resturants and at very reasonable prices .The biggest attraction there of course is the ski slope " Ski Dubai " which for 180 Dirhams or $45 AUD will let you have ago on their 200m ski slope for 2 hours which of course I had to do regardless of the fact that I had not skied for almost 20 years but be warned the slope although it is a good length the surface is Really , Really icey with little or no powder on it so it is very fast and didn,t take much to get up ended as I found , much to my wifes amusement .Still after all that I was happy that I gave it ago ( didn,t come half around the world not to ) and there was a very nice cafe over looking the slope while drinking a loverly hot coco to warm up .It will take you a complete day to look around the whole mall and the only little , little gripe I would have with as seems to be the case with all the malls we visited , there just doesn,t seem to be very many places to sit ( apart from cafes and the like ) where you can rest those tired and sore feet and back a while .Getting back on the train to the city proved to us that timing is every thing , we boarded the train at about 4pm to find the train was packed obviously it is a popular form of transport here but in true Emirate style there was no pushing or shoving just an orderly boarding and alighting that made the trip a very memorable one back to our hotel .peter and sue

MOE = Entertaiment, leisure and Shopping. MOE is considered as one of the best malls in Dubai. We can easily reach this mall by Metro train, RTA buses and free shuttle buses. The main attraction of this mall is Ski Dubai.It is the indoor ski resort with amazing snow setting to enjoy skiing, snowboarding and tobogganing or just playing in the snow. For Children there is Magic Planet which has variety of games and fun rides. This mall also has good retail fashion stores and Carrefour.After all the shopping and entertainment you can head towards the food court to grab a pizza, burger and drinks or for fine dining you can go to restaurants like Al Hallab, Chillis or More.

Finest mall in Dubai. Its the only shopping mall in the middle east where you can experience snow fall and make snow man and go skiing all under one roof and its simply the best and infact a great time pass and fun activity
Cool and big. This mall had a ski slope inside. Also a few Starbucks and plenty of US food chains such as Chilis and California pizza kitchen.

Second to Dubai Mall. Stands second comparing to Dubai Mall ... The Architecture is amazing , the ski slope inside surprising ... this one has an advantage and you walk from metro station directly inside the mall ... good place for shopping , hanging around and having fun!

A great place for a day out shopping.... It's a shopping mall, the largest one in Dubai before the Dubai Mall was built. Its got hordes of shops, plenty of eating options and most importantly, the largest indoor ski slope in the world.
It's a fantastic place for a day out shopping and an absolute must visit if you are visiting Dubai.

Not comfortable place. I was in this mall 2 times, while my trip in Dubai. Its really not comfortable place for walking. No place to sit ( no benches) , exept cafe, so if you tired walking, you have to go and find cafe to sit. Also really hard to find wash room. This small things make this big mall not comfortable for shopping!!!

Nice Mall, but not the best in Dubai. The Mall of the Emirates is a very nice Mall and visiting it is worth it, even if it can't reach Dubai Mall.It's easy to acces from the "Mall of the Emirates Metro Station" which connects the mall with the airport, downtown, creek area and Jebel Ali. It's also the cheapest way to go here with about 4.10 Dirham (0.90€)But the MoE can't reach the Dubai Mall, which has a much more inviting style. Aditionally, it was ramadan, and none of the two food courts inside the mall had a covered dine in area in contrast to Dubai Mall. Only the Kempinski Hotels Restaurant was open for dining in.In fact, the MoE is a nice mall, in which you can find everything you like, but it's not the best in Dubai.

Mall of Emirates is a must visit on every trip. I have been a frequent traveller to Dubai and every trip here I always visit the Mall of the Emirates. I love browsing and buying items from the boutique stores like Christian Dior and Tod's. Whenever you go to this section of the mall, you feel like you're shopping along Rodeo Drive and the fact that you feel safe and well-taken care of by staff add to the good experience. The section has now easy access to the metro station which makes it more convenient for me to hop from one mall to another especially now that Dubai is celebrating DSS. More reasons to shop."

Came For Skiing, Enjoyed Architecture. I had the chance to visit the "Mall of the Emirates" primarily for the Ski Hill. I was rather impressed with the hill, obviously it was no Mount everest, but it was a fun time. The mall was okay, although it was a bit expensive. I recommend the Dubai Mall for shopping.
We came only because Ski Dubai. .. Ski Dubai is perfect attraction, hard to belive for all newcommings, that there is a snow in Dubai. In Dubai Mall we found more and better shops than here...

If you have little time, choose this mall for your shopping. I was in Dubai for a business trip with extremely tight schedule. I had only two hours to do some shopping and I am happy that I choose this shopping mall. Great internal architecture, huge and diverse areas for shopping, dinning (check my review for Butcher Shop & Grill), even skiing! Even if you will not go snow-skiing in Dubai, you get images that add to the overall pleasant trip experience. Prices are almost the same as Europe unless you find clearence or sale bargains (e.g. 60% off Nike running shoes was a bargain that shouldn't be missed, but were only 3 pairs left).

Big mall with big ambition. The Mall of Emirates (MoE) is a very complete shopping mall that has almost everything you can ask for (CarreFour, Dubai Ski, Cinema, at least 3 food courts etc).The design of the whole architecture is one masterpiece, although it doesn't look that great from the outside, the interior is definitely one of the best in Dubai!Getting to this mall may be a hassle unless you are staying near the Al Barsha area, which is now heavily under construction.

The Mall of the Emirates. This is a Mall on an absolutely mammoth scale! It has several very nice resturants and bars and Ski Dubai is definately worth a look. The other good thing about the malls in Dubai is that they are open on most nights until 10pm so my tip is go a bit later when it is quieter.

Place has to be seen to be believed. You don't need to shop to check out this amazing work of art. We're talking about a mall, for Pete's sake. I HATE shopping. Yet this place is unreal. It's got it's own indoor ski slope. Come on!Despite all of the high-fashion stores in this mall, the one store that blew my mind was Carrefour. It's like Target, Wal-Mart, Best Buy and the biggest grocery store around all combined into one store, then pumped up on steroids. I've never been in a store so big. Place was packed. Great place to do your one-stop shopping for souvenirs for everyone on your list, including yourself.

An important landmark. The original "Big Mall" in Dubai, it has now been surpassed in both size and grandeur by the new "DUBAI MALL" at the base of the Burj Dubai. Still Mall of the Emirates offers a killer indoor ski park (reviewed separately) and a very nice selection of restaurants. It's proximity to the beach resorts means this mall never go out of fashion. However, if you are staying downtown or near the business centers, this mall is a bit of a trek.If you go to Dubai, you need to see Mall of the Emirates.More on our trip to the Mall of the Emirates:http://justanothertravelblog.blogspot.com/2009/02/mall-of-emirates.htmlSki Dubai is reviewed separately:http://justanothertravelblog.blogspot.com/2009/02/ski-dubai.html

If you go to any malls go to this one!. Although not a big shopper if you go to any malls in dubai make sure you go to this one! We went to the Battuta mall on our first day and it is rubbisg in comparison to this one. If nothing else go to see the ski slope and have something to eat at the Kimpinski hotel.

All-round and very stylish. Yeah, that's not the cheapest place to shop, but who cares when you can find almost every shop under the one roof? The ski center is worth of seeing, but most of all I loved shops which I can't find in Finland, like Top Shop, Bershka.. And the environment and atmosphere are quite elegant too.

Not the Cheapest Place to shop. Ok, This is a Mall that needs to be visited to be understood. With all the big names at the mall on the top floor and a lot of high stree stores this is definatley a place to drop into. However do not go here expecting to find the big bargins other shopping malls in Dubai have to offer. Yes you can pick up the od cheaper item but by and large everything is not comprable if not sometimes more expesnsive than your home country or duty free. One store I noted was the Virgin store. I went looking to find an 160g Ipod. How disapointed I was to find all Ipod gear more expensive. I also noted that nost of the shops were now orientented towards the wealther customer. Although I would not dismis a visit just dont go here thinking you can buy all you Xmas presents at a knockdown price. My friend who has property in the city has notice an increase in prices across the board. This was just one of the let downs I had on my vist. By the way the Sky centre is very good if you can get in

As good as any other mall. I have been to mega malls in the USA, UK, Singapore, Malaysia, Saudi, South Africa and UAE previously.The Mall of the Emirates is one of the two new malls built in Dubai since my last visit in 2004. I am not someone in awe with these structures as I have now visited so many.The gimmick of a ski slope is fine but to me its just froth. A fancy mall is no good to me if the shops in it does not have deals that can entice me to spend money. I'm looking for bargains.Dubai has bargains for jewellery, watches and used to be good for electronic products. Designer labels is not its forte but if you search hard you can strike a good deal.This mall is vast and is set on two floors. There is a big car park, plenty of entertainment. Apart from the ski slope, they have a cinema, a children's play area, arcade and a good selection of food places.Our kids had a great time in the play area and did not want to leave the arcade.There are a wide range of designer shops, electronic stores and a hypermarket. Walking around the mall you would not think that you are in Dubai but any other international cosmopolitan city given the diverse array of shoppers.At the time of my visit in February the French Connection store had good bargains. The Hypermarket was a good place to get cheap cigarettes for smokers in the family as gifts.But to me its just another mall. They did not have enough bargains for me to part too much of my cash.

It's just another mall that happens to have a ski slope. Mall of the emirates is just one of the many stupendous malls that Dubai has to offfer. it just happend to have the a snow slope. The snow looks.....artifiical. But, like most of the things you see in Dubai....'Am i really in the middle of the desert!?'I have enjoyed the malls towards the Bur Dubai side more since they seem to be more established. The brands available at Mal of the Emirates are not as various as the other malls. The shopping experience just does not dawn on me when at the Mall of the Emirates. The mall has a couple of cafes that are pretty good....one worth mentioning is Paul's Cafe. I have heard the lebanese restraunt on the first floor is pretty good as well, little out of my budget.

best mall in dubai. hi i have been to this mall two times and there is so much to do for adults and children the magic planet is amazing for children as well as the cinema complex the evenings are excellent the atmosphere is great as there are so many people about including children where else can your teeenager go at night with their friends on their own and you do not have to worry this mall is the best so far in dubai and i have been to all of them we are actually staying in the kempinski in the next two weeks next to the mall
